full_text: Water. Earth. Fire. Air. My grandmother used to tell me stories about the old days: a time of peace when the Avatar kept balance between the Water Tribes, Earth Kingdom, Fire Nation and Air Nomads. But that all changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar mastered all four elements; only he could stop the ruthless firebenders. But when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years have passed, and the Fire Nation is nearing victory in the war. Two years ago, my father and the men of my tribe journeyed to the Earth Kingdom to help fight against the Fire Nation, leaving me and my brother to look after our tribe. Some people believe that the Avatar was never reborn into the Air Nomads and that the cycle is broken, but I haven't lost hope. I still believe that, somehow, the Avatar will return to save the world.
character_words: Water. Earth. Fire. Air. My grandmother used to tell me stories about the old days: a time of peace when the Avatar kept balance between the Water Tribes, Earth Kingdom, Fire Nation and Air Nomads. But that all changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar mastered all four elements; only he could stop the ruthless firebenders. But when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years have passed, and the Fire Nation is nearing victory in the war. Two years ago, my father and the men of my tribe journeyed to the Earth Kingdom to help fight against the Fire Nation, leaving me and my brother to look after our tribe. Some people believe that the Avatar was never reborn into the Air Nomads and that the cycle is broken, but I haven't lost hope. I still believe that, somehow, the Avatar will return to save the world.

full_text: It's not getting away from me this time. [Close-up of the boy as he grins confidently over his shoulder in the direction of the girl.] Watch and learn, Katara. This is how you catch a fish.
character_words: It's not getting away from me this time.  Watch and learn, Katara. This is how you catch a fish.

full_text: [Happily surprised.] Sokka, look!
character_words: Sokka, look!

full_text: [Close-up of Sokka; whispering.] Sshh! Katara, you're going to scare it away. [A look of bliss adorns his face. He licks his lips and wiggles his fingers, not taking his eyes off the fish.] Mmmm ... I can already smell it cookin'.
character_words: Sshh! Katara, you're going to scare it away.  Mmmm ... I can already smell it cookin'.

full_text: [Struggling with the water that passes right in front of her.] But, Sokka! I caught one!
character_words: But, Sokka! I caught one!

full_text: [Exclaims indignantly.] Hey!
character_words: Hey!

full_text: Why is it that every time you play with magic water, I get soaked?
character_words: Why is it that every time you play with magic water, I get soaked?

full_text: [Cut to her face; she sighs lightly before answering in slight annoyance.] It's not "magic", it's waterbending! And it's ...
character_words: It's not "magic", it's waterbending! And it's ...

full_text: Yeah, yeah, "an ancient art unique to our culture", blah, blah, blah. Look, I'm just saying [Grabbing his warrior's wolf knot with his left hand as he turns away from her, wringing the water out of it. Meanwhile, Katara has crossed her arms.] that if I had weird powers, I'd keep my weirdness to myself.
character_words: Yeah, yeah, "an ancient art unique to our culture", blah, blah, blah. Look, I'm just saying  that if I had weird powers, I'd keep my weirdness to myself.

full_text: [Cut to her face as she raises an eyebrow skeptically, arms still crossed.] You're calling me weird? I'm not the one who makes muscles at myself every time I see my reflection in the water!
character_words: You're calling me weird? I'm not the one who makes muscles at myself every time I see my reflection in the water!

full_text: Watch out! Go left! Go left!
character_words: Watch out! Go left! Go left!

full_text: [A touch of bitterness in her voice.] You call that left?
character_words: You call that left?

full_text: You don't like my steering? Well, maybe you should've [He waves his hands, mockingly imitating waterbending.] waterbended us out of the ice.
character_words: You don't like my steering? Well, maybe you should've  waterbended us out of the ice.

full_text: [Indignantly.] So it's my fault?
character_words: So it's my fault?

full_text: [Annoyed.] I knew I should've left you home! [Cut to a close-up of the siblings; Katara is staring down at her brother in anger while he rants calmly.] Leave it to a girl to screw things up!
character_words: I knew I should've left you home!  Leave it to a girl to screw things up!

full_text: You are the most sexist, [She brings her hands up to her head and swings them back down and behind her in her rage; the movement creates a small wave of water behind her.] immature, [Hands raised back to her head.] nut brained ... [Swings her arms back down again, creating a slightly larger wave; she raises her hands back to her head during a brief loss for words.] I'm embarrassed [Throwing a hand upward, a short jet of water shoots upward as well.] to be related to you!
character_words: You are the most sexist,  immature,  nut brained ...  I'm embarrassed  to be related to you!

full_text: Ever since mom died, [Points to herself.] I've been doing all the work around camp while you've been off playing soldier!
character_words: Ever since mom died,  I've been doing all the work around camp while you've been off playing soldier!

full_text: [Pointing to the iceberg behind her, his voice subdued by fright.] Uh ... Katara ...
character_words: Uh ... Katara ...

full_text: [Close-up of a rage-fueled Katara as she continues her outburst, a finger pointed in Sokka's face.] I even wash all the clothes! Have you ever smelled your dirty socks? Let me tell you, not pleasant!
character_words: I even wash all the clothes! Have you ever smelled your dirty socks? Let me tell you, not pleasant!

full_text: [In a screeching voice, his eyes open wide in fear.] Katara, settle down!
character_words: Katara, settle down!

full_text: No that's it! I'm done helping you! From now on, you're on your own!
character_words: No that's it! I'm done helping you! From now on, you're on your own!

full_text: Okay, you've gone from "weird" to "freakish", [He releases her.] Katara.
character_words: Okay, you've gone from "weird" to "freakish",  Katara.

full_text: [Astonished.] You mean I did that?
character_words: You mean I did that?

full_text: [Sarcastically, glancing at her and smirking.] Yep. [Nudging her with his elbow.] Congratulations.
character_words: Yep.  Congratulations.

full_text: He's alive! We have to help!
character_words: He's alive! We have to help!

full_text: Katara, get back here! [He grabs his spear from the ice and runs after Katara, who is already at the ice's edge.] We don't know what that thing is!
character_words: Katara, get back here!  We don't know what that thing is!

full_text: Finally! [He turns around to face another person in uniform, who sits at a small table.] Uncle, do you realize what this means?!
character_words: Finally!  Uncle, do you realize what this means?!

full_text: [The man is playing some sort of card game. He answers calmly while looking over the tile he's holding toward his nephew.] I won't get to finish my game?
character_words: I won't get to finish my game?

full_text: [Turning around again to face the light.] It means my search is about to come to an end.
character_words: It means my search is about to come to an end.

full_text: [Gestures at the light while facing his uncle again.] That light came from an incredibly powerful source! [The light dwindles and disappears.] It has to be him!
character_words: That light came from an incredibly powerful source!  It has to be him!

full_text: [With continuing disinterest and an air of skepticism.] Or it's just the celestial lights. We've been down this road before, Prince Zuko. [He looks at the tile in his hand, depicting the symbol of airbending.] I don't want you to get too excited over nothing. [He places it on a tile carrying the symbol of firebending and gestures toward the open place at the other side of the table while continuing in a relaxed voice.] Please, sit. Why don't you enjoy a cup of calming Jasmine tea?
character_words: Or it's just the celestial lights. We've been down this road before, Prince Zuko.  I don't want you to get too excited over nothing.  Please, sit. Why don't you enjoy a cup of calming Jasmine tea?

full_text: [Furiously, still facing Iroh.] I don't need any calming tea! I need to capture the Avatar! Helmsman, head a course for the light!
character_words: I don't need any calming tea! I need to capture the Avatar! Helmsman, head a course for the light!

full_text: [Brandishing his spear in defense once again.] Stop!
character_words: Stop!

full_text: [Waves the spear away. Annoyed.] Stop it!
character_words: Stop it!

full_text: [In a weak voice.] I need to ask you something ...
character_words: I need to ask you something ...

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: Please ... come closer.
character_words: Please ... come closer.

full_text: [Curiously.] What is it?
character_words: What is it?

full_text: [In a clear, happy, hopeful tone.] Will you go penguin sledding with me?
character_words: Will you go penguin sledding with me?

full_text: [Awkwardly.] Uh, sure ... I-I guess.
character_words: Uh, sure ... I-I guess.

full_text: [Looking around and rubbing his head, while Katara scrambles on her feet.] What's going on here?
character_words: What's going on here?

full_text: [Aggressively.] You tell us! [Points at the top of the crater.] How did you get in the ice? And why aren't you frozen? [He pokes the boy in his side with his spear.]
character_words: You tell us!  How did you get in the ice? And why aren't you frozen?

full_text: [Lazily pushes the spear away.] I'm ... not sure.
character_words: I'm ... not sure.

full_text: [Exclaims happily.] Appa! Are you all right? [He hangs down the side of the beast to look at its eyes, which are still closed.] Wake up, buddy.
character_words: Appa! Are you all right?  Wake up, buddy.

full_text: [Laughing cheerfully.] Ha, ha! You're okay!
character_words: Ha, ha! You're okay!

full_text: What is that thing?
character_words: What is that thing?

full_text: This is Appa, my flying bison.
character_words: This is Appa, my flying bison.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Right, and this is Katara, my flying sister. [Katara shoots him an odd look.]
character_words: Right, and this is Katara, my flying sister.

full_text: [Cheerfully.] Don't worry, it'll wash out. [Green slime is hanging from Sokka's face to his glove, dripping down as he retracts his hand. Katara covers her mouth in disgust.] So do you guys live around here?
character_words: Don't worry, it'll wash out.  So do you guys live around here?

full_text: [Pointing his spear accusingly again at Aang who is surprised to see the thing.] Don't answer that! Did you see that crazy bolt of light?! He was probably trying to signal the Fire Navy!
character_words: Don't answer that! Did you see that crazy bolt of light?! He was probably trying to signal the Fire Navy!

full_text: [Pushes Sokka's spear away again and addresses him sarcastically.] Oh yeah, I'm sure he's a spy for the Fire Navy. You can tell by that evil look in his eye. [Aang shoots the two an earnest grin.] The paranoid one is my brother, Sokka. You never told us your name.
character_words: Oh yeah, I'm sure he's a spy for the Fire Navy. You can tell by that evil look in his eye.  The paranoid one is my brother, Sokka. You never told us your name.

full_text: I'm A ... a-a-a-Achoo! [The boy sneezes, creating an air blast that sends him soaring into the air. He lands on the ground, unharmed.] I'm Aang. [He sniffles a bit.]
character_words: I'm A ... a-a-a-Achoo!  I'm Aang.

full_text: [Total disbelief.] You just sneezed ... [Points to the sky.] and flew ten feet in the air!
character_words: You just sneezed ...  and flew ten feet in the air!

full_text: [He looks questioningly toward the sky.] Really? It felt higher than that.
character_words: Really? It felt higher than that.

full_text: [Gasps for air in comprehension.] You're an airbender!
character_words: You're an airbender!

full_text: Sure am!
character_words: Sure am!

full_text: Giant light beams, flying bison, airbenders ... [Walks away.] I think I got midnight sun madness. I'm going home to where stuff makes sense. [He realizes, however, that he is stranded in the middle of the ocean with no way home.]
character_words: Giant light beams, flying bison, airbenders ...  I think I got midnight sun madness. I'm going home to where stuff makes sense.

full_text: Well, if you guys are stuck, Appa and I can give you a lift. [Aang airbends himself onto Appa.]
character_words: Well, if you guys are stuck, Appa and I can give you a lift.

full_text: We'd love a ride! Thanks! [Katara runs to the side of the bison.]
character_words: We'd love a ride! Thanks!

full_text: Oh no! I'm not getting on that fluffy snot monster!
character_words: Oh no! I'm not getting on that fluffy snot monster!

full_text: [While climbing on top of Appa with the help of Aang.] Are you hoping some other kind of monster will come along and give you a ride home? You know, before you freeze to death?
character_words: Are you hoping some other kind of monster will come along and give you a ride home? You know, before you freeze to death?

full_text: Okay, first time flyers, hold on tight! Appa, yip-yip!
character_words: Okay, first time flyers, hold on tight! Appa, yip-yip!

full_text: Come on, Appa. Yip-yip!
character_words: Come on, Appa. Yip-yip!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Wow, that was truly amazing ...
character_words: Wow, that was truly amazing ...

full_text: [Katara shoots her brother an angry glance.] Appa's just a little tired. A little rest and he'll be soaring through the sky. You'll see. [Katara smiles at Aang, who returns this gesture. When she wants to move back, she realizes that he is still smiling at her.]
character_words: Appa's just a little tired. A little rest and he'll be soaring through the sky. You'll see.

full_text: [Uncomfortably.] Why are you smiling at me like that?
character_words: Why are you smiling at me like that?

full_text: Oh, I was smiling? [Surprised, Katara smiles back.]
character_words: Oh, I was smiling?

full_text: I'm going to bed now. [Yawns and stretches.] Yep, a man needs his rest. [After a short pause, he abandons his try at a veiled suggestion and delivers his request more clearly, his tone tired.] Prince Zuko, you need some sleep. Even if you're right, and the Avatar is alive, you won't find him. Your father, grandfather and great-grandfather all tried and failed.
character_words: I'm going to bed now.  Yep, a man needs his rest.  Prince Zuko, you need some sleep. Even if you're right, and the Avatar is alive, you won't find him. Your father, grandfather and great-grandfather all tried and failed.

full_text: Because their honor didn't hinge on the Avatar's capture. Mine does. This coward's hundred years in hiding are over.
character_words: Because their honor didn't hinge on the Avatar's capture. Mine does. This coward's hundred years in hiding are over.

full_text: Hey.
character_words: Hey.

full_text: Hey. What'cha thinkin' about?
character_words: Hey. What'cha thinkin' about?

full_text: I guess I was wondering, your being an airbender and all, if you had any idea what happened to the Avatar?
character_words: I guess I was wondering, your being an airbender and all, if you had any idea what happened to the Avatar?

full_text: Oh, no. I didn't know him. I mean, I knew people that knew him, but I didn't. Sorry. [He smiles weakly at Katara.]
character_words: Oh, no. I didn't know him. I mean, I knew people that knew him, but I didn't. Sorry.

full_text: Okay. Just curious. [She slants her eyes in disappointment for a second before smiling again at Aang.] Good night.
character_words: Okay. Just curious.  Good night.

full_text: Sleep tight.
character_words: Sleep tight.

full_text: Aang? Aang! Wake up. [Aang shoots up, throwing the covers of his body and gasping for air. Katara perches beside him and stands up as she sees that Aang is awake.] It's okay, we're in the village now! Come on, get ready. [She points to the door of the tent.] Everyone's waiting to meet you.
character_words: Aang? Aang! Wake up.  It's okay, we're in the village now! Come on, get ready.  Everyone's waiting to meet you.

full_text: Aang, this is the entire village. [Points to the line of villagers in front of them.] Entire village, Aang.
character_words: Aang, this is the entire village.  Entire village, Aang.

full_text: [Uncomfortably.] Uh, why are they all looking at me like that? Did Appa sneeze on me?
character_words: Uh, why are they all looking at me like that? Did Appa sneeze on me?

full_text: Well, no one has seen an airbender in a hundred years. We thought they were extinct, until my granddaughter and grandson found you.
character_words: Well, no one has seen an airbender in a hundred years. We thought they were extinct, until my granddaughter and grandson found you.

full_text: [Shocked disbelief.] Extinct?
character_words: Extinct?

full_text: [Gesturing.] Aang, this is my grandmother.
character_words: Aang, this is my grandmother.

full_text: Call me Gran-Gran.
character_words: Call me Gran-Gran.

full_text: [Annoyed.] What is this, a weapon? You can't stab anything with this!
character_words: What is this, a weapon? You can't stab anything with this!

full_text: [Aang uses a small air current to get his staff back.] It's not for stabbing! It's for airbending. [He opens his staff into a glider, making Sokka gasp in fright and cover his head with his hands.]
character_words: It's not for stabbing! It's for airbending.

full_text: [Excited.] Magic trick! Do it again!
character_words: Magic trick! Do it again!

full_text: Not magic, airbending. [He moves his glider around him, visually demonstrating what he is talking about.] It lets me control the air currents around my glider and fly.
character_words: Not magic, airbending.  It lets me control the air currents around my glider and fly.

full_text: [Mockingly states his disbelief.] Ya know, last time I checked, humans can't fly!
character_words: Ya know, last time I checked, humans can't fly!

full_text: [Accepting Sokka's challenge, smiling.] Check again!
character_words: Check again!

full_text: [In admiration.] He's flying!
character_words: He's flying!

full_text: It's amazing!
character_words: It's amazing!

full_text: [Shocked.] My watchtower!
character_words: My watchtower!

full_text: [Offering her hand to pull him out of the snow.] That was amazing!
character_words: That was amazing!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Great. You're an airbender, Katara's a waterbender. Together you can just waste time all day long. [He wedges himself free from underneath the weight of the snow and stalks off.]
character_words: Great. You're an airbender, Katara's a waterbender. Together you can just waste time all day long.

full_text: [Surprised and with admiration.] You're a waterbender?
character_words: You're a waterbender?

full_text: [Nervously.] Well, sort of. Not yet.
character_words: Well, sort of. Not yet.

full_text: All right, no more playing. Come on, Katara, you have chores.
character_words: All right, no more playing. Come on, Katara, you have chores.

full_text: [Excitedly.] I told you, he's the real thing Gran-Gran! I finally found a bender to teach me!
character_words: I told you, he's the real thing Gran-Gran! I finally found a bender to teach me!

full_text: [Calmly.] Katara, try not to put all your hopes in this boy.
character_words: Katara, try not to put all your hopes in this boy.

full_text: But he's special! I can tell! [Clenches her fist and closes her eyes in hope.] I sense he's filled with much wisdom.
character_words: But he's special! I can tell!  I sense he's filled with much wisdom.

full_text: [Muffled.] See? Now my tongue is stuck to my staff!
character_words: See? Now my tongue is stuck to my staff!

full_text: [Sternly.] Again.
character_words: Again.

full_text: [Sighs while he gets up.] No! [Zuko lowers his arms and looks at his uncle.] Power in firebending comes from the breath [Iroh moves his both hand up in front of him to emphasize the breathing motion.], not the muscles. [He stretches his left arm out as if he was sending a fire blast.] The breath becomes energy in the body. The energy extends past your limbs and becomes: fire! [Iroh directs a fire blast at his nephew that evaporates just before it would scorch him.] Get it right this time.
character_words: No!  Power in firebending comes from the breath , not the muscles.  The breath becomes energy in the body. The energy extends past your limbs and becomes: fire!  Get it right this time.

full_text: [With suppressed anger, he walks toward his uncle and addresses him.] Enough! I've been drilling this sequence all day. Teach me the next set! I'm more than ready!
character_words: Enough! I've been drilling this sequence all day. Teach me the next set! I'm more than ready!

full_text: No, you are impatient. [He sits down again on his chair.] You have yet to master your basics. [He yells his order.] Drill it again!
character_words: No, you are impatient.  You have yet to master your basics.  Drill it again!

full_text: [The suppressed anger is very apparent in his voice.] The sages tell us that the Avatar is the last airbender. [Close-up of Iroh, who does not look pleased with the attitude of his nephew.] He must be over a hundred years old by now. He's had a century to master the four elements! I'll need more than basic firebending to defeat him. [Starts to yell at his uncle.] You will teach me the advanced set!
character_words: The sages tell us that the Avatar is the last airbender.  He must be over a hundred years old by now. He's had a century to master the four elements! I'll need more than basic firebending to defeat him.  You will teach me the advanced set!

full_text: [Concedes reluctantly. On a dire tone.] Very well, [His expression changes completely to one of delight as he picks something up from the ground.] but first, I must finish my roast duck. [He quickly munches down the roast duck, much to the dismay of Zuko.]
character_words: Very well,  but first, I must finish my roast duck.

full_text: [With a stern expression.] Now men, it's important that you show no fear when you face a firebender. [He brings out his club and holds it proudly.] In the Water Tribe, we fight to the last man standing! For without courage, how can we call ourselves men? [He clutches his fist to emphasize the word "men" as he stares down the people in front of him.]
character_words: Now men, it's important that you show no fear when you face a firebender.  In the Water Tribe, we fight to the last man standing! For without courage, how can we call ourselves men?

full_text: [Waving his hand in the air.] I gotta pee!
character_words: I gotta pee!

full_text: [Angrily.] Listen! Until your fathers return from the War, they're counting on you to be the men of this tribe, and that means no potty breaks! [He makes some wide arm gestures to emphasize his words again.]
character_words: Listen! Until your fathers return from the War, they're counting on you to be the men of this tribe, and that means no potty breaks!

full_text: But I really gotta go!
character_words: But I really gotta go!

full_text: [Sighs.] Okay, who else has to go?
character_words: Okay, who else has to go?

full_text: [Runs up to Sokka as the children leave. In a worried tone.] Have you seen Aang? Gran-Gran said he disappeared over an hour ago.
character_words: Have you seen Aang? Gran-Gran said he disappeared over an hour ago.

full_text: [Amused.] Wow! Everything freezes in there!
character_words: Wow! Everything freezes in there!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Uh! [Angrily points at Aang.] Katara, get him out of here! This lesson is for warriors only!
character_words: Uh!  Katara, get him out of here! This lesson is for warriors only!

full_text: Whee!
character_words: Whee!

full_text: [Yelling angrily.] Stop! Stop it right now! [The laughter of the children is stifled immediately and Appa turns his head to look at Sokka, who accusingly directs his anger to Aang.] What's wrong with you?! We don't have time for fun and games with the War going on!
character_words: Stop! Stop it right now!  What's wrong with you?! We don't have time for fun and games with the War going on!

full_text: [Slides down from Appa's head.] What war? What are you talking about?
character_words: What war? What are you talking about?

full_text: [Raises one eyebrow in disbelief.] You're kidding, right?
character_words: You're kidding, right?

full_text: [Exclaims enthusiastically.] Penguin!
character_words: Penguin!

full_text: He's kidding, right?
character_words: He's kidding, right?

full_text: Aang?
character_words: Aang?

full_text: [Chasing the penguins while laughing.] Hey, come on little guy. Wanna go sledding? [He jumps at a penguin, but the animal evades his attempt and Aang belly flops into the snow. He turns on his back and quickly erects himself with his airbending as Katara comes up beside him.] Heh heh. I have a way with animals.
character_words: Hey, come on little guy. Wanna go sledding?  Heh heh. I have a way with animals.

full_text: [Amused.] Hehehe, Aang, I'll help you catch a penguin if you teach me waterbending.
character_words: Hehehe, Aang, I'll help you catch a penguin if you teach me waterbending.

full_text: [Having grabbed the tail of a penguin, he holds on as it pulls him through the snow for a short way before letting go and looking up at Katara.] You got a deal! Just one little problem ... [He airbends himself into a sitting position.] I'm an airbender, not a waterbender. Isn't there someone in your tribe who can teach you?
character_words: You got a deal! Just one little problem ...  I'm an airbender, not a waterbender. Isn't there someone in your tribe who can teach you?

full_text: [Sadly.] No. You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole.
character_words: No. You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole.

full_text: This isn't right. A waterbender needs to master water. [He thinks for a moment.] What about the North Pole? There's another Water Tribe up there, right? Maybe they have waterbenders who could teach you.
character_words: This isn't right. A waterbender needs to master water.  What about the North Pole? There's another Water Tribe up there, right? Maybe they have waterbenders who could teach you.

full_text: Maybe, but we haven't had contact with our sister tribe in a long time. It's not exactly "turn right at the second glacier". It's on the other side of the world.
character_words: Maybe, but we haven't had contact with our sister tribe in a long time. It's not exactly "turn right at the second glacier". It's on the other side of the world.

full_text: But you forget, I have a flying bison. [He happily points at himself.] Appa and I can personally fly you to the North Pole. Katara, we're going to find you a master!
character_words: But you forget, I have a flying bison.  Appa and I can personally fly you to the North Pole. Katara, we're going to find you a master!

full_text: [Unsure.] That's ... I mean, I don't know. I've never left home before.
character_words: That's ... I mean, I don't know. I've never left home before.

full_text: Well, you think about it, but in the meantime, can you teach me catch one of these penguins?
character_words: Well, you think about it, but in the meantime, can you teach me catch one of these penguins?

full_text: [Mockingly imitating a teacher.] Okay, listen closely my young pupil. [Inclines her head toward Aang.] Catching penguins is an ancient and sacred art. [She conjures a fish out of her sleeve.] Observe!
character_words: Okay, listen closely my young pupil.  Catching penguins is an ancient and sacred art.  Observe!

full_text: Hi hi hi! Ha, ha, ha!
character_words: Hi hi hi! Ha, ha, ha!

full_text: [Happily.] I haven't done this since I was a kid!
character_words: I haven't done this since I was a kid!

full_text: You still are a kid!
character_words: You still are a kid!

full_text: [In awe.] Whoa! What is that?
character_words: Whoa! What is that?

full_text: [On a slightly dark tone.] A Fire Navy ship. And a very bad memory for my people. [Aang begins to approach the wreckage.] Aang, stop! We're not allowed to go near it! The ship could be booby-trapped!
character_words: A Fire Navy ship. And a very bad memory for my people.  Aang, stop! We're not allowed to go near it! The ship could be booby-trapped!

full_text: If you want to be a bender, you have to let go of fear.
character_words: If you want to be a bender, you have to let go of fear.

full_text: [Her voice echoes through the room.] This ship has haunted my tribe since Gran-Gran was a little girl. [The camera shifts through the room, revealing all the weapons more closely.] It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.
character_words: This ship has haunted my tribe since Gran-Gran was a little girl.  It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.

full_text: Okay, back up. I have friends all over the world, even in the Fire Nation. [Aang picks up a Guan Dao to inspect it.] I've never seen any war.
character_words: Okay, back up. I have friends all over the world, even in the Fire Nation.  I've never seen any war.

full_text: Aang, how long were you in that iceberg?
character_words: Aang, how long were you in that iceberg?

full_text: [Uncertain.] I don't know. A few days, maybe?
character_words: I don't know. A few days, maybe?

full_text: I think it was more like a hundred years!
character_words: I think it was more like a hundred years!

full_text: [In full disbelief and slightly accusing.] What?! That's impossible! Do I look like a hundred-twelve-year-old man to you?
character_words: What?! That's impossible! Do I look like a hundred-twelve-year-old man to you?

full_text: Think about it. The War is a century old. You don't know about it because, somehow, you were in there the whole time! [Aang's expression changes to one of comprehension.] It's the only explanation.
character_words: Think about it. The War is a century old. You don't know about it because, somehow, you were in there the whole time!  It's the only explanation.

full_text: A hundred years! [Saddened by his new discovery.] I can't believe it.
character_words: A hundred years!  I can't believe it.

full_text: [Squats beside him.] I'm sorry, Aang. Maybe somehow there's a bright side to all this ...
character_words: I'm sorry, Aang. Maybe somehow there's a bright side to all this ...

full_text: [Cheerfully.] I did get to meet you.
character_words: I did get to meet you.

full_text: [Smiling warmly at him while offering her hand.] Come on, let's get out of here.
character_words: Come on, let's get out of here.

full_text: Aang, let's head back, this place is creepy.
character_words: Aang, let's head back, this place is creepy.

full_text: Huh?
character_words: Huh?

full_text: What's that you said about booby traps?
character_words: What's that you said about booby traps?

full_text: Uh oh ... [Aang notices a hole in the roof of the ship and takes a surprised Katara into his arms.] Hold on tight!
character_words: Uh oh ...  Hold on tight!

full_text: Aaah!
character_words: Aaah!

full_text: The last airbender! [Aang and Katara reach the ground again and Aang sets Katara down. They start to walk away.] Quite agile for his old age. [He turns and angrily yells to a soldier behind him.] Wake my uncle! Tell him I found the Avatar. [Zuko peeks through his telescope again to see that Katara and Aang are running now. Zuko follows the direction they are running in with his telescope and discovers that they must be headed for the village he spots.] As well as his hiding place ...
character_words: The last airbender!  Quite agile for his old age.  Wake my uncle! Tell him I found the Avatar.  As well as his hiding place ...

full_text: Water. Earth. Fire. Air. Long ago, the four nations lived together in harmony. Then, everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar, master of all four elements, could stop them, but when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years passed, and my brother and I discovered the new Avatar, an airbender named Aang. And although his airbending skills are great, he has a lot to learn before he's ready to save anyone. But I believe Aang can save the world.
character_words: Water. Earth. Fire. Air. Long ago, the four nations lived together in harmony. Then, everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar, master of all four elements, could stop them, but when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years passed, and my brother and I discovered the new Avatar, an airbender named Aang. And although his airbending skills are great, he has a lot to learn before he's ready to save anyone. But I believe Aang can save the world.

full_text: [Joyfully.] Yay! Aang's back!
character_words: Yay! Aang's back!

full_text: [Angrily.] I knew it! [Accusingly points a finger at Aang as he and Katara draw closer.] You signaled the Fire Navy with that flare! You're leading them straight to us, aren't you?
character_words: I knew it!  You signaled the Fire Navy with that flare! You're leading them straight to us, aren't you?

full_text: [Protesting.] Aang didn't do anything! It was an accident.
character_words: Aang didn't do anything! It was an accident.

full_text: [Sheepishly, as Katara glares at Sokka.] Yeah. We were on the ship and there was this booby trap, and, well -- [Awkwardly rubs his head.] -- we booby-ed right into it.
character_words: Yeah. We were on the ship and there was this booby trap, and, well --  -- we booby-ed right into it.

full_text: [Worriedly.] Katara, you shouldn't have gone on that ship! Now we could all be in danger!
character_words: Katara, you shouldn't have gone on that ship! Now we could all be in danger!

full_text: [Sorrowfully.] Don't blame Katara. I brought her there. It's my fault.
character_words: Don't blame Katara. I brought her there. It's my fault.

full_text: [Angry and triumphant, having found an excuse.] Aha! The traitor confesses! Warriors, away from the enemy. [The children begin to sadly walk away.] The foreigner is banished from our village.
character_words: Aha! The traitor confesses! Warriors, away from the enemy.  The foreigner is banished from our village.

full_text: [Irritably, clenching her fists.] Sokka, you're making a mistake.
character_words: Sokka, you're making a mistake.

full_text: [Stubbornly persisting in his anger.] No, I'm keeping my promise to Dad. [Pointing to Aang.] I'm protecting you, from threats like him!
character_words: No, I'm keeping my promise to Dad.  I'm protecting you, from threats like him!

full_text: [Angrily.] Aang is not our enemy! [Continues in a calm, soothing voice.] Don't you see? Aang's brought us something we haven't had in a long time: fun.
character_words: Aang is not our enemy!  Don't you see? Aang's brought us something we haven't had in a long time: fun.

full_text: [Annoyed.] Fun?! We can't fight firebenders with fun!
character_words: Fun?! We can't fight firebenders with fun!

full_text: [Optimistically.] You should try it sometime.
character_words: You should try it sometime.

full_text: [Angrily.] Get out of our village! Now!
character_words: Get out of our village! Now!

full_text: [Pleading.] Grandmother, please. Don't let Sokka do this!
character_words: Grandmother, please. Don't let Sokka do this!

full_text: [Gravely.] Katara, you knew going on that ship was forbidden. Sokka is right. I think it best if the airbender leaves.
character_words: Katara, you knew going on that ship was forbidden. Sokka is right. I think it best if the airbender leaves.

full_text: [Outraged.] Fine! Then I'm banished, too! [Drags Aang away.] Come on Aang, let's go.
character_words: Fine! Then I'm banished, too!  Come on Aang, let's go.

full_text: [Demanding.] Where do you think you're going?
character_words: Where do you think you're going?

full_text: [Angrily.] To find a waterbender. Aang is taking me to the North Pole.
character_words: To find a waterbender. Aang is taking me to the North Pole.

full_text: [Confusedly.] I am? [Brightening.] Great!
character_words: I am?  Great!

full_text: Katara! Would you really choose him over your tribe? [Shows shot of the entire Southern Water Tribe.] Your own family?
character_words: Katara! Would you really choose him over your tribe?  Your own family?

full_text: [Understanding.] Katara, I don't want to come between you and your family.
character_words: Katara, I don't want to come between you and your family.

full_text: [Upset.] So, you're leaving the South Pole? [In a quieter tone.] This is goodbye?
character_words: So, you're leaving the South Pole?  This is goodbye?

full_text: Thanks for penguin sledding with me.
character_words: Thanks for penguin sledding with me.

full_text: [Still in that quiet tone.] Where will you go?
character_words: Where will you go?

full_text: Guess I'll go back home and look for the airbenders. [He places one hand on Appa, but is suddenly struck with realization.] Wow, I haven't cleaned my room in a hundred years. Not looking forward to that. [He uses his airbending to hop onto Appa's head.] It was nice meeting everyone.
character_words: Guess I'll go back home and look for the airbenders.  Wow, I haven't cleaned my room in a hundred years. Not looking forward to that.  It was nice meeting everyone.

full_text: [Sarcastically, with arms crossed.] Let's see your bison fly now, air boy.
character_words: Let's see your bison fly now, air boy.

full_text: [Encouragingly.] Come on Appa, you can do it. Yip-yip!
character_words: Come on Appa, you can do it. Yip-yip!

full_text: [Mockingly.] Yeah, I thought so!
character_words: Yeah, I thought so!

full_text: [Runs from crowd to stand next to Katara with tears in her eyes.] Ahhh! [Close-up.] Aang, don't go! I'll miss you!
character_words: Ahhh!  Aang, don't go! I'll miss you!

full_text: [Sadly.] I'll miss you, too. [Looks at Katara, who frowns back at him, her eyes saddened while her hair loopies sway in the wind.] Come on, boy.
character_words: I'll miss you, too.  Come on, boy.

full_text: [Consoling tone.] Katara, you'll feel better after you- [Katara quickly turns around and cuts her off.]
character_words: Katara, you'll feel better after you-

full_text: [Rounding on Kanna and interrupting her, her voice full of empassioned rage.] You happy now? [Gestures in the direction Aang took off.] There goes my one chance at becoming a waterbender!
character_words: You happy now?  There goes my one chance at becoming a waterbender!

full_text: All right, ready our defenses! The Fire Nation could be on our shores any moment now!
character_words: All right, ready our defenses! The Fire Nation could be on our shores any moment now!

full_text: [Stopping and dancing around.] But I gotta ...
character_words: But I gotta ...

full_text: [Authoritatively, a twinge of annoyance in his voice; he points onward, ushering the boy in that direction.] And no potty breaks!
character_words: And no potty breaks!

full_text: [Sorrowfully.] Yeah, I liked her too. [Catches sight of Fire Nation ship advancing toward the Southern Water Tribe; gasps.] The village! [He slides off the ice formation onto the ground.] Appa, wait here.
character_words: Yeah, I liked her too.  The village!  Appa, wait here.

full_text: [Disappointed at the tower's collapse.] Oh man!
character_words: Oh man!

full_text: [Horrified.] Oh maaan ...
character_words: Oh maaan ...

full_text: [Hysterically.] Sokka, get out of the way!
character_words: Sokka, get out of the way!

full_text: [Angrily.] Where are you hiding him?
character_words: Where are you hiding him?

full_text: [Shaking Kanna; annoyed.] He'd be about this age, master of all elements?
character_words: He'd be about this age, master of all elements?

full_text: [Angrily.] I know you're hiding him!
character_words: I know you're hiding him!

full_text: Show no fear!
character_words: Show no fear!

full_text: [Cheerfully, despite the present situation.] Hey, Katara. Hey, Sokka.
character_words: Hey, Katara. Hey, Sokka.

full_text: [Moodily.] Hi, Aang. Thanks for coming.
character_words: Hi, Aang. Thanks for coming.

full_text: Looking for me?
character_words: Looking for me?

full_text: [Shocked.] You're the airbender? You're the Avatar?
character_words: You're the airbender? You're the Avatar?

full_text: [Surprised.] Aang?
character_words: Aang?

full_text: [Bewildered.] No way!
character_words: No way!

full_text: I've spent years preparing for this encounter. Training, meditating. [Angrily.] You're just a child!
character_words: I've spent years preparing for this encounter. Training, meditating.  You're just a child!

full_text: [Calmly, tilting his head to one side with a somewhat confused expression.] Well, you're just a teenager.
character_words: Well, you're just a teenager.

full_text: If I go with you, [He holds his staff in front of him as an offer, making sure Zuko understands that he does not wish to continue fighting.] will you promise to leave everyone alone?
character_words: If I go with you,  will you promise to leave everyone alone?

full_text: [Sadly.] No! Aang, don't do this!
character_words: No! Aang, don't do this!

full_text: [Surprisingly calm.] Don't worry, Katara. It'll be okay. [He gasps when he is shoved on the walkway. Katara's face contorts with sadness and fright.] Take care of Appa for me until I get back.
character_words: Don't worry, Katara. It'll be okay.  Take care of Appa for me until I get back.

full_text: [Boarding the ship up the walkway. Determined.] Head a course for the Fire Nation. I'm going home.
character_words: Head a course for the Fire Nation. I'm going home.

full_text: [Sokka is seen in the background, carrying a pack as she speaks on a determined tone.] We have to go after that ship, Sokka. Aang saved our tribe, now we have to save him.
character_words: We have to go after that ship, Sokka. Aang saved our tribe, now we have to save him.

full_text: Katara, I --
character_words: Katara, I --

full_text: [Making arm gestures to emphasize her words while she speaks in an objective tone.] Why can't you realize that he's on our side? [Cuts to shot of her and her brother, her back to the screen.] If we don't help him, no one will. I know you don't like Aang, but we owe him and --
character_words: Why can't you realize that he's on our side?  If we don't help him, no one will. I know you don't like Aang, but we owe him and --

full_text: [Cutting her off.] Katara! [Slightly annoyed.] Are you gonna talk all day, or are you comin' with me?
character_words: Katara!  Are you gonna talk all day, or are you comin' with me?

full_text: [Running over to her brother.] Sokka! [She gives him a hug.]
character_words: Sokka!

full_text: [Inviting.] Get in, we're going to save your boyfriend.
character_words: Get in, we're going to save your boyfriend.

full_text: [Annoyed.] He's not my --
character_words: He's not my --

full_text: [Shrugging, nonchalant.] Whatever.
character_words: Whatever.

full_text: [Accusingly.] What do you two think you're doing?
character_words: What do you two think you're doing?

full_text: [Smiling warmly.] You'll need these. [Kanna holds up their sleeping bags.] You have a long journey ahead of you. [The siblings glance at each other in surprise. Kanna walks over to face Katara.] It's been so long since I've had hope, but you brought it back to life, my little waterbender. [Hugs Katara and who at the end takes the sleeping back out of her hands; to Sokka.] And you, my brave warrior, be nice to your sister.
character_words: You'll need these.  You have a long journey ahead of you.  It's been so long since I've had hope, but you brought it back to life, my little waterbender.  And you, my brave warrior, be nice to your sister.

full_text: [Kanna hugs Sokka, who, slightly embarrassed, pats her back.] Yeah, okay Gran. [He smiles broadly when she releases him.]
character_words: Yeah, okay Gran.

full_text: Aang is the Avatar. He's the world's only chance. You both found him for a reason. Now your destinies are intertwined with his.
character_words: Aang is the Avatar. He's the world's only chance. You both found him for a reason. Now your destinies are intertwined with his.

full_text: [Pointing at the ready canoe.] There's no way we're going to catch a warship with a canoe.
character_words: There's no way we're going to catch a warship with a canoe.

full_text: [Brightly.] Appa! [Begins running toward the bison.]
character_words: Appa!

full_text: [Annoyed.] You just looove taking me out of my comfort zone, don't you?
character_words: You just looove taking me out of my comfort zone, don't you?

full_text: This staff will make an excellent gift for my father. [Inspects the staff further.] I suppose you wouldn't know of fathers, being raised by monks. [To his soldiers.] Take the Avatar to the prison hold, [Handing the staff to Iroh.] and take this to my quarters.
character_words: This staff will make an excellent gift for my father.  I suppose you wouldn't know of fathers, being raised by monks.  Take the Avatar to the prison hold,  and take this to my quarters.

full_text: [Turns to one of Zuko's men and gives him the staff; casually.] Hey, you mind taking this to his quarters for me?
character_words: Hey, you mind taking this to his quarters for me?

full_text: [Slyly.] So, I guess you've never fought an airbender before. I bet I could take you both with my hands tied behind my back.
character_words: So, I guess you've never fought an airbender before. I bet I could take you both with my hands tied behind my back.

full_text: [Unamused.] Silence.
character_words: Silence.

full_text: The Avatar has escaped!
character_words: The Avatar has escaped!

full_text: [Unamused.] Go. Fly. [Katara glances annoyed at her brother.] Soar.
character_words: Go. Fly.  Soar.

full_text: [Pleading as Appa growls again.] Please, Appa. We need your help. Aang needs your help.
character_words: Please, Appa. We need your help. Aang needs your help.

full_text: [Blandly.] Up. Ascend. Elevate.
character_words: Up. Ascend. Elevate.

full_text: Sokka doesn't believe you can fly, but I do, Appa. [Strokes Appa.] Come on, don't you want to save Aang? [Appa grunts.]
character_words: Sokka doesn't believe you can fly, but I do, Appa.  Come on, don't you want to save Aang?

full_text: What was it that kid said? Yee-haw? Hup-hup? Wah-hoo? Uh ... Yip-yip?
character_words: What was it that kid said? Yee-haw? Hup-hup? Wah-hoo? Uh ... Yip-yip?

full_text: [Thrilled.] You did it, Sokka!
character_words: You did it, Sokka!

full_text: [Ecstatically looking over the rim of the saddle.] He's flying! He's flying! Katara, he's -
character_words: He's flying! He's flying! Katara, he's -

full_text: [Sheepishly.] I mean, big deal. He's flying. [Brightens quickly.]
character_words: I mean, big deal. He's flying.

full_text: You haven't seen my staff around, have you?
character_words: You haven't seen my staff around, have you?

full_text: [Off camera.] Thanks anyway!
character_words: Thanks anyway!

full_text: [Whispering.] Sorry!
character_words: Sorry!

full_text: My staff!
character_words: My staff!

full_text: Looks like I underestimated you.
character_words: Looks like I underestimated you.

full_text: [Shocked.] What is that?
character_words: What is that?

full_text: [Ecstatic.] Appa!
character_words: Appa!

full_text: [Horrified.] Aang! No!
character_words: Aang! No!

full_text: [Voice-over.] Aang! Aang! Aang!
character_words: Aang! Aang! Aang!

full_text: [Shocked.] Did you see what he just did?!
character_words: Did you see what he just did?!

full_text: [Impressed.] Now that was some waterbending!
character_words: Now that was some waterbending!

full_text: [Worried.] Aang! Are you okay?
character_words: Aang! Are you okay?

full_text: [Weakly.] Hey, Katara. Hey, Sokka. Thanks for coming.
character_words: Hey, Katara. Hey, Sokka. Thanks for coming.

full_text: Well, I couldn't let you have all the glory.
character_words: Well, I couldn't let you have all the glory.

full_text: [Weakly.] I dropped my staff.
character_words: I dropped my staff.

full_text: [Rising.] Got it!
character_words: Got it!

full_text: [Triumphantly.] Ha! That's from the Water Tribe!
character_words: Ha! That's from the Water Tribe!

full_text: [Complaining.] Katara!
character_words: Katara!

full_text: [Urgently.] Hurry up, Sokka!
character_words: Hurry up, Sokka!

full_text: [Muttering to himself, as he uses his boomerang to chip the ice.] I'm just a guy, with a boomerang. [He frees his left foot.] I didn't ask for all this flying and magic! [He manages to break free and races up Appa's tail.] Yip-yip! Yip-yip!
character_words: I'm just a guy, with a boomerang.  I didn't ask for all this flying and magic!  Yip-yip! Yip-yip!

full_text: [Rubbing eyes and staring up at Appa in surprise.] Duh? Huh?
character_words: Duh? Huh?

full_text: [Angrily.] Shoot them down!
character_words: Shoot them down!

full_text: [Calmly.] Good news for the Fire Lord. The Fire Nation's greatest threat is just a little kid.
character_words: Good news for the Fire Lord. The Fire Nation's greatest threat is just a little kid.

full_text: [Holding back rage.] That "kid", Uncle, just did this. [Cuts to a shot of the damaged ship, the whole front covered in ice and snow.] I won't underestimate him again. [Yells his order to the soldiers and points at the piles of snow.] Dig the ship out and follow them!
character_words: That "kid", Uncle, just did this.  I won't underestimate him again.  Dig the ship out and follow them!

full_text: [Slightly embarrassed.] As soon as you're done with that.
character_words: As soon as you're done with that.

full_text: [Bewildered.] How did you do that?! With the water? It was the most amazing thing I've ever seen!
character_words: How did you do that?! With the water? It was the most amazing thing I've ever seen!

full_text: [Quietly, slightly downcast, sitting on the edge of the saddle.] I don't know. I just sort of ... did it.
character_words: I don't know. I just sort of ... did it.

full_text: [Curious, but serious.] Why didn't you tell us you were the Avatar?
character_words: Why didn't you tell us you were the Avatar?

full_text: Because ... [Turns away slightly; saddened.] I never wanted to be.
character_words: Because ...  I never wanted to be.

full_text: But Aang, the world's been waiting for the Avatar to return and finally put an end to this war.
character_words: But Aang, the world's been waiting for the Avatar to return and finally put an end to this war.

full_text: [Downcast.] And how am I going to do that?
character_words: And how am I going to do that?

full_text: According to legend, you need to first master water, then earth, then fire, right?
character_words: According to legend, you need to first master water, then earth, then fire, right?

full_text: [Looking at Katara.] That's what the monks told me.
character_words: That's what the monks told me.

full_text: [Brightening a bit.] Well, if we go to the North Pole, you can master waterbending!
character_words: Well, if we go to the North Pole, you can master waterbending!

full_text: [Turning to face her, smiling and brightening up completely.] We can learn it together!
character_words: We can learn it together!

full_text: [Faces her brother; cheerfully.] And Sokka, I'm sure you'll get to knock some firebender heads on the way.
character_words: And Sokka, I'm sure you'll get to knock some firebender heads on the way.

full_text: [Content.] I'd like that. I'd reeally like that.
character_words: I'd like that. I'd reeally like that.

full_text: [Optimistically.] Then we're in this together!
character_words: Then we're in this together!

full_text: [Cheerfully, pulling out a rolled up scroll.] All right, but before I learn waterbending, we have some serious business to attend to. [He uses airbending to situate himself onto the saddle and unrolls the scroll, revealing a map of the Avatar World.] Here, here and here.
character_words: All right, but before I learn waterbending, we have some serious business to attend to.  Here, here and here.

full_text: [Curiously.] What's there? [Points to one of the locations.]
character_words: What's there?

full_text: [Points to the location in Earth Kingdom.] Here, we'll ride the hopping llamas. [Points to the location in Air Nomad territory.] Then waaay over here, we'll surf on the backs of giant koi fish. [Katara and Sokka stare at him in wonder.] Then back over here, we'll ride the hog monkeys. [The siblings glance at each other.] They don't like people riding them, but that's what makes it fun!
character_words: Here, we'll ride the hopping llamas.  Then waaay over here, we'll surf on the backs of giant koi fish.  Then back over here, we'll ride the hog monkeys.  They don't like people riding them, but that's what makes it fun!

full_text: [Excitedly.] Wait 'til you see it, Katara! The Air Temple is one of the most beautiful places in the world!
character_words: Wait 'til you see it, Katara! The Air Temple is one of the most beautiful places in the world!

full_text: [Cautiously.] Aang, I know you're excited, [She turns around to face him.] but it's been a hundred years since you've been home.
character_words: Aang, I know you're excited,  but it's been a hundred years since you've been home.

full_text: [Smiling broadly.] That's why I'm so excited!
character_words: That's why I'm so excited!

full_text: [Cautiously.] It's just that ... a lot can change in all that time.
character_words: It's just that ... a lot can change in all that time.

full_text: [Happily.] I know, but I need to see it for myself.
character_words: I know, but I need to see it for myself.

full_text: [Cheerfully.] Wake up, Sokka! Air Temple, here we come! [Sokka awakens, making groggy noises.]
character_words: Wake up, Sokka! Air Temple, here we come!

full_text: [Grunting sleepily.] Uggh! Sleep now. Temple later.
character_words: Uggh! Sleep now. Temple later.

full_text: [Alarmed.] Sokka! Wake up! [Aang moves the stick up and down the sleeping bag, only touching Sokka with the tip of it.] There's a prickle snake in your sleeping bag!
character_words: Sokka! Wake up!  There's a prickle snake in your sleeping bag!

full_text: [He lazily opens one eye before yelling out in horror.] Ahh! [He quickly rises and hops around, still inside the sleeping bag.] Get it off! Get it off! [After two hops, Sokka slams flat to the ground.] Ahh!
character_words: Ahh!  Get it off! Get it off!  Ahh!

full_text: [Happily.] Great! You're awake! Let's go!
character_words: Great! You're awake! Let's go!

full_text: Uncle, I want the repairs made as quickly as possible. I don't want to stay too long and risk losing his trail.
character_words: Uncle, I want the repairs made as quickly as possible. I don't want to stay too long and risk losing his trail.

full_text: [Disinterested.] You mean the Avatar?
character_words: You mean the Avatar?

full_text: [Turns around sharply to face Iroh, as he slightly backs off.] Don't mention his name on these docks! [Makes some wide arm movements.] Once word gets out that he's alive, every firebender will be out looking for him, and I don't want anyone getting in the way!
character_words: Don't mention his name on these docks!  Once word gets out that he's alive, every firebender will be out looking for him, and I don't want anyone getting in the way!

full_text: [Iroh and Zuko turn, with shocked expressions on their face, toward the camera in the direction the sound came from.] Getting in the way of what, [Close-up of a man with big sideburns dressed in a Fire Nation uniform.] Prince Zuko?
character_words: Getting in the way of what,  Prince Zuko?

full_text: [With dislike in his voice.] Captain Zhao.
character_words: Captain Zhao.

full_text: [Smirks.] It's commander now. And [Bows slightly in Iroh's direction.] General Iroh. Great hero of our nation.
character_words: It's commander now. And  General Iroh. Great hero of our nation.

full_text: [Bows back.] Retired general.
character_words: Retired general.

full_text: The Fire Lord's brother and son are welcome guests anytime. What brings you to my harbor?
character_words: The Fire Lord's brother and son are welcome guests anytime. What brings you to my harbor?

full_text: Our ship is being repaired.
character_words: Our ship is being repaired.

full_text: That's quite a bit of damage.
character_words: That's quite a bit of damage.

full_text: Yes. [He holds up one finger, while Iroh stares disinterested in front of him.] You wouldn't believe what happened. [He glances at his uncle, and angrily commands him as he gestures at Zhao.] Uncle! Tell Commander Zhao what happened.
character_words: Yes.  You wouldn't believe what happened.  Uncle! Tell Commander Zhao what happened.

full_text: [Iroh's eyes open wide in surprise, as he is addressed by Zuko.] Yes. I will do that. [He happily holds his hand up and relates enthusiastically.] It was incredible! [To Zuko, from the corner of his mouth in a confused tone.] What? Did we crash or something?
character_words: Yes. I will do that.  It was incredible!  What? Did we crash or something?

full_text: [Looks at his uncle uncomfortably.] Yes! Right into ... an Earth Kingdom ship!
character_words: Yes! Right into ... an Earth Kingdom ship!

full_text: [In disbelief.] Really? You must regale me with all of the thrilling details. [Smirks while he gets into Zuko's face.] Join me for a drink?
character_words: Really? You must regale me with all of the thrilling details.  Join me for a drink?

full_text: [He averts his gaze and begins to walk away.] Sorry, but we have to go.
character_words: Sorry, but we have to go.

full_text: Prince Zuko, show Commander Zhao your respect. [Removes his hand from Zuko's shoulder as he faces Zhao while Zuko just slants his eyes.] We would be honored to join you. Do you have any ginseng tea? It's my favorite.
character_words: Prince Zuko, show Commander Zhao your respect.  We would be honored to join you. Do you have any ginseng tea? It's my favorite.

full_text: [Annoyed.] Hey, stomach? Be quiet, all right? I'm trying to find us some food.
character_words: Hey, stomach? Be quiet, all right? I'm trying to find us some food.

full_text: [Accusingly to the two in front of him.] Hey! Who ate all of my blubbered seal jerky?!
character_words: Hey! Who ate all of my blubbered seal jerky?!

full_text: [Surprised.] Oh. That was food? [Happily.] I used it to start the campfire last night. [The hint of a smile can be heard.] Sorry.
character_words: Oh. That was food?  I used it to start the campfire last night.  Sorry.

full_text: [Shocked.] You what?! [Looks up before slanting his eyes and groans. Longing.] No wonder the flames smelled so good.
character_words: You what?!  No wonder the flames smelled so good.

full_text: [Excitedly.] The Patola Mountain range! We're almost there!
character_words: The Patola Mountain range! We're almost there!

full_text: [Uneasily.] Aang, before we get to the temple, I want to talk to you about the airbenders.
character_words: Aang, before we get to the temple, I want to talk to you about the airbenders.

full_text: [Cheerfully.] What about 'em?
character_words: What about 'em?

full_text: [Close-up of Katara.] Well, I just want you to be prepared for what you might see. The Fire Nation is ruthless. [Sadly.] They killed my mother, and they could have done the same to your people.
character_words: Well, I just want you to be prepared for what you might see. The Fire Nation is ruthless.  They killed my mother, and they could have done the same to your people.

full_text: [Ponders over her words for a bit. Hopefully.] Just because no one has seen an airbender, doesn't mean the Fire Nation killed them all. They probably escaped!
character_words: Just because no one has seen an airbender, doesn't mean the Fire Nation killed them all. They probably escaped!

full_text: [Places one hand on Aang's shoulder.] I know it's hard to accept.
character_words: I know it's hard to accept.

full_text: [Cheerfully, as Katara moves her hand back to her side.] You don't understand, Katara. The only way to get to an airbender temple is on a flying bison, and I doubt the Fire Nation has any flying bison! [Caresses Appa's head.] Right, Appa?
character_words: You don't understand, Katara. The only way to get to an airbender temple is on a flying bison, and I doubt the Fire Nation has any flying bison!  Right, Appa?

full_text: Yip yip!
character_words: Yip yip!

full_text: [Voice-over.] There it is. The Southern Air Temple.
character_words: There it is. The Southern Air Temple.

full_text: Aang, it's amazing!
character_words: Aang, it's amazing!

full_text: [To Appa.] We're home, buddy! We're home. [His eyes squint a bit in happiness.]
character_words: We're home, buddy! We're home.

full_text: ... And by the year's end, the Earth Kingdom capital will be under our rule. [Shift to a bird view of the tent, revealing Zuko, sitting at a table, and Iroh, standing in the corner, looking at some weapons that are placed against the wall. Zhao turns around.] The Fire Lord will finally claim victory in this war.
character_words: ... And by the year's end, the Earth Kingdom capital will be under our rule.  The Fire Lord will finally claim victory in this war.

full_text: [Close-up. Angrily.] If my father thinks the rest of the world will follow him willingly, then he is a fool!
character_words: If my father thinks the rest of the world will follow him willingly, then he is a fool!

full_text: [Pulls up alongside Zuko and smirks.] Two years at sea have done little to temper your tongue. So, how is your search for the Avatar going?
character_words: Two years at sea have done little to temper your tongue. So, how is your search for the Avatar going?

full_text: Eh.. My fault, entirely.
character_words: Eh.. My fault, entirely.

full_text: [Aggressively.] We haven't found him yet.
character_words: We haven't found him yet.

full_text: Did you really expect to? The Avatar died a hundred years ago. [Close-up of Zuko, as he slants his eyes.] Along with the rest of the airbenders. [Close-up of Zhao, whose face contorts in an evil expression.] Unless you have found some evidence that the Avatar is alive?
character_words: Did you really expect to? The Avatar died a hundred years ago.  Along with the rest of the airbenders.  Unless you have found some evidence that the Avatar is alive?

full_text: [Faces Zhao and responds very clearly.] No. [Stares back in front of him.] Nothing.
character_words: No.  Nothing.

full_text: [With an expression of disbelief on his face, as he rises from his chair.] Prince Zuko, the Avatar is the only one who can stop the Fire Nation from winning this war. [Leans in and faces Zuko.] If you have an ounce of loyalty left, you'll tell me what you found.
character_words: Prince Zuko, the Avatar is the only one who can stop the Fire Nation from winning this war.  If you have an ounce of loyalty left, you'll tell me what you found.

full_text: I haven't found [Looks up at Zhao and his tone becomes slightly more aggressive.] anything. [Close-up, as he continues on a softer tone, slightly mockingly.] It's like you said. The Avatar probably died a long time ago. [Gets up.] Come on, Uncle, we're going.
character_words: I haven't found  anything.  It's like you said. The Avatar probably died a long time ago.  Come on, Uncle, we're going.

full_text: Commander Zhao, we interrogated the crew as you instructed. They confirmed Prince Zuko had the Avatar in custody, [Close-up of Zuko's head from behind.] but let him escape.
character_words: Commander Zhao, we interrogated the crew as you instructed. They confirmed Prince Zuko had the Avatar in custody,  but let him escape.

full_text: [Smiling evilly.] Now remind me, [Close-up of Zuko's face, as Zhao walks up to him and leans over to talk into Zuko's ear. Zuko slants his eyes.] how, exactly, was your ship damaged?
character_words: Now remind me,  how, exactly, was your ship damaged?

full_text: So where do I get something to eat?
character_words: So where do I get something to eat?

full_text: [Irritated.] You're lucky enough to be one of the first outsiders to ever visit an airbender temple, and all you can think about is food?
character_words: You're lucky enough to be one of the first outsiders to ever visit an airbender temple, and all you can think about is food?

full_text: I'm just a simple guy, with simple needs.
character_words: I'm just a simple guy, with simple needs.

full_text: [Excited.] So that's where my friends and I would play airball, [The camera shifts to a shot of a stadium consisting of many tall poles.] and over there [The camera pans to the right to reveal the trio again.] is where the bison would sleep, and ... [Aang sighs.]
character_words: So that's where my friends and I would play airball,  and over there  is where the bison would sleep, and ...

full_text: What's wrong?
character_words: What's wrong?

full_text: [A bit saddened.] This place used to be full of monks and lemurs and bison. Now there's just a bunch of weeds. [His eyes squint with sadness. The shot changes to a back view of Aang as he stands on the ledge; his clothes flutter in the wind, a dead tree at each side of him. In a sad tone.] I can't believe how much things have changed.
character_words: This place used to be full of monks and lemurs and bison. Now there's just a bunch of weeds.  I can't believe how much things have changed.

full_text: [Cheerfully trying to distract Aang from his sadness.] So uh, this airball game. How do you play?
character_words: So uh, this airball game. How do you play?

full_text: [Smiling broadly, he stretches out his arms above his head.] Aang, seven! [He forms a Zero with his hands and makes a circular movement with his whole body.] Sokka, zero!
character_words: Aang, seven!  Sokka, zero!

full_text: [Painfully.] Making him feel better is putting me in a world of hurt. [He erects himself, but before he gets up completely, his eyes widen when he sees something in front of him and he crawls to the front. The camera shifts to reveal an old Fire Nation helmet lying in the snow. It has been battered by the elements, and shows signs of cracks and burns. He looks up at his sister.] Katara, check this out.
character_words: Making him feel better is putting me in a world of hurt.  Katara, check this out.

full_text: Fire Nation.
character_words: Fire Nation.

full_text: We should tell him.
character_words: We should tell him.

full_text: [Yelling.] Aang! There's something you need to see.
character_words: Aang! There's something you need to see.

full_text: [Aang runs to them from the airball court, still playing with the hollow ball. Cheerfully.] Okay!
character_words: Okay!

full_text: [Happily runs up.] What is it?
character_words: What is it?

full_text: [Innocently holds her hands behind her back.] Uh ... Just a new waterbending move I learned.
character_words: Uh ... Just a new waterbending move I learned.

full_text: Nice one! But enough practicing, [Excited as he turns around and start walking away.] we have a whole temple to see!
character_words: Nice one! But enough practicing,  we have a whole temple to see!

full_text: [Brushes the last of the snow from his head and shoulders.] You know, you can't protect him forever.
character_words: You know, you can't protect him forever.

full_text: [Arms crossed; stern.] Katara, firebenders were here. You can't pretend they weren't.
character_words: Katara, firebenders were here. You can't pretend they weren't.

full_text: I can for Aang's sake. If he finds out that the Fire Nation invaded his home, he'll be devastated.
character_words: I can for Aang's sake. If he finds out that the Fire Nation invaded his home, he'll be devastated.

full_text: [Happily.] Hey guys! [The two look up and see Aang standing in front of a statue of a monk, turning around and pointing toward it.] I want you to meet somebody!
character_words: Hey guys!  I want you to meet somebody!

full_text: Who's that?
character_words: Who's that?

full_text: [Facing the statue again.] Monk Gyatso! The greatest airbender in the world. [Scene switches to a frontal view of the statue as Aang turns around again toward the siblings while gesturing at the statue.] He taught me everything I know.
character_words: Monk Gyatso! The greatest airbender in the world.  He taught me everything I know.

full_text: But the true secret, is in the gooey center.
character_words: But the true secret, is in the gooey center.

full_text: [Distant.] Hmm ...
character_words: Hmm ...

full_text: [With a calm, soothing and understanding voice.] My ancient cake-making technique isn't the only thing on your mind, is it, Aang?
character_words: My ancient cake-making technique isn't the only thing on your mind, is it, Aang?

full_text: [Downcast.] This whole Avatar thing, m-maybe the monks made a mistake.
character_words: This whole Avatar thing, m-maybe the monks made a mistake.

full_text: The only mistake they made was telling you before you turned sixteen, but we can't concern ourselves with what was. We must act on what is.
character_words: The only mistake they made was telling you before you turned sixteen, but we can't concern ourselves with what was. We must act on what is.

full_text: [Voice-over.] But Gyatso? How do I know if I'm ready for this?
character_words: But Gyatso? How do I know if I'm ready for this?

full_text: [Cut back to a close shot of Gyatso with Aang sitting on the ledge in the background.] Your questions will be answered when you're old enough to enter the air temple sanctuary. Inside, you will meet someone who will guide you on your journey.
character_words: Your questions will be answered when you're old enough to enter the air temple sanctuary. Inside, you will meet someone who will guide you on your journey.

full_text: [Excited and curious.] Who is it?
character_words: Who is it?

full_text: [Cut back to the close shot of Gyatso with Aang in the background.] When you are ready, he will reveal himself to you. [In the background, Aang, annoyed by this vague answer, grunts softly and looks up to the sky before cupping his face in his hands again. Monk Gyatso continues on a bright, happy tone.] Now, are you going to help me with these cakes, [Close-up of Aang as he smiles lovingly at Gyatso.] or not?
character_words: When you are ready, he will reveal himself to you.  Now, are you going to help me with these cakes,  or not?

full_text: [Happily stands up.] All right.
character_words: All right.

full_text: One. [The camera switches to a side-view as the duo conjures a small air ball.] Two. Three!
character_words: One.  Two. Three!

full_text: [Full admiration and love.] Your aim has improved greatly, [Caressing Aang's head.] my young pupil.
character_words: Your aim has improved greatly,  my young pupil.

full_text: [Understandingly places a hand on his shoulder.] You must miss him.
character_words: You must miss him.

full_text: [Downcast.] Yeah. [He walks away.]
character_words: Yeah.

full_text: [Curious.] Where are you going?
character_words: Where are you going?

full_text: [Switch to a shot from Katara's point of view. Aang is walking up some stairs that lead to a corridor behind the statue. He looks back while answering.] The air temple sanctuary. There's someone I'm ready to meet.
character_words: The air temple sanctuary. There's someone I'm ready to meet.

full_text: But Aang, no one could have survived in there for a hundred years.
character_words: But Aang, no one could have survived in there for a hundred years.

full_text: [Camera changes to show the trio looking up at the door. Hopeful.] It's not impossible. [Opening his arms.] I survived in the iceberg for that long.
character_words: It's not impossible.  I survived in the iceberg for that long.

full_text: [Touching her chin with a finger.] Good point.
character_words: Good point.

full_text: [Close shot of Aang with Katara visible over his shoulder. He glances hopeful at her over his shoulder. Excited.] Katara, whoever's in there might help figure out this Avatar thing!
character_words: Katara, whoever's in there might help figure out this Avatar thing!

full_text: [Appears in screen from behind Aang's back. Katara and Aang look surprised at him. Eagerly.] And whoever's in there might have [Katara's look changes to one of annoyance. Close-up of Sokka's determined, anticipating face.] a medley of delicious [He rubs his hands together and practically starts to drool over the thought.] cured meats!
character_words: And whoever's in there might have  a medley of delicious  cured meats!

full_text: I don't suppose you have a key?
character_words: I don't suppose you have a key?

full_text: [Shot from over Sokka's shoulder.] The key, Sokka, is airbending.
character_words: The key, Sokka, is airbending.

full_text: [Cut to a front view of Aang, as he brings his hand besides his mouth.] Hello? [Switch back to a shot from behind Sokka and Katara as Aang enters the sanctuary.] Anyone home?
character_words: Hello?  Anyone home?

full_text: So a twelve-year-old boy bested you and your firebenders. [Wider shot of the tent as Zhao stops pacing. Iroh can be seen sitting in a corner.] You're more pathetic than I thought.
character_words: So a twelve-year-old boy bested you and your firebenders.  You're more pathetic than I thought.

full_text: [Angrily.] I underestimated him once, but it will not happen again!
character_words: I underestimated him once, but it will not happen again!

full_text: [Frontal view with Zuko in the background. Aggressively.] No, it will not. Because you won't have a second chance.
character_words: No, it will not. Because you won't have a second chance.

full_text: [Alarmed.] Commander Zhao, [Closer shot of Zuko.] I've been hunting the Avatar for two years and I -
character_words: Commander Zhao,  I've been hunting the Avatar for two years and I -

full_text: [Cut to a shot from over Zuko's shoulder as Zhao angrily turns around, spreading flames in an arc.] And you failed! [He walks intimidatingly up to Zuko.] Capturing the Avatar is too important to leave in a teenager's hands. He's mine now.
character_words: And you failed!  Capturing the Avatar is too important to leave in a teenager's hands. He's mine now.

full_text: Keep them here.
character_words: Keep them here.

full_text: [Calmly with a hint of amusement in his voice.] More tea, please.
character_words: More tea, please.

full_text: [Disappointed.] Statues? That's it? Where's the meat?
character_words: Statues? That's it? Where's the meat?

full_text: Who are all these people?
character_words: Who are all these people?

full_text: [Pensive.] I'm not sure. [Frontal view of Aang.] But it feels like I know them somehow. Look! [Camera shifts to a point behind Aang and Katara. Aang points at the statue of a man with airbending mastery tattoos in front of him.] That one's an airbender.
character_words: I'm not sure.  But it feels like I know them somehow. Look!  That one's an airbender.

full_text: [Camera pans to the right. Katara points at the statue of a male dressed in Water Tribe clothes next to the airbender.] And this one's a waterbender. [Looks to the right and back to the left.] They're lined up in a pattern: [Points at the respective statues.] air, water, earth and fire.
character_words: And this one's a waterbender.  They're lined up in a pattern:  air, water, earth and fire.

full_text: That's the Avatar Cycle.
character_words: That's the Avatar Cycle.

full_text: [Understanding.] Of course. They're Avatars. All these people are your past lives, Aang.
character_words: Of course. They're Avatars. All these people are your past lives, Aang.

full_text: Wow! There are so many!
character_words: Wow! There are so many!

full_text: [Skeptically.] Past lives? [Aang stops before a statue while Sokka and Katara are still visible in the background.] Katara, you really believe in that stuff?
character_words: Past lives?  Katara, you really believe in that stuff?

full_text: It's true. [The picture pans up the reveal Aang staring at the statue of an elderly man with a beard. In the background hundreds of statues can be seen spiraling up.] When the Avatar dies, he's reincarnated into the next nation in the cycle.
character_words: It's true.  When the Avatar dies, he's reincarnated into the next nation in the cycle.

full_text: Aang! Snap out of it!
character_words: Aang! Snap out of it!

full_text: [Dazed.] Huh?
character_words: Huh?

full_text: [She curiously follows his gaze and looks at the statue as well.] Who is that?
character_words: Who is that?

full_text: That's Avatar Roku. The Avatar before me.
character_words: That's Avatar Roku. The Avatar before me.

full_text: You were a firebender? No wonder I didn't trust you when we first met.
character_words: You were a firebender? No wonder I didn't trust you when we first met.

full_text: [Looks at the base of the statue.] There's no writing. How do you know his name?
character_words: There's no writing. How do you know his name?

full_text: I'm not sure. I just know it somehow.
character_words: I'm not sure. I just know it somehow.

full_text: [Growls irritably while crossing his arms.] You just couldn't get any weirder.
character_words: You just couldn't get any weirder.

full_text: [Whispering.] Firebender. Nobody make a sound.
character_words: Firebender. Nobody make a sound.

full_text: [Irritably.] You're making a sound!
character_words: You're making a sound!

full_text: [Putting their finger before their mouths.] Shhhh!
character_words: Shhhh!

full_text: [Whispering.] That firebender won't know what hit him.
character_words: That firebender won't know what hit him.

full_text: [Excitedly.] Lemur!
character_words: Lemur!

full_text: [Quickly pans to a drooling Sokka.] Dinner!
character_words: Dinner!

full_text: [Reassuring.] Don't listen to him. You're going to be my new pet.
character_words: Don't listen to him. You're going to be my new pet.

full_text: [Aang glares angrily at Sokka, before the scene switches to a close-up of his drooling face. Challenging.] Not if I get him first!
character_words: Not if I get him first!

full_text: Wait! Come back!
character_words: Wait! Come back!

full_text: I want to eat you!
character_words: I want to eat you!

full_text: Hey! No fair!
character_words: Hey! No fair!

full_text: My search party is ready. Once I'm out to sea, [Cut to a shot from over Zhao's head to reveal Iroh and Zuko sitting in two chairs in front of him in the middle of the tent.] my guards will escort you back to your ship and [Close-up of Zuko, who angrily looks down.] you'll be free to go.
character_words: My search party is ready. Once I'm out to sea,  my guards will escort you back to your ship and  you'll be free to go.

full_text: [Angrily.] Why? Are you worried I'm going to try and stop you?
character_words: Why? Are you worried I'm going to try and stop you?

full_text: [Amused.] You? Stop me? Impossible.
character_words: You? Stop me? Impossible.

full_text: [Angrily gets up. Enraged.] Don't underestimate me, Zhao! I will capture the Avatar before you!
