full_text: They lost hope the Avatar would ever return. When Fire Lord Sozin began the War, my grandfather and the other sages were forced to follow him. [Shakes head sadly.] I never wanted to serve the Fire Lord. When I learned you were coming, I knew I would have to betray the other sages.
character_words: They lost hope the Avatar would ever return. When Fire Lord Sozin began the War, my grandfather and the other sages were forced to follow him.  I never wanted to serve the Fire Lord. When I learned you were coming, I knew I would have to betray the other sages.

full_text: Thank you for helping me. [Close-up as Shyu smiles to Aang.]
character_words: Thank you for helping me.

full_text: [Continues leading the group up a spiraling flight of stairs.] We'll follow these stairs to the sanctuary. [Time skip, Shyu continues talking as they near the top of the stairs.] Once you're inside, wait for the light to hit Avatar Roku's statue. Only then will you be able to speak with him.
character_words: We'll follow these stairs to the sanctuary.  Once you're inside, wait for the light to hit Avatar Roku's statue. Only then will you be able to speak with him.

full_text: [Gasps.] No!
character_words: No!

full_text: [Approaches door.] Shyu, what's wrong?
character_words: Shyu, what's wrong?

full_text: The sanctuary doors, they're closed!
character_words: The sanctuary doors, they're closed!

full_text: [Aang tugs at the door uselessly.] Can't you just open them with firebending? Like you opened that other door?
character_words: Can't you just open them with firebending? Like you opened that other door?

full_text: No. Only a fully realized Avatar is powerful enough to open this door alone. Otherwise, the sages must open this door together, [Sokka shown in deep thought.] with five simultaneous fire blasts.
character_words: No. Only a fully realized Avatar is powerful enough to open this door alone. Otherwise, the sages must open this door together,  with five simultaneous fire blasts.

full_text: [Ponderously states.] Five fire blasts, huh? [Zoom out to show a lamplight above him.] I think I can help you out.
character_words: Five fire blasts, huh?  I think I can help you out.

full_text: Uncle, keep heading north. Zhao will follow the smoke trail, while I use it as a cover.
character_words: Uncle, keep heading north. Zhao will follow the smoke trail, while I use it as a cover.

full_text: [Kneeling. Pours oil into a bag.] This is a little trick I picked up from my father. I seal the lamp oil inside an animal skin casing, Shyu lights the oil soaked twine and, [Picks up bag, holds it proudly before him.] ta-da! Fake firebending!
character_words: This is a little trick I picked up from my father. I seal the lamp oil inside an animal skin casing, Shyu lights the oil soaked twine and,  ta-da! Fake firebending!

full_text: [Impressed.] You've really outdone yourself this time, Sokka.
character_words: You've really outdone yourself this time, Sokka.

full_text: This might actually work.
character_words: This might actually work.

full_text: [Time skip. Sokka places his last bag into the dragon's mouth.] The sages will hear the explosion, so as soon as they go off, you rush in!
character_words: The sages will hear the explosion, so as soon as they go off, you rush in!

full_text: [Hides behind a column with her brother. Holds Momo. Glances to the next column where Aang hides.] It's almost sunset. Are you ready?
character_words: It's almost sunset. Are you ready?

full_text: Definitely.
character_words: Definitely.

full_text: [Surprised.] They're still locked!
character_words: They're still locked!

full_text: [Sadly sighs. Sokka rises from hiding behind his sister.] It didn't work. [Aang falls to his knees.]
character_words: It didn't work.

full_text: [Time skip. Everyone stands in front of the door. Aang beats upon it furiously with consecutive airbending slices.] Why, won't, it, open?!
character_words: Why, won't, it, open?!

full_text: [Presses forward. Seizes Aang's arm.] Aang! Stop! [Relaxes, releasing his arm.] There's nothing else we can do ...
character_words: Aang! Stop!  There's nothing else we can do ...

full_text: [Glumly.] I'm sorry I put you through all of this for nothing.
character_words: I'm sorry I put you through all of this for nothing.

full_text: [Examining the explosion. Runs his finger across the black soot.] I don't get it. That firebending looked as strong as any firebending I've seen.
character_words: I don't get it. That firebending looked as strong as any firebending I've seen.

full_text: [A moment passes. Sudden excitement.] Sokka, you're a genius!
character_words: Sokka, you're a genius!

full_text: [Confused.] Wait. How is Sokka a genius? His plan didn't even work.
character_words: Wait. How is Sokka a genius? His plan didn't even work.

full_text: [Pleasantly.] Come on Aang. Let her dream.
character_words: Come on Aang. Let her dream.

full_text: You're right. Sokka's plan didn't work. But it looks like it did.
character_words: You're right. Sokka's plan didn't work. But it looks like it did.

full_text: [Dubiously.] Did the definition of genius change over the last hundred years? [Katara grasps her chin, slyly grinning toward Aang.]
character_words: Did the definition of genius change over the last hundred years?

full_text: [Time skip. Fire Sages run toward Shyu in front of the door.] Come quickly! The Avatar has entered the sanctuary!
character_words: Come quickly! The Avatar has entered the sanctuary!

full_text: How did he get in?
character_words: How did he get in?

full_text: I don't know. But look at the scorch marks! And down there! [Points to a shadow visible at the bottom of the door.]
character_words: I don't know. But look at the scorch marks! And down there!

full_text: He's inside! Open the doors, immediately! Before he contacts Avatar Roku!
character_words: He's inside! Open the doors, immediately! Before he contacts Avatar Roku!

full_text: It's the Avatar's lemur. He must have crawled through the pipes! We've been tricked!
character_words: It's the Avatar's lemur. He must have crawled through the pipes! We've been tricked!

full_text: [Grabs the last free sage and hauls him into his grip, pinning him.] Now, Aang!
character_words: Now, Aang!

full_text: [A moment of silence.] Aang! Now's your chance!
character_words: Aang! Now's your chance!

full_text: [Steps out from behind column. Grips Aang from behind, pinning Aang's arms behind him.] The Avatar's coming with me! [The captured sages use their captors' surprise to reclaim the upper hand, pinning their captors down. Momo flies off with the Great Fire Sage's hat.] Close the doors! Quickly!
character_words: The Avatar's coming with me!  Close the doors! Quickly!

full_text: [Chained. Sees him coming toward her. Turns head toward the closing door.] Go!
character_words: Go!

full_text: [Pleased.] He made it!
character_words: He made it!

full_text: [Stands. Confused.] The light hits the statue and I talk to Roku. So why isn't anything happening?
character_words: The light hits the statue and I talk to Roku. So why isn't anything happening?

full_text: [He and four sages launch fire blasts into the door's locks. Nothing happens. Frustrated.] Why isn't it working, it's sealed shut?
character_words: Why isn't it working, it's sealed shut?

full_text: It must have been the light. Avatar Roku doesn't want us inside.
character_words: It must have been the light. Avatar Roku doesn't want us inside.

full_text: [Exasperated. Standing in the middle of the room, facing the statue.] Why isn't anything happening? I don't know what I'm doing! All I know is airbending! Please Avatar Roku, talk to me!
character_words: Why isn't anything happening? I don't know what I'm doing! All I know is airbending! Please Avatar Roku, talk to me!

full_text: It's good to see you Aang. What took you so long? [Aang respectfully places a fist into his palm, bowing his head to the Avatar before him.]
character_words: It's good to see you Aang. What took you so long?

full_text: [Firmly to Shyu, who is kneeling before him with his hands behind his back.] Why did you help the Avatar?
character_words: Why did you help the Avatar?

full_text: [Sadly and proudly.] Because it was once the sages' duty. It is still our duty.
character_words: Because it was once the sages' duty. It is still our duty.

full_text: [Claps. Interrupts interrogation. Approaches with six firebender guards.] What a moving and heartfelt performance. I'm certain the Fire Lord will understand, when you explain why you betrayed him.
character_words: What a moving and heartfelt performance. I'm certain the Fire Lord will understand, when you explain why you betrayed him.

full_text: [Places palms together. Bows head forward.] Commander Zhao.
character_words: Commander Zhao.

full_text: And Prince Zuko. It was a noble effort, but your little smokescreen didn't work. [Zuko scowls sharply. Firebenders step behind him, seizing his arms.] Two traitors in one day, the Fire Lord will be pleased.
character_words: And Prince Zuko. It was a noble effort, but your little smokescreen didn't work.  Two traitors in one day, the Fire Lord will be pleased.

full_text: [Strains against his captor, snaps at Zhao.] You're too late, Zhao! The Avatar's inside and the doors are sealed.
character_words: You're too late, Zhao! The Avatar's inside and the doors are sealed.

full_text: No matter. [Grins confidently.] Sooner or later, he has to come out. [Katara and Sokka share a worried glance.]
character_words: No matter.  Sooner or later, he has to come out.

full_text: I have something very important to tell you, Aang. That is why, when you were in the Spirit World, I sent my dragon to find you.
character_words: I have something very important to tell you, Aang. That is why, when you were in the Spirit World, I sent my dragon to find you.

full_text: [Interested, curious.] Is it about that vision? The one of the comet?
character_words: Is it about that vision? The one of the comet?

full_text: Yes.
character_words: Yes.

full_text: What does it mean?
character_words: What does it mean?

full_text: One hundred years ago, [Viewers see a visual of a comet in the dark sky.] Fire Lord Sozin used that comet to begin the War. He and his firebending army harnessed its incredible power, and dealt a deadly first strike against the other nations.
character_words: One hundred years ago,  Fire Lord Sozin used that comet to begin the War. He and his firebending army harnessed its incredible power, and dealt a deadly first strike against the other nations.

full_text: [Close-up.] So the comet made them stronger?
character_words: So the comet made them stronger?

full_text: [Close-up.] Yes. Stronger than you could even imagine.
character_words: Yes. Stronger than you could even imagine.

full_text: [Close-up.] But that happened a hundred years ago. What does the comet have to do with the War now?
character_words: But that happened a hundred years ago. What does the comet have to do with the War now?

full_text: Listen carefully. [Viewers see silhouette of Fire Lord Ozai standing amid flames, fists taut.] Sozin's Comet will return by the end of the summer, and Fire Lord Ozai will use its power to finish the War, once and for all. [Visual and audio of Ozai's silhouette roaring upward, fire streaming from his mouth.] If he succeeds, even the Avatar won't be able to restore balance to the world. Aang. You must defeat the Fire Lord, before the comet arrives.
character_words: Listen carefully.  Sozin's Comet will return by the end of the summer, and Fire Lord Ozai will use its power to finish the War, once and for all.  If he succeeds, even the Avatar won't be able to restore balance to the world. Aang. You must defeat the Fire Lord, before the comet arrives.

full_text: [Counters anxiously.] But I haven't even started learning waterbending! Not to mention earth and fire!
character_words: But I haven't even started learning waterbending! Not to mention earth and fire!

full_text: Mastering the elements takes years of discipline and practice. But if the world is to survive, you must do it by summer's end. [Close-up of a shocked Aang.]
character_words: Mastering the elements takes years of discipline and practice. But if the world is to survive, you must do it by summer's end.

full_text: When those doors open, [Shouts.] unleash all your firepower!
character_words: When those doors open,  unleash all your firepower!

full_text: [Worried.] How's Aang gonna make it out of this?
character_words: How's Aang gonna make it out of this?

full_text: [Troubled, questioning.] How are we gonna make it out of this?
character_words: How are we gonna make it out of this?

full_text: [Terrified.] What if I can't master all the elements in time? What if I fail?
character_words: What if I can't master all the elements in time? What if I fail?

full_text: I know you can do it Aang. [Close-up of half his face.] For you have done it before. [Close-up of half of Aang's now-smiling face.] The solstice is ending. We must go our separate ways, for now.
character_words: I know you can do it Aang.  For you have done it before.  The solstice is ending. We must go our separate ways, for now.

full_text: But I won't be able to come back to the temple. What if I have questions? How will I talk to you?
character_words: But I won't be able to come back to the temple. What if I have questions? How will I talk to you?

full_text: I am a part of you. When you need to talk to me again, you will find a way. [Closes his eyes, providing Aang a vision of Fire Navy ships surrounding the island. Speaks to his mind without words.] A great danger awaits you at the temple. [Provides a vision of the awaiting firebenders on the other side of the door.] I can help you face the threat. But only if you are ready.
character_words: I am a part of you. When you need to talk to me again, you will find a way.  A great danger awaits you at the temple.  I can help you face the threat. But only if you are ready.

full_text: [Eyes and arrows glow.] I'm ready.
character_words: I'm ready.

full_text: Ready ... [Light fades, revealing a pair of glowing white eyes in the darkness.]
character_words: Ready ...

full_text: [Sokka struggles against his chains. Katara is terrified.] No! Aang!
character_words: No! Aang!

full_text: Fire! [He and his guards cooperate in blasting fire onto the unseen target.]
character_words: Fire!

full_text: [In awe.] Avatar Roku ...
character_words: Avatar Roku ...

full_text: [Implores.] Avatar Roku is going to destroy the temple! We have to get out of here!
character_words: Avatar Roku is going to destroy the temple! We have to get out of here!

full_text: Not without Aang!
character_words: Not without Aang!

full_text: [Aang sighs weakly and drops to his knees. Sokka and Katara approach Aang's sides, supportively lifting him back to his feet.] We got your back.
character_words: We got your back.

full_text: [Weakly.] Thanks. Where's Shyu?
character_words: Thanks. Where's Shyu?

full_text: [ Walking away with Sokka, helping Aang.] I don't know.
character_words: I don't know.

full_text: [Turns angrily, snapping.] No Prince, no Avatar! Apparently, the only thing I do have is five traitors!
character_words: No Prince, no Avatar! Apparently, the only thing I do have is five traitors!

full_text: [Interjects.] But Commander! Only Shyu helped the Avatar.
character_words: But Commander! Only Shyu helped the Avatar.

full_text: [Close-up.] Save your stories for the Fire Lord. As far as I'm concerned, you are all guilty! [Orders.] Take them to the prison hold!
character_words: Save your stories for the Fire Lord. As far as I'm concerned, you are all guilty!  Take them to the prison hold!

full_text: [Aang is pacing around on Appa's saddle, breathing heavily.] Would you sit down? [Turns around from his perch on Appa's head.] If we hit a bump, you'll go flying off. What's bugging you anyway?
character_words: Would you sit down?  If we hit a bump, you'll go flying off. What's bugging you anyway?

full_text: [Worriedly.] It's what Avatar Roku said. I'm supposed to master all four elements before that comet arrives.
character_words: It's what Avatar Roku said. I'm supposed to master all four elements before that comet arrives.

full_text: [In a sarcastic, amused tone while facing Aang.] Well, let's see. You pretty much mastered airbending and that only took you a hundred and twelve years. I'm sure you can master three more elements by next summer.
character_words: Well, let's see. You pretty much mastered airbending and that only took you a hundred and twelve years. I'm sure you can master three more elements by next summer.

full_text: [Frightfully.] I haven't even started waterbending and we're still weeks away from the North Pole. What am I gonna do?
character_words: I haven't even started waterbending and we're still weeks away from the North Pole. What am I gonna do?

full_text: [Grabs Aang's arm.] Calm down, it's going to be okay. [Aang sits down in front of her.] If you want, I can try to teach you some of the stuff I know.
character_words: Calm down, it's going to be okay.  If you want, I can try to teach you some of the stuff I know.

full_text: [Smiling.] You'd do that?
character_words: You'd do that?

full_text: [Nods and looks over the side of Appa's saddle.] We'll need to find a good source of water first.
character_words: We'll need to find a good source of water first.

full_text: [Grinning; sarcastically.] Maybe we can find a puddle for you to splash in.
character_words: Maybe we can find a puddle for you to splash in.

full_text: [Frowning beside Aang and Katara's ecstatic faces.] Nice puddle.
character_words: Nice puddle.

full_text: [Takes off his shirt, smiling.] Yeah! Don't start without me, boy! [Begins to run toward the water.]
character_words: Yeah! Don't start without me, boy!

full_text: [Somewhat blankly.] Remember the reason we're here.
character_words: Remember the reason we're here.

full_text: [Stops short and looks at Katara.] Oh right. Time to practice waterbending. [Puts his clothes back on.]
character_words: Oh right. Time to practice waterbending.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Great. So what am I supposed to do?
character_words: Great. So what am I supposed to do?

full_text: You could ... clean the gunk out of Appa's toes. [Hands Sokka a branch with a bushel of leaves at the end.]
character_words: You could ... clean the gunk out of Appa's toes.

full_text: [Frowns and crosses his arms.] So, while you guys are playing in the water, I'm supposed to be hard at work picking mud out of a giant bison's feet?
character_words: So, while you guys are playing in the water, I'm supposed to be hard at work picking mud out of a giant bison's feet?

full_text: [Smiles; somewhat cheerfully.] Mud and bugs!
character_words: Mud and bugs!

full_text: Okay. [Takes stick and walks over to Appa who is floating in the water.]
character_words: Okay.

full_text: [Close-up of his face; he glares at the tower.] Someone's changing our course.
character_words: Someone's changing our course.

full_text: [Storming in, yelling.] What is the meaning of this mutiny? No one told you to change course! [Shows Iroh and the rest of the crew playing Pai Sho behind them.]
character_words: What is the meaning of this mutiny? No one told you to change course!

full_text: Actually, someone did. I assure you, it is a matter of utmost importance, Prince Zuko. [Scratches beard.]
character_words: Actually, someone did. I assure you, it is a matter of utmost importance, Prince Zuko.

full_text: [Hopefully.] Is it something to do with the Avatar?
character_words: Is it something to do with the Avatar?

full_text: Even more urgent. It seems, I- [Rubs forehead in stress.] -I have lost my lotus tile. [Moves a piece of his across the Pai Sho board.]
character_words: Even more urgent. It seems, I-  -I have lost my lotus tile.

full_text: [Confused.] Lotus tile?
character_words: Lotus tile?

full_text: For my Pai Sho game. Most people think the lotus tile insignificant, but it is essential for the unusual strategy that I employ.
character_words: For my Pai Sho game. Most people think the lotus tile insignificant, but it is essential for the unusual strategy that I employ.

full_text: [In disbelief.] You've changed our course for a stupid lotus tile?
character_words: You've changed our course for a stupid lotus tile?

full_text: See, you, like most people, underestimate it's value. Just give me ten minutes to check the merchants at this port of call. [Excitedly.] Hopefully, they will have the lotus tile in stock and I can get on with my life. [Zuko breathes fire up at the ceiling in anger and Iroh smiles.] I'm lucky to have such an understanding nephew.
character_words: See, you, like most people, underestimate it's value. Just give me ten minutes to check the merchants at this port of call.  Hopefully, they will have the lotus tile in stock and I can get on with my life.  I'm lucky to have such an understanding nephew.

full_text: Yeah, don't get too happy. You've got to do me next. [Appa moans happily.]
character_words: Yeah, don't get too happy. You've got to do me next.

full_text: This is a pretty basic move, but is still took me months to perfect. So don't get frustrated if you don't get it right away. [She moves her hands back and forth and makes small waves in the water, while Aang looks up, smiling.] Just push and pull the water like this. The key is getting the wrist movement right.
character_words: This is a pretty basic move, but is still took me months to perfect. So don't get frustrated if you don't get it right away.  Just push and pull the water like this. The key is getting the wrist movement right.

full_text: [Stands up.] Like this? [Does the hand movements Katara is doing, but nothing is happening yet.]
character_words: Like this?

full_text: [Kindly.] That's almost right. If you keep practicing I'm sure eventually
character_words: That's almost right. If you keep practicing I'm sure eventually

full_text: Hey, I'm bending it already! [Shows Aang making much bigger waves than Katara's on his first try.]
character_words: Hey, I'm bending it already!

full_text: [Surprised.] Wow, I can't believe you got that so quickly. It took me two months to learn that move.
character_words: Wow, I can't believe you got that so quickly. It took me two months to learn that move.

full_text: [Shrugs shoulders.] Well, you had to figure it all on your own. I'm lucky enough to have a great teacher.
character_words: Well, you had to figure it all on your own. I'm lucky enough to have a great teacher.

full_text: [Smiles.] Thanks.
character_words: Thanks.

full_text: So, what's next?
character_words: So, what's next?

full_text: This is a more difficult move. I call it streaming the water. [She moves her hands and raises a stream of water from the river into the air and moves it around.] It's harder than it looks, so don't be disappointed if- [Shows Aang already controlling a stream of water, moving it around and above his body and neatly coiling it back into the river, much to Katara's dismay.] Nice work. [She frowns.] Though the over-the-head flare was unnecessary.
character_words: This is a more difficult move. I call it streaming the water.  It's harder than it looks, so don't be disappointed if-  Nice work.  Though the over-the-head flare was unnecessary.

full_text: Sorry. [Excited.] Well, don't stop now! Keep 'em coming!
character_words: Sorry.  Well, don't stop now! Keep 'em coming!

full_text: [Looks up sadly.] Well I kind of know this one other move, but it's pretty hard. I haven't even totally figured it out yet. The idea is to create a big, powerful wave. [She moves her hands up, shaking, and starts to get a big mass of water to rise out of the river, but it pops before forming into anything substantial.]
character_words: Well I kind of know this one other move, but it's pretty hard. I haven't even totally figured it out yet. The idea is to create a big, powerful wave.

full_text: So, like this? [He raises his hands and creates a massive wave that towers over their heads.]
character_words: So, like this?

full_text: [Still working on cleaning up Appa, he looks up and stares at Aang's wave crashing toward him in fear.] Aang?! [The wave throws Sokka off into the water and his head slowly rises out, annoyed.]
character_words: Aang?!

full_text: [Smiling.] Looks like I got the hang of that move! What else do you got?
character_words: Looks like I got the hang of that move! What else do you got?

full_text: [Angry at Aang's quick success.] That's enough practicing for today.
character_words: That's enough practicing for today.

full_text: [Head still sticking out of the water.] Yeah, I'll say! [Points to the left.] You just "practiced" our supplies down the river. [Shows a group of bags floating away.]
character_words: Yeah, I'll say!  You just "practiced" our supplies down the river.

full_text: [Looking guilty.] Uh, sorry. [Smiles worriedly.] I'm sure we can find somewhere to replace all this stuff.
character_words: Uh, sorry.  I'm sure we can find somewhere to replace all this stuff.

full_text: My life was hard enough when you were just an airbender. [Sinks back underwater.]
character_words: My life was hard enough when you were just an airbender.

full_text: [Walking back from alleyway with a bag over his shoulders.] We've got exactly three copper pieces left from the money that King Bumi gave us. Let's spend it wisely.
character_words: We've got exactly three copper pieces left from the money that King Bumi gave us. Let's spend it wisely.

full_text: Uh, make that two copper pieces, Sokka. I couldn't say no to this whistle! [Pulls out a white whistle that looks like a bison, takes a huge breath and blows into it, but it barely makes a sound.]
character_words: Uh, make that two copper pieces, Sokka. I couldn't say no to this whistle!

full_text: [Pulls out fingers over his ears after expecting a loud noise.] It doesn't even work. [Aang stops blowing when Momo squawks at him.] See? Even Momo thinks it's a piece of junk.
character_words: It doesn't even work.  See? Even Momo thinks it's a piece of junk.

full_text: No offense Aang, but I'll hold the money from now on. [Aang hands her the two copper coins.]
character_words: No offense Aang, but I'll hold the money from now on.

full_text: [Moving hands and shouting excitedly.] Earth Nation! Fire Nation! Water Nation! So long as bargains are your inclination, you're welcome here! Don't be shy, come on by! [Sokka, Katara, and Aang walk by and he runs up to them.] Oh! You there, I can see from your clothing that you're world-traveling types. Perhaps I can interest you in some exotic curios?
character_words: Earth Nation! Fire Nation! Water Nation! So long as bargains are your inclination, you're welcome here! Don't be shy, come on by!  Oh! You there, I can see from your clothing that you're world-traveling types. Perhaps I can interest you in some exotic curios?

full_text: [Walks back to the man.] Sure! What are curios?
character_words: Sure! What are curios?

full_text: [Looks confused and thinks.] I'm not entirely sure. But we got 'em! [Puts his hand on Aang's shoulder and smiles, walking him into the ship.]
character_words: I'm not entirely sure. But we got 'em!

full_text: [Looks up close at an item on a shelf, confused.] Huh?
character_words: Huh?

full_text: [Standing in a dark doorway as Aang passes by with Momo on his back.] I've never seen such a fine specimen of lemur. [Walks into the light, an iguana parrot on his shoulder.] That beast would fetch me a hefty sum if you'd be interested in bartering. [The iguana parrot squawks at them.]
character_words: I've never seen such a fine specimen of lemur.  That beast would fetch me a hefty sum if you'd be interested in bartering.

full_text: [Grabbing Momo.] Momo's not for sale.
character_words: Momo's not for sale.

full_text: [Smiling.] Look at this, Aang. It's a waterbending scroll! [Aang walks over.] Check out these crazy moves.
character_words: Look at this, Aang. It's a waterbending scroll!  Check out these crazy moves.

full_text: [Turns to the captain, excited.] Where did you get a waterbending scroll?
character_words: Where did you get a waterbending scroll?

full_text: [Slams his hand onto the scroll and pulls it away.] Let's just say I got it up North, at a most reasonable price, free. [Rolls the scroll back up and puts it away back in its shelf.]
character_words: Let's just say I got it up North, at a most reasonable price, free.

full_text: [Turns around and looks at the captain from the other side of the room.] Wait a minute ... Sea loving traders, with suspiciously acquired merchandise, [Raises eyebrows, almost yelling.] and pet reptile birds? [Turns around to Oh, almost spitting in his face.] You guys are pirates!
character_words: Wait a minute ... Sea loving traders, with suspiciously acquired merchandise,  and pet reptile birds?  You guys are pirates!

full_text: [Puts his arm around a terrified Sokka's shoulders.] We prefer to think of ourselves as "high risk traders."
character_words: We prefer to think of ourselves as "high risk traders."

full_text: So, how much for the, uh, traded scroll?
character_words: So, how much for the, uh, traded scroll?

full_text: I've already got a buyer, a nobleman in the Earth Kingdom. [Voice turns less serious.] Unless of course, you kids have two hundred gold pieces on you right now.
character_words: I've already got a buyer, a nobleman in the Earth Kingdom.  Unless of course, you kids have two hundred gold pieces on you right now.

full_text: [Turns around and whispers to Katara.] I know how to deal with these guys, Katara. Pirates love to haggle. [Katara drops the final coins in his hand.] Watch and learn. [Walks over to the counter, leans against it, and talks in a pirate voice.] Let's say to the price of, one copper piece! [Smiles, and dramatically presents the single coin.]
character_words: I know how to deal with these guys, Katara. Pirates love to haggle.  Watch and learn.  Let's say to the price of, one copper piece!

full_text: [Laughs hysterically.] The price is two hundred gold pieces. I don't haggle on items this rare.
character_words: The price is two hundred gold pieces. I don't haggle on items this rare.

full_text: [Still smirking and talking like a pirate.] Okay, two copper pieces!
character_words: Okay, two copper pieces!

full_text: [Aggravated.] It's not as amusing the second time, boy!
character_words: It's not as amusing the second time, boy!

full_text: [Whispering.] Aang, can we get out of here? I feel like we're getting weird looks.
character_words: Aang, can we get out of here? I feel like we're getting weird looks.

full_text: Aye, we be casting off now! [Walks away.]
character_words: Aye, we be casting off now!

full_text: What was that all about, Katara?
character_words: What was that all about, Katara?

full_text: Yeah, I was just starting to browse through their boomerang collection.
character_words: Yeah, I was just starting to browse through their boomerang collection.

full_text: [Worried, holding her arms.] I'll just feel a lot better once we get away from here.
character_words: I'll just feel a lot better once we get away from here.

full_text: Hey you! Get back here!
character_words: Hey you! Get back here!

full_text: [Calmly turns around.] Well, well. Look who's come to their senses. Told you the haggling would pay off.
character_words: Well, well. Look who's come to their senses. Told you the haggling would pay off.

full_text: [Scared.] I don't think these pirates are here to trade with us. [Turns around and runs, Aang and Sokka follow and the pirates chase behind them. Half of the group runs down one street while the other goes down the one next to it.]
character_words: I don't think these pirates are here to trade with us.

full_text: This way. Let's cut 'em off!
character_words: This way. Let's cut 'em off!

full_text: [Turning a corner with Aang and Katara.] Whoa! [Katara freezes a puddle behind them that a pirate slips on.]
character_words: Whoa!

full_text: [Angry.] My cabbages! This place is worse than Omashu!
character_words: My cabbages! This place is worse than Omashu!

full_text: I hope that lemur of yours has nine lives!
character_words: I hope that lemur of yours has nine lives!

full_text: [Him and the pirates corner them in the dead end of a street.] Now, who gets to taste the steel of my blade first?
character_words: Now, who gets to taste the steel of my blade first?

full_text: No thanks. [Spins and hurls a blast of air at the pirates that send them backward, and runs toward them with his glider out.] Grab on tight!
character_words: No thanks.  Grab on tight!

full_text: Aang! I thought we were running away from the pirates! [Jumps on to Aang's glider with Sokka and they lift off into the air.]
character_words: Aang! I thought we were running away from the pirates!

full_text: Just hang on! [Flies over the pirates' heads and into the distance.]
character_words: Just hang on!

full_text: [Putting his glider away.] I used to kind of look up to pirates, but those guys are terrible.
character_words: I used to kind of look up to pirates, but those guys are terrible.

full_text: [Mischievously.] I know. That's why I took this. [Holds out the waterbending scroll they saw in the shop.]
character_words: I know. That's why I took this.

full_text: [Surprised.] No way!
character_words: No way!

full_text: [Excited.] Isn't it great?
character_words: Isn't it great?

full_text: No wonder they were trying to hack us up! You stole their waterbending scroll!
character_words: No wonder they were trying to hack us up! You stole their waterbending scroll!

full_text: [Jokingly.] I prefer to think of it as high risk trading.
character_words: I prefer to think of it as high risk trading.

full_text: [Laughs.] Good one, Katara.
character_words: Good one, Katara.

full_text: Sokka, where do you think theygot it? They stole it from a waterbender!
character_words: Sokka, where do you think theygot it? They stole it from a waterbender!

full_text: It doesn't matter. You put all of our lives in danger just so you could learn some stupid, fancy splashes.
character_words: It doesn't matter. You put all of our lives in danger just so you could learn some stupid, fancy splashes.

full_text: These are real waterbending forms. You know how crucial it is for Aang to learn waterbending!
character_words: These are real waterbending forms. You know how crucial it is for Aang to learn waterbending!

full_text: [Walks away.] Whatever.
character_words: Whatever.

full_text: Well, what's done is done. We have it, we might as well learn from it.
character_words: Well, what's done is done. We have it, we might as well learn from it.

full_text: I've checked all the shops on this pier. Not a lotus tile in the entire marketplace.
character_words: I've checked all the shops on this pier. Not a lotus tile in the entire marketplace.

full_text: It's good to know this trip was a complete waste of time for everyone!
character_words: It's good to know this trip was a complete waste of time for everyone!

full_text: Quite the contrary. I always say, the only thing better than finding something you are looking for [Crew members begin to walk past carrying Iroh's purchases.] is finding something you weren't looking for at a great bargain! [A crew member walks past the two playing a tsungi horn.]
character_words: Quite the contrary. I always say, the only thing better than finding something you are looking for  is finding something you weren't looking for at a great bargain!

full_text: You bought a tsungi horn?
character_words: You bought a tsungi horn?

full_text: For music night on the ship. Now, if we only had some woodwinds. [Pointing to the ship.] Oh, this place looks promising! [The monkey statue is shown again.] Oh, that is handsome! Wouldn't it look magnificent in the galley?
character_words: For music night on the ship. Now, if we only had some woodwinds.  Oh, this place looks promising!  Oh, that is handsome! Wouldn't it look magnificent in the galley?

full_text: [To pirate captain.] We lost the Water Tribe girl and the little bald monk she was traveling with.
character_words: We lost the Water Tribe girl and the little bald monk she was traveling with.

full_text: [Turning.] This monk, did he have an arrow on his head? [Iroh turns around, making a face similar to the monkey's.]
character_words: This monk, did he have an arrow on his head?

full_text: I just want to try this one move first and then it's all yours. [Gives it to Aang.] Here, hold it open for me. The single water whip. Looks doable. [Attempts the move, but ends up hitting herself in the forehead.] Ow!
character_words: I just want to try this one move first and then it's all yours.  Here, hold it open for me. The single water whip. Looks doable.  Ow!

full_text: Ha, ha, ha!
character_words: Ha, ha, ha!

full_text: [Glaring at Sokka.] What's so funny?
character_words: What's so funny?

full_text: I'm sorry, but you deserved that. [To Aang.] You've been duped; she's only interested in teaching herself.
character_words: I'm sorry, but you deserved that.  You've been duped; she's only interested in teaching herself.

full_text: [Angrily.] Aang will get his turn once I figure out the water whip. [She tries again, but hits Momo instead, who screeches.] Ugh, why can't I get this stupid move?
character_words: Aang will get his turn once I figure out the water whip.  Ugh, why can't I get this stupid move?

full_text: You'll get it. [Katara glares at him.] You just gotta shift your weight through the stances. [He tries and does it perfectly on the first try.] There, see, the key to bending is
character_words: You'll get it.  You just gotta shift your weight through the stances.  There, see, the key to bending is

full_text: [Screaming.] Will you please shut your air hole? Believe it or not your infinite wisdom gets a little old sometimes! Why don't we just throw the scroll away since you're so naturally gifted! [Sokka glares at her.] What? [She looks back at Aang, who has tears in his eyes.] Oh my gosh, Aang, I am so sorry, I don't know what came over me. But you know what, it won't happen again. [She gives the scroll to Aang.] Here, this is yours. I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore.
character_words: Will you please shut your air hole? Believe it or not your infinite wisdom gets a little old sometimes! Why don't we just throw the scroll away since you're so naturally gifted!  What?  Oh my gosh, Aang, I am so sorry, I don't know what came over me. But you know what, it won't happen again.  Here, this is yours. I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore.

full_text: It's okay Katara.
character_words: It's okay Katara.

full_text: What about Momo? He's the real victim here.
character_words: What about Momo? He's the real victim here.

full_text: [Bends down to pet Momo as he rubs his hind end.] I'm sorry, Momo.
character_words: I'm sorry, Momo.

full_text: And what about me? There was that time you
character_words: And what about me? There was that time you

full_text: No more apologies!
character_words: No more apologies!

full_text: Shouldn't we stop to search the woods?
character_words: Shouldn't we stop to search the woods?

full_text: We don't need to stop. They stole a waterbending scroll, right?
character_words: We don't need to stop. They stole a waterbending scroll, right?

full_text: Mm-hm.
character_words: Mm-hm.

full_text: Then they'll be on the water.
character_words: Then they'll be on the water.

full_text: [Whispering.] Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh! [The camera fades to show her standing by the river, attempting but failing to perfect the water whip, frustrated.] Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll! [The pirate captain and Zuko are shown hearing her.] Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances. [She drops the water again and hears the ship pulling up onto the river bank. She peaks through the bushes to see what the noise was, and gasps upon seeing the pirates. She turns to run, but it grabbed by a pirate.] No! Let go of me! [She bends water up into the pirate's face, and he releases her, she runs but is grabbed again on the wrists by Zuko.]
character_words: Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh!  Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll!  Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances.  No! Let go of me!

full_text: [He glares at her as she looks frightfully at him.] I'll save you from the pirates.
character_words: I'll save you from the pirates.

full_text: Tell me where he is and I won't hurt you or your brother.
character_words: Tell me where he is and I won't hurt you or your brother.

full_text: [Furiously.] Go jump in the river!
character_words: Go jump in the river!

full_text: Try to understand. I need to capture him to restore something I've lost, my honor. [Katara jerks her head away from Zuko.] Perhaps in exchange I can restore something you've lost. [He holds her mother's necklace up to her neck.]
character_words: Try to understand. I need to capture him to restore something I've lost, my honor.  Perhaps in exchange I can restore something you've lost.

full_text: My mother's necklace! How did you get that?
character_words: My mother's necklace! How did you get that?

full_text: I didn't steal it, if that's what you're wondering. Tell me where he is. [Points at Katara.]
character_words: I didn't steal it, if that's what you're wondering. Tell me where he is.

full_text: No!
character_words: No!

full_text: Enough of this necklace garbage! You promised a scroll!
character_words: Enough of this necklace garbage! You promised a scroll!

full_text: I wonder how much this is worth ... [The pirates gasp as he takes it out and holds it over a fire in his hand.] A lot, apparently. Now you help me find what I want, you'll get this back, and everyone goes home happy. Search the woods for the boy and meet back here!
character_words: I wonder how much this is worth ...  A lot, apparently. Now you help me find what I want, you'll get this back, and everyone goes home happy. Search the woods for the boy and meet back here!

full_text: Fine.
character_words: Fine.

full_text: [Notices Katara's missing.] Huh? Where did she go? [Looks through the bag.] I don't believe it.
character_words: Huh? Where did she go?  I don't believe it.

full_text: [Yawns.] What's wrong?
character_words: What's wrong?

full_text: She took the scroll! She's obsessed with that thing. It's just a matter of time before she gets us all in deep- [Yells as a pirate throws a rope around his arms and drags him forward. He rolls away and charges at the pirate while another pirate captures Aang in a net and drags him away.]
character_words: She took the scroll! She's obsessed with that thing. It's just a matter of time before she gets us all in deep-

full_text: I got him, come on!
character_words: I got him, come on!

full_text: Oh, what? I'm not good enough to kidnap? Ah! [The pirate shoots another net at Sokka and drags him away too.]
character_words: Oh, what? I'm not good enough to kidnap? Ah!

full_text: Nice work.
character_words: Nice work.

full_text: Aang, this is all my fault.
character_words: Aang, this is all my fault.

full_text: No Katara, it isn't.
character_words: No Katara, it isn't.

full_text: Yeah, it kind of is. [Katara glares at Iroh.]
character_words: Yeah, it kind of is.

full_text: [To the pirate captain.] Give me the boy.
character_words: Give me the boy.

full_text: You give us the scroll.
character_words: You give us the scroll.

full_text: You're really gonna hand over the Avatar for a stupid piece of parchment?
character_words: You're really gonna hand over the Avatar for a stupid piece of parchment?

full_text: Don't listen to him, he's trying to turn us against each other!
character_words: Don't listen to him, he's trying to turn us against each other!

full_text: [Turns to Aang.] Your friend is the Avatar?
character_words: Your friend is the Avatar?

full_text: Sure is, and I'll bet he'll fetch a lot more on the black market than that fancy scroll.
character_words: Sure is, and I'll bet he'll fetch a lot more on the black market than that fancy scroll.

full_text: Shut your mouth, you Water Tribe peasant!
character_words: Shut your mouth, you Water Tribe peasant!

full_text: Yeah, Sokka, you really should shut your mouth.
character_words: Yeah, Sokka, you really should shut your mouth.

full_text: I'm just sayin' it's bad business sense. Think how much the Fire Lord would pay for the Avatar. You guys would be set for life.
character_words: I'm just sayin' it's bad business sense. Think how much the Fire Lord would pay for the Avatar. You guys would be set for life.

full_text: [To Zuko.] Keep the scroll; we can buy a hundred with the reward we'll get for the kid. [The pirates turn to leave.]
character_words: Keep the scroll; we can buy a hundred with the reward we'll get for the kid.

full_text: You'll regret breaking a deal with me. [He and two of his soldiers send a blast of fire at the pirates. The pirates jump back and Oh runs out, throwing smoke bombs and jumping into the cloud as the fight ensues. Some of the soldiers run out to Sokka and Aang, who are struggling with their ropes, but are stopped by several pirates. Momo runs down the tree and frees Katara.]
character_words: You'll regret breaking a deal with me.

full_text: Thanks, Momo. I owe you a bushel of apples. [She runs to join the fight. Aang is shown lost in the smoke, a thrown knife narrowly misses him and cuts through his ropes. Zuko finds his way out of the smoke cloud and hides the scroll behind his back, but the pirate captain sees him and the two begin to fight. The scroll flies into the air and his caught by Momo, the iguana parrot sees him and hits Momo. The scroll flies back down to the ground. A knife narrowly misses Sokka's head, and he uses it to cuts the ropes on his hands.]
character_words: Thanks, Momo. I owe you a bushel of apples.

full_text: [Shouting.] Aang, are you there?
character_words: Aang, are you there?

full_text: I'm over here! Follow my voice!
character_words: I'm over here! Follow my voice!

full_text: Where? I can't find you!
character_words: Where? I can't find you!

full_text: I'm right here! [Airbends the dust away, revealing the pirates surrounding him, and immediately airbends it back around himself.] Never mind! I'll find you! [Sokka climbs out of the dust cloud on his hands and knees. Aang vaults over him in a full sprint.] Run! [They find Katara, who is trying to push the pirate boat back into the water.] Katara, you're okay!
character_words: I'm right here!  Never mind! I'll find you!  Run!  Katara, you're okay!

full_text: Help me get this boat back in the water so we can get outta here. [They join her in trying to push the boat, but can't.]
character_words: Help me get this boat back in the water so we can get outta here.

full_text: We'd need a team of rhinos to budge this ship.
character_words: We'd need a team of rhinos to budge this ship.

full_text: A team of rhinos, or two waterbenders.
character_words: A team of rhinos, or two waterbenders.

full_text: Everybody in!
character_words: Everybody in!

full_text: Are you so busy fighting you cannot see your own ship has set sail?
character_words: Are you so busy fighting you cannot see your own ship has set sail?

full_text: We have no time for your proverbs, Uncle!
character_words: We have no time for your proverbs, Uncle!

full_text: It's no proverb! [Points to Team Avatar who has hijacked the pirate ship.]
character_words: It's no proverb!

full_text: Bleeding hog monkeys! [Zuko laughs while pointing at him. His laughter dissipates as the pirates hijack his own boat. The pirates taunt him and the screen pans to a steaming Zuko.]
character_words: Bleeding hog monkeys!

full_text: [Angrily.] Hey! That's my boat! [Goes chasing after the hijacked boat.]
character_words: Hey! That's my boat!

full_text: [Pondering.] Maybe it should be a proverb ...
character_words: Maybe it should be a proverb ...

full_text: [Off camera.] C'mon, Uncle! [Iroh runs after Zuko.]
character_words: C'mon, Uncle!

full_text: Sokka, can't you make it go any faster?
character_words: Sokka, can't you make it go any faster?

full_text: I don't know how. This thing wasn't made by the Water Tribe!
character_words: I don't know how. This thing wasn't made by the Water Tribe!

full_text: Hey, you did the water whip!
character_words: Hey, you did the water whip!

full_text: I couldn't have done it without your help.
character_words: I couldn't have done it without your help.

full_text: Would you two quit congratulating each other and help me out?
character_words: Would you two quit congratulating each other and help me out?

full_text: That's good ... [Aang lands behind him and airbends him and the other pirate off the ship before jumping down to Sokka.]
character_words: That's good ...

full_text: [Pointing.] Aang, look! [The ship is shown headed toward a huge waterfall.]
character_words: Aang, look!

full_text: Oh no ...
character_words: Oh no ...

full_text: Have you lost your mind? This is no time for flute practice! [Katara and Aang stare in horror at the approaching waterfall.]
character_words: Have you lost your mind? This is no time for flute practice!

full_text: We can stop the boat! Aang, together, push and pull the water! [They create a small Whirlpool that stops the boat.] It's working, it's slowing down! We're doing it!
character_words: We can stop the boat! Aang, together, push and pull the water!  It's working, it's slowing down! We're doing it!

full_text: But we have another problem. [Zuko's boat is shown sailing straight toward their ship. The boat rams into the ship and Sokka, Aang, and Katara are forced to jump as the boat goes over the falls.]
character_words: But we have another problem.

full_text: Jump! [Appa is shown flying toward them. They land on him and fly to safety.]
character_words: Jump!

full_text: [Holding up the whistle.] I knew a bison whistle would come in handy! Thanks Appa.
character_words: I knew a bison whistle would come in handy! Thanks Appa.

full_text: Yeah, we owe you one. [Appa roars and the scene cuts to show Zuko running to the cliff in horror at the fact that his boat has gone over the falls.]
character_words: Yeah, we owe you one.

full_text: My boat!
character_words: My boat!

full_text: [Chuckles.] Prince Zuko, you're really going to get a kick out of this. That lotus tile was in my sleeve the whole time! [Has a big smile on his face.]
character_words: Prince Zuko, you're really going to get a kick out of this. That lotus tile was in my sleeve the whole time!

full_text: Aang, I still owe you an apology. You were just so good at waterbending without really trying. I got so competitive that I put us all in danger, I'm sorry.
character_words: Aang, I still owe you an apology. You were just so good at waterbending without really trying. I got so competitive that I put us all in danger, I'm sorry.

full_text: That's okay Katara.
character_words: That's okay Katara.

full_text: Besides, who needs that stupid scroll anyway?
character_words: Besides, who needs that stupid scroll anyway?

full_text: [Holding the scroll. Sarcastically.] Is that really how you feel?
character_words: Is that really how you feel?

full_text: The scroll!
character_words: The scroll!

full_text: [Puts his hand in front to keep Katara from grabbing it.] First, what did you learn?
character_words: First, what did you learn?

full_text: Stealing is wrong. [Snatches scroll.] Unless it's from pirates.
character_words: Stealing is wrong.  Unless it's from pirates.

full_text: [Laughing.] Good one, Katara.
character_words: Good one, Katara.

full_text: Where's Momo? [Camera zooms in to close-up shot of Aang, Katara, and Sokka, the siblings sitting next to each other with bored faces, and Aang standing with his back to the camera. Momo screeches and the gang looks around.]
character_words: Where's Momo?

full_text: Hang on, Momo! [Aang uses his airbending to fly to the top of the tree, jumping from trunk-to-trunk to get higher. He finds the traps' mechanisms, undoes them, and carefully lowers Momo to the ground where Katara and Sokka are waiting. They open the trap together and the lemur runs out with one of the lychee nuts in his mouth. Katara and Sokka look on as Momo gets on his hind legs and eats it as though nothing has happened. Sokka grunts in frustration and facepalms. When Aang lands, he looks up to see the other two animals seemingly crying out to him for help.] All right, you too. [Jumps up to them.]
character_words: Hang on, Momo!  All right, you too.

full_text: This is gonna take forever. [Throws his boomerang to simply cut the animals free.]
character_words: This is gonna take forever.

full_text: [Inching his way upside-down to the traps on the tree branch. They fall before he can reach them.] That works.
character_words: That works.

full_text: These are Fire Nation traps, [Camera zooms to upward shot of the gang looking at the trap.] you can tell from the metalwork. We better pack up camp, and get moving.
character_words: These are Fire Nation traps,  you can tell from the metalwork. We better pack up camp, and get moving.

full_text: Uh uh. No flying this time.
character_words: Uh uh. No flying this time.

full_text: [Confused.] What? Why wouldn't we fly?
character_words: What? Why wouldn't we fly?

full_text: [Takes the sleeping bag from Aang's hands.] Think about it: Somehow Prince Zuko and the Fire Nation keep finding us. It's because they spot Appa, he's just too noticeable.
character_words: Think about it: Somehow Prince Zuko and the Fire Nation keep finding us. It's because they spot Appa, he's just too noticeable.

full_text: What? Appa's not too noticeable!
character_words: What? Appa's not too noticeable!

full_text: [Points dramatically at Appa; condescendingly.] He's a gigantic fluffy monster with an arrow on his head! It's kinda hard to miss him! [The bison yawns and the camera flashes to Aang sitting comfortably on the animal's head.]
character_words: He's a gigantic fluffy monster with an arrow on his head! It's kinda hard to miss him!

full_text: [To Appa.] Sokka's just jealous 'cause he doesn't have an arrow.
character_words: Sokka's just jealous 'cause he doesn't have an arrow.

full_text: [Camera closes in on Sokka and Katara next to each other.] I know you all wanna fly, but my instincts tell me we should play it safe this time and walk.
character_words: I know you all wanna fly, but my instincts tell me we should play it safe this time and walk.

full_text: [Leans forward at her brother and smiles.] Who made you the boss?
character_words: Who made you the boss?

full_text: [Points his finger at his chest; to Katara.] I'm not the boss, I'm the leader.
character_words: I'm not the boss, I'm the leader.

full_text: [Amused.] You're the leader? But your voice still cracks!
character_words: You're the leader? But your voice still cracks!

full_text: [Voice cracks.] I'm the oldest, and I'm a warrior, so [Deepens voice.] I'm the leader!
character_words: I'm the oldest, and I'm a warrior, so  I'm the leader!

full_text: [Close-up shot of Katara's face.] If anyone's the leader, it's Aang. I mean he is the Avatar. [Pan back to Sokka.]
character_words: If anyone's the leader, it's Aang. I mean he is the Avatar.

full_text: Are you kidding, he's just a goofy kid!
character_words: Are you kidding, he's just a goofy kid!

full_text: [While hanging upside-down from Appa's right horn with feet sticking out in the air.] He's right.
character_words: He's right.

full_text: Why do boys always think someone has to be the leader? I bet you wouldn't be so bossy if you kissed a girl.
character_words: Why do boys always think someone has to be the leader? I bet you wouldn't be so bossy if you kissed a girl.

full_text: [Close-up on Sokka; defensively.] I've kissed a girl, you just haven't met her.
character_words: I've kissed a girl, you just haven't met her.

full_text: [Back to Sokka.] Who? Gran-Gran? I've met Gran-Gran.
character_words: Who? Gran-Gran? I've met Gran-Gran.

full_text: [Throws arms into the air.] No! Besides Gran-Gran. Look, my instincts tell me we have a better chance of slipping through on foot, and a leader has to trust his instincts.
character_words: No! Besides Gran-Gran. Look, my instincts tell me we have a better chance of slipping through on foot, and a leader has to trust his instincts.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Okay, we'll try it your way, oh wise leader.
character_words: Okay, we'll try it your way, oh wise leader.

full_text: [Aang steps over, now wearing a backpack. Momo is sitting on the top.] Who knows? Walking might be fun. [Cut to the forest at a later time. Between trees the group trudges along, with Sokka in front, followed by Aang and Momo, Katara, and Appa.] Walking stinks! How do people go anywhere without a flying bison?
character_words: Who knows? Walking might be fun.  Walking stinks! How do people go anywhere without a flying bison?

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Well I don't know, Aang. Why don't you ask Sokka's instincts? They seem to know everything.
character_words: Well I don't know, Aang. Why don't you ask Sokka's instincts? They seem to know everything.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Ha, ha, very funny.
character_words: Ha, ha, very funny.

full_text: [Complaining.] I'm tired of carrying this pack.
character_words: I'm tired of carrying this pack.

full_text: You know who you should ask to carry it for a while? Sokka's instincts. [Sokka's eyes turn to her in irritation.]
character_words: You know who you should ask to carry it for a while? Sokka's instincts.

full_text: That's a great idea. Hey, Sokka's instincts, would you mind-
character_words: That's a great idea. Hey, Sokka's instincts, would you mind-

full_text: Okay, okay, I get it. Look guys, I'm tired too. But the important thing is that we're safe from the [Walks through a bush and sees something in front of him.] Fire ... Nation.
character_words: Okay, okay, I get it. Look guys, I'm tired too. But the important thing is that we're safe from the  Fire ... Nation.

full_text: Run! [They turn to run but a firebender blocks them off by setting the plants behind them on fire.] We're cut off!
character_words: Run!  We're cut off!

full_text: Sokka, your shirt! [Sokka yells; Katara clears a fire on Sokka's shirt with waterbending.]
character_words: Sokka, your shirt!

full_text: If you let us pass, we promise not to hurt you.
character_words: If you let us pass, we promise not to hurt you.

full_text: [Whispers.] What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: [Whispers.] Bluffing?
character_words: Bluffing?

full_text: You promise not to hurt us? [He's somehow knocked out.]
character_words: You promise not to hurt us?

full_text: Nice work, Sokka! How'd you do that?
character_words: Nice work, Sokka! How'd you do that?

full_text: Uh, instinct?
character_words: Uh, instinct?

full_text: [Points up a tree.] Look!
character_words: Look!

full_text: Down you go. [Katara looks amazed, Aang shocked, and Sokka confused.]
character_words: Down you go.

full_text: They're in the trees!
character_words: They're in the trees!

full_text: Hey, he was mine!
character_words: Hey, he was mine!

full_text: Gotta be quicker next time.
character_words: Gotta be quicker next time.

full_text: [Angrily.] Man!
character_words: Man!

full_text: Hey.
character_words: Hey.

full_text: Hi.
character_words: Hi.

full_text: [Amazed.] You just took out a whole army almost single-handed.
character_words: You just took out a whole army almost single-handed.

full_text: [Disdainfully.] Army? There were only like, twenty guys.
character_words: Army? There were only like, twenty guys.

full_text: My name is Jet, and these are my Freedom Fighters, Sneers, Longshot, Smellerbee, The Duke, and Pipsqueak.
character_words: My name is Jet, and these are my Freedom Fighters, Sneers, Longshot, Smellerbee, The Duke, and Pipsqueak.

full_text: [Laughing; looking at The Duke.] Ha, ha, Pipsqueak, that's a funny name. [The Duke sniffs his nose, as the camera pans upward to Pipsqueak.]
character_words: Ha, ha, Pipsqueak, that's a funny name.

full_text: [Looming over Aang in a threatening manner; in a low, growling tone of voice.] You think my name is funny?
character_words: You think my name is funny?

full_text: [Side-shot; Aang looks taken aback for a second before replying in an upbeat tone.] It's hilarious!
character_words: It's hilarious!

full_text: [Approaching Jet.] Umm, thanks for saving us Jet. We're lucky you were there.
character_words: Umm, thanks for saving us Jet. We're lucky you were there.

full_text: I should be thanking you. We were waiting to ambush those soldiers all morning, we just needed the right distraction, and then you guys stumbled in.
character_words: I should be thanking you. We were waiting to ambush those soldiers all morning, we just needed the right distraction, and then you guys stumbled in.

full_text: [Eyeing Sokka.] We were relying on instincts.
character_words: We were relying on instincts.

full_text: You'll get yourself killed doing that.
character_words: You'll get yourself killed doing that.

full_text: Hey Jet, these barrels are filled of blasting jelly.
character_words: Hey Jet, these barrels are filled of blasting jelly.

full_text: That's a great score.
character_words: That's a great score.

full_text: And these boxes are filled with jelly candy!
character_words: And these boxes are filled with jelly candy!

full_text: Also good, let's not get those mixed up.
character_words: Also good, let's not get those mixed up.

full_text: We'll take this stuff back to the hideout.
character_words: We'll take this stuff back to the hideout.

full_text: You guys have a hideout?
character_words: You guys have a hideout?

full_text: You wanna see it?
character_words: You wanna see it?

full_text: [Very excitedly.] Yes, we wanna see it!
character_words: Yes, we wanna see it!

full_text: We're here.
character_words: We're here.

full_text: Where? There's nothing here.
character_words: Where? There's nothing here.

full_text: Hold this. [Gives a rope to Sokka.]
character_words: Hold this.

full_text: [Skeptically.] Why? What's this do? [Screams as he is pulled up into the branches.]
character_words: Why? What's this do?

full_text: Aang? [Offers Aang another rope.]
character_words: Aang?

full_text: I'll get up on my own. [Leaps up into the trees with airbending.]
character_words: I'll get up on my own.

full_text: Grab hold of me, Katara.
character_words: Grab hold of me, Katara.

full_text: [While passing through with Momo.] Nice place you got!
character_words: Nice place you got!

full_text: It's beautiful up here!
character_words: It's beautiful up here!

full_text: It's beautiful ... and more importantly the Fire Nation can't find us. [Smellerbee lands near the two.]
character_words: It's beautiful ... and more importantly the Fire Nation can't find us.

full_text: They would love to find you. Wouldn't they, Jet?
character_words: They would love to find you. Wouldn't they, Jet?

full_text: It's not gonna happen, Smellerbee.
character_words: It's not gonna happen, Smellerbee.

full_text: [As Aang zips by again.] Why does the Fire Nation want to find you?
character_words: Why does the Fire Nation want to find you?

full_text: I guess you could say I've been causing them a little trouble. See, they took over a nearby Earth Kingdom town a few years back.
character_words: I guess you could say I've been causing them a little trouble. See, they took over a nearby Earth Kingdom town a few years back.

full_text: We've been ambushin' their troops, cutting off their supply lines, and doing anything we can to mess with 'em. [Sokka is now seen comically hopping around trying to get past Pipsqueak.]
character_words: We've been ambushin' their troops, cutting off their supply lines, and doing anything we can to mess with 'em.

full_text: One day, we'll drive the Fire Nation out of here for good and free that town.
character_words: One day, we'll drive the Fire Nation out of here for good and free that town.

full_text: That's so brave. [Sokka manages to get by Pipsqueak.]
character_words: That's so brave.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, nothing's braver than a guy in a tree house.
character_words: Yeah, nothing's braver than a guy in a tree house.

full_text: Don't pay any attention to my brother.
character_words: Don't pay any attention to my brother.

full_text: No problem. He probably had a rough day.
character_words: No problem. He probably had a rough day.

full_text: So, you all live here? [Sokka who is being ignored comically sinks back behind them.]
character_words: So, you all live here?

full_text: That's right. Longshot over there? [The screen cuts to Longshot and The Duke walking not making a sound.] His town got burned down by the Fire Nation. And we found The Duke trying to steal our food. I don't think he ever really had a home.
character_words: That's right. Longshot over there?  His town got burned down by the Fire Nation. And we found The Duke trying to steal our food. I don't think he ever really had a home.

full_text: What about you?
character_words: What about you?

full_text: [Katara and Jet come to a halt as the rest pass.] The Fire Nation killed my parents. I was only eight years old. That day changed me forever.
character_words: The Fire Nation killed my parents. I was only eight years old. That day changed me forever.

full_text: Sokka and I lost our mother to the Fire Nation.
character_words: Sokka and I lost our mother to the Fire Nation.

full_text: I'm so sorry, Katara.
character_words: I'm so sorry, Katara.

full_text: Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine. [Everyone cheers. Katara and Aang smile while Sokka cops an attitude and a scowling face.] I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey. [The Duke, without his helmet, climbs up the table. He marches on the table with his arms in the air.] Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees. [He prepares to take a drink from his wooden cup.] Maybe they're right. [A very loud and long boo is heard; with an angry face.] Or maybe ... they're dead wrong. [A loud and long cheer is heard.]
character_words: Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine.  I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey.  Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees.  Maybe they're right.  Or maybe ... they're dead wrong.

full_text: Hey Jet, nice speech.
character_words: Hey Jet, nice speech.

full_text: Thanks. By the way, I was really impressed with you and Aang. That was some great bending I saw out there today.
character_words: Thanks. By the way, I was really impressed with you and Aang. That was some great bending I saw out there today.

full_text: Well, he's great. He's the Avatar. [Blushes.] I could use some more training.
character_words: Well, he's great. He's the Avatar.  I could use some more training.

full_text: Avatar huh? Very nice.
character_words: Avatar huh? Very nice.

full_text: Thanks Jet.
character_words: Thanks Jet.

full_text: So I might know a way that you and Aang can help in our struggle.
character_words: So I might know a way that you and Aang can help in our struggle.

full_text: Unfortunately, we have to leave tonight. [Sokka starts walking away.]
character_words: Unfortunately, we have to leave tonight.

full_text: Sokka, you're kidding me! I needed you on an important mission tomorrow. [Sokka turns around.]
character_words: Sokka, you're kidding me! I needed you on an important mission tomorrow.

full_text: What mission?
character_words: What mission?

full_text: What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: Shh ... It amplifies vibrations.
character_words: Shh ... It amplifies vibrations.

full_text: [Impressed.] Good trick.
character_words: Good trick.

full_text: [Sokka puts his ear to the handle of his knife.] Nothing yet. [Whispers.] Wait! Yes, someone's approaching.
character_words: Nothing yet.  Wait! Yes, someone's approaching.

full_text: [Whispers.] How many?
character_words: How many?

full_text: I think there's just one.
character_words: I think there's just one.

full_text: [Does a another birdcall.] Good work, Sokka. Ready your weapon. [Sokka takes his knife out of the tree. His eyes spot an old man.]
character_words: Good work, Sokka. Ready your weapon.

full_text: [Whispers.] Wait, false alarm ... He's just an old man.
character_words: Wait, false alarm ... He's just an old man.

full_text: What are you doing in our woods, you leech?
character_words: What are you doing in our woods, you leech?

full_text: Please sir, I'm just a traveler.
character_words: Please sir, I'm just a traveler.

full_text: Do you like destroying towns? Do you like destroying families? Do you?
character_words: Do you like destroying towns? Do you like destroying families? Do you?

full_text: Oh ... Please let me go ... have mercy ...
character_words: Oh ... Please let me go ... have mercy ...

full_text: Does the Fire Nation let people go? Does the Fire Nation have mercy?
character_words: Does the Fire Nation let people go? Does the Fire Nation have mercy?

full_text: Jet, he's just an old man!
character_words: Jet, he's just an old man!

full_text: He's Fire Nation! Search him! [Pipsqueak holds the prisoner and Smellerbee steps up to search the poor man.]
character_words: He's Fire Nation! Search him!

full_text: But he's not hurting anyone!
character_words: But he's not hurting anyone!

full_text: Have you forgotten that the Fire Nation killed your mother? Remember why you fight!
character_words: Have you forgotten that the Fire Nation killed your mother? Remember why you fight!

full_text: We've got his stuff, Jet. [She holds up the old man's bag. The old man is thrown back on the ground.]
character_words: We've got his stuff, Jet.

full_text: This doesn't feel right.
character_words: This doesn't feel right.

full_text: It's what has to be done, now let's get outta here.
character_words: It's what has to be done, now let's get outta here.

full_text: Come on, Sokka!
character_words: Come on, Sokka!

full_text: Sokka! Look what the Duke gave me! [Aang is wearing a bag and pulls a small pellet from it. With a sly grin, he tosses it next to Momo, where it explodes with a pop. Momo puffs up like a startled cat. He hisses and lunges for the bag. Momo sits on Aang's shoulder and tosses several pellets at his feet. Aang dances about wildly.] Ow! Quit it!
character_words: Sokka! Look what the Duke gave me!  Ow! Quit it!

full_text: Hey, Sokka. Is Jet back?
character_words: Hey, Sokka. Is Jet back?

full_text: Yeah he's back. But we're leaving.
character_words: Yeah he's back. But we're leaving.

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: But I made him this hat. [She shows a cap made out of stitched leaves with a flower on top.]
character_words: But I made him this hat.

full_text: Your boyfriend Jet's a thug.
character_words: Your boyfriend Jet's a thug.

full_text: What? No, he's not.
character_words: What? No, he's not.

full_text: He's messed up Katara.
character_words: He's messed up Katara.

full_text: He's not messed up, he's just got a different way of life, a really fun way of life.
character_words: He's not messed up, he's just got a different way of life, a really fun way of life.

full_text: He beat and robbed a harmless old man!
character_words: He beat and robbed a harmless old man!

full_text: I wanna hear Jet's side of the story. [The scene changes to Jet in a room.]
character_words: I wanna hear Jet's side of the story.

full_text: Sokka, you told them what happened, but you didn't mention that the guy was Fire Nation?
character_words: Sokka, you told them what happened, but you didn't mention that the guy was Fire Nation?

full_text: No, he conveniently left that part out.
character_words: No, he conveniently left that part out.

full_text: Fine! But even if he was Fire Nation, he was a harmless civilian!
character_words: Fine! But even if he was Fire Nation, he was a harmless civilian!

full_text: He was an assassin, Sokka.
character_words: He was an assassin, Sokka.

full_text: See? There's a compartment for poison in the knife. [He pulls on the ring and removes a small glass tube filled with red liquid.]. He was sent to eliminate me; you helped save my life, Sokka.
character_words: See? There's a compartment for poison in the knife. . He was sent to eliminate me; you helped save my life, Sokka.

full_text: I knew there was an explanation.
character_words: I knew there was an explanation.

full_text: I didn't see any knife!
character_words: I didn't see any knife!

full_text: That's because he was concealing it.
character_words: That's because he was concealing it.

full_text: See, Sokka? I'm sure you just didn't notice the knife.
character_words: See, Sokka? I'm sure you just didn't notice the knife.

full_text: There was no knife! I'm going back to the hut and packing my things. [Sokka stomps away.]
character_words: There was no knife! I'm going back to the hut and packing my things.

full_text: Tell me you guys aren't leaving yet. I really need your help.
character_words: Tell me you guys aren't leaving yet. I really need your help.

full_text: What can we do?
character_words: What can we do?

full_text: The Fire Nation is planning on burning down our forest. If you both use waterbending to fill the reservoir, we could fight the fires. But if you leave now, they'll destroy the whole valley.
character_words: The Fire Nation is planning on burning down our forest. If you both use waterbending to fill the reservoir, we could fight the fires. But if you leave now, they'll destroy the whole valley.

full_text: We can't leave now with the Fire Nation about to burn down a forest!
character_words: We can't leave now with the Fire Nation about to burn down a forest!

full_text: I'm sorry Katara. Jet's very smooth, but we can't trust him.
character_words: I'm sorry Katara. Jet's very smooth, but we can't trust him.

full_text: You know what I think? You're jealous that he's a better warrior and a better leader!
character_words: You know what I think? You're jealous that he's a better warrior and a better leader!

full_text: Katara, I'm not jealous of Jet. It's just that my instinct
character_words: Katara, I'm not jealous of Jet. It's just that my instinct

full_text: Well my instincts tell me we need to stay here a little longer and help Jet. Come on Aang.
character_words: Well my instincts tell me we need to stay here a little longer and help Jet. Come on Aang.

full_text: Sorry, Sokka.
character_words: Sorry, Sokka.

full_text: Let's go.
character_words: Let's go.

full_text: Now listen, you are not to blow the dam until I give the signal. If the reservoir isn't full, the Fire Nation troops could survive. [The Duke jumps off the wagon.]
character_words: Now listen, you are not to blow the dam until I give the signal. If the reservoir isn't full, the Fire Nation troops could survive.

full_text: But what about the people in the town, won't they get wiped out too? [Jet places a hand on The Duke's shoulder.]
character_words: But what about the people in the town, won't they get wiped out too?

full_text: Look Duke, that's the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation. [To Longshot.] Now don't blow the dam until I give the signalgot it? [Longshot nods.]
character_words: Look Duke, that's the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation.  Now don't blow the dam until I give the signalgot it?

full_text: [Sneering.] Where do you think you're going, ponytail?
character_words: Where do you think you're going, ponytail?

full_text: Sokka, I'm glad you decided to join us. [Pipsqueak and Smellerbee send Sokka to his knees. He rubs his shoulder.]
character_words: Sokka, I'm glad you decided to join us.

full_text: I heard your plan to destroy the Earth Kingdom town.
character_words: I heard your plan to destroy the Earth Kingdom town.

full_text: Our plan is to rid the valley of the Fire Nation.
character_words: Our plan is to rid the valley of the Fire Nation.

full_text: There are people living there, Jet; mothers and fathers and children.
character_words: There are people living there, Jet; mothers and fathers and children.

full_text: We can't win without making some sacrifices. [Sokka points an accusing finger at Jet.]
character_words: We can't win without making some sacrifices.

full_text: You lied to Aang and Katara about the forest fire!
character_words: You lied to Aang and Katara about the forest fire!

full_text: Because they don't understand the demands of war. Not like you and I do.
character_words: Because they don't understand the demands of war. Not like you and I do.

full_text: I do understand. I understand that there's nothing you won't do to get what you want.
character_words: I do understand. I understand that there's nothing you won't do to get what you want.

full_text: I was hoping you'd have an open mind, but I can see you've made your choice.
character_words: I was hoping you'd have an open mind, but I can see you've made your choice.

full_text: I can't let you warn Katara and Aang. [Jet releases Sokka's hand; it is immediately forced behind his back.] Take him for a walk, a long walk.
character_words: I can't let you warn Katara and Aang.  Take him for a walk, a long walk.

full_text: You can't do this!
character_words: You can't do this!

full_text: Cheer up, Sokka. We're gonna win a great victory against the Fire Nation today.
character_words: Cheer up, Sokka. We're gonna win a great victory against the Fire Nation today.

full_text: Jet, I'm sorry about how Sokka's been acting.
character_words: Jet, I'm sorry about how Sokka's been acting.

full_text: No worries, he already apologized.
character_words: No worries, he already apologized.

full_text: Really? [Aang and Katara stop and look at one another.] Sokka apologized?
character_words: Really?  Sokka apologized?

full_text: Yeah, I was surprised too. I got the sense that maybe you talked to him or something.
character_words: Yeah, I was surprised too. I got the sense that maybe you talked to him or something.

full_text: Yeah, I did.
character_words: Yeah, I did.

full_text: I guess something you said got through to him. Anyhow, he went out on a scouting mission with Pipsqueak and Smellerbee.
character_words: I guess something you said got through to him. Anyhow, he went out on a scouting mission with Pipsqueak and Smellerbee.

full_text: I'm glad he cooled off. He's so stubborn sometimes.
character_words: I'm glad he cooled off. He's so stubborn sometimes.

full_text: All right, we're here. Underground water's trying to escape through these vents. I need you guys to help it along.
character_words: All right, we're here. Underground water's trying to escape through these vents. I need you guys to help it along.

full_text: I've never used bending on water I can't see. I don't know ... [Jet stands behind her and places his hands on her shoulders.]
