full_text: Katara, I think you were right before. I'm done dwelling on the past.
character_words: Katara, I think you were right before. I'm done dwelling on the past.

full_text: Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: I can't make guesses about what would have turned out if I hadn't run away. I'm here now and I'm going to make the most out of it.
character_words: I can't make guesses about what would have turned out if I hadn't run away. I'm here now and I'm going to make the most out of it.

full_text: I don't think you're gonna have those nightmares anymore.
character_words: I don't think you're gonna have those nightmares anymore.

full_text: And if you weren't here now, well, I guess I wouldn't be either. Thank you for saving my life, Avatar.
character_words: And if you weren't here now, well, I guess I wouldn't be either. Thank you for saving my life, Avatar.

full_text: Do you hear that? It stopped raining.
character_words: Do you hear that? It stopped raining.

full_text: Appa!
character_words: Appa!

full_text: [In response to Zhao; somewhat angrily.] Absolutely not! The Yuyan Archers stay here. Your request is denied, Commander Zhao.
character_words: Absolutely not! The Yuyan Archers stay here. Your request is denied, Commander Zhao.

full_text: Colonel Shinu, please reconsider ... Their precision is legendary. The Yuyan can pin a fly to a tree from one hundred yards away ... without killing it. [Annoyed.] You're wasting their talents using them as mere security guards.
character_words: Colonel Shinu, please reconsider ... Their precision is legendary. The Yuyan can pin a fly to a tree from one hundred yards away ... without killing it.  You're wasting their talents using them as mere security guards.

full_text: I can do whatever I want with their talents, they're my archers, and what I say goes.
character_words: I can do whatever I want with their talents, they're my archers, and what I say goes.

full_text: But my search for the Avatar is-
character_words: But my search for the Avatar is-

full_text: [Cutting Zhao off mid-sentence while getting close to him and scoffing angrily.] Is nothing but a vanity project! We're fighting a real war here, and I need every man I've got, commander.
character_words: Is nothing but a vanity project! We're fighting a real war here, and I need every man I've got, commander.

full_text: But-!
character_words: But-!

full_text: [Furiously.] That's final! I don't wanna hear another word about it!
character_words: That's final! I don't wanna hear another word about it!

full_text: [Intrigued.] News from Fire Lord Ozai?
character_words: News from Fire Lord Ozai?

full_text: [Pleased.] It appears I've been promoted to Admiral. My request ... is now an order.
character_words: It appears I've been promoted to Admiral. My request ... is now an order.

full_text: [Pressing a wet rag onto Sokka's forehead.] This should bring your fever down.
character_words: This should bring your fever down.

full_text: You know what I love about Appa the most? His sense of humor.
character_words: You know what I love about Appa the most? His sense of humor.

full_text: That's nice. I'll tell him.
character_words: That's nice. I'll tell him.

full_text: [Laughs.] Classic Appa.
character_words: Classic Appa.

full_text: How's Sokka doing?
character_words: How's Sokka doing?

full_text: Not so good, being out in that storm really did a number on him.
character_words: Not so good, being out in that storm really did a number on him.

full_text: I couldn't find any ginger root for the tea. But I found a map. There's an herbalist institute on top of that mountain. We could probably find a cure for Sokka there.
character_words: I couldn't find any ginger root for the tea. But I found a map. There's an herbalist institute on top of that mountain. We could probably find a cure for Sokka there.

full_text: Aang, he's in no condition for travel. Sokka just needs more rest. I'm sure he'll be better by tomorrow. [Starts coughing.]
character_words: Aang, he's in no condition for travel. Sokka just needs more rest. I'm sure he'll be better by tomorrow.

full_text: Not you too!
character_words: Not you too!

full_text: Relax, it was just a little cough. I'm fi- [She coughs again, this time with greater force, and lightly groans after.]
character_words: Relax, it was just a little cough. I'm fi-

full_text: [Shielding his face.] That's how Sokka started yesterday. Now look at him! He thinks he's an earthbender!
character_words: That's how Sokka started yesterday. Now look at him! He thinks he's an earthbender!

full_text: [Delirious.] Take that, you rock! [He flails his arms as if he is hitting something.]
character_words: Take that, you rock!

full_text: A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine! [He grabs his glider and begins to head out just as a flash of lightning strikes.] Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot. [To Appa and Momo.] Keep an eye on them guys. [Appa groans while Momo chitters.]
character_words: A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine!  Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot.  Keep an eye on them guys.

full_text: Ha, ha! You guys are killing me!
character_words: Ha, ha! You guys are killing me!

full_text: We haven't been able to pick up the Avatar's trail since the storm, but if we continue heading northeast ... [A larger Fire Nation ship pulls up next to theirs.]
character_words: We haven't been able to pick up the Avatar's trail since the storm, but if we continue heading northeast ...

full_text: What do they want?
character_words: What do they want?

full_text: Perhaps, a sporting game of Pai Sho!
character_words: Perhaps, a sporting game of Pai Sho!

full_text: [To Zuko.] The hunt for the Avatar has been given prime importance. All information regarding the Avatar must be reported directly to Admiral Zhao.
character_words: The hunt for the Avatar has been given prime importance. All information regarding the Avatar must be reported directly to Admiral Zhao.

full_text: Zhao has been promoted? Well, good for him! [As Iroh makes a move in his Pai Sho game, another player slaps his hand against his own forehead as if he lost.]
character_words: Zhao has been promoted? Well, good for him!

full_text: [Looking down.] I've got nothing to report to Admiral Zhao. Now get off my ship and let us pass.
character_words: I've got nothing to report to Admiral Zhao. Now get off my ship and let us pass.

full_text: Admiral Zhao is not allowing ships in or out of this area.
character_words: Admiral Zhao is not allowing ships in or out of this area.

full_text: Off my ship!
character_words: Off my ship!

full_text: [Iroh wins his game.] Excellent! I take the pot! [A crew member punches himself.] But you're all improving! I'm certain you will win if we play again.
character_words: Excellent! I take the pot!  But you're all improving! I'm certain you will win if we play again.

full_text: [Reading Aang's wanted poster out loud.] Says here that the Avatar can create tornadoes and run faster than the wind. Pretty amazing!
character_words: Says here that the Avatar can create tornadoes and run faster than the wind. Pretty amazing!

full_text: Ah, that's just a bunch of Fire Lord propaganda! There's no way that's true!
character_words: Ah, that's just a bunch of Fire Lord propaganda! There's no way that's true!

full_text: [Weakly.] Katara, please, water.
character_words: Katara, please, water.

full_text: [Also weak.] Listen carefully, Momo. [Holds up a water skin.] I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water. [She is shown through Momo's eyes, speaking gibberish.] Got it? [Momo takes the skin and flies off.]
character_words: Listen carefully, Momo.  I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water.  Got it?

full_text: [Speaking fast.] Hello, I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends, they have fevers and they were coughing- [Gets cut off by the herbalist.]
character_words: Hello, I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends, they have fevers and they were coughing-

full_text: Settle down, young man. Your friends are going to be fine. I've been up here for over forty years you know, used to be others, but they all left years ago. [She pets Miyuki who begins to purr.] Now it's just me and Miyuki.
character_words: Settle down, young man. Your friends are going to be fine. I've been up here for over forty years you know, used to be others, but they all left years ago.  Now it's just me and Miyuki.

full_text: That's nice.
character_words: That's nice.

full_text: Wounded Earth Kingdom troops still come by now and again, brave boys, and thanks to my remedies they always leave in better shape they when they arrive.
character_words: Wounded Earth Kingdom troops still come by now and again, brave boys, and thanks to my remedies they always leave in better shape they when they arrive.

full_text: That's nice. Are you almost done?
character_words: That's nice. Are you almost done?

full_text: Hold on, I just need to add one last ingredient. [Walking among the shrubbery, looking around and muttering to herself.] Oh, sandalwood ... oh, er, uh, that won't do, banana leaf? Ah, nope, uh, ginger root, uh uh, oh where is that pesky little plant?
character_words: Hold on, I just need to add one last ingredient.  Oh, sandalwood ... oh, er, uh, that won't do, banana leaf? Ah, nope, uh, ginger root, uh uh, oh where is that pesky little plant?

full_text: Is everything okay? It's been almost an hour and you haven't given the men an order.
character_words: Is everything okay? It's been almost an hour and you haven't given the men an order.

full_text: I don't care what they do.
character_words: I don't care what they do.

full_text: Don't give up hope yet. You can still find the Avatar before Zhao.
character_words: Don't give up hope yet. You can still find the Avatar before Zhao.

full_text: [Turning back, desperation and fear on his face.] How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources, it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar. [Turns back out to sea and whispers.] My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all.
character_words: How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources, it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar.  My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all.

full_text: Ah! Plum blossom! [She plucks a flower from the tree.]
character_words: Ah! Plum blossom!

full_text: [He lifts up his head off the table.] Finally! [Close-up of the mixing bowl as the herbalist drops the flower into the mixture, and Aang grabs for the bowl.] Thanks for all your help!
character_words: Finally!  Thanks for all your help!

full_text: Hands off!
character_words: Hands off!

full_text: Ow!
character_words: Ow!

full_text: [Close-up, holding her spoon at the ready for a new attack.] What do you think you're doing?
character_words: What do you think you're doing?

full_text: [Rubs his hand, flinching.] Taking the cure to my friends.
character_words: Taking the cure to my friends.

full_text: [Lowers her spoon; laughs.] This isn't a cure! It's Miyuki's dinner. Plum blossom is her favorite.
character_words: This isn't a cure! It's Miyuki's dinner. Plum blossom is her favorite.

full_text: What about my friends?
character_words: What about my friends?

full_text: Well, all they need are some frozen wood frogs. There's plenty down in the valley swamp.
character_words: Well, all they need are some frozen wood frogs. There's plenty down in the valley swamp.

full_text: [Confused.] What am I supposed to do with frozen frogs?
character_words: What am I supposed to do with frozen frogs?

full_text: Why, suck on them of course!
character_words: Why, suck on them of course!

full_text: [Shocked and disgusted; his eye twitches.] Suck on them?
character_words: Suck on them?

full_text: The frog skin excretes a substance that will cure your friends. Be sure to get plenty because once those little critters thaw out, they're useless!
character_words: The frog skin excretes a substance that will cure your friends. Be sure to get plenty because once those little critters thaw out, they're useless!

full_text: You're insane, aren't you?
character_words: You're insane, aren't you?

full_text: [Crazily.] That's right! Well, don't stand there all day! Go!
character_words: That's right! Well, don't stand there all day! Go!

full_text: Uh ... I think you dropped this ... [Screams as he sees the Yuyan Archers taking aim at him. Panicking, he frees himself from the arrow that had pinned his foot to the ground and runs. He falls off a cliff into a swamp and finds the frozen frogs.] A frog!
character_words: Uh ... I think you dropped this ...  A frog!

full_text: So this is the great Avatar. Master of all the elements. I don't know how you've managed to elude the Fire Nation for a hundred years, but your little game of hide and seek is over.
character_words: So this is the great Avatar. Master of all the elements. I don't know how you've managed to elude the Fire Nation for a hundred years, but your little game of hide and seek is over.

full_text: [Angry.] I've never hidden from you! Untie me and I'll fight you right now!
character_words: I've never hidden from you! Untie me and I'll fight you right now!

full_text: Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people? [Aang looks down sadly.] Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were. [Aang looks angry again.] See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely. [Aang takes a deep breath and blows at gale force at Zhao, who falls over.] Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.
character_words: Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people?  Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were.  See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely.  Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.

full_text: [Weakly.] Water ...
character_words: Water ...

full_text: [Weakly.] Momo should be back any minute.
character_words: Momo should be back any minute.

full_text: [Weakly; in disgust.] Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter! [Momo's ear go straight up. He jumps off her and scampers.] Aang, what in the world is taking you so long?
character_words: Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter!  Aang, what in the world is taking you so long?

full_text: All clear.
character_words: All clear.

full_text: All clear. Go on in.
character_words: All clear. Go on in.

full_text: We are the sons and daughters of fire, the superior element! Until today only one thing stood our path to victory, the Avatar. I am here to tell you that he is now my prisoner! [The crowd cheers.] This is the year Sozin's Comet returns to grant us its power! [The crowd cheers.] This is the year the Fire Nation breaks through the walls of Ba Sing Se and burns the city to the ground!
character_words: We are the sons and daughters of fire, the superior element! Until today only one thing stood our path to victory, the Avatar. I am here to tell you that he is now my prisoner!  This is the year Sozin's Comet returns to grant us its power!  This is the year the Fire Nation breaks through the walls of Ba Sing Se and burns the city to the ground!

full_text: [To the frogs.] What? No! Don't leave, frogs! My friends are sick and they need you! Please go back to being frozen!
character_words: What? No! Don't leave, frogs! My friends are sick and they need you! Please go back to being frozen!

full_text: Who are you? What's going on? Are you here to rescue me? [The Blue Spirit opens the door and motions for him to follow.] I'll take that as a "yes."
character_words: Who are you? What's going on? Are you here to rescue me?  I'll take that as a "yes."

full_text: My frogs! Come back! And stop thawing out! [The Blue Spirit comes back, picks him up by the collar and carries him out.] Wait! My friends need to suck on those frogs!
character_words: My frogs! Come back! And stop thawing out!  Wait! My friends need to suck on those frogs!

full_text: [With a weak, sickly voice.] How many times do I have to tell you, Momo? We need water, wa-ter. Oh forget it. Aang, please, hurry.
character_words: How many times do I have to tell you, Momo? We need water, wa-ter. Oh forget it. Aang, please, hurry.

full_text: [Delirious.] Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness? [Katara gets an annoyed look on her face.]
character_words: Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness?

full_text: I want a full transcription of my speech sent to the Fire Lord, along with glowing testimonials from all of the ranking officers present, and
character_words: I want a full transcription of my speech sent to the Fire Lord, along with glowing testimonials from all of the ranking officers present, and

full_text: Sir, should I hold off sending that speech to the Fire Lord?
character_words: Sir, should I hold off sending that speech to the Fire Lord?

full_text: There, on the wall!
character_words: There, on the wall!

full_text: [Shouting.] The Avatar has escaped! Close all the gates immediately! [Cut to the escapees running, Aang passes the Blue Spirit.]
character_words: The Avatar has escaped! Close all the gates immediately!

full_text: Stay close to me!
character_words: Stay close to me!

full_text: Take this. Jump on my back!
character_words: Take this. Jump on my back!

full_text: Give me the next one!
character_words: Give me the next one!

full_text: Hold your fire! The Avatar must be captured alive!
character_words: Hold your fire! The Avatar must be captured alive!

full_text: [Through gritted teeth.] Open the gate.
character_words: Open the gate.

full_text: Admiral, what are you doing?
character_words: Admiral, what are you doing?

full_text: Let them out, now!
character_words: Let them out, now!

full_text: How could you let them go?
character_words: How could you let them go?

full_text: A situation like this requires ... precision.
character_words: A situation like this requires ... precision.

full_text: Do you have a clear shot?
character_words: Do you have a clear shot?

full_text: Knock out the thief. I'll deliver him to the Fire Lord along with the Avatar.
character_words: Knock out the thief. I'll deliver him to the Fire Lord along with the Avatar.

full_text: Quick! Recover the Avatar!
character_words: Quick! Recover the Avatar!

full_text: [To Zuko.] You know what the worst part of being born over a hundred years ago is? I miss all the friends I used to hang out with. Before the war started, I used to always visit my friend Kuzon. The two of us, we'd get in and out of so much trouble together. He was one of the best friends I ever had, and he was from the Fire Nation, just like you. If we knew each other back then, do you think we could have been friends, too?
character_words: You know what the worst part of being born over a hundred years ago is? I miss all the friends I used to hang out with. Before the war started, I used to always visit my friend Kuzon. The two of us, we'd get in and out of so much trouble together. He was one of the best friends I ever had, and he was from the Fire Nation, just like you. If we knew each other back then, do you think we could have been friends, too?

full_text: Where have you been, Prince Zuko? You missed music night! Lieutenant Jee sang a stirring love song.
character_words: Where have you been, Prince Zuko? You missed music night! Lieutenant Jee sang a stirring love song.

full_text: I'm going to bed. No disturbances.
character_words: I'm going to bed. No disturbances.

full_text: Suck on these. They'll make you feel better.
character_words: Suck on these. They'll make you feel better.

full_text: [With his mouth full; still spouting out nonsense.] Aang, how was your trip? Did you make any new friends?
character_words: Aang, how was your trip? Did you make any new friends?

full_text: No, I don't think I did.
character_words: No, I don't think I did.

full_text: Mmmm! This is tasty! Mmm!
character_words: Mmmm! This is tasty! Mmm!

full_text: [Excitedly.] Look!
character_words: Look!

full_text: He is taunting us! [Camera zooms out to the lake and the group's camp site.] You are so going to be dinner!
character_words: He is taunting us!  You are so going to be dinner!

full_text: [Observes the fishing pole.] Hey, where's the fishing line?
character_words: Hey, where's the fishing line?

full_text: [Sheepishly.] Oh, I didn't think you would need it, Sokka. [He holds up an intricately woven necklace decorated with a red flower.]
character_words: Oh, I didn't think you would need it, Sokka.

full_text: [Walks over and examines the necklace.] Aw, it's all tangled!
character_words: Aw, it's all tangled!

full_text: [Rises to his feet.] Not tangled. Woven! I made you a necklace, Katara. I thought since you lost your other one ...
character_words: Not tangled. Woven! I made you a necklace, Katara. I thought since you lost your other one ...

full_text: [Smiling and approaching him.] Thanks, Aang. [Takes the necklace.] I love it.
character_words: Thanks, Aang.  I love it.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Great, Aang. Maybe instead of saving the world, you can go into the jewelry-making business.
character_words: Great, Aang. Maybe instead of saving the world, you can go into the jewelry-making business.

full_text: I don't see why I can't do both.
character_words: I don't see why I can't do both.

full_text: Stop taunting me!
character_words: Stop taunting me!

full_text: [Off-camera.] So, how do I look?
character_words: So, how do I look?

full_text: [Nervously.] You mean, all of you or just your neck? [Puts his right hand behind his head in embarrassment.] I mean, because both look great!
character_words: You mean, all of you or just your neck?  I mean, because both look great!

full_text: [Emerges from the water, holding the se tu.] Smoochie, smoochie, someone's in love! [Makes kissing noises before the se tu breaks free from his grasp, slapping Sokka in the face with its tail and disappearing under the water.]
character_words: Smoochie, smoochie, someone's in love!

full_text: [Embarrassed.] I ... well, uh ...
character_words: I ... well, uh ...

full_text: [Annoyed.] Stop teasing him, Sokka. Aang's just a good friend. [Pats the side of his head.] A sweet, little guy! Just like Momo. [Pets Momo, who lands on Aang's shoulder.]
character_words: Stop teasing him, Sokka. Aang's just a good friend.  A sweet, little guy! Just like Momo.

full_text: [Dismayed.] Thanks.
character_words: Thanks.

full_text: [Urgently.] Someone's being attacked by a platypus bear!
character_words: Someone's being attacked by a platypus bear!

full_text: Well, hello there! [Dodges another swift swing of the bear's claws.] Nice day, isn't it?
character_words: Well, hello there!  Nice day, isn't it?

full_text: Make noise! He'll run off!
character_words: Make noise! He'll run off!

full_text: No, play dead! He'll lose interest!
character_words: No, play dead! He'll lose interest!

full_text: [Happily.] Whoa, close one! [Laughs bemusedly.]
character_words: Whoa, close one!

full_text: [Cups a hand to her mouth and makes gestures with her other hand.] Run downhill, then climb a tree!
character_words: Run downhill, then climb a tree!

full_text: No, punch him in the bill! [Swings a fist upward.]
character_words: No, punch him in the bill!

full_text: And then run in zig-zags!
character_words: And then run in zig-zags!

full_text: No need, it's going to be fine!
character_words: No need, it's going to be fine!

full_text: [Holding his hands out in front of him and assuming a fighting stance.] Whoa there!
character_words: Whoa there!

full_text: [Joyfully picks up the egg.] Mmm, lunch! [He sniffs it.] Lucky for you, we came along.
character_words: Mmm, lunch!  Lucky for you, we came along.

full_text: Thanks, but everything was already under control. Not to worry. Aunt Wu predicted I'd have a safe journey. [Folds hands together and bows slightly.]
character_words: Thanks, but everything was already under control. Not to worry. Aunt Wu predicted I'd have a safe journey.

full_text: Aunt who?
character_words: Aunt who?

full_text: No, Aunt Wu. She's the fortuneteller from my village. Awful nice knowing your future.
character_words: No, Aunt Wu. She's the fortuneteller from my village. Awful nice knowing your future.

full_text: [Looks off to the side as she ponders this.] Wow, it must be. [Faces the man with a bright expression on her face.] That explains why you were so calm!
character_words: Wow, it must be.  That explains why you were so calm!

full_text: But the fortuneteller was wrong! You didn't have a safe journey; you were almost killed!
character_words: But the fortuneteller was wrong! You didn't have a safe journey; you were almost killed!

full_text: [Cheerfully.] But I wasn't! All right, have a good one! [He bids them a farewell and begins to walk away only to turn back again.] Oh, and Aunt Wu said if I met any travelers to give them this.
character_words: But I wasn't! All right, have a good one!  Oh, and Aunt Wu said if I met any travelers to give them this.

full_text: [Excitedly.] Maybe we should go see Aunt Wu and learn our fortunes. It could be fun.
character_words: Maybe we should go see Aunt Wu and learn our fortunes. It could be fun.

full_text: Oh, come on. Fortune telling is nonsense!
character_words: Oh, come on. Fortune telling is nonsense!

full_text: What do you know? An umbrella!
character_words: What do you know? An umbrella!

full_text: That proves it! [She ducks under the umbrella.]
character_words: That proves it!

full_text: [Holding egg above his head to shield himself from the rain.] No, it doesn't! You can't really tell the future!
character_words: No, it doesn't! You can't really tell the future!

full_text: [Smugly.] I guess you're not really getting wet then.
character_words: I guess you're not really getting wet then.

full_text: [Crossly.] Of course she predicted it was going to rain. The sky's been gray all day!
character_words: Of course she predicted it was going to rain. The sky's been gray all day!

full_text: Just admit you might be wrong, and you can come under the umbrella.
character_words: Just admit you might be wrong, and you can come under the umbrella.

full_text: Look, I'm going to predict the future now. [Stops walking and hops from foot to foot in an exaggerated way.] It's going to keep drizzling. [The rain continues to fall.] See?
character_words: Look, I'm going to predict the future now.  It's going to keep drizzling.  See?

full_text: Not everyone has the gift, Sokka.
character_words: Not everyone has the gift, Sokka.

full_text: [Disgusted.] Agh!
character_words: Agh!

full_text: Aunt Wu is expecting you.
character_words: Aunt Wu is expecting you.

full_text: [Excitedly.] Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: My name is Meng and I'm Aunt Wu's assistant.
character_words: My name is Meng and I'm Aunt Wu's assistant.

full_text: [Pleased.] Well, hello there.
character_words: Well, hello there.

full_text: [Rubs nose in disinterest.] Hello.
character_words: Hello.

full_text: [Aang and Katara seat themselves on the pillows.] Can I get you some tea or some of Aunt Wu's special bean curd puffs?
character_words: Can I get you some tea or some of Aunt Wu's special bean curd puffs?

full_text: [Brightening.] I'll try a curd puff.
character_words: I'll try a curd puff.

full_text: [Holds up index finger in gesture.] Just a second. [To Aang.] So what's your name?
character_words: Just a second.  So what's your name?

full_text: [Flatly.] Aang.
character_words: Aang.

full_text: [Delighted.] That rhymes with Meng! And you've got some pretty big ears, don't you?
character_words: That rhymes with Meng! And you've got some pretty big ears, don't you?

full_text: [Awkwardly.] I guess.
character_words: I guess.

full_text: [Waves hand in dismissal and jokes.] Don't be modest! [Spreads arms outward in emphasis.] They're huge!
character_words: Don't be modest!  They're huge!

full_text: [Begins walking away.] Well, Aang, it was very nice to meet you. [Smiles slyly.] Very nice. [Turns and leaves.]
character_words: Well, Aang, it was very nice to meet you.  Very nice.

full_text: Likewise.
character_words: Likewise.

full_text: I can't believe we're here in the house of nonsense.
character_words: I can't believe we're here in the house of nonsense.

full_text: Try to keep an open mind, Sokka. There are things in this world that just can't be explained. Wouldn't it be nice to have some insight into your future?
character_words: Try to keep an open mind, Sokka. There are things in this world that just can't be explained. Wouldn't it be nice to have some insight into your future?

full_text: [Nonchalantly.] It would be nice to have some bean curd puffs.
character_words: It would be nice to have some bean curd puffs.

full_text: Oh, Meng! Aunt Wu says I'm going to meet my true love. He's going to give me a rare panda lily.
character_words: Oh, Meng! Aunt Wu says I'm going to meet my true love. He's going to give me a rare panda lily.

full_text: That's so romantic! [Dreamily, while casting Aang a flirtatious look.] I wonder if my true love will give me a rare flower.
character_words: That's so romantic!  I wonder if my true love will give me a rare flower.

full_text: [Breezily.] Good luck with that!
character_words: Good luck with that!

full_text: [Trying to contain her laughter.] Is that the big-eared guy who Aunt Wu predicted you'd marry?
character_words: Is that the big-eared guy who Aunt Wu predicted you'd marry?

full_text: [Nervously.] Enjoy your snack! [Leaves in a hurry.]
character_words: Enjoy your snack!

full_text: Welcome, young travelers. Now, who's next? Don't be shy.
character_words: Welcome, young travelers. Now, who's next? Don't be shy.

full_text: [Rising in anticipation.] I guess that's me.
character_words: I guess that's me.

full_text: [Delighted; with his mouth full.] Mm, not bad, not bad! [Holding out bowl to Aang.] Mhm?
character_words: Mm, not bad, not bad!  Mhm?

full_text: [Refusing the bowl.] I'm good on puffs. [Sokka shrugs and continues eating the puffs; trying to act casual.] So, what do you think they're talking about back there?
character_words: I'm good on puffs.  So, what do you think they're talking about back there?

full_text: [Causally, holding up puff.] Boring stuff I'm sure. Love, who she's going to marry, how many babies she's going to have.
character_words: Boring stuff I'm sure. Love, who she's going to marry, how many babies she's going to have.

full_text: [Trying to act cool.] Yeah, dumb stuff like that ... [Tenses a bit and bites his fingers nervously.] Well, I've got to find a bathroom.
character_words: Yeah, dumb stuff like that ...  Well, I've got to find a bathroom.

full_text: Your palms are so smooth. Do you use moisturizer?
character_words: Your palms are so smooth. Do you use moisturizer?

full_text: Actually, I have this special seaweed lotion. I can get you some if you want. [Aang sticks out his tongue; slight pause.] So, do you see anything interesting in my love line? [Aang immediately perks up upon hearing this.]
character_words: Actually, I have this special seaweed lotion. I can get you some if you want.  So, do you see anything interesting in my love line?

full_text: [Somewhat dramatically.] I feel a great romance for you. The man you are going to marry.
character_words: I feel a great romance for you. The man you are going to marry.

full_text: [Excitedly.] Tell me more!
character_words: Tell me more!

full_text: I can see that he's a very powerful bender.
character_words: I can see that he's a very powerful bender.

full_text: Looks like someone had a pretty good bathroom break.
character_words: Looks like someone had a pretty good bathroom break.

full_text: Yeah ... when I was in there ...
character_words: Yeah ... when I was in there ...

full_text: [Disgusted, looking away and holding up a hand to signal Aang to stop.] I don't even want to know!
character_words: I don't even want to know!

full_text: [Entering the room with Katara.] Who's next?
character_words: Who's next?

full_text: [Rising.] Okay, let's get this over with.
character_words: Okay, let's get this over with.

full_text: [Dryly.] Your future is full of struggle and anguish. Most of it, self-inflicted.
character_words: Your future is full of struggle and anguish. Most of it, self-inflicted.

full_text: [Holding up his hands in protest.] But you didn't read my palms or anything!
character_words: But you didn't read my palms or anything!

full_text: I don't need to. It's written all over your face. [Sokka resumes picking his teeth in disgust; to Aang.] You there, come with me.
character_words: I don't need to. It's written all over your face.  You there, come with me.

full_text: This is the most reliable method of telling your fortune. The bones never lie. [Urging Aang to pick a bone.] Go on, pick one. [Aang takes one bone and they sit down.] Now throw it on the fire. [Aang tosses the bone into the fire.] The heat makes cracks in the bone and I read the bone cracks to tell your destiny.
character_words: This is the most reliable method of telling your fortune. The bones never lie.  Go on, pick one.  Now throw it on the fire.  The heat makes cracks in the bone and I read the bone cracks to tell your destiny.

full_text: Wow, that's a big crack.
character_words: Wow, that's a big crack.

full_text: [Surprised.] I've never seen this before!
character_words: I've never seen this before!

full_text: [Her and Aang shielding their faces in surprise.] Oh my! [Cuts to shot of the bone lying in the fire and back to Aunt Wu who is fascinated.] Your destiny! This is incredible. You will be involved in a great battle, an awesome conflict between the forces of good and evil. A battle whose outcome will determine the fate of the whole world!
character_words: Oh my!  Your destiny! This is incredible. You will be involved in a great battle, an awesome conflict between the forces of good and evil. A battle whose outcome will determine the fate of the whole world!

full_text: [Casually.] Yeah, yeah, I knew that already. But did it say anything about a girl?
character_words: Yeah, yeah, I knew that already. But did it say anything about a girl?

full_text: [Surprised.] A girl? You want to know about love?
character_words: A girl? You want to know about love?

full_text: [Excited.] Yes!
character_words: Yes!

full_text: I'm sorry, but I didn't see anything.
character_words: I'm sorry, but I didn't see anything.

full_text: [Trying to cheer him up.] Well, look! [Holding her hand against her face in mock forgetfulness.] I must've missed something. [Cuts to a bone piece lying on the floor; Wu picks it up.] Right here. [Holds bone up to examine it.] It says "trust your heart and you will be with the one you love."
character_words: Well, look!  I must've missed something.  Right here.  It says "trust your heart and you will be with the one you love."

full_text: Really? [Rises to his feet joyfully.] Thank you, Aunt Wu!
character_words: Really?  Thank you, Aunt Wu!

full_text: Well, now you got to see for yourselves how fortune telling is just a big, stupid hoax.
character_words: Well, now you got to see for yourselves how fortune telling is just a big, stupid hoax.

full_text: You're just saying that because you're going to make yourself unhappy your whole life.
character_words: You're just saying that because you're going to make yourself unhappy your whole life.

full_text: [Voice rising in anger.] That woman is crazy! My life will calm and happy and joyful!
character_words: That woman is crazy! My life will calm and happy and joyful!

full_text: That doesn't prove anything!
character_words: That doesn't prove anything!

full_text: [Satisfied.] Well, I liked my predictions. [Clasps her hands together anxiously.] Certain things are going to turn out very well.
character_words: Well, I liked my predictions.  Certain things are going to turn out very well.

full_text: [Slyly, crossing his arms and leaning in toward her.] They sure are ...
character_words: They sure are ...

full_text: Why? What did she tell you?
character_words: Why? What did she tell you?

full_text: [Ambiguously.] Some stuff. You'll find out.
character_words: Some stuff. You'll find out.

full_text: [Looking at the sky.] What's with the sky?
character_words: What's with the sky?

full_text: [Also viewing the sky.] We are waiting for Aunt Wu to come and read the clouds to predict the fate of the whole village.
character_words: We are waiting for Aunt Wu to come and read the clouds to predict the fate of the whole village.

full_text: [Pointing upward.] That cloud kind of looks like a fluffy bunny.
character_words: That cloud kind of looks like a fluffy bunny.

full_text: [Slightly worried.] You better hope that's not a bunny! The fluffy bunny cloud forecasts doom and destruction.
character_words: You better hope that's not a bunny! The fluffy bunny cloud forecasts doom and destruction.

full_text: [Disgusted.] Do you even hear yourself?
character_words: Do you even hear yourself?

full_text: [Gesturing to the mountain in the background.] The cloud reading will tell us if Mt. Makapu will remain dormant for another year or if it will erupt.
character_words: The cloud reading will tell us if Mt. Makapu will remain dormant for another year or if it will erupt.

full_text: We used to have a tradition once a year of going up the mountain to check the volcano ourselves. [Smiles.] But every since Aunt Wu moved to the village twenty years ago, we have a tradition of not doing that.
character_words: We used to have a tradition once a year of going up the mountain to check the volcano ourselves.  But every since Aunt Wu moved to the village twenty years ago, we have a tradition of not doing that.

full_text: I can't believe you would trust your lives to that crazy, old woman's superstition!
character_words: I can't believe you would trust your lives to that crazy, old woman's superstition!

full_text: [Laying a hand on Sokka's shoulder.] Shhh! She's coming!
character_words: Shhh! She's coming!

full_text: [Trying to impress him.] Hey, Aang. [Pointing upward.] Don't you think that cloud looks like a flower?
character_words: Hey, Aang.  Don't you think that cloud looks like a flower?

full_text: [Awkwardly.] Huh? Sure, I guess. [He pushes Meng away as the camera pans to the right; to Katara.] Hey, Katara, don't you think that cloud look like a flower?
character_words: Huh? Sure, I guess.  Hey, Katara, don't you think that cloud look like a flower?

full_text: [Annoyed.] Shhh!
character_words: Shhh!

full_text: [Thoughtfully.] Bending arrow cloud ... good crops this year. Nice big harvest.
character_words: Bending arrow cloud ... good crops this year. Nice big harvest.

full_text: [Hugs elderly woman happily.] Darn good news!
character_words: Darn good news!

full_text: Wavy, moon-shaped cloud ... let's see. [Smiling.] Gonna be a great year for twins!
character_words: Wavy, moon-shaped cloud ... let's see.  Gonna be a great year for twins!

full_text: [High-five each other joyfully.] Yes!
character_words: Yes!

full_text: [Thoughtfully.] And a cumulus cloud with a twisted nob coming off the end of it ... [Spreads arms outward again.] The village will not be destroyed by the volcano this year!
character_words: And a cumulus cloud with a twisted nob coming off the end of it ...  The village will not be destroyed by the volcano this year!

full_text: [Slightly nervous.] Since I got you here, uh, there's something I want to tell you. I like you, but more than normal.
character_words: Since I got you here, uh, there's something I want to tell you. I like you, but more than normal.

full_text: [Crushed.] Never mind.
character_words: Never mind.

full_text: Hi, Aunt Wu! Sorry to bother you.
character_words: Hi, Aunt Wu! Sorry to bother you.

full_text: Any time.
character_words: Any time.

full_text: About this man I'm supposed to marry ... [Looks down awkwardly and blushes.] Is he going to be handsome? [Clasps her hands together hopefully.] Oh, I hope he's tall!
character_words: About this man I'm supposed to marry ...  Is he going to be handsome?  Oh, I hope he's tall!

full_text: Ah ... You want another reading?
character_words: Ah ... You want another reading?

full_text: Yes, please!
character_words: Yes, please!

full_text: I can't believe all these saps! [Cuts to side-view of Sokka walking forward, Aang following close behind.] Someone really needs to scream some sense into them.
character_words: I can't believe all these saps!  Someone really needs to scream some sense into them.

full_text: They seem happy, Sokka.
character_words: They seem happy, Sokka.

full_text: Not for long. I'm going to prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense. [Pulls over a man standing nearby.] Hey you, I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she? [Cuts to shot of the man's red shoes.]
character_words: Not for long. I'm going to prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense.  Hey you, I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she?

full_text: Yeah. She said I'd be wearing red shoes when I met my true love.
character_words: Yeah. She said I'd be wearing red shoes when I met my true love.

full_text: Uh huh ... And how many times have you worn those shoes since you got that fortune?
character_words: Uh huh ... And how many times have you worn those shoes since you got that fortune?

full_text: [Smiles sheepishly.] Everyday.
character_words: Everyday.

full_text: [Background becomes a spiral of swirling orange and yellow flames; angry.] Then of course it's gonna come true!
character_words: Then of course it's gonna come true!

full_text: [Delighted.] Really? You think so? [Begins walking away.] I'm so excited!
character_words: Really? You think so?  I'm so excited!

full_text: And then you will have your third great-grandchild before quietly passing away in your sleep. [Cuts to shot of Aunt Wu, who does not seem particularly happy.] Is that enough information for you?
character_words: And then you will have your third great-grandchild before quietly passing away in your sleep.  Is that enough information for you?

full_text: [Lifts her palm in wonder.] Wow, thanks, Aunt Wu. [She rises and prepares to leave, but suddenly turns back.] Oh wait, one more thing. How warmly should I dress tomorrow?
character_words: Wow, thanks, Aunt Wu.  Oh wait, one more thing. How warmly should I dress tomorrow?

full_text: You want me to do a reading for that?
character_words: You want me to do a reading for that?

full_text: [Crazed.] I don't care what Aunt Wu told you! You have to take a bath sometime!
character_words: I don't care what Aunt Wu told you! You have to take a bath sometime!

full_text: So, Sokka, you know some stuff about ladies, right?
character_words: So, Sokka, you know some stuff about ladies, right?

full_text: [Pleased.] Some stuff? [Places an arm around Aang's shoulders.] You've come to the right place. What can I do you for?
character_words: Some stuff?  You've come to the right place. What can I do you for?

full_text: Well, there's this girl.
character_words: Well, there's this girl.

full_text: [Thinking of Meng rather than Katara.] I think I know who you mean.
character_words: I think I know who you mean.

full_text: [Surprised.] You do? And you're okay with it?
character_words: You do? And you're okay with it?

full_text: Of course I am. And to tell you the truth, I've been picking up a subtle vibe that she likes you, too.
character_words: Of course I am. And to tell you the truth, I've been picking up a subtle vibe that she likes you, too.

full_text: [Growing anxious; Meng tries to catch Aang's attention in the background.] She does?
character_words: She does?

full_text: Oh yeah, she's crazy about you. All you have to do now is not mess it up.
character_words: Oh yeah, she's crazy about you. All you have to do now is not mess it up.

full_text: Well, how do I do that?
character_words: Well, how do I do that?

full_text: The number once mistake nice guys like you make: being too nice.
character_words: The number once mistake nice guys like you make: being too nice.

full_text: You can be too nice?
character_words: You can be too nice?

full_text: Yep. If you want to keep her interested, you have to act aloof, like you don't really care one way or the other.
character_words: Yep. If you want to keep her interested, you have to act aloof, like you don't really care one way or the other.

full_text: Well, okay ...
character_words: Well, okay ...

full_text: Hey, Aang, I was wondering ...
character_words: Hey, Aang, I was wondering ...

full_text: See you later ... [Walks away casually and waves hand breezily.]
character_words: See you later ...

full_text: [Impressed.] Wow, that kid is good.
character_words: Wow, that kid is good.

full_text: And you'll be fine as long as you've got a scarf. Bye-bye now.
character_words: And you'll be fine as long as you've got a scarf. Bye-bye now.

full_text: Okay, okay, but one more thing.
character_words: Okay, okay, but one more thing.

full_text: [Stares horrified at Katara before sighing and leaning forward slightly in surrender.] All right, what is it?
character_words: All right, what is it?

full_text: [Puts a hand to her chin thoughtfully.] Should I eat a mango or a papaya for breakfast tomorrow?
character_words: Should I eat a mango or a papaya for breakfast tomorrow?

full_text: [Angrily.] Papaya! [Slams the door shut.]
character_words: Papaya!

full_text: [Kicks the ground, sending up a small cloud of dust.] Aww, I hate papaya.
character_words: Aww, I hate papaya.

full_text: [Breezily.] Oh, hey, Katara. I didn't see you there.
character_words: Oh, hey, Katara. I didn't see you there.

full_text: [Half-heartedly.] Hey, Aang. [Walks away.]
character_words: Hey, Aang.

full_text: [Trying to catch her attention.] That's okay. I'm busy with my own stuff.
character_words: That's okay. I'm busy with my own stuff.

full_text: [Less than pleased.] Ugh, papaya please.
character_words: Ugh, papaya please.

full_text: [Aloof.] So ... papaya.
character_words: So ... papaya.

full_text: Uh huh. Would you like some?
character_words: Uh huh. Would you like some?

full_text: [Causally, picking an apple from the stand.] You know me. I don't really care what I eat.
character_words: You know me. I don't really care what I eat.

full_text: [Begins walking away.] Okay then. See you later.
character_words: Okay then. See you later.

full_text: [Slightly downcast.] Maybe aloof isn't my style.
character_words: Maybe aloof isn't my style.

full_text: [From afar; delighted.] Oh, a panda lily!
character_words: Oh, a panda lily!

full_text: [To Momo.] Did you see that?
character_words: Did you see that?

full_text: Excuse me. [Pointing to the flower.] Where can a guy find one of those things?
character_words: Excuse me.  Where can a guy find one of those things?

full_text: [Off-camera.] I can't believe you're dragging me all the way up here for a stupid flower.
character_words: I can't believe you're dragging me all the way up here for a stupid flower.

full_text: Not just any flower, a panda lily. I've seen it in action and boy, does it work.
character_words: Not just any flower, a panda lily. I've seen it in action and boy, does it work.

full_text: Flowers are fine once you're married, but at this early stage, it's critical that you maintain maximum aloofness.
character_words: Flowers are fine once you're married, but at this early stage, it's critical that you maintain maximum aloofness.

full_text: But my heart is telling me to get this flower, [Looks up toward the rim of the mountain.] and Aunt Wu said if I trusted in my heart, I will be with the one I love.
character_words: But my heart is telling me to get this flower,  and Aunt Wu said if I trusted in my heart, I will be with the one I love.

full_text: [Irritated.] What? Don't tell me you believe in that stuff, too.
character_words: What? Don't tell me you believe in that stuff, too.

full_text: [Cuts to shot of Aang perched on one boulder, Sokka appearing on-screen.] Well, Aunt Wu hasn't been wrong yet. Why should she be wrong about love? [Leaps upward and points in delight at the rim.] There! On the rim!
character_words: Well, Aunt Wu hasn't been wrong yet. Why should she be wrong about love?  There! On the rim!

full_text: [Shocked.] Oh no. [Cuts to overhead shot of the volcano.] Aunt Wu was wrong.
character_words: Oh no.  Aunt Wu was wrong.

full_text: Those people all think they're safe! We've got to warn them!
character_words: Those people all think they're safe! We've got to warn them!

full_text: There's no time to walk! [Whips out his glider.] Grab on! [He pulls Sokka forward, who shouts in surprise and the two take off.]
character_words: There's no time to walk!  Grab on!

full_text: [Shyly, raises hand slightly.] Hi, Katara.
character_words: Hi, Katara.

full_text: [Annoyed.] Can you believe she won't let me in? And after all the business I've given her?
character_words: Can you believe she won't let me in? And after all the business I've given her?

full_text: But she doesn't even charge.
character_words: But she doesn't even charge.

full_text: I know, but still ...
character_words: I know, but still ...

full_text: Well, we have other things to worry about. Aunt Wu was wrong about the volcano.
character_words: Well, we have other things to worry about. Aunt Wu was wrong about the volcano.

full_text: [Slightly irked, raises finger accusingly.] Sokka, you tried to convince me she was wrong before. It's going to take an awful lot to change my mind -
character_words: Sokka, you tried to convince me she was wrong before. It's going to take an awful lot to change my mind -

full_text: [Worriedly.] Oh no.
character_words: Oh no.

full_text: [Urgently.] Everyone, that volcano is gonna blow any second! Aunt Wu was wrong!
character_words: Everyone, that volcano is gonna blow any second! Aunt Wu was wrong!

full_text: [Not buying his claim.] Yeah, yeah, we know you don't believe in Aunt Wu, Mr. science and reason lover.
character_words: Yeah, yeah, we know you don't believe in Aunt Wu, Mr. science and reason lover.

full_text: [Stepping forward.] If you won't listen to him, maybe you'll listen to me. I want to believe Aunt Wu and her predictions as much as you do, but my brother and Aang saw the lava with their own eyes.
character_words: If you won't listen to him, maybe you'll listen to me. I want to believe Aunt Wu and her predictions as much as you do, but my brother and Aang saw the lava with their own eyes.

full_text: [Unmoved.] Well, I heard Aunt Wu's prediction with my own ears.
character_words: Well, I heard Aunt Wu's prediction with my own ears.

full_text: [Leaps onto the awning of a nearby building; urgently.] Please listen to us! You are all in danger! And we have to get out of here! You can't rely on Aunt Wu's prediction, [Cuts to shot of villagers who gaze up at him, seemingly listening.] you have to take fate into your own hands!
character_words: Please listen to us! You are all in danger! And we have to get out of here! You can't rely on Aunt Wu's prediction,  you have to take fate into your own hands!

full_text: Look! [Points to the volcano.] Can your fortune telling explain that?
character_words: Look!  Can your fortune telling explain that?

full_text: [Amused.] Can your science explain why it rains?
character_words: Can your science explain why it rains?

full_text: [Turns to him; yells angrily.] Yes! Yes, it can!
character_words: Yes! Yes, it can!

full_text: [Dismayed.] They just won't listen to reason. [Aang leaps down from the awning.]
character_words: They just won't listen to reason.

full_text: [Brightening.] But they will listen to Aunt Wu!
character_words: But they will listen to Aunt Wu!

full_text: I know that's the problem.
character_words: I know that's the problem.

full_text: Well, it's about to become the solution. We're taking fate in our own hands. First, I need to borrow Aunt Wu's cloud reading book.
character_words: Well, it's about to become the solution. We're taking fate in our own hands. First, I need to borrow Aunt Wu's cloud reading book.

full_text: [Whispering.] Shhh! We don't want anyone to hear us.
character_words: Shhh! We don't want anyone to hear us.

full_text: Oh, I didn't see you there.
character_words: Oh, I didn't see you there.

full_text: [Sadly.] You don't like me, do you? [Her ears droop down.]
character_words: You don't like me, do you?

full_text: Of course I like you.
character_words: Of course I like you.

full_text: [Downcast.] But not the way I like you.
character_words: But not the way I like you.

full_text: Oh, I guess not.
character_words: Oh, I guess not.

full_text: It's okay. It's just really hard when you like someone, but they don't think of you that way.
character_words: It's okay. It's just really hard when you like someone, but they don't think of you that way.

full_text: [Casting sad glance to the side.] I know what you mean.
character_words: I know what you mean.

full_text: [Off-camera.] She's beautiful, by the way.
character_words: She's beautiful, by the way.

full_text: [Blushes and looks at her, surprised.] Huh?
character_words: Huh?

full_text: [Cuts to shot of the two standing in the room.] That Water Tribe girl. I can see why you like her so much. [Clasps hands together, counts on her fingers.] She's sweet, she's a bender [Cuts to shot of Meng.] and her hair seems so manageable. [While saying this last part, she tries to smooth down her braids only for them to immediately stick up again.]
character_words: That Water Tribe girl. I can see why you like her so much.  She's sweet, she's a bender  and her hair seems so manageable.

full_text: Don't worry. You're going to meet a great guy who's going to completely fall for you. I know it. [Places a hand on her shoulder comfortingly; turns to leave.]
character_words: Don't worry. You're going to meet a great guy who's going to completely fall for you. I know it.

full_text: Thanks. [Holds up hand in alert.] Wait! Don't you want this? [Aang looks surprised; Meng hands him the cloud reading book, revealing she had had it in her possession the whole time.]
character_words: Thanks.  Wait! Don't you want this?

full_text: How did you know?
character_words: How did you know?

full_text: [Nervously playing with her fingers.] I've kind of been stalking you. [Smiles sheepishly.] Heh ...
character_words: I've kind of been stalking you.  Heh ...

full_text: [Blushing.] Oh, thanks ... I guess.
character_words: Oh, thanks ... I guess.

full_text: Clouds are made of water and air, so between the two of us, we ought to be able to bend them into any shape we want.
character_words: Clouds are made of water and air, so between the two of us, we ought to be able to bend them into any shape we want.

full_text: [Reading Aunt Wu's book.] I found it. The symbol for volcanic doom.
character_words: I found it. The symbol for volcanic doom.

full_text: Aunt Wu, look! Something is happening in the clouds.
character_words: Aunt Wu, look! Something is happening in the clouds.

full_text: [Quizzically.] That's very strange. It shouldn't ... [A shadow falls over her face as the sky darkens; suddenly terrified.] Oh my!
character_words: That's very strange. It shouldn't ...  Oh my!

full_text: We still can save the village if we act fast. [Gesturing toward Sokka, who stands on the pagoda.] Sokka has a plan.
character_words: We still can save the village if we act fast.  Sokka has a plan.

full_text: [Making motions with his arm.] Lava is gonna flow downhill to this spot. If we can dig a deep enough trench we can channel all the lava away from the village to the river.
character_words: Lava is gonna flow downhill to this spot. If we can dig a deep enough trench we can channel all the lava away from the village to the river.

full_text: If any of you are earthbenders, come with me.
character_words: If any of you are earthbenders, come with me.

full_text: [Raising hand.] I'm an earthbender!
character_words: I'm an earthbender!

full_text: [Raising hand.] I'm not!
character_words: I'm not!

full_text: Everybody else grab a shovel [As another explosion resonates over the village, everyone stumbles before regaining balance.] Come on! We've gotta hurry!
character_words: Everybody else grab a shovel  Come on! We've gotta hurry!

full_text: [Resuming work.] Dig faster! Dig faster!
character_words: Dig faster! Dig faster!

full_text: Everyone needs to evacuate! We'll come for you when it's safe!
character_words: Everyone needs to evacuate! We'll come for you when it's safe!

full_text: It's too much! It's gonna overflow!
character_words: It's too much! It's gonna overflow!

full_text: Man, sometimes I forget what a powerful bender that kid is. [Katara's expression changes at this, remembering Aunt Wu's words about her future marriage.]
character_words: Man, sometimes I forget what a powerful bender that kid is.

full_text: Wait, what did you just say?
character_words: Wait, what did you just say?

full_text: [Casually.] Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.
character_words: Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.

full_text: [Slowly widens her eyes in realization; as if having an epiphany.] I suppose he is.
character_words: I suppose he is.

full_text: [Sheepishly.] By the way, we kind of borrowed your book.
character_words: By the way, we kind of borrowed your book.

full_text: So you messed with the clouds, did you?
character_words: So you messed with the clouds, did you?

full_text: [Laughs in amusement.] Very clever!
character_words: Very clever!

full_text: No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortune telling.
character_words: No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortune telling.

full_text: [Cheerfully.] But Aunt Wu predicted the village wouldn't be destroyed and it wasn't. She was right, after all.
character_words: But Aunt Wu predicted the village wouldn't be destroyed and it wasn't. She was right, after all.

full_text: [Gets near the Calm man's face, through gritted teeth.] I hate you.
character_words: I hate you.

full_text: [Holding Sokka by the shoulders and leading him away.] It's okay, Sokka. Everything's going to be all right.
character_words: It's okay, Sokka. Everything's going to be all right.

full_text: Can I ask you something?
character_words: Can I ask you something?

full_text: Of course, honey.
character_words: Of course, honey.

full_text: [Disappointed.] You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.
character_words: You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.

full_text: I'll tell you a little secret, young airbender. [Gestures to the sky.] Just as you reshaped those clouds, [Cuts to shot of Aang, who smiles; off-camera.] you have the power to shape your own destiny.
character_words: I'll tell you a little secret, young airbender.  Just as you reshaped those clouds,  you have the power to shape your own destiny.

full_text: [Brightly.] Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you! [To Meng.] Take care, Meng.
character_words: Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you!  Take care, Meng.

full_text: [Waving.] Take care! [Appa turns away. Cuts to Meng's face, whose smile disappears and is replaced by a frown.] Floozy.
character_words: Take care!  Floozy.

full_text: Hey, look! [Examines the sword.] A sword made out of a whale's tooth.
character_words: Hey, look!  A sword made out of a whale's tooth.

full_text: Let me see that.
character_words: Let me see that.

full_text: This is a Water Tribe weapon. [Turns to Aang, his expression serious.] See if you can find anything else.
character_words: This is a Water Tribe weapon.  See if you can find anything else.

full_text: [Curiously.] Did someone lose something?
character_words: Did someone lose something?

full_text: [Rummaging through the bushes; somewhat cheerfully.] No, we found something!
character_words: No, we found something!

full_text: It's burned. [Cut to shot of a tree trunk, scorch marks and sharp cuts running across its bark. Cut to shot of Sokka and the others.] There was a battle! Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders. [He turns away from the tree and looking down the slope of the hill seeing a black spot on the ground.] The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.
character_words: It's burned.  There was a battle! Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders.  The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.

full_text: [Intrigued.] So, then what happened?
character_words: So, then what happened?

full_text: [Disappointed.] I don't know. The trail ends here.
character_words: I don't know. The trail ends here.

full_text: [Pointing at something in the distance.] Wait, look! [Cut to shot of a Water Tribe ship, half obscured behind large rocks, sitting idly on the shore.]
character_words: Wait, look!

full_text: [Happily.] It's one of our boats!
character_words: It's one of our boats!

full_text: Is this dad's boat? [She and Sokka run toward it. Cut to shot of entire ship as they approach.]
character_words: Is this dad's boat?

full_text: No, but it's from his fleet. [Strokes the boat off, while Aang appears behind them.] Dad was here. [Turns to Katara.]
character_words: No, but it's from his fleet.  Dad was here.

full_text: [Exhaling.] Aahh! [Cuts to shot of entire room where he and Zuko are seated at a low-lying table.] See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being. [Pours Zuko a cup of tea.]
character_words: Aahh!  See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being.

full_text: Look out! Argh!
character_words: Look out! Argh!

full_text: [Holding a rolled up whip.] Get back! We're after a stowaway! [Cut to overhead shot of the ship's deck.]
character_words: Get back! We're after a stowaway!

full_text: [Arrives with Iroh.] There are no stowaways on my ship.
character_words: There are no stowaways on my ship.

full_text: [Shocked.] He's paralyzed.
character_words: He's paralyzed.

full_text: Only temporarily. [Lifts the man and slings him over her shoulder.] The toxins will wear off in about an hour. But by then, he'll be in jail and I'll have my money. [Walks to Nyla.]
character_words: Only temporarily.  The toxins will wear off in about an hour. But by then, he'll be in jail and I'll have my money.

full_text: But how did you find him on my ship?
character_words: But how did you find him on my ship?

full_text: [Prepares to mount Nyla, the stowaway already slung onto his back.] My shirshu can smell a rat a continent away. [Mounts her shirshu.]
character_words: My shirshu can smell a rat a continent away.

full_text: Well, I'm impressed. [June cracks her whip. Cuts to shot of the shirshu bolting off the ship and racing down the dock.] Very impressed. [Leaning over the ledge of the ship with Zuko, stroking his beard thoughtfully; Zuko look at him, disgusted.]
character_words: Well, I'm impressed.  Very impressed.

full_text: Sokka.
character_words: Sokka.

full_text: I'm coming with you.
character_words: I'm coming with you.

full_text: You're not old enough to go to war, Sokka, you know that.
character_words: You're not old enough to go to war, Sokka, you know that.

full_text: [Desperately.] I'm strong, I'm brave, I can fight! Please, Dad!
character_words: I'm strong, I'm brave, I can fight! Please, Dad!

full_text: [Lays a hand on his son's shoulder; grimly and sadly.] Being a man is knowing where you're needed the most. And for you right now, that's here, protecting your sister.
character_words: Being a man is knowing where you're needed the most. And for you right now, that's here, protecting your sister.

full_text: I don't understand. [His eyes glisten.]
character_words: I don't understand.

full_text: Someday you will. [Sokka throws aside his bag and throws himself into his father's arms. Cut to close-up of him as he sobs and buries his face in his father's parka.] I'm gonna miss you so much.
character_words: Someday you will.  I'm gonna miss you so much.

full_text: [Alert.] Who's there? [Stands up, boomerang in hand.]
character_words: Who's there?

full_text: Sokka?
character_words: Sokka?

full_text: [Quizzically, raising an eyebrow.] Bato? [Spirited.]
character_words: Bato?

full_text: [Having awoken, along with Katara.] Who the what now?
character_words: Who the what now?

full_text: [Cheerfully.] Bato!
character_words: Bato!

full_text: [Cuts to side-shot of Bato, Sokka running over to him, followed closely by Katara.] Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two. [Hugs Katara and Sokka.] You've grown so much! [Aang follows them, but remains standing a few feet away.]
character_words: Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two.  You've grown so much!

full_text: [Bows in greeting.] Hi, I'm Aang.
character_words: Hi, I'm Aang.

full_text: Where's Dad?
character_words: Where's Dad?

full_text: Is he here?
character_words: Is he here?

full_text: No, he and the other warriors should be in the Eastern Earth Kingdom by now. [Both siblings look crestfallen at this news. A gust of wind blows, causing them to shiver. Cut to a shot of Bato who shivers as well.] This is no place for a reunion. Let's get inside.
character_words: No, he and the other warriors should be in the Eastern Earth Kingdom by now.  This is no place for a reunion. Let's get inside.

full_text: After I was wounded, your father carried me to this abbey. The sisters have cared for me ever since. Superior, [A woman turns around.] these are Hakoda's children. They've been traveling with the Avatar. I found them by my boat.
character_words: After I was wounded, your father carried me to this abbey. The sisters have cared for me ever since. Superior,  these are Hakoda's children. They've been traveling with the Avatar. I found them by my boat.

full_text: Young Avatar, it gives me great joy to be in your presence. Welcome to our abbey.
character_words: Young Avatar, it gives me great joy to be in your presence. Welcome to our abbey.

full_text: Thank you, it's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything- [Sokka abruptly cuts him off.]
character_words: Thank you, it's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything-

full_text: What smells so good, Bato?
character_words: What smells so good, Bato?

full_text: [Sniffs.] The sisters craft ointments and perfumes.
character_words: The sisters craft ointments and perfumes.

full_text: Perfume? [Pointing his thumbs at Appa.] Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much. [Waves his hand in front of his face.] Am I right? [Everyone is silent, a single person coughs.]
character_words: Perfume?  Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much.  Am I right?

full_text: You have your father's wit.
character_words: You have your father's wit.

full_text: Bato, it looks like home! [Bato, Katara, Sokka, and Aang file inside.]
character_words: Bato, it looks like home!

full_text: Everything's here, even the pelts!
character_words: Everything's here, even the pelts!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, nothing's cozier than dead animal skins.
character_words: Yeah, nothing's cozier than dead animal skins.

full_text: [Surprised and delighted.] No way! Stewed sea prunes!
character_words: No way! Stewed sea prunes!

full_text: Help yourself!
character_words: Help yourself!

full_text: Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things!
character_words: Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things!

full_text: Bato, is it true that you and dad lassoed an arctic hippo?
character_words: Bato, is it true that you and dad lassoed an arctic hippo?

full_text: It was your father's idea, he just dragged me along. Well, the hippo did the dragging! [Momo, sitting by Aang, starts to eat the stewed sea prunes that Aang set aside, but ends up spitting it out.]
character_words: It was your father's idea, he just dragged me along. Well, the hippo did the dragging!

full_text: [Sokka and Katara are slurping their stewed sea prunes as Aang speaks.] Hey, I ride animals, too! There was this one time when I rode a giant eel and I-
character_words: Hey, I ride animals, too! There was this one time when I rode a giant eel and I-

full_text: [Cutting Aang off.] So, who was it that came up with the Great Blubber Fiasco?
character_words: So, who was it that came up with the Great Blubber Fiasco?

full_text: [Chuckles to himself.] You knew about that?
character_words: You knew about that?

full_text: Everyone does!
character_words: Everyone does!

full_text: [Curiously.] What's that story?
character_words: What's that story?

full_text: [Waving Aang off.] It's a long one Aang, some other time.
character_words: It's a long one Aang, some other time.

full_text: [To Bato.] You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures.
character_words: You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures.

full_text: Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight. [Chuckling.] Hey, Aang! Please put that down, [Aang is shown wearing a fur pelt on his head.] it's ceremonial and very fragile. [Aang puts the pelt back on the wall, and sits in the back of the room.]
character_words: Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight.  Hey, Aang! Please put that down,  it's ceremonial and very fragile.

full_text: Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?
character_words: Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?

full_text: Your dad wore the octopus, [Lowers his voice.] but I did the spooky voice.
character_words: Your dad wore the octopus,  but I did the spooky voice.

full_text: [Annoyed.] Out of my way! [Pushing a man out of the way.] Step aside, filth!
character_words: Out of my way!  Step aside, filth!

full_text: [Apologetically.] He means no offense! I'm certain you bathe regularly!
character_words: He means no offense! I'm certain you bathe regularly!

full_text: I need to talk to you!
character_words: I need to talk to you!

full_text: Well, if it isn't my new friends: Angry Boy and Uncle Lazy.
character_words: Well, if it isn't my new friends: Angry Boy and Uncle Lazy.

full_text: Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back!
character_words: Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back!

full_text: [As she collects her winnings.] Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money. [To the crowd.] Drinks on me! [The crowd cheers.]
character_words: Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money.  Drinks on me!

full_text: Money isn't what I had in mind.
character_words: Money isn't what I had in mind.

full_text: I need you to find someone. [Cut to Katara's necklace.]
character_words: I need you to find someone.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] What happened, your girlfriend run off on you?
character_words: What happened, your girlfriend run off on you?

full_text: It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with.
character_words: It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with.

full_text: [Unamused.] Whatever you say.
character_words: Whatever you say.

full_text: If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for.
character_words: If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for.

full_text: [Scoffs.] Heh, forget it. [She starts to climb her saddle.]
character_words: Heh, forget it.

full_text: Plus, we'll pay your weight in gold.
character_words: Plus, we'll pay your weight in gold.

full_text: [Stops and widens her eyes in surprise. She smiles. Cut to a side-shot of June walking over to Iroh.] Make it your [Pokes his stomach.] weight, and we gotta deal.
character_words: Make it your  weight, and we gotta deal.

full_text: [Laughs with his hand on his stomach.] You got it!
character_words: You got it!

full_text: [As she turns back to Nyla.] Get on!
character_words: Get on!

full_text: There's something I should tell you kids. I'm expecting a message from your father. [Aang is shown with his eyes closed, excluded from the group.]
character_words: There's something I should tell you kids. I'm expecting a message from your father.

full_text: [Excited.] Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: [Slightly demanding.] When?
character_words: When?

full_text: Any day now. Your father said he'd send a message when they found the rendezvous point. If you wait until the message arrives, you can come with me, and see your father again.
character_words: Any day now. Your father said he'd send a message when they found the rendezvous point. If you wait until the message arrives, you can come with me, and see your father again.

full_text: It's been over two years since we've seen Dad. That would be so incredible! Katara!
character_words: It's been over two years since we've seen Dad. That would be so incredible! Katara!

full_text: I do really miss him, it would be great to see Dad. [Aang gets up to leave, but no one notices him.]
character_words: I do really miss him, it would be great to see Dad.

full_text: It's been far too long, hasn't it? [As Aang leaves.] I'm not sure when word will arrive, but when it does-
character_words: It's been far too long, hasn't it?  I'm not sure when word will arrive, but when it does-

full_text: It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.
character_words: It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.

full_text: Even if we do have time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour.
character_words: Even if we do have time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour.

full_text: I'm sure your father would understand, and be proud that his children are helping the Avatar.
character_words: I'm sure your father would understand, and be proud that his children are helping the Avatar.

full_text: I can't believe they would leave me.
character_words: I can't believe they would leave me.

full_text: I'm looking for Bato of the Water Tribe.
character_words: I'm looking for Bato of the Water Tribe.

full_text: Uhhh, I know Bato!
character_words: Uhhh, I know Bato!

full_text: Make sure he gets this! [Hands Aang the scroll and rides away.]
character_words: Make sure he gets this!

full_text: It's the map to Sokka and Katara's dad!
character_words: It's the map to Sokka and Katara's dad!

full_text: Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.
character_words: Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.

full_text: [Turns to face him.] Hey, Aang, I didn't notice you left.
character_words: Hey, Aang, I didn't notice you left.

full_text: Yup, but now I'm back. [Sitting down.] Sure could go for some delicious sea prunes!
character_words: Yup, but now I'm back.  Sure could go for some delicious sea prunes!

full_text: Out for a bit of fresh air, are we?
character_words: Out for a bit of fresh air, are we?

full_text: We're looking for someone.
character_words: We're looking for someone.

full_text: I hope it's not Miyuki [To Miyuki.] Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation, again? [Miyuki meows.]
character_words: I hope it's not Miyuki  Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation, again?

full_text: The Avatar's been through here. Let's keep moving.
character_words: The Avatar's been through here. Let's keep moving.

full_text: Aha! I caught you. [Picks up the crumpled paper as Aang looks at her nervously.] You should be ashamed of yourself ... Littering in the courtyard.
character_words: Aha! I caught you.  You should be ashamed of yourself ... Littering in the courtyard.

full_text: [Takes back the crumpled paper.] I'm sorry, I'll take care of this. [Bows. As Mother Superior walks away, Aang stuffs the map back up his sleeve.]
character_words: I'm sorry, I'll take care of this.

full_text: This ship is sentimental to me. It was built by my father.
character_words: This ship is sentimental to me. It was built by my father.

full_text: [To Bato.] Is this the boat he took you ice dodging in?
character_words: Is this the boat he took you ice dodging in?

full_text: Yep! It's got the scar to prove it. Ha. How 'bout you Sokka? You must have some good stories from your first time ice dodging. [Sokka begins to look saddened.]
character_words: Yep! It's got the scar to prove it. Ha. How 'bout you Sokka? You must have some good stories from your first time ice dodging.

full_text: He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough.
character_words: He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough.

full_text: Oh, I forgot you were too young.
character_words: Oh, I forgot you were too young.

full_text: What's ice dodging?
character_words: What's ice dodging?

full_text: It's a rite of passage for young Water Tribe members. When you turn fourteen, your dad takes you- [Bato smile and puts his hand on Sokka's shoulder with a new thought.] You know what, you're about to find out!
character_words: It's a rite of passage for young Water Tribe members. When you turn fourteen, your dad takes you-  You know what, you're about to find out!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Why are we stopping?
character_words: Why are we stopping?

full_text: Because the girl must have spent a lot of time here.
character_words: Because the girl must have spent a lot of time here.

full_text: We have no time for this!
character_words: We have no time for this!

full_text: Hey! Watch it!
character_words: Hey! Watch it!

full_text: [As Iroh laughs from behind her.] Oh look, he likes you!
character_words: Oh look, he likes you!

full_text: Care to hear your fortune, handsome?
character_words: Care to hear your fortune, handsome?

full_text: At my age, there's really only one big surprise left, and I'd just as soon leave it a mystery.
character_words: At my age, there's really only one big surprise left, and I'd just as soon leave it a mystery.

full_text: Ice dodging is a ceremonial test of wisdom, bravery, and trust. [Shot changes to on the boat.] In our village, ice dodging was done by weaving a boat through a field of icebergs.
character_words: Ice dodging is a ceremonial test of wisdom, bravery, and trust.  In our village, ice dodging was done by weaving a boat through a field of icebergs.

full_text: How are we supposed to ice dodge without ice?
character_words: How are we supposed to ice dodge without ice?

full_text: You'll be dodging those. [Points to a group of tall, sharp, jagged rocks near the shore. Katara and Sokka appear nervous.] Sokka, you steer and call the shots, lead wisely. Katara, you secure the main sail. [Katara grabs a rope.] The winds can be brutal, so be brave. Aang, you control the jib. Without your steady hand, we all go down. Your position is about trust.
