full_text: Sorry Momo, I'll feed you later.
character_words: Sorry Momo, I'll feed you later.

full_text: Plague! Plague!
character_words: Plague! Plague!

full_text: What is going on down there?
character_words: What is going on down there?

full_text: I saw some kids yesterday who were sick with pentapox. It must have spread!
character_words: I saw some kids yesterday who were sick with pentapox. It must have spread!

full_text: Pentapox! [He pulls his beard.] Hmm, I'm pretty sure I've heard of that.
character_words: Pentapox!  Hmm, I'm pretty sure I've heard of that.

full_text: Oh, this is terrible.
character_words: Oh, this is terrible.

full_text: What should we do?
character_words: What should we do?

full_text: Drive them out of the city [He points toward the gates.] ... but don't touch them! We have to rid the city of this disease!
character_words: Drive them out of the city  ... but don't touch them! We have to rid the city of this disease!

full_text: Fire flakes, Dad?
character_words: Fire flakes, Dad?

full_text: [Gasping.] How awful!
character_words: How awful!

full_text: Flopsie!
character_words: Flopsie!

full_text: Come on, Flopsie. [He climbs on top of Flopsie.] You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip! [Flopsie does not move a muscle.] Oh ... I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go!
character_words: Come on, Flopsie.  You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip!  Oh ... I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go!

full_text: We're deeply honored to have the Fire Lord's daughter at our humble circus.
character_words: We're deeply honored to have the Fire Lord's daughter at our humble circus.

full_text: Uh ... tell us if there is anything we can do to make the show more enjoyable.
character_words: Uh ... tell us if there is anything we can do to make the show more enjoyable.

full_text: I will.
character_words: I will.

full_text: Incredible. Do you think she'll fall?
character_words: Incredible. Do you think she'll fall?

full_text: Of course not.
character_words: Of course not.

full_text: Then wouldn't it make it more interesting if you removed the net?
character_words: Then wouldn't it make it more interesting if you removed the net?

full_text: [Concerned.] Uh ... the thing is ... the performers ...
character_words: Uh ... the thing is ... the performers ...

full_text: You're right, you're right. That's been done. [After a short pause, she continues with a tone of dark pleasure.] I know. Set the net on fire.
character_words: You're right, you're right. That's been done.  I know. Set the net on fire.

full_text: [Worried.] Of course, Princess.
character_words: Of course, Princess.

full_text: [Ecstatic.] Brilliant, just brilliant! [She looks down at Shuzumu and asks happily.] Ooh, what kind of dangerous animals do you have?
character_words: Brilliant, just brilliant!  Ooh, what kind of dangerous animals do you have?

full_text: Well, our circus boasts the most exotic assortment-
character_words: Well, our circus boasts the most exotic assortment-

full_text: Release them all!
character_words: Release them all!

full_text: [Sadly.] We looked everywhere. No Bumi.
character_words: We looked everywhere. No Bumi.

full_text: We've got a problem. We just did a head count.
character_words: We've got a problem. We just did a head count.

full_text: [Worried, turns back to Yung.] Oh no. Did someone get left behind?
character_words: Oh no. Did someone get left behind?

full_text: No, we have an extra.
character_words: No, we have an extra.

full_text: So, the resistance has kidnapped my son. Everything so clever, so tricky. Just like their King Bumi.
character_words: So, the resistance has kidnapped my son. Everything so clever, so tricky. Just like their King Bumi.

full_text: What do you want to do, sir?
character_words: What do you want to do, sir?

full_text: What an exquisite performance. I can't wait to see how you'll top yourself tomorrow.
character_words: What an exquisite performance. I can't wait to see how you'll top yourself tomorrow.

full_text: [Smiling at Azula's reflection in the mirror.] I'm sorry Azula, but unfortunately there won't be a show tomorrow.
character_words: I'm sorry Azula, but unfortunately there won't be a show tomorrow.

full_text: Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: [Hangs up her tiara.] The universe has given me strong hints that it's time for a career change. [She gets up and turns around to face Azula.] I want to join you on your mission.
character_words: The universe has given me strong hints that it's time for a career change.  I want to join you on your mission.

full_text: No! Bad Fire Nation baby!
character_words: No! Bad Fire Nation baby!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Oh ... all right.
character_words: Oh ... all right.

full_text: [Baby voice.] Oooh, you're so cute. [She kisses him on the cheek, while an annoyed Sokka looks the other side, resting his head on his hand.] Mmmmm ...
character_words: Oooh, you're so cute.  Mmmmm ...

full_text: Sure he's cute now, but when he's older, he'll join the Fire Nation army. [Switch to Katara who is happily playing with the baby under the annoyed gaze of her brother.] You won't think he's so cute then. He'll be a killer.
character_words: Sure he's cute now, but when he's older, he'll join the Fire Nation army.  You won't think he's so cute then. He'll be a killer.

full_text: Does that look like the face of a killer to you?
character_words: Does that look like the face of a killer to you?

full_text: A messenger hawk!
character_words: A messenger hawk!

full_text: It's from the Fire Nation governor. He thinks we kidnapped his son. [Switch to another view. Aang is shown standing at the other side of the campfire, reading the message.] So ... he wants to make a trade. His son [Zoom to Aang's surprised face while he continues dramatically, his eyes widening.] for King Bumi.
character_words: It's from the Fire Nation governor. He thinks we kidnapped his son.  So ... he wants to make a trade. His son  for King Bumi.

full_text: You realize we're probably walking right into a trap.
character_words: You realize we're probably walking right into a trap.

full_text: I don't think so. I'm sure the governor wants his son back as much as we want Bumi. [Smiling at the sleeping baby he holds against his chest.] It's a new day. I have a good feeling about this.
character_words: I don't think so. I'm sure the governor wants his son back as much as we want Bumi.  It's a new day. I have a good feeling about this.

full_text: Please tell me you're here to kill me.
character_words: Please tell me you're here to kill me.

full_text: [Placing her hands on Mai's shoulders.] It's great to see you, Mai.
character_words: It's great to see you, Mai.

full_text: I thought you ran off and joined the circus. You said it was your calling.
character_words: I thought you ran off and joined the circus. You said it was your calling.

full_text: [Releases Mai.] Well, Azula called a little louder.
character_words: Well, Azula called a little louder.

full_text: I have a mission and I need you both. [Azula places a hand on both her friends' shoulders.]
character_words: I have a mission and I need you both.

full_text: Count me in. Anything to get me out of this place. [She looks annoyed at the palace.]
character_words: Count me in. Anything to get me out of this place.

full_text: I apologize. [Switch to a closer shot of the governor who squatting down on a pillow.] You've come to Omashu at a difficult time. At noon we're making a trade with the resistance to get Tom-Tom back.
character_words: I apologize.  You've come to Omashu at a difficult time. At noon we're making a trade with the resistance to get Tom-Tom back.

full_text: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really, [She crosses her legs and clasps her hands.] what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave? [She stands up, addressing the governor in a harsher tone.] My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things! [She emphasizes her words with a hand gesture.]
character_words: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really,  what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave?  My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things!

full_text: Forgive me, Princess.
character_words: Forgive me, Princess.

full_text: You stay here. [Mai and Ty Lee get up behind her.] Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up. [Cut to a shot of the still smoking city of Omashu, followed by some shots of Fire Nation construction sites.] And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the city of New Ozai.
character_words: You stay here.  Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up.  And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the city of New Ozai.

full_text: [Chuckling.] Hi, everybody!
character_words: Hi, everybody!

full_text: You brought my brother?
character_words: You brought my brother?

full_text: He's here. We're ready to trade.
character_words: He's here. We're ready to trade.

full_text: [To Mai.] I'm sorry, but a thought just occurred to me. Do you mind?
character_words: I'm sorry, but a thought just occurred to me. Do you mind?

full_text: [Turning to Azula.] Of course not, Princess Azula.
character_words: Of course not, Princess Azula.

full_text: We're trading a two year old for a king. [Looks up at Bumi.] A powerful, earthbending king?
character_words: We're trading a two year old for a king.  A powerful, earthbending king?

full_text: [Nods.] Mmm hmmm!
character_words: Mmm hmmm!

full_text: It just doesn't seem like a fair trade, does it?
character_words: It just doesn't seem like a fair trade, does it?

full_text: You're right. [Azula smiles slyly while Mai walks forward.] The deal's off.
character_words: You're right.  The deal's off.

full_text: [Clearly amused by all this.] Whhhoa! See you all later!
character_words: Whhhoa! See you all later!

full_text: Bumi!
character_words: Bumi!

full_text: [Surprised.] The Avatar!
character_words: The Avatar!

full_text: My lucky day.
character_words: My lucky day.

full_text: [Surprised.] Aang, is that you? Where did you come from?
character_words: Aang, is that you? Where did you come from?

full_text: Hang on! We're gonna get you out of here.
character_words: Hang on! We're gonna get you out of here.

full_text: We've got to get the baby out of here!
character_words: We've got to get the baby out of here!

full_text: [Blows on the bison whistle before looking at his sister with a big smile.] Way ahead of ya! [Tom-Tom reaches for the whistle and starts to play with it.]
character_words: Way ahead of ya!

full_text: Aang, stop your blowing for a minute.
character_words: Aang, stop your blowing for a minute.

full_text: Now hold on just a [The swing of Aang's staff breaks the frozen chain and they freefall down.] duahhh!!!
character_words: Now hold on just a  duahhh!!!

full_text: It's just like old times, isn't it, Bumi?
character_words: It's just like old times, isn't it, Bumi?

full_text: [Looking serious.] Aang, I need to talk to you!
character_words: Aang, I need to talk to you!

full_text: It's good to see you too!
character_words: It's good to see you too!

full_text: [Taunting.] How are you gonna fight without your bending?
character_words: How are you gonna fight without your bending?

full_text: [Catching the boomerang.] I seem to manage!
character_words: I seem to manage!

full_text: There's Aang!
character_words: There's Aang!

full_text: [Gazing in the direction Katara pointed.] We can catch him!
character_words: We can catch him!

full_text: Hang on, Bumi! Our ride's here!
character_words: Hang on, Bumi! Our ride's here!

full_text: [Shocked.] You could earthbend? All along?
character_words: You could earthbend? All along?

full_text: Well, they didn't cover my face.
character_words: Well, they didn't cover my face.

full_text: [Slightly annoyed and angry.] I don't understand. Why didn't you free yourself? Why did you surrender when Omashu was invaded? What's the matter with you, Bumi?
character_words: I don't understand. Why didn't you free yourself? Why did you surrender when Omashu was invaded? What's the matter with you, Bumi?

full_text: [Calmly.] Listen to me, Aang. There are options in fighting, called jing. It's a choice of how you direct your energy.
character_words: Listen to me, Aang. There are options in fighting, called jing. It's a choice of how you direct your energy.

full_text: [Cut to a close-up of an annoyed Aang, counting along on his fingers as he sums up the different jings.] I know! There's positive jing when you're attacking, and negative jing when you're retreating.
character_words: I know! There's positive jing when you're attacking, and negative jing when you're retreating.

full_text: [Happily smiling.] ... and neutral jing when you do nothing!
character_words: ... and neutral jing when you do nothing!

full_text: [He looks shocked at his three raised fingers.] There arethree jings?
character_words: There arethree jings?

full_text: Well, technically there are eighty-five, but let's just focus on the third. Neutral jing is the key to earthbending. It involves listening and waiting for the right moment to strike.
character_words: Well, technically there are eighty-five, but let's just focus on the third. Neutral jing is the key to earthbending. It involves listening and waiting for the right moment to strike.

full_text: [Starting to understand.] That's why you surrendered, isn't it?
character_words: That's why you surrendered, isn't it?

full_text: Yes, and it's why I can't leave now.
character_words: Yes, and it's why I can't leave now.

full_text: [Disappointed.] I guess I need to find someone else to teach me earthbending.
character_words: I guess I need to find someone else to teach me earthbending.

full_text: Your teacher will be someone who has mastered neutral jing. You need to find someone who waits and listens before striking.
character_words: Your teacher will be someone who has mastered neutral jing. You need to find someone who waits and listens before striking.

full_text: [Happily.] Hey, Momo!
character_words: Hey, Momo!

full_text: Momo's mastered a few jings himself!
character_words: Momo's mastered a few jings himself!

full_text: Goodbye, Aang. I'll see you when the time is right.
character_words: Goodbye, Aang. I'll see you when the time is right.

full_text: So, we're tracking down your brother and Uncle, huh?
character_words: So, we're tracking down your brother and Uncle, huh?

full_text: [Turning to Mai.] It'll be interesting seeing Zuko again, [Teasing.] won't it, Mai?
character_words: It'll be interesting seeing Zuko again,  won't it, Mai?

full_text: It's not just Zuko and Iroh anymore. [Cut closer to Azula who continues on a serious tone.] We have a third target now.
character_words: It's not just Zuko and Iroh anymore.  We have a third target now.

full_text: Tom-Tom!
character_words: Tom-Tom!

full_text: [Somewhat enthusiastically.] Spare coins for weary travelers?
character_words: Spare coins for weary travelers?

full_text: [Angrily, with his arms folded.] This is humiliating! We're royalty! These people should be giving us whatever we want.
character_words: This is humiliating! We're royalty! These people should be giving us whatever we want.

full_text: They will if you ask nicely. [A peasant woman strolls past; somewhat dramatically.] Spare change for a hungry old man?
character_words: They will if you ask nicely.  Spare change for a hungry old man?

full_text: [Withdrawing a coin from her sleeve.] Aw, here you go.
character_words: Aw, here you go.

full_text: The coin is appreciated, but not as much as your smile!
character_words: The coin is appreciated, but not as much as your smile!

full_text: [Smiling.] How about some entertainment in exchange for ... a gold piece? [He pulls the piece from his pocket with a flourish.]
character_words: How about some entertainment in exchange for ... a gold piece?

full_text: [Annoyed.] We're not performers.
character_words: We're not performers.

full_text: [Standing up.] Not professional anyway. [He puts the hat down and stands up, swaying lightly as he begins to sing.] It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se, but the girls in the city, they look so pretty!
character_words: Not professional anyway.  It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se, but the girls in the city, they look so pretty!

full_text: [Annoyed with the quality of the entertainment.] Come on, we're talking a gold piece here! Let's see some action! [Zuko glances up sharply as the man withdraws his swords.] Dance!
character_words: Come on, we're talking a gold piece here! Let's see some action!  Dance!

full_text: [Singing.] They kiss so sweet that you really got to meet the girls from Ba Sing Se!
character_words: They kiss so sweet that you really got to meet the girls from Ba Sing Se!

full_text: [Stops slicing and laughs.] Ha, ha! Nothing like a fat man dancing for his dinner! Here ya go! [Tosses the gold coin onto the ground and walks away.]
character_words: Ha, ha! Nothing like a fat man dancing for his dinner! Here ya go!

full_text: [Dramatically; close to tears.] Such a kind man.
character_words: Such a kind man.

full_text: [To Aang.] Hey, you taking us down for a reason? [Aang continues to stare at the swamp.] Aang, [Aang snaps out of the trance.] why are we going down?
character_words: Hey, you taking us down for a reason?  Aang,  why are we going down?

full_text: [Confused.] What? I didn't even notice.
character_words: What? I didn't even notice.

full_text: Are you noticing now?
character_words: Are you noticing now?

full_text: [Moving to the front of the saddle.] Is something wrong?
character_words: Is something wrong?

full_text: [He still seems somewhat dazed by the swamp.] I know this is going to sound weird, but I think the swamp is calling to me.
character_words: I know this is going to sound weird, but I think the swamp is calling to me.

full_text: [Holding his stomach.] Is it telling you where we can get something to eat?
character_words: Is it telling you where we can get something to eat?

full_text: No, I ... I think it wants us to land there.
character_words: No, I ... I think it wants us to land there.

full_text: [Shrugging.] No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on.
character_words: No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on.

full_text: I don't know. Bumi said to learn earthbending I would have to wait and listen, and now I'm actually hearing the earth. Do you want me to ignore it?
character_words: I don't know. Bumi said to learn earthbending I would have to wait and listen, and now I'm actually hearing the earth. Do you want me to ignore it?

full_text: Yes.
character_words: Yes.

full_text: I don't know. There's something ominous about that place.
character_words: I don't know. There's something ominous about that place.

full_text: See, even Appa and Momo don't like it here.
character_words: See, even Appa and Momo don't like it here.

full_text: [Resignedly.] Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this, [Looks at swamp.] bye swamp. [Shakes Appa's rope.] Yip, Yip!
character_words: Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this,  bye swamp.  Yip, Yip!

full_text: [Panicked.] You better throw in an extra "yip"! We gotta move!
character_words: You better throw in an extra "yip"! We gotta move!

full_text: [Looking around the swamp and at his friends.] Where's Appa and Momo? [Aang jumps up to the top of the trees, looking for his animal friends as he uses the height to search for them.] Appa! Momo!
character_words: Where's Appa and Momo?  Appa! Momo!

full_text: [Pointing blandly.] Sokka, you've got an elbow leech.
character_words: Sokka, you've got an elbow leech.

full_text: [He spins around, panicking, trying to find it.] Where? Where?
character_words: Where? Where?

full_text: [Crosses her arms; sarcastically.] Where do you think?
character_words: Where do you think?

full_text: [Ripping off the elbow leech and throwing it behind to Katara. He cries out angrily.] Why do things keep attaching to me?!
character_words: Why do things keep attaching to me?!

full_text: You couldn't find them?
character_words: You couldn't find them?

full_text: [Jumping down into the muddy water.] No, and the tornado ... it just disappeared.
character_words: No, and the tornado ... it just disappeared.

full_text: [Cutting the vines with his machete.] We better speed things up.
character_words: We better speed things up.

full_text: [To Sokka.] Maybe we should be a little nicer to the swamp.
character_words: Maybe we should be a little nicer to the swamp.

full_text: [Continuing to cut the vines.] Aang, these are just plants. Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?
character_words: Aang, these are just plants. Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?

full_text: Maybe you should listen to Aang. Something about this place feels ... alive.
character_words: Maybe you should listen to Aang. Something about this place feels ... alive.

full_text: I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.
character_words: I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.

full_text: [Yelling.] Appa! Momo!
character_words: Appa! Momo!

full_text: There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night.
character_words: There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night.

full_text: What was that?
character_words: What was that?

full_text: Nothing, just swamp gas. [Indicating.] Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.
character_words: Nothing, just swamp gas.  Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.

full_text: [Sweating, his voice cracking.] I think we should build a fire.
character_words: I think we should build a fire.

full_text: Sokka, the longer we're here, the more I think you shouldn't be doing do that.
character_words: Sokka, the longer we're here, the more I think you shouldn't be doing do that.

full_text: No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine. [Grabs a nearby root.] Right, swamp? [Shakes the root and fakes a reply.] "No problem, Sokka!"
character_words: No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine.  Right, swamp?  "No problem, Sokka!"

full_text: Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched?
character_words: Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched?

full_text: Please, we're all alone out here.
character_words: Please, we're all alone out here.

full_text: Except for them.
character_words: Except for them.

full_text: [His calm demeanor vanishing.] Right, except for them.
character_words: Right, except for them.

full_text: Guys?
character_words: Guys?

full_text: What'd you reckon make a track like that, Tho?
character_words: What'd you reckon make a track like that, Tho?

full_text: Don't know, Due. [Points his stick at the footprint.] Some'in with six legs. Pretty big'uns too.
character_words: Don't know, Due.  Some'in with six legs. Pretty big'uns too.

full_text: Leaves a nice, wide trail to folla'.
character_words: Leaves a nice, wide trail to folla'.

full_text: You know what's at the end of that trail?
character_words: You know what's at the end of that trail?

full_text: [Grinning.] Dinner.
character_words: Dinner.

full_text: [Calling out.] Aang! Sokka!
character_words: Aang! Sokka!

full_text: Hello? Hello? Can you help me? [She squints.] Mom? [More loudly and running toward the figure.] Mom!
character_words: Hello? Hello? Can you help me?  Mom?  Mom!

full_text: I can't believe ...
character_words: I can't believe ...

full_text: Aang! [While slashing at the vines.] Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara! [He becomes caught, and grunts with exertion before slicing himself free.] You think you're so tough, huh?
character_words: Aang!  Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara!  You think you're so tough, huh?

full_text: Hello? Yue? [He takes a hold of his head, before removing his hands and shrugging, turning away from the apparition.] This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ... I ... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy. [Almost fearfully, he turns around and walks closer.]
character_words: Hello? Yue?  This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ... I ... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy.

full_text: [Accusingly.] You didn't protect me.
character_words: You didn't protect me.

full_text: Katara! Appa!
character_words: Katara! Appa!

full_text: Hello? Who are you?
character_words: Hello? Who are you?

full_text: Hey, come back! [He holds his hand out as though to grab her.]
character_words: Hey, come back!

full_text: Look at that Tho. Is that a little hairy fella ridin' that thing?
character_words: Look at that Tho. Is that a little hairy fella ridin' that thing?

full_text: No, that's what they call a "lemoo". Saw one at a traveling show once. Real smart they say.
character_words: No, that's what they call a "lemoo". Saw one at a traveling show once. Real smart they say.

full_text: Bet he tastes a lot like possum chicken.
character_words: Bet he tastes a lot like possum chicken.

full_text: You think everything tastes like possum chicken.
character_words: You think everything tastes like possum chicken.

full_text: C'mon now, fellas. [He moves to the front of the boat.] Just a little closer. Nice and easy. Nothing to worry about. We just fixin' to eat ya.
character_words: C'mon now, fellas.  Just a little closer. Nice and easy. Nothing to worry about. We just fixin' to eat ya.

full_text: [Annoyed.] What'd you say that fer?
character_words: What'd you say that fer?

full_text: [Shrugging as he tries to appease his friend.] Well, we are!
character_words: Well, we are!

full_text: But you don't have to tell 'em that.
character_words: But you don't have to tell 'em that.

full_text: [He shrugs again.] Well how'd I know they'd understand me?
character_words: Well how'd I know they'd understand me?

full_text: Come on!
character_words: Come on!

full_text: Who are you?
character_words: Who are you?

full_text: [He stands up and puts his machete away.] What do you guys think you're doing!? I've been looking all over for you!
character_words: What do you guys think you're doing!? I've been looking all over for you!

full_text: [She has not moved, although her hand is on her head as she sits on the root they have fallen onto.] Well, I've been wandering around looking for you!
character_words: Well, I've been wandering around looking for you!

full_text: [He looks away before airbending himself to his feet. He appears embarrassed that he was not actively searching for his friends like they were him.] I was chasing some girl.
character_words: I was chasing some girl.

full_text: What girl?
character_words: What girl?

full_text: [He walks over to Katara and helps her up before rubbing his ear.] I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress.
character_words: I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress.

full_text: [Sarcastically, with exaggerated hand movements.] Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!
character_words: Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!

full_text: I thought I saw Mom.
character_words: I thought I saw Mom.

full_text: Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here.
character_words: Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here.

full_text: [Surprised.] You saw something too?
character_words: You saw something too?

full_text: [He looks away for a moment, before turning back and taking a step closer to his sister.] I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.
character_words: I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.

full_text: What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here.
character_words: What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here.

full_text: Okay ... so where's here? The middle of the swamp?
character_words: Okay ... so where's here? The middle of the swamp?

full_text: Yeah, the center ... it's the heart of the swamp. It's been calling us here. I knew it.
character_words: Yeah, the center ... it's the heart of the swamp. It's been calling us here. I knew it.

full_text: It's just a tree. [He raises his arms above his head.] It can't call anyone. For the last time, there's nothing after us and there's nothing magical happening here.
character_words: It's just a tree.  It can't call anyone. For the last time, there's nothing after us and there's nothing magical happening here.

full_text: Now, what would a lemoo need a shirt fer?
character_words: Now, what would a lemoo need a shirt fer?

full_text: There's someone in there! He's bending the vines!
character_words: There's someone in there! He's bending the vines!

full_text: [Demanding offensively.] Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us!?
character_words: Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us!?

full_text: Wait! [The vines drop to reveal a slightly larger man wearing nothing but a leaf loincloth.] I didn't call you here.
character_words: Wait!  I didn't call you here.

full_text: [He shares a look of confusion with Sokka, who is also in an offensive stance.] We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land.
character_words: We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land.

full_text: He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us a lot.
character_words: He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us a lot.

full_text: The Avatar? Come with me.
character_words: The Avatar? Come with me.

full_text: So, who are you then?
character_words: So, who are you then?

full_text: [Bending a vine out of the way.] I protect the swamp from folks that want to hurt it, like this fella with his big knife.
character_words: I protect the swamp from folks that want to hurt it, like this fella with his big knife.

full_text: See, completely reasonable. [He finally puts his machete away.] Not a monster, just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it.
character_words: See, completely reasonable.  Not a monster, just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it.

full_text: Oh the swamp is a mystical place all right. It's sacred. I reached enlightenment right here under the banyan-grove tree. [He sits on the tree, looking at the group as he explains.] I heard it calling me, just like you did.
character_words: Oh the swamp is a mystical place all right. It's sacred. I reached enlightenment right here under the banyan-grove tree.  I heard it calling me, just like you did.

full_text: [Humoring Huu.] Sure you did. It seems real chatty.
character_words: Sure you did. It seems real chatty.

full_text: [The camera zooms out as he explains, slowly revealing more and more of the swamp. It shows how large the banyan-grove tree is compared to the others, but at the final magnification, it is impossible to distinguish it from the other trees.] See this whole swamp is actually just one tree spread out over miles. Branches spread and sink, take root, and spread some more. One big, living organism. Just like the entire world.
character_words: See this whole swamp is actually just one tree spread out over miles. Branches spread and sink, take root, and spread some more. One big, living organism. Just like the entire world.

full_text: [Cuts back to Aang, looking at Huu. He is still openly skeptical.] I get how the tree is one big thing, but the whole world?
character_words: I get how the tree is one big thing, but the whole world?

full_text: Sure. You think you're any different from me or your friends or this tree? If you listen hard enough, you can hear every living thing breathing together. [Another shot shows the swamp river. There are the sounds of several animals heard in the background.] You can feel everything growing. We're all living together, even if most folks don't act like it. We all have the same roots and we are all branches of the same tree.
character_words: Sure. You think you're any different from me or your friends or this tree? If you listen hard enough, you can hear every living thing breathing together.  You can feel everything growing. We're all living together, even if most folks don't act like it. We all have the same roots and we are all branches of the same tree.

full_text: [She and her friends are now sitting, listening to Huu.] But what did our visions mean?
character_words: But what did our visions mean?

full_text: In the swamp, we see visions of people we've lost, people we loved, folks we think are gone. [The shot cuts to show the people that Sokka and Katara saw in the swamp, before cutting back to Huu.] But the swamp tells us they're not. We're still connected to them. Time is an illusion and so is death.
character_words: In the swamp, we see visions of people we've lost, people we loved, folks we think are gone.  But the swamp tells us they're not. We're still connected to them. Time is an illusion and so is death.

full_text: But what about my vision? It was someone I had never met.
character_words: But what about my vision? It was someone I had never met.

full_text: You're the Avatar. You tell me.
character_words: You're the Avatar. You tell me.

full_text: [He looks down as he tries to understand.] Time is an illusion. So, it's someone I will meet.
character_words: Time is an illusion. So, it's someone I will meet.

full_text: Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to find Appa and Momo.
character_words: Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to find Appa and Momo.

full_text: I think I know how to find them. [Aang kneels down and places his hand on the tree.] Everything is connected. [Energy travels from Aang's hand to Appa's location. Appa is seen being captured by the Foggy Swamp members. Back at the banyan-grove tree, Aang stands up.] Come on! We've got to hurry!
character_words: I think I know how to find them.  Everything is connected.  Come on! We've got to hurry!

full_text: [Singing and tapping the side of his canoe. Momo is seen struggling inside the sack he has been placed in.] Set my lines by the river bed! Caught ten fish and I killed 'em dead! Cut 'em and gut 'em and I tossed the heads in the water to keep them catgators fed.
character_words: Set my lines by the river bed! Caught ten fish and I killed 'em dead! Cut 'em and gut 'em and I tossed the heads in the water to keep them catgators fed.

full_text: Appa!
character_words: Appa!

full_text: We're under attack!
character_words: We're under attack!

full_text: Hey, you guys are waterbenders!
character_words: Hey, you guys are waterbenders!

full_text: You too! That means we're kin! [Due ceases waterbending, followed by a slightly disgusted Katara. He watches as Sokka and Huu run up to the branch Katara and Aang are standing on.] Hey Huu! How you been?
character_words: You too! That means we're kin!  Hey Huu! How you been?

full_text: You know, scared some folks, swung some vines, the usual.
character_words: You know, scared some folks, swung some vines, the usual.

full_text: Huu?
character_words: Huu?

full_text: How you like that possum chicken?
character_words: How you like that possum chicken?

full_text: Tastes just like arctic hen. So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa? [He indicates the catgator lying behind Tho.] You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.
character_words: Tastes just like arctic hen. So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa?  You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.

full_text: You want me to eat old Slim? He's like a member of the family!
character_words: You want me to eat old Slim? He's like a member of the family!

full_text: Nice Slim!
character_words: Nice Slim!

full_text: [Laughing.] Oh, he don't eat no bugs! That's people food.
character_words: Oh, he don't eat no bugs! That's people food.

full_text: Where'd you say you was from?
character_words: Where'd you say you was from?

full_text: [Smiling. Sokka is shown chewing nonchalantly next to her.] The South Pole.
character_words: The South Pole.

full_text: Didn't know there was waterbenders anywhere but here. They got a nice swamp there, do they?
character_words: Didn't know there was waterbenders anywhere but here. They got a nice swamp there, do they?

full_text: No, it's all ice and snow.
character_words: No, it's all ice and snow.

full_text: Hmm. No wonder you left.
character_words: Hmm. No wonder you left.

full_text: [To Katara.] Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here. [He raises his arms for emphasis.] Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.
character_words: Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here.  Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.

full_text: What about the visions?
character_words: What about the visions?

full_text: I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug!
character_words: I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug!

full_text: [Feeding Momo.] But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?
character_words: But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?

full_text: That's Avatar stuff, that doesn't count. [To Huu.] The only thing I can't figure out is how you made that tornado that sucked us down.
character_words: That's Avatar stuff, that doesn't count.  The only thing I can't figure out is how you made that tornado that sucked us down.

full_text: I can't do anything like that. I just bend the water in the plants.
character_words: I can't do anything like that. I just bend the water in the plants.

full_text: Well, no accounting for weather. Still, there's absolutely nothing mysterious about the swamp.
character_words: Well, no accounting for weather. Still, there's absolutely nothing mysterious about the swamp.

full_text: Who's there?
character_words: Who's there?

full_text: [Angrily.] What are you doing in my mouth? [Momo chitters happily while lying upside down on Sokka's belly, chewing on the fly he "rescued" from the spider's web.] Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries.
character_words: What are you doing in my mouth?  Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries.

full_text: [Shouting from up above as he looks over the campsite.] Give up! You're completely surrounded!
character_words: Give up! You're completely surrounded!

full_text: [Crawling toward Appa.] Come on! Come on! Come on!
character_words: Come on! Come on! Come on!

full_text: My scrolls!
character_words: My scrolls!

full_text: [Shocked.] My staff!
character_words: My staff!

full_text: Yip yip!
character_words: Yip yip!

full_text: [Stretching out his arm over the saddle as if he wants to grab it.] Wait, my boomerang!
character_words: Wait, my boomerang!

full_text: [Grabbing Sokka's arm.] There's no time!
character_words: There's no time!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Oh, I see, [Turning to Katara.] so there's time to get your scrolls [Turning toward Aang.] and time to get your staff, [Looking back at Katara with his hand on his chest.] but no time for my boomerang?
character_words: Oh, I see,  so there's time to get your scrolls  and time to get your staff,  but no time for my boomerang?

full_text: [Cheerfully.] That's correct!
character_words: That's correct!

full_text: [Bowing his head in defeat by this totally honest answer.] Oh.
character_words: Oh.

full_text: [To a sulking Sokka.] Sorry about your boomerang, Sokka.
character_words: Sorry about your boomerang, Sokka.

full_text: [Sadly.] I feel like I've lost part of my identity. [He jumps up and moves Aang's hat slightly so that he can point at Aang's arrow.] Imagine if you lost your arrow, or Katara lost her ... [Makes a hair loopies gesture with a somewhat bored look.] hair loopies.
character_words: I feel like I've lost part of my identity.  Imagine if you lost your arrow, or Katara lost her ...  hair loopies.

full_text: Here's your produce, ponytail guy.
character_words: Here's your produce, ponytail guy.

full_text: [He picks up the basket full of supplies, looking dejected at the nickname.] I used to be boomerang guy ...
character_words: I used to be boomerang guy ...

full_text: [Surprised, after inspecting the money.] Hey, Water Tribe money!
character_words: Hey, Water Tribe money!

full_text: I hope that's okay.
character_words: I hope that's okay.

full_text: [Clutching the coin.] So long as it's money. [The merchant closes his shop, while Katara walks over to Aang, who is trying to console a crying Sokka as the camera pans up to show just the merchant's head.] Have a nice Avatar Day!
character_words: So long as it's money.  Have a nice Avatar Day!

full_text: [Interested.] Avatar Day?
character_words: Avatar Day?

full_text: [Turning around while waving.] You guys are going to the festival, right?
character_words: You guys are going to the festival, right?

full_text: There's a holiday for the Avatar. Who knew?
character_words: There's a holiday for the Avatar. Who knew?

full_text: [Pointing at the float.] Look! They made a giant Kyoshi float!
character_words: Look! They made a giant Kyoshi float!

full_text: And here comes Avatar Roku! [Roku effigy rolls by.]
character_words: And here comes Avatar Roku!

full_text: Having a huge festival in your honor is great, but frankly, it's just nice to be appreciated.
character_words: Having a huge festival in your honor is great, but frankly, it's just nice to be appreciated.

full_text: And it's nice to appreciate their deep-fried festival food! [He takes a huge bite out of the food-item he is holding.]
character_words: And it's nice to appreciate their deep-fried festival food!

full_text: [Pointing at a giant float of Aang coming down the street.] Aang, look!
character_words: Aang, look!

full_text: That's the biggest me I've ever seen!
character_words: That's the biggest me I've ever seen!

full_text: Now a torch, that's a nice prop. It's bright, dangerous ... [Sniffs.] smells manly. But I'm not sure I could carry it off.
character_words: Now a torch, that's a nice prop. It's bright, dangerous ...  smells manly. But I'm not sure I could carry it off.

full_text: [Surprised.] Hey, what's that guy doing?
character_words: Hey, what's that guy doing?

full_text: [Chanting as Kyoshi's effigy is consumed by the flames.] Down with the Avatar!
character_words: Down with the Avatar!

full_text: [Wondering.] Where did you get these?
character_words: Where did you get these?

full_text: [Angrily, while walking away.] What does it matter where they came from?
character_words: What does it matter where they came from?

full_text: [Seriously.] Mmmm ... [Takes a bite out of one of the cupcakes Zuko brought. The jam drips of his chin. In delight.] ... mmmm!
character_words: Mmmm ...  ... mmmm!

full_text: [Angrily pointing an accusing finger at Katara.] That party pooper's ruining Avatar Day!
character_words: That party pooper's ruining Avatar Day!

full_text: [Angered.] That party pooper's my friend! [He takes off his hat and throws it away to reveal his arrow.]
character_words: That party pooper's my friend!

full_text: [Pointing in shock at Aang.] It's the Avatar himself!
character_words: It's the Avatar himself!

full_text: [Scared.] It's going to kill us with its awesome Avatar powers!
character_words: It's going to kill us with its awesome Avatar powers!

full_text: No, I'm not, I ...
character_words: No, I'm not, I ...

full_text: [Crawling back on his feet.] I suggest you leave! [He waves them away with a gesture of his hand.] You're not welcome here, Avatar!
character_words: I suggest you leave!  You're not welcome here, Avatar!

full_text: Why not? Aang helps people.
character_words: Why not? Aang helps people.

full_text: [Landing beside Katara.] It's true! I'm on your side.
character_words: It's true! I'm on your side.

full_text: [Calmly.] I find that hard to swallow, [Raising his voice.] considering what you did to us in your past life! It was Avatar Kyoshi; she murdered our glorious leader, Chin the Great.
character_words: I find that hard to swallow,  considering what you did to us in your past life! It was Avatar Kyoshi; she murdered our glorious leader, Chin the Great.

full_text: [Utterly shocked.] You think that I ... murdered someone?
character_words: You think that I ... murdered someone?

full_text: [Lisping and slurring.] We used to be a great society before you killed our leader. [Pointing at himself as the camera zooms in on him.] Now look at us!
character_words: We used to be a great society before you killed our leader.  Now look at us!

full_text: [Frightened by the appearances of the old man.] Huh!
character_words: Huh!

full_text: [Katara places her arms on Aang's shoulders and starts to defend him.] Aang would never do something like that. No Avatar would. [Shaking her head in disapproval before pointing an accusing finger at the villagers.] And it's not fair for you all to question his honor!
character_words: Aang would never do something like that. No Avatar would.  And it's not fair for you all to question his honor!

full_text: [Raising his arm to emphasize his remark.] Let's tell her what we all think of the Avatar's "honor"!
character_words: Let's tell her what we all think of the Avatar's "honor"!

full_text: Give me a chance to clear my name!
character_words: Give me a chance to clear my name!

full_text: The only way to prove your innocence is to stand trial.
character_words: The only way to prove your innocence is to stand trial.

full_text: [Confidently.] I'll gladly stand trial!
character_words: I'll gladly stand trial!

full_text: You'll have to follow all our rules. That includes paying bail.
character_words: You'll have to follow all our rules. That includes paying bail.

full_text: No problem.
character_words: No problem.

full_text: [Apologetically.] How was I supposed to know they wouldn't take Water Tribe money?
character_words: How was I supposed to know they wouldn't take Water Tribe money?

full_text: So some people don't like you, big deal! There's a whole nation of firebenders who hate you. Now let's bust you out of here!
character_words: So some people don't like you, big deal! There's a whole nation of firebenders who hate you. Now let's bust you out of here!

full_text: I can't.
character_words: I can't.

full_text: [Upbeat.] Sure you can! A little [Theatrically jumps back and pretends to airbend by blowing air. Katara looks ashamed for her brother. He moves to the back of the room to "cut" the air.] swish-swish-swish! [He makes a grotesque movement with his arm before thrusting his face in the camera.] Airbending slice! [He resumes his place beside Katara, who is still looking annoyed by her brother. He makes a circular motion with his hands and points toward the door.] And we're on our way!
character_words: Sure you can! A little  swish-swish-swish!  Airbending slice!  And we're on our way!

full_text: [Slightly mocking.] I think what "Master Swish" is trying to say [Serious tone as she looks at Aang.] is that you're supposed to be out saving the world. You can't do that locked up in here.
character_words: I think what "Master Swish" is trying to say  is that you're supposed to be out saving the world. You can't do that locked up in here.

full_text: [Unhappy.] I can't do that with people thinking I'm a murderer either. I need you guys to help prove my innocence.
character_words: I can't do that with people thinking I'm a murderer either. I need you guys to help prove my innocence.

full_text: How're we gonna to do that? The crime happened over three hundred years ago.
character_words: How're we gonna to do that? The crime happened over three hundred years ago.

full_text: [Cunningly.] That's okay, Sokka. For some reason, I thought you were an expert detective.
character_words: That's okay, Sokka. For some reason, I thought you were an expert detective.

full_text: [Content.] Well, I guess I could be classified as such.
character_words: Well, I guess I could be classified as such.

full_text: [Aiding Aang by playing Sokka's ego.] Yeah! Back home, he was famous for solving the mystery of the missing seal jerky.
character_words: Yeah! Back home, he was famous for solving the mystery of the missing seal jerky.

full_text: [Bragging.] Everyone wanted to blame it on the polar leopard, but I figured out it was Old Man Jarko wearing polar leopard boots! [Katara holds her hand to her brow, annoyed by Sokka's monologue.] See, a real eight hundred-pound polar leopard would have left much deeper tracks. [Aang is making fun of Sokka, Katara holds her hand to her mouth to refrain herself from bursting out in laughs.] Okay, I guess I am pretty good.
character_words: Everyone wanted to blame it on the polar leopard, but I figured out it was Old Man Jarko wearing polar leopard boots!  See, a real eight hundred-pound polar leopard would have left much deeper tracks.  Okay, I guess I am pretty good.

full_text: So, you'll help me with my case?
character_words: So, you'll help me with my case?

full_text: [Pretends to ponder about the question. Katara stares at him, trying to figure out what he is doing.] Fine! But I'm going to need some new props. [The camera spins around. When it stops again, Sokka is wearing a hat with a monocle.] I'm ready. [Katara looks surprised at his new outfit and giggles. Sokka extends his monocle to investigate her.] What?
character_words: Fine! But I'm going to need some new props.  I'm ready.  What?

full_text: This is the crime scene. [Cut to Sokka, who inquisitively looks around. He gazes directly into the camera lens through his magnifying glass, making his left eye appear huge. He moves on to investigate the walls of the shrine, while the mayor is standing at the edge of the cliff, pointing down at something.] This is the footprint of the killer, Kyoshi. [Sokka quickly squats beside the footprint to take a closer look at it.] It was at sunset, 370 years ago today, that she emerged from the temple, and struck down Chin the Great. After that tragic day, we built this statue to immortalize our great leader. [They all look up at a statue of Chin the Great, who has a raised left hand in triumph.] Feel free to appreciate it.
character_words: This is the crime scene.  This is the footprint of the killer, Kyoshi.  It was at sunset, 370 years ago today, that she emerged from the temple, and struck down Chin the Great. After that tragic day, we built this statue to immortalize our great leader.  Feel free to appreciate it.

full_text: This temple and this statue were cut from the same stone. [Runs back over to the statue.] And we know that the statue was built after Chin died.
character_words: This temple and this statue were cut from the same stone.  And we know that the statue was built after Chin died.

full_text: [Excitedly drawing her conclusions.] So if they were built at the same time, that means
character_words: So if they were built at the same time, that means

full_text: [Shouting.] Shhh! I wanna solve it! [Pointing at the temple.] That means Kyoshi never set foot in this temple!
character_words: Shhh! I wanna solve it!  That means Kyoshi never set foot in this temple!

full_text: That's a big hole in the mayor's story, [Disappointed.] but it's not enough to prove Aang's innocence.
character_words: That's a big hole in the mayor's story,  but it's not enough to prove Aang's innocence.

full_text: You're right. [Blows soap bubbles with his dragon shaped pipe, while thinking about their next course of action.] We need to go to Kyoshi Island.
character_words: You're right.  We need to go to Kyoshi Island.

full_text: [Surprised.] Where did you get that?
character_words: Where did you get that?

full_text: You got a bald head. [Aang looks up in wonder to see who is talking. Switch to Aang's angle of view. A man is standing in the shadows, only his outline is visible.] Some nice tattoos. [The man emerges from the shadows. He has a strong build, earrings in both ears, and his body has a large snake tattoo that covers the top of his chest and down his right arm. He suddenly charges Aang, letting out a load growl. He is stopped in his tracks by the chains around his neck. Aang slides down the wall in fear, while the man addresses him calmly.] You're going to fit in real well around here.
character_words: You got a bald head.  Some nice tattoos.  You're going to fit in real well around here.

full_text: [Angrily stamping her foot on the ground.] Where's Aangy?
character_words: Where's Aangy?

full_text: [Gently breaks the news to Koko.] He couldn't be here, Koko.
character_words: He couldn't be here, Koko.

full_text: [Nagging.] I wanted to see Aangy ...
character_words: I wanted to see Aangy ...

full_text: Oyaji! Aang is in jail. The town of Chin says he murdered their leader in a past life.
character_words: Oyaji! Aang is in jail. The town of Chin says he murdered their leader in a past life.

full_text: They say it was Kyoshi.
character_words: They say it was Kyoshi.

full_text: [Shocked.] Kyoshi? That's crazy talk! I'll take you to her shrine. Maybe something there will help you clear her name.
character_words: Kyoshi? That's crazy talk! I'll take you to her shrine. Maybe something there will help you clear her name.

full_text: [With feigned casualness.] So, uh ... what's Suki up to? Is she around?
character_words: So, uh ... what's Suki up to? Is she around?

full_text: Actually, she and the other warriors left to fight in the war. You kids had a big impact on Suki. She said you inspired her and she wanted to help change the world.
character_words: Actually, she and the other warriors left to fight in the war. You kids had a big impact on Suki. She said you inspired her and she wanted to help change the world.

full_text: [He disappointedly slants his eyes.] Oh, well ... that's great.
character_words: Oh, well ... that's great.

full_text: This temple was converted into a shrine to Kyoshi. The clerics tell us these relics are still connected to her spirit. That's her kimono.
character_words: This temple was converted into a shrine to Kyoshi. The clerics tell us these relics are still connected to her spirit. That's her kimono.

full_text: [Approvingly.] She had exquisite taste.
character_words: She had exquisite taste.

full_text: Please don't touch!
character_words: Please don't touch!

full_text: These fans ... [He picks up one of the fans and waves it back and forth.] They were her weapons, no?
character_words: These fans ...  They were her weapons, no?

full_text: [Sternly.] Also refrain from touching the fans.
character_words: Also refrain from touching the fans.

full_text: [Squatting beside a really big pair of brown boots.] These were her boots? Her feet must have been enormous!
character_words: These were her boots? Her feet must have been enormous!

full_text: [Proudly.] The biggest of any Avatar.
character_words: The biggest of any Avatar.

full_text: [Realizing something.] Wait a minute ... big feet? [A flashback shows the much smaller footprint they saw at the edge of the cliff outside Chin Village.] Little footprint? [She happily exclaims her findings.] There's no way
character_words: Wait a minute ... big feet?  Little footprint?  There's no way

full_text: [Annoyed.] Special outfit? Hat and pipe? These things mean anything to you?
character_words: Special outfit? Hat and pipe? These things mean anything to you?

full_text: [Sarcastically.] You're right. I'm sorry. [She bows slightly in a mocking gesture.] Please.
character_words: You're right. I'm sorry.  Please.

full_text: [Dramatically raises his hand in the air.] Aha! [Showing his own boots to Oyaji.] There's no way Kyoshi could have made that footprint. [Moves toward Katara to explain everything to her.] And therefore there is nothing linking her to the crime scene.
character_words: Aha!  There's no way Kyoshi could have made that footprint.  And therefore there is nothing linking her to the crime scene.

full_text: [Unimpressed.] Brilliant, Sokka. [Rolls her eyes.]
character_words: Brilliant, Sokka.

full_text: [In a very friendly voice that does not stroke with his scary appearances.] This girl you're talking about? She'll come around. You just gotta hang in there.
character_words: This girl you're talking about? She'll come around. You just gotta hang in there.

full_text: [Hopeful.] You think so?
character_words: You think so?

full_text: Sure.
character_words: Sure.

full_text: Yeah.
character_words: Yeah.

full_text: You're a catch.
character_words: You're a catch.

full_text: [Doubtful.] I don't know ...
character_words: I don't know ...

full_text: Hey! You're smart, handsome, funny. Not to mention you're the Avatar.
character_words: Hey! You're smart, handsome, funny. Not to mention you're the Avatar.

full_text: [Smiling sincerely.] You guys are great.
character_words: You guys are great.

full_text: [Tears stream down his face while he talk in a very soft voice.] Don't be afraid to tell her how you feel. [He dries his tears and sniffs.]
character_words: Don't be afraid to tell her how you feel.

full_text: This piece is called "The Birth of Kyoshi". [Sokka investigates the painting thoroughly.] It was painted at sunrise on this day this island was founded. Why, it was today in fact, three hundred and seventy years ago.
character_words: This piece is called "The Birth of Kyoshi".  It was painted at sunrise on this day this island was founded. Why, it was today in fact, three hundred and seventy years ago.

full_text: [Sokka spins around in shock, spitting out some of the bubbles he swallowed. Very surprised.] Three hundred and seventy years? Wait, [He grabs Oyaji by his collar.] are you sure it was today?
character_words: Three hundred and seventy years? Wait,  are you sure it was today?

full_text: Oh, seeing how it's Kyoshi Day, yes, [He pulls himself free from Sokka's grasp and throws him back a little.] I'm sure.
character_words: Oh, seeing how it's Kyoshi Day, yes,  I'm sure.

full_text: [Staring at the painting again.] This ceremony didn't take place at sunrise. It took place at sunset. [Addresses Katara.] Look at the shadows.
character_words: This ceremony didn't take place at sunrise. It took place at sunset.  Look at the shadows.

full_text: They point east. So the sun must have been in the west.
character_words: They point east. So the sun must have been in the west.

full_text: So what?
character_words: So what?

full_text: [Shoves Katara out of the way as she yelps.] If Kyoshi was in the ceremony at sunset, she couldn't have been in Chin committing the crime. She has an alibi! [Points his pipe dramatically toward the camera upon making his conclusion.]
character_words: If Kyoshi was in the ceremony at sunset, she couldn't have been in Chin committing the crime. She has an alibi!

full_text: Honorable Mayor, we've prepared a solid defense for the Avatar. We did an investigation and found some very strong evidence.
character_words: Honorable Mayor, we've prepared a solid defense for the Avatar. We did an investigation and found some very strong evidence.

full_text: Evidence? [Dismissive.] Hmph! That's not how our court system works.
character_words: Evidence?  Hmph! That's not how our court system works.

full_text: Then how can I prove my innocence?
character_words: Then how can I prove my innocence?

full_text: Simple. I say what happened [He points to himself, before pointing to Aang.], then you say what happened, and then I decide who's right. [Everyone gasps at once, horrified by this news.] That's why we call it justice. Because it's "just us."
character_words: Simple. I say what happened , then you say what happened, and then I decide who's right.  That's why we call it justice. Because it's "just us."

full_text: [Emotionally.] Everyone loved Chin the Great because he was so great. Then the Avatar showed up and killed him, and that's how it happened.
character_words: Everyone loved Chin the Great because he was so great. Then the Avatar showed up and killed him, and that's how it happened.

full_text: [Very deep, monotone voice.] The accused will now present its argument.
character_words: The accused will now present its argument.

full_text: [Raises his hand before his mouth to say some quiet, encouraging words.] You can do it, Aang. Just remember the evidence.
character_words: You can do it, Aang. Just remember the evidence.

full_text: [Still tied up, unsure.] Right ... evidence. [He shifts his eyes to the left while he is trying to remember what to say. Enthusiastically.] Ladies and gentlemen ... I'm about to tell you what really happened. And I will prove it with facts. Fact number one. [Raises his finger to count along but blanks out.] Uhhh ...
character_words: Right ... evidence.  Ladies and gentlemen ... I'm about to tell you what really happened. And I will prove it with facts. Fact number one.  Uhhh ...

full_text: [Whispers.] The footprint!
character_words: The footprint!

full_text: Oh, yeah. You see ... I have very large feet. [The camera tilts down to reveal his small feet. The villagers are unimpressed by his argument.] Furthermore ... your temple matches your statue. [The villagers look from one to the other, not knowing where Aang is going with this.] But ... I was in a painting at sunset. [He quickly ends his exposition with a big smile.] So, there you have it, I'm not guilty.
character_words: Oh, yeah. You see ... I have very large feet.  Furthermore ... your temple matches your statue.  But ... I was in a painting at sunset.  So, there you have it, I'm not guilty.

full_text: [Mumbles to Katara while they continue to smile.] He's dead.
character_words: He's dead.

full_text: Looks like you did some serious shopping. [He picks up a big, gold-colored teapot.] But where did you get the money?
character_words: Looks like you did some serious shopping.  But where did you get the money?

full_text: [Lazily resting against a tree trunk.] Do you like your new teapot?
character_words: Do you like your new teapot?

full_text: To be honest with you [He puts the pot down.], the best tea tastes delicious whether it comes in a porcelain pot or a tin cup. [Iroh walks over to Zuko and squats down beside him.] I know we've had some difficult times lately. We've had to struggle just to get by. [Places a hand on Zuko's shoulder who closes his eyes as if he was holding something back.] But it's nothing to be ashamed of. There is a simple honor in poverty.
character_words: To be honest with you , the best tea tastes delicious whether it comes in a porcelain pot or a tin cup.  I know we've had some difficult times lately. We've had to struggle just to get by.  But it's nothing to be ashamed of. There is a simple honor in poverty.

full_text: There's no honor for me without the Avatar.
character_words: There's no honor for me without the Avatar.

full_text: Zuko ... [Sighs.] Even if you did capture the Avatar, I'm not so sure it would solve our problems. Not now.
character_words: Zuko ...  Even if you did capture the Avatar, I'm not so sure it would solve our problems. Not now.

full_text: [Turns away from his uncle.] Then there is no hope at all.
character_words: Then there is no hope at all.

full_text: No, Zuko! You must never give in to despair. Allow yourself to slip down that road and you surrender to your lowest instincts. [Zuko bows his head as he listens to his uncle's wisdom.] In the darkest times, hope is something you give yourself. That is the meaning of inner strength.
character_words: No, Zuko! You must never give in to despair. Allow yourself to slip down that road and you surrender to your lowest instincts.  In the darkest times, hope is something you give yourself. That is the meaning of inner strength.

full_text: Mayor Tong, I'd like for the court to hear one last testimony.
character_words: Mayor Tong, I'd like for the court to hear one last testimony.

full_text: I've already told you, it's just me and the accused. You can't call any witnesses!
character_words: I've already told you, it's just me and the accused. You can't call any witnesses!

full_text: This isn't just any witness. I'm going to call ... [Spreads her arms.] Avatar Kyoshi herself!
character_words: This isn't just any witness. I'm going to call ...  Avatar Kyoshi herself!

full_text: [Whispering.] What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: [Hopeful.] Well, she is Aang's past life. Maybe wearing her stuff will trigger something.
character_words: Well, she is Aang's past life. Maybe wearing her stuff will trigger something.

full_text: [Plays with his magnifying glass.] I do believe in the power of stuff.
character_words: I do believe in the power of stuff.

full_text: [Angry.] This is a mockery of Chin Law!
character_words: This is a mockery of Chin Law!

full_text: [Pleading.] Please! If you could just wait one more second, I'm sure Kyoshi will be here!
character_words: Please! If you could just wait one more second, I'm sure Kyoshi will be here!

full_text: [Higher pitch.] Hey, everybody! Avatar Kyoshi here. [Rapidly blinks his eyes.]
character_words: Hey, everybody! Avatar Kyoshi here.

full_text: [Walking over to Aang.] This is ridiculous! [Points at Aang while he addresses the audience.] For the murder of Chin the Great, this court finds the Avatar
character_words: This is ridiculous!  For the murder of Chin the Great, this court finds the Avatar

full_text: I killed Chin the Conqueror. [A flashback shows how Chin earthbends an earth column beneath one of his subjects as he was offering something to Chin. Voice-over.] A horrible tyrant, Chin was expanding his army to all corners of the continent.
character_words: I killed Chin the Conqueror.  A horrible tyrant, Chin was expanding his army to all corners of the continent.

full_text: When they came to the neck of the peninsula where we lived, he demanded our immediate surrender. [Kyoshi calmly walks toward him to face his challenge.] I warned him that I would not sit passively while he took our home. But he did not back down.
character_words: When they came to the neck of the peninsula where we lived, he demanded our immediate surrender.  I warned him that I would not sit passively while he took our home. But he did not back down.

full_text: On that day, we split from the mainland.
character_words: On that day, we split from the mainland.

full_text: I created Kyoshi Island so my people could be safe from invaders.
character_words: I created Kyoshi Island so my people could be safe from invaders.

full_text: [Confused.] So, what just happened?
character_words: So, what just happened?

full_text: [Awkwardly.] Uhhh ... you kind of confessed. Sorry.
character_words: Uhhh ... you kind of confessed. Sorry.

full_text: [Standing up in the background.] And I find you ... [He brushes himself off and points at Aang.] Guilty! Bring out the Wheel of Punishment!
character_words: And I find you ...  Guilty! Bring out the Wheel of Punishment!

full_text: Uncle ... [Switch to a close-up of Iroh with Zuko on the background.] I thought a lot about what you said.
character_words: Uncle ...  I thought a lot about what you said.

full_text: [Iroh's sad expression clears up as he hears Zuko talk.] You did? Good, good.
character_words: You did? Good, good.

full_text: It's helped me realize something. We no longer have anything to gain by traveling together. [Iroh's brightened expression quickly disappears again.] I need to find my own way.
character_words: It's helped me realize something. We no longer have anything to gain by traveling together.  I need to find my own way.

full_text: [Calling after Zuko.] Wait!
character_words: Wait!

full_text: [Deep, monotonous voice.] The accused will now spin the Wheel of Punishment to determine his sentence.
character_words: The accused will now spin the Wheel of Punishment to determine his sentence.

full_text: I said I would face justice, so I will.
character_words: I said I would face justice, so I will.

full_text: [Hoping.] Come on, torture machine!
character_words: Come on, torture machine!

full_text: Eaten by bears!
character_words: Eaten by bears!

full_text: Razor pit!
character_words: Razor pit!

full_text: [Begging.] Community service! Please stop on community service!
character_words: Community service! Please stop on community service!

full_text: [Monotone.] Looks like it's "boiled in oil."
character_words: Looks like it's "boiled in oil."

full_text: We've come to claim this village for the Fire Lord! [Close-up.] Now show me your leader so I may ... [Kahchi swings his Guan Dao back and forth, slicing through the statue of Chin the Great. While it crumbles down, Mongke continues with a grin.] dethrone him!
character_words: We've come to claim this village for the Fire Lord!  Now show me your leader so I may ...  dethrone him!

full_text: That's him over there!
character_words: That's him over there!

full_text: Ahhh! [Commanding.] You, Avatar, do something!
character_words: Ahhh!  You, Avatar, do something!

full_text: [Apathetically.] Gee, I'd love to help, but I'm supposed to be boiled in oil.
character_words: Gee, I'd love to help, but I'm supposed to be boiled in oil.

full_text: There, community service! Now serve our community and get rid of those rhinos!
character_words: There, community service! Now serve our community and get rid of those rhinos!

full_text: [Raising his hand while shouting his command.] Rough Rhinos, to the town!
character_words: Rough Rhinos, to the town!

full_text: [Raises his arms in the air and exclaims ecstatically.] Boomerang! You do always come back!
character_words: Boomerang! You do always come back!

full_text: From now on, we'll celebrate a new Avatar Day in honor of the day Avatar Aang [Camera pans down to show Katara, Aang, and Sokka, each holding a bowl and grinning happily.] saved us from the Rough Rhino Invasion.
character_words: From now on, we'll celebrate a new Avatar Day in honor of the day Avatar Aang  saved us from the Rough Rhino Invasion.

full_text: [Looks questioningly into his bowl.] What is this?
character_words: What is this?

full_text: That's our new festival food! Un-fried dough. May we eat it and be reminded of how on this day the Avatar was not boiled in oil.
character_words: That's our new festival food! Un-fried dough. May we eat it and be reminded of how on this day the Avatar was not boiled in oil.

full_text: Happy Avatar Day, everyone!
character_words: Happy Avatar Day, everyone!

full_text: [Stares skeptically at his dough-cookie.] This is by far the worst town we've ever been to.
character_words: This is by far the worst town we've ever been to.

full_text: [Pensively.] It's pricey ... but I really do like it.
character_words: It's pricey ... but I really do like it.

full_text: Then you should get it, you deserve something nice.
character_words: Then you should get it, you deserve something nice.

full_text: I do, don't I? [Katara looks at him with a bored expression.] But no, it's too expensive. I shouldn't.
character_words: I do, don't I?  But no, it's too expensive. I shouldn't.

full_text: All right, then don't.
character_words: All right, then don't.

full_text: [Enthusiastically.] You know what? I'm gonna get it. [Smiles in a pleased way.]
character_words: You know what? I'm gonna get it.

full_text: Psst, psst! Hey, you kids love earthbending? You like ... throwing rocks? Then check out Master Yu's Earthbending Academy.
character_words: Psst, psst! Hey, you kids love earthbending? You like ... throwing rocks? Then check out Master Yu's Earthbending Academy.

full_text: Look! There's a coupon on the back! The first lesson is free.
character_words: Look! There's a coupon on the back! The first lesson is free.

full_text: Who knows? This Master Yu could be the earthbending teacher you've been looking for.
character_words: Who knows? This Master Yu could be the earthbending teacher you've been looking for.

full_text: Take your stances! [His students take their fighting stances, except for Aang.] Now, strike as if you're punching through your opponent's head!
character_words: Take your stances!  Now, strike as if you're punching through your opponent's head!

full_text: [Approaches Aang.] So, are you ready to commit to more lessons? If you pay for the whole year in advance, I'll bump you up to the next belt!
character_words: So, are you ready to commit to more lessons? If you pay for the whole year in advance, I'll bump you up to the next belt!

full_text: Ehhh, he's not the one. [Beats his right ear, causing sand to fall out of his left ear.]
character_words: Ehhh, he's not the one.

full_text: [Leaves the Earthbending Academy, accompanied by another student.] I think The Boulder's going to win back the belt at Earth Rumble VI.
character_words: I think The Boulder's going to win back the belt at Earth Rumble VI.

full_text: He's going to have to fight his way through the best earthbenders in the world to get a shot at the champ.
character_words: He's going to have to fight his way through the best earthbenders in the world to get a shot at the champ.

full_text: Excuse me, but where is this earthbending tournament, exactly?
character_words: Excuse me, but where is this earthbending tournament, exactly?

full_text: [Sarcastically.] It's on the island of Noneya ... "Noneya" business!
character_words: It's on the island of Noneya ... "Noneya" business!

full_text: [Laughs and wipes tears of laughter away.] Oh, I got to remember that one!
character_words: Oh, I got to remember that one!

full_text: [Consolingly to Aang.] I'll take care of this. [To the students.] Hey, strong guys! Wait up! [Runs after the students around a corner.]
character_words: I'll take care of this.  Hey, strong guys! Wait up!

full_text: [Looking at his bag, holding it out.] What was I thinking? [Angrily to Aang.] I don't need a new bag! Why did you let me buy this?
character_words: What was I thinking?  I don't need a new bag! Why did you let me buy this?

full_text: You ready to find an earthbending teacher? Because we're going to Earth Rumble VI!
character_words: You ready to find an earthbending teacher? Because we're going to Earth Rumble VI!

full_text: [Looks surprised.] How'd you get them to tell you?
character_words: How'd you get them to tell you?

full_text: Oh ... a girl has her ways. [Smiles.]
character_words: Oh ... a girl has her ways.

full_text: Hey, front row seats! I wonder why no one else is sitting here.
character_words: Hey, front row seats! I wonder why no one else is sitting here.

full_text: I guess that's why.
character_words: I guess that's why.

full_text: [Raises his left arm.] Welcome to Earth Rumble VI! I am your host, Xin Fu!
character_words: Welcome to Earth Rumble VI! I am your host, Xin Fu!

full_text: [Sighs and looks the other way.] This is just going to be a bunch of guys chucking rocks at each other, isn't it?
character_words: This is just going to be a bunch of guys chucking rocks at each other, isn't it?

full_text: [Happily.] That's what I paid for.
character_words: That's what I paid for.

full_text: The rules are simple. Just knock the other guy out of the ring, and you win! [Leaps up to a podium above the ring. A bell rings.] Round one: The Boulder vs. The Big Bad Hippo! [While Xin Fu speaks, The Boulder raises his arms and turns around to the cheering of the audience. The Hippo roars.]
character_words: The rules are simple. Just knock the other guy out of the ring, and you win!  Round one: The Boulder vs. The Big Bad Hippo!

full_text: [Pointing at The Hippo.] Listen up, Hippo. You may be big, but you ain't bad! [Grinning insanely.] The Boulder's gonna win this in a landslide!
character_words: Listen up, Hippo. You may be big, but you ain't bad!  The Boulder's gonna win this in a landslide!

full_text: Hippo ... mad!
character_words: Hippo ... mad!

full_text: Unbelievable, ladies and gentlemen! The Hippo is rocking the boat!
character_words: Unbelievable, ladies and gentlemen! The Hippo is rocking the boat!

full_text: The Boulder wins!
character_words: The Boulder wins!

full_text: [Looking at The Boulder.] How about The Boulder? He's got some good moves.
character_words: How about The Boulder? He's got some good moves.

full_text: [Shrugs.] I don't know. Bumi said I need a teacher who listens to the earth. He's just listening to his big muscles. What do you think, Sokka?
character_words: I don't know. Bumi said I need a teacher who listens to the earth. He's just listening to his big muscles. What do you think, Sokka?

full_text: Next match ... The Boulder versus [Cut to to a close-up of Fire Nation Man happily waving a Fire Nation flag; voice-over.] Fire Nation Man!
character_words: Next match ... The Boulder versus  Fire Nation Man!

full_text: [With a pseudo-Russian accent.] Please, to rise for Fire Nation national anthem! [Put his left hand over his heart; begins to sing.] Fire Lord, my flame burns [Drops to his right knee and stretches out his left arm.] for thee!
character_words: Please, to rise for Fire Nation national anthem!  Fire Lord, my flame burns  for thee!

full_text: [Yelling.] Go back to the Fire Nation!
character_words: Go back to the Fire Nation!

full_text: No, no, please!
character_words: No, no, please!

full_text: Yeah! Wooo! [Points at Fire Nation Man.] The Boulder knows how to put the hurt in the dirt! [Close-up of Sokka as he continues to cheer and make taunting faces.] Yeah! Woohoo!
character_words: Yeah! Wooo!  The Boulder knows how to put the hurt in the dirt!  Yeah! Woohoo!

full_text: Now, the moment [The light slowly dims to put him in the spotlight.] you've all been waiting for. The Boulder versus [Cut to a shot of a person with black hair mostly obscured by a green prize belt; voice-over.] your champion ... the Blind Bandit!
character_words: Now, the moment  you've all been waiting for. The Boulder versus  your champion ... the Blind Bandit!

full_text: She can't really be blind. [Turn her head and squints her eyes skeptically.] It's just part of her [Cut to a close-up of the Bandit's milky-green eyes; pans right.] character, right?
character_words: She can't really be blind.  It's just part of her  character, right?

full_text: [Frontal shot.] I think she is.
character_words: I think she is.

full_text: [Camera moves back to include Sokka in the shot; deadpanned.] I think she is ... [Shouting, gesturing downward with both hands.] going down!
character_words: I think she is ...  going down!

full_text: The Boulder feels conflicted about fighting a young blind girl.
character_words: The Boulder feels conflicted about fighting a young blind girl.

full_text: [Points at The Boulder. Mockingly.] Sounds to me like you're [Goes into a mockingly scared position.] scared, Boulder!
character_words: Sounds to me like you're  scared, Boulder!
