character_words: So Uncle, I've been thinking. It's only a matter of time before I run into Azula again. I'm going to need to know more advanced firebending if I want to stand a chance against her. I know what you're going to say: she's my sister and I should be trying to get along with her.

full_text: [With the exact opposite of Zuko's thoughts.] No, she's crazy, and she needs to go down. [Zuko nods. Iroh grunts as he stands up.] It's time to resume your training.
character_words: No, she's crazy, and she needs to go down.  It's time to resume your training.

full_text: I don't understand what went wrong. He did it exactly the way you did.
character_words: I don't understand what went wrong. He did it exactly the way you did.

full_text: Maybe there's another way ... what if I came at the boulder from another angle?
character_words: Maybe there's another way ... what if I came at the boulder from another angle?

full_text: No. That's the problem. You've got to stop thinking like an airbender. There's no different angle, no clever solution, no trickety-trick that's going to move that rock. You've got to face it head on. And when I say head on, I mean like this ... [Jumps up and destroys the rock with her head.]
character_words: No. That's the problem. You've got to stop thinking like an airbender. There's no different angle, no clever solution, no trickety-trick that's going to move that rock. You've got to face it head on. And when I say head on, I mean like this ...

full_text: Whoa!
character_words: Whoa!

full_text: [Trying to help Toph teach.] I've been training Aang for a while now. He really responds well to a positive teaching experience. Lots of encouragement and praise. Kind words. If he's doing something wrong, maybe a gentle nudge in the right direction.
character_words: I've been training Aang for a while now. He really responds well to a positive teaching experience. Lots of encouragement and praise. Kind words. If he's doing something wrong, maybe a gentle nudge in the right direction.

full_text: Thanks, Katara. A gentle nudge. I'll try that. [Moments later; yelling at the top of her lungs.] Keep your knees high, Twinkle Toes!
character_words: Thanks, Katara. A gentle nudge. I'll try that.  Keep your knees high, Twinkle Toes!

full_text: Rock-like!
character_words: Rock-like!

full_text: Rock-like!
character_words: Rock-like!

full_text: You're awfully cute, but unfortunately you're made of meat. Just a bit closer ... [Jumps but falls into a crack that is in the ground. He looks at the cub.] Gotcha! [Sinks further in.] You are one lucky little meat creature.
character_words: You're awfully cute, but unfortunately you're made of meat. Just a bit closer ...  Gotcha!  You are one lucky little meat creature.

full_text: Lightning is a pure form of firebending, without aggression. It is not fueled by rage or emotion the way other firebending is. Some call lightning the cold-blooded fire. It is precise and deadly, like Azula. To perform the technique requires peace of mind.
character_words: Lightning is a pure form of firebending, without aggression. It is not fueled by rage or emotion the way other firebending is. Some call lightning the cold-blooded fire. It is precise and deadly, like Azula. To perform the technique requires peace of mind.

full_text: I see. That's why we're drinking tea, to calm the mind.
character_words: I see. That's why we're drinking tea, to calm the mind.

full_text: Oh yeah, good point! I mean, yes. [Outside.] There is energy all around us. The energy is both yin and yang. Positive energy and negative energy. Only a select few firebenders can separate these energies. This creates an imbalance. The energy wants to restore balance, and in a moment the positive and negative energy come crashing back together, you provide release and guidance, creating lightning. [Steps up, and generates lightning, and shoots it away from the two.]
character_words: Oh yeah, good point! I mean, yes.  There is energy all around us. The energy is both yin and yang. Positive energy and negative energy. Only a select few firebenders can separate these energies. This creates an imbalance. The energy wants to restore balance, and in a moment the positive and negative energy come crashing back together, you provide release and guidance, creating lightning.

full_text: I'm ready to try it!
character_words: I'm ready to try it!

full_text: Remember, once you separate the energy, you do not command it. You are simply its humble guide. Breathe first.
character_words: Remember, once you separate the energy, you do not command it. You are simply its humble guide. Breathe first.

full_text: This time we're going to try something a little different. Instead of moving a rock, you're going to stop a rock. Get in your horse stance! I'm going to roll that boulder down at you. If you have the attitude of an earthbender, you'll stay in your stance and stop the rock. Like this! [Stretches out, still in stance.]
character_words: This time we're going to try something a little different. Instead of moving a rock, you're going to stop a rock. Get in your horse stance! I'm going to roll that boulder down at you. If you have the attitude of an earthbender, you'll stay in your stance and stop the rock. Like this!

full_text: Sorry Toph, but are you really sure this is the way to teach Aang earthbending?
character_words: Sorry Toph, but are you really sure this is the way to teach Aang earthbending?

full_text: I'm glad you said something. Actually there is a better way. [Blindfolds Aang.] This way, you'll actually have to sense the vibrations of the boulder to stop it. Thank you, Katara.
character_words: I'm glad you said something. Actually there is a better way.  This way, you'll actually have to sense the vibrations of the boulder to stop it. Thank you, Katara.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, thanks, Katara!
character_words: Yeah, thanks, Katara!

full_text: [Nervously.] Heh.
character_words: Heh.

full_text: I guess I just panicked. I don't know what to say.
character_words: I guess I just panicked. I don't know what to say.

full_text: There's nothing to say, you blew it! You had a perfect stance, and a perfect form. But when it came right down to it, you didn't have the guts!
character_words: There's nothing to say, you blew it! You had a perfect stance, and a perfect form. But when it came right down to it, you didn't have the guts!

full_text: [Disappointed.] I know. I'm sorry.
character_words: I know. I'm sorry.

full_text: Yeah, you are sorry! If you're not tough enough to stop the rock, then you can at least give it the pleasure of smashing you instead of jumping out of the way like a jelly-boned wimp! Now, do you have what it takes to face that rock like an earthbender?
character_words: Yeah, you are sorry! If you're not tough enough to stop the rock, then you can at least give it the pleasure of smashing you instead of jumping out of the way like a jelly-boned wimp! Now, do you have what it takes to face that rock like an earthbender?

full_text: No, I don't think I do.
character_words: No, I don't think I do.

full_text: Aang, it's no big deal. You'll take a break and try earthbending again when you're ready. Besides, you still have a lot of waterbending to work on. Okay?
character_words: Aang, it's no big deal. You'll take a break and try earthbending again when you're ready. Besides, you still have a lot of waterbending to work on. Okay?

full_text: Yeah, that sounds good.
character_words: Yeah, that sounds good.

full_text: Yeah, whatever, go splash around until you feel better.
character_words: Yeah, whatever, go splash around until you feel better.

full_text: Why can't I do it? Instead of lightning it keeps exploding in my face ... like everything always does.
character_words: Why can't I do it? Instead of lightning it keeps exploding in my face ... like everything always does.

full_text: I was afraid this might happen. You will not be able to master lightning until you have dealt with the turmoil inside you.
character_words: I was afraid this might happen. You will not be able to master lightning until you have dealt with the turmoil inside you.

full_text: What turmoil?
character_words: What turmoil?

full_text: Zuko, you must let go of your feelings of shame if you want your anger to go away.
character_words: Zuko, you must let go of your feelings of shame if you want your anger to go away.

full_text: But I don't feel any shame at all. I'm as proud as ever.
character_words: But I don't feel any shame at all. I'm as proud as ever.

full_text: Prince Zuko, pride is not the opposite of shame, but its source. True humility is the only antidote to shame.
character_words: Prince Zuko, pride is not the opposite of shame, but its source. True humility is the only antidote to shame.

full_text: Well, my life has been nothing but humbling lately.
character_words: Well, my life has been nothing but humbling lately.

full_text: I have another idea. I will teach you a firebending move that even Azula doesn't know, because I made it up myself. [Zuko smiles.]
character_words: I have another idea. I will teach you a firebending move that even Azula doesn't know, because I made it up myself.

full_text: You probably think I deserve this, don't you? Look, I'm sorry I hunted you, but that's just the natural order of things. Big things eat smaller things, nothing personal. But this time it didn't work out that way. I admit it ... you're cute. Okay, you convinced me, if I get out of this alive, it's a karmically correct, vegetarian existence for me. No meat. Even though meat is so tasty. [The cub brings an apple.] Hey, looks like my karma is already paying off! That's okay, I got it. [Tosses his boomerang at it in a desperate attempt.] Now, come back boomerang.
character_words: You probably think I deserve this, don't you? Look, I'm sorry I hunted you, but that's just the natural order of things. Big things eat smaller things, nothing personal. But this time it didn't work out that way. I admit it ... you're cute. Okay, you convinced me, if I get out of this alive, it's a karmically correct, vegetarian existence for me. No meat. Even though meat is so tasty.  Hey, looks like my karma is already paying off! That's okay, I got it.  Now, come back boomerang.

full_text: You know this block you're having is only temporary, right?
character_words: You know this block you're having is only temporary, right?

full_text: I don't want to talk about it.
character_words: I don't want to talk about it.

full_text: You do realize that's the problem, don't you? If you face this issue instead of avoiding it
character_words: You do realize that's the problem, don't you? If you face this issue instead of avoiding it

full_text: [Frustrated at himself.] I know, I know, I know, I know! I get it, all right? I need to face it head on like a rock, but I just can't do it. I don't know why I can't, but I can't.
character_words: I know, I know, I know, I know! I get it, all right? I need to face it head on like a rock, but I just can't do it. I don't know why I can't, but I can't.

full_text: Aang, if fire and water are opposites, then what's the opposite of air?
character_words: Aang, if fire and water are opposites, then what's the opposite of air?

full_text: I guess it's earth.
character_words: I guess it's earth.

full_text: That's why it's so difficult for you to get this. You're working with your natural opposite. But you'll figure it out. I know you will. Think fast! [Throws a piece of grass at him, but Aang stops it with waterbending.] Excellent. You have the reflexes of a waterbending master.
character_words: That's why it's so difficult for you to get this. You're working with your natural opposite. But you'll figure it out. I know you will. Think fast!  Excellent. You have the reflexes of a waterbending master.

full_text: Thanks, Katara. Sifu Katara. [Bows.]
character_words: Thanks, Katara. Sifu Katara.

full_text: Fire is the element of power. [Draws the firebending insignia in the dirt.] The people of the Fire Nation have desire and will, and the energy to drive and achieve what they want. Earth is the element of substance. [Draws the earthbending insignia.] The people of the Earth Kingdom are diverse and strong. They are persistent and enduring. Air is the element of freedom. [Draws the airbending insignia.] The Air Nomads detached themselves from worldly concerns and found peace and freedom. Also, they apparently had pretty good senses of humor! Water is the element of change. [Draws the waterbending insignia.] The people of the Water Tribe are capable of adapting to many things. They have a deep sense of community and love that holds them together through anything.
character_words: Fire is the element of power.  The people of the Fire Nation have desire and will, and the energy to drive and achieve what they want. Earth is the element of substance.  The people of the Earth Kingdom are diverse and strong. They are persistent and enduring. Air is the element of freedom.  The Air Nomads detached themselves from worldly concerns and found peace and freedom. Also, they apparently had pretty good senses of humor! Water is the element of change.  The people of the Water Tribe are capable of adapting to many things. They have a deep sense of community and love that holds them together through anything.

full_text: Why are you telling me these things?
character_words: Why are you telling me these things?

full_text: It is important to draw wisdom from many different places. If you take it from only one place, it becomes rigid and stale. [Divides the four insignias into separate sections.] Understanding others, the other elements, and the other nations will help you become whole. [Draws a circle around the insignias.]
character_words: It is important to draw wisdom from many different places. If you take it from only one place, it becomes rigid and stale.  Understanding others, the other elements, and the other nations will help you become whole.

full_text: All this four elements talk is sounding like Avatar stuff.
character_words: All this four elements talk is sounding like Avatar stuff.

full_text: It is the combination of the four elements in one person that makes the Avatar so powerful. But it can make you more powerful, too. You see the technique I'm about to teach you is one I learned by studying the waterbenders.
character_words: It is the combination of the four elements in one person that makes the Avatar so powerful. But it can make you more powerful, too. You see the technique I'm about to teach you is one I learned by studying the waterbenders.

full_text: Aang, I found these nuts in your bag. I figured you wouldn't mind. And besides, even if you did, you're too much of a pushover to do anything about it.
character_words: Aang, I found these nuts in your bag. I figured you wouldn't mind. And besides, even if you did, you're too much of a pushover to do anything about it.

full_text: As a matter of fact, I don't mind. I'm happy to share anything I have.
character_words: As a matter of fact, I don't mind. I'm happy to share anything I have.

full_text: You know, I'm really glad you feel that way. Because I also have this great new nutcracker.
character_words: You know, I'm really glad you feel that way. Because I also have this great new nutcracker.

full_text: Actually, I prefer if you didn't ... [Crack.] That's an antique, handcrafted by the monks ... [Crack.] It's a delicate instrument!
character_words: Actually, I prefer if you didn't ...  That's an antique, handcrafted by the monks ...  It's a delicate instrument!

full_text: It's not the only delicate instrument around here. [Walks away, hitting the staff off rocks.]
character_words: It's not the only delicate instrument around here.

full_text: [Resumes meditating.] Ohm.
character_words: Ohm.

full_text: Hey Aang, have you seen
character_words: Hey Aang, have you seen

full_text: [Frustrated.] Meditating here!
character_words: Meditating here!

full_text: It's important. It's almost sundown and Sokka isn't back yet. I think we should search for him.
character_words: It's important. It's almost sundown and Sokka isn't back yet. I think we should search for him.

full_text: We'll find him faster if we split up. [The two begin to search.]
character_words: We'll find him faster if we split up.

full_text: Okay, karma person or thing, whoever's in charge of this stuff. If I can just get out of this situation alive, I will give up meat and sarcasm. Okay? [Sokka's warrior's wolf tail gets yanked out of his hair by the cub.] Ow! That's all I got. It's pretty much my whole identity. Sokka, the meat and sarcasm guy. But I'm willing to be Sokka, the veggies and straight talk fellow. Deal? [Aang shows up.] Aang! Thank goodness! Have you got any meat?
character_words: Okay, karma person or thing, whoever's in charge of this stuff. If I can just get out of this situation alive, I will give up meat and sarcasm. Okay?  Ow! That's all I got. It's pretty much my whole identity. Sokka, the meat and sarcasm guy. But I'm willing to be Sokka, the veggies and straight talk fellow. Deal?  Aang! Thank goodness! Have you got any meat?

full_text: Sokka! Are you okay? [Tries to pull him out.]
character_words: Sokka! Are you okay?

full_text: Aggh, stop, stop! You're going to pull my fingers off and I don't think the rest of me is coming!
character_words: Aggh, stop, stop! You're going to pull my fingers off and I don't think the rest of me is coming!

full_text: Hmmm ... I bet I can airbend you out of here. [Blows up a gust of wind but Sokka remains trapped.]
character_words: Hmmm ... I bet I can airbend you out of here.

full_text: Seriously Aang, I know you're new at it, but I could use a little earthbending here. How about it?
character_words: Seriously Aang, I know you're new at it, but I could use a little earthbending here. How about it?

full_text: I can't ... I can't do it.
character_words: I can't ... I can't do it.

full_text: Well, if you can't earthbend me out of here, go get Toph.
character_words: Well, if you can't earthbend me out of here, go get Toph.

full_text: I can't do that either.
character_words: I can't do that either.

full_text: You can't? Why not?
character_words: You can't? Why not?

full_text: It would just be really ... uncomfortable.
character_words: It would just be really ... uncomfortable.

full_text: Uncomfortable? [Sarcastically.] Well, I wouldn't want you to feel uncomfortable ...
character_words: Uncomfortable?  Well, I wouldn't want you to feel uncomfortable ...

full_text: Thanks, Sokka. This whole earthbending thing really has me confused. There's so much pressure. Everyone expects me to get it right away. It puts me in a really awkward position.
character_words: Thanks, Sokka. This whole earthbending thing really has me confused. There's so much pressure. Everyone expects me to get it right away. It puts me in a really awkward position.

full_text: Awkward position, I think I know the feeling.
character_words: Awkward position, I think I know the feeling.

full_text: If I try, I fail. If I don't try, I'm never going to get it. I feel like I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.
character_words: If I try, I fail. If I don't try, I'm never going to get it. I feel like I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.

full_text: Hmmm ... how about that. Aang, this is my friend, Foo Foo Cuddlypoops. Foo Foo Cuddlypoops, Aang.
character_words: Hmmm ... how about that. Aang, this is my friend, Foo Foo Cuddlypoops. Foo Foo Cuddlypoops, Aang.

full_text: Awww, what a cute name for a baby saber-tooth moose-lion cub.
character_words: Awww, what a cute name for a baby saber-tooth moose-lion cub.

full_text: Really? He looks nothing like a saber-tooth moose-lion.
character_words: Really? He looks nothing like a saber-tooth moose-lion.

full_text: It's hard to tell before their giant teeth and horns grow in. What are you doing out here little guy? Did you lose your mama?
character_words: It's hard to tell before their giant teeth and horns grow in. What are you doing out here little guy? Did you lose your mama?

full_text: Waterbenders deal with the flow of energy. A waterbender lets their defense become their offense, turning their opponents' energy against them. I learned a way to do this with lightning.
character_words: Waterbenders deal with the flow of energy. A waterbender lets their defense become their offense, turning their opponents' energy against them. I learned a way to do this with lightning.

full_text: You can teach me to redirect lightning?
character_words: You can teach me to redirect lightning?

full_text: If you let the energy in your own body flow, the lightning will follow it. You must create a pathway from your fingertips, up your arm to your shoulder, then down into your stomach. The stomach is the source of energy in your body. It is called the sea of chi. Only in my case it is more like a vast ocean. [Laughs.] From the stomach, you direct it up again, and out the other arm. The stomach detour is critical. You must not let the lightning pass through your heart, or the damage could be deadly. You may wish to try a physical motion, to get a feel for the pathways' flow, like this. [The two begin to practice the redirection motion.] Now, are you focusing your energy? Can you feel your own chi flowing in, down, up, and out?
character_words: If you let the energy in your own body flow, the lightning will follow it. You must create a pathway from your fingertips, up your arm to your shoulder, then down into your stomach. The stomach is the source of energy in your body. It is called the sea of chi. Only in my case it is more like a vast ocean.  From the stomach, you direct it up again, and out the other arm. The stomach detour is critical. You must not let the lightning pass through your heart, or the damage could be deadly. You may wish to try a physical motion, to get a feel for the pathways' flow, like this.  Now, are you focusing your energy? Can you feel your own chi flowing in, down, up, and out?

full_text: I think so.
character_words: I think so.

full_text: Come on, you've got to feel the flow. [They practice the motion for a few minutes.] Excellent! You've got it!
character_words: Come on, you've got to feel the flow.  Excellent! You've got it!

full_text: Great, I'm ready to try it with real lightning!
character_words: Great, I'm ready to try it with real lightning!

full_text: What, are you crazy? Lightning is very dangerous!
character_words: What, are you crazy? Lightning is very dangerous!

full_text: I thought that was the point! You teaching me to protect myself from it!
character_words: I thought that was the point! You teaching me to protect myself from it!

full_text: Yeah! But I'm not going to shoot lightning at you! If you're lucky, you will never have to use this technique at all!
character_words: Yeah! But I'm not going to shoot lightning at you! If you're lucky, you will never have to use this technique at all!

full_text: Well, if you won't help me, I'll find my own lightning. [Rides away.]
character_words: Well, if you won't help me, I'll find my own lightning.

full_text: Hey there, we found your cub! See, we have no problem with you! We're friendly!
character_words: Hey there, we found your cub! See, we have no problem with you! We're friendly!

full_text: Aang, this is bad, you've got to get me out of here!
character_words: Aang, this is bad, you've got to get me out of here!

full_text: This is really bad! Please Aang, you have to earthbend me out, there's no other way!
character_words: This is really bad! Please Aang, you have to earthbend me out, there's no other way!

full_text: Oh no! [Gets on top of a rock to try and distract the saber-tooth moose-lion.] Woo-hoo, look at me!
character_words: Oh no!  Woo-hoo, look at me!

full_text: Please, don't leave me again.
character_words: Please, don't leave me again.

full_text: I won't.
character_words: I won't.

full_text: What are you doing here?
character_words: What are you doing here?

full_text: Just enjoying the show.
character_words: Just enjoying the show.

full_text: What? You were there the whole time?
character_words: What? You were there the whole time?

full_text: Pretty much.
character_words: Pretty much.

full_text: Why didn't you do something? Sokka was in trouble! I was in trouble! You could have gotten him out and helped us get away!
character_words: Why didn't you do something? Sokka was in trouble! I was in trouble! You could have gotten him out and helped us get away!

full_text: Guess it just didn't occur to me. [Throws a nut down and attempts to crack it with the staff.]
character_words: Guess it just didn't occur to me.

full_text: [Grabs hold of it.] Enough! I want my staff back! [Takes it away.]
character_words: Enough! I want my staff back!

full_text: Do it now!
character_words: Do it now!

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: Earthbend, Twinkle Toes. You just stood your ground against a crazy beast. And even more impressive, you stood your ground against me. You've got stuff.
character_words: Earthbend, Twinkle Toes. You just stood your ground against a crazy beast. And even more impressive, you stood your ground against me. You've got stuff.

full_text: But
character_words: But

full_text: Do it!
character_words: Do it!

full_text: You did it! You're an earthbender.
character_words: You did it! You're an earthbender.

full_text: I can't believe it!
character_words: I can't believe it!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Awww, this is a really wonderful, touching moment. So could you get me out of here so I can give you both a big, snuggly hug?
character_words: Awww, this is a really wonderful, touching moment. So could you get me out of here so I can give you both a big, snuggly hug?

full_text: No problem, Sokka!
character_words: No problem, Sokka!

full_text: Actually, you should probably let me do that. You're still a little new to this. You might accidentally crush him.
character_words: Actually, you should probably let me do that. You're still a little new to this. You might accidentally crush him.

full_text: Yeah, no crushing, please.
character_words: Yeah, no crushing, please.

full_text: You found him! [Embraces Sokka.]
character_words: You found him!

full_text: The whole time, I was in that hole, not knowing if I was going to live or die. It makes a man to think about what's really important. I realized
character_words: The whole time, I was in that hole, not knowing if I was going to live or die. It makes a man to think about what's really important. I realized

full_text: [Interrupting Sokka.] Hey Katara, look what I can do! [Bends a rock and slams it on the ground.]
character_words: Hey Katara, look what I can do!

full_text: You did it! I knew you would! [Whispering to Toph.] You tried the positive reinforcement, didn't you?
character_words: You did it! I knew you would!  You tried the positive reinforcement, didn't you?

full_text: [Happily.] Yep, it worked wonders.
character_words: Yep, it worked wonders.

full_text: Appa, Appa, I can earthbend now! The key is being completely rooted. Physically and mentally unmovable!
character_words: Appa, Appa, I can earthbend now! The key is being completely rooted. Physically and mentally unmovable!

full_text: You've always thrown everything you could at me! Well, I can take it, and now I can give it back! [Yelling as loud as he can at the storm.] Come on, strike me! You've never held back before!
character_words: You've always thrown everything you could at me! Well, I can take it, and now I can give it back!  Come on, strike me! You've never held back before!

full_text: What's out here?
character_words: What's out here?

full_text: [Puts her hand on the ground.] A lot, actually. There's hundreds of little ...
character_words: A lot, actually. There's hundreds of little ...

full_text: [Turns around and silences Toph.] Shh! I know you can see underground, but don't ruin the surprise. Just watch. [Blows a note on the flute. A groundhog-type creature pops out of a hole in the ground and mimics the note.] Yeah! [Plays another note and another groundhog mimics it.] I'm putting an orchestra together.
character_words: Shh! I know you can see underground, but don't ruin the surprise. Just watch.  Yeah!  I'm putting an orchestra together.

full_text: [Makes hand motions while looking on with annoyance.] Orchestra, huh? Well, la-di-da.
character_words: Orchestra, huh? Well, la-di-da.

full_text: [Annoyed.] This is great and all, but don't we have more important things to worry about? We should be making plans.
character_words: This is great and all, but don't we have more important things to worry about? We should be making plans.

full_text: We did make plans. We're all picking mini-vacations.
character_words: We did make plans. We're all picking mini-vacations.

full_text: There's no time for vacations.
character_words: There's no time for vacations.

full_text: I'm learning the elements as fast as I can. I practice hard every day with Toph and Katara. I've been training my arrow off!
character_words: I'm learning the elements as fast as I can. I practice hard every day with Toph and Katara. I've been training my arrow off!

full_text: [Walks next to Aang.] Yeah, what's wrong with having a little fun in our down time?
character_words: Yeah, what's wrong with having a little fun in our down time?

full_text: Even if you do master all of the elements, then what? It's not like we have a map of the Fire Nation. [Gestures to the side, sarcastically.] Should we just head west until we reach the Fire Lord's house? [Knocking on an imaginary door.] Knock, knock. Hello, Fire Lord? Anybody home? I don't think so. We need some intelligence if we're going to win this war.
character_words: Even if you do master all of the elements, then what? It's not like we have a map of the Fire Nation.  Should we just head west until we reach the Fire Lord's house?  Knock, knock. Hello, Fire Lord? Anybody home? I don't think so. We need some intelligence if we're going to win this war.

full_text: All right, we'll finish our vacations and [Mockingly.] then we'll look for Sokka's intelligence. [Aang laughs.]
character_words: All right, we'll finish our vacations and  then we'll look for Sokka's intelligence.

full_text: [Opening a map and shows it to Katara.] Your turn, Katara. Where would you like to go on your mini-vacation?
character_words: Your turn, Katara. Where would you like to go on your mini-vacation?

full_text: [Pointing at the map.] How about the Misty Palms Oasis? That sounds refreshing.
character_words: How about the Misty Palms Oasis? That sounds refreshing.

full_text: Oh, yeah, I've been there. It's a pristine natural ice spring. And I usually don't use the word "pristine". [Cut to the symbol on the map.] It's one of nature's wonders.
character_words: Oh, yeah, I've been there. It's a pristine natural ice spring. And I usually don't use the word "pristine".  It's one of nature's wonders.

full_text: Must've changed ownership since I was here. [Laughs sheepishly.]
character_words: Must've changed ownership since I was here.

full_text: [To the bartender.] One mango, please.
character_words: One mango, please.

full_text: I don't see anything wrong with having one of those fruity beverages while we plan our strategy. [Runs up to the bartender.] Excuse me.
character_words: I don't see anything wrong with having one of those fruity beverages while we plan our strategy.  Excuse me.

full_text: No worries, I clean up easy. [Airbends the drink off of his clothes.]
character_words: No worries, I clean up easy.

full_text: [Gasps.] You're a living relic.
character_words: You're a living relic.

full_text: [Shrugs.] Thanks, I try.
character_words: Thanks, I try.

full_text: An Air Nomad, right in front of me. [Shot changes to show Katara holding an icy bowl.] Professor Zei, head of anthropology at Ba Sing Se University. [Grabs Aang's arm and points at his arrow tattoo. Camera pans to Aang's face.] Tell me, which of the air temples do you hail from?
character_words: An Air Nomad, right in front of me.  Professor Zei, head of anthropology at Ba Sing Se University.  Tell me, which of the air temples do you hail from?

full_text: The Southern Temple.
character_words: The Southern Temple.

full_text: [Measures Aang's head with a pair of calipers and speaking excitedly.] Oh, splendid! Now tell me- what was the primary agricultural product of your people?
character_words: Oh, splendid! Now tell me- what was the primary agricultural product of your people?

full_text: [Nervously.] Uh, are fruit pies an agricultural product?
character_words: Uh, are fruit pies an agricultural product?

full_text: Oh, truly fascinating. That is one for the journal. [While Sokka speaks, Zei writes in his journal.]
character_words: Oh, truly fascinating. That is one for the journal.

full_text: So Professor, you're obviously a well-traveled guy. Do you have a more current map? Ours seems to be a little dated.
character_words: So Professor, you're obviously a well-traveled guy. Do you have a more current map? Ours seems to be a little dated.

full_text: Certainly.
character_words: Certainly.

full_text: What, no Fire Nation? [Straightening his back.] Doesn't anybody have a good map of that place?
character_words: What, no Fire Nation?  Doesn't anybody have a good map of that place?

full_text: [Examines the map while the camera pans across it.] You've made a lot of trips into the desert.
character_words: You've made a lot of trips into the desert.

full_text: All in vain, I'm afraid. I've found lost civilizations all over the Earth Kingdom, [Raises his fist slightly.] but I haven't managed to find the crown jewel: Wan Shi Tong's Library. [Cut to a shot of Toph laying down. Her feet are closest to the camera, showing her dirt-stained soles.]
character_words: All in vain, I'm afraid. I've found lost civilizations all over the Earth Kingdom,  but I haven't managed to find the crown jewel: Wan Shi Tong's Library.

full_text: [In disbelief.] You spent years walking through the desert to find some guy's library?
character_words: You spent years walking through the desert to find some guy's library?

full_text: This library is more valuable than gold, little lady. It is said to contain a vast collection of knowledge, and knowledge is priceless.
character_words: This library is more valuable than gold, little lady. It is said to contain a vast collection of knowledge, and knowledge is priceless.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Hmm, sounds like good times.
character_words: Hmm, sounds like good times.

full_text: Oh, it is. According to legend, it was built by the great Knowledge Spirit, Wan Shi Tong, with the help of his "foxy" knowledge seekers.
character_words: Oh, it is. According to legend, it was built by the great Knowledge Spirit, Wan Shi Tong, with the help of his "foxy" knowledge seekers.

full_text: [Intrigued.] Oh, so this spirit has attractive assistants, huh?
character_words: Oh, so this spirit has attractive assistants, huh?

full_text: [Puts her hand on the side of Sokka's face to stop him from talking.] I think he means they look like actual foxes, Sokka.
character_words: I think he means they look like actual foxes, Sokka.

full_text: You're both right. [Katara and Sokka turn to him in surprise. Cut to Zei.] Handsome little creatures. [Takes out a drawing of the library and places it on the table.] Wan Shi Tong and his knowledge seekers collected books from all over the world, and put them on display for mankind to read, so that we might better ourselves.
character_words: You're both right.  Handsome little creatures.  Wan Shi Tong and his knowledge seekers collected books from all over the world, and put them on display for mankind to read, so that we might better ourselves.

full_text: If this place has books from all over the world, [Aang walks over to look at the maps while he sips his drink.] do you think they've got info on the Fire Nation? A map, maybe?
character_words: If this place has books from all over the world,  do you think they've got info on the Fire Nation? A map, maybe?

full_text: I wouldn't know. But if such a thing exists, it's in Wan Shi Tong's Library.
character_words: I wouldn't know. But if such a thing exists, it's in Wan Shi Tong's Library.

full_text: Then it's settled. Aang, I do believe it's my turn. I'd like to spend my vacation [Cut to a shot of Sokka as he points his finger into the air dramatically. The background changes to a rushing one.] at the library! [Sokka's voice echoes. Zoom back to a group shot, with Sokka still having his finger raised in the air.]
character_words: Then it's settled. Aang, I do believe it's my turn. I'd like to spend my vacation  at the library!

full_text: [Waving her hand to gain the others attention.] Uh, hey, what about me? When do I get to pick?
character_words: Uh, hey, what about me? When do I get to pick?

full_text: You gotta work here a little longer before you qualify for vacation time.
character_words: You gotta work here a little longer before you qualify for vacation time.

full_text: Hmph! [Slams her drink on the table and folds her arms. Cut to a shot of Zei.]
character_words: Hmph!

full_text: Of course, there's the matter of finding it. I've made several trips into the Si Wong Desert and almost died each time. [In a depressed voice.] I'm afraid that desert's impossible to cross.
character_words: Of course, there's the matter of finding it. I've made several trips into the Si Wong Desert and almost died each time.  I'm afraid that desert's impossible to cross.

full_text: Professor, would you like to see our sky bison?
character_words: Professor, would you like to see our sky bison?

full_text: A sky bison?! You actually have one?
character_words: A sky bison?! You actually have one?

full_text: [Runs toward the sandbenders.] Sandbenders, shoo, away from the bison!
character_words: Sandbenders, shoo, away from the bison!

full_text: Tell me, sky bison, are you the last of your breed? [Appa growls and Zei responds enthusiastically.] Delightful! I only wish I spoke his tongue. [Scratches Appa's head.] Oh, the stories this beast could tell. [Momo crawls up to Zei's side and starts chittering.] Shush, chatty monkey.
character_words: Tell me, sky bison, are you the last of your breed?  Delightful! I only wish I spoke his tongue.  Oh, the stories this beast could tell.  Shush, chatty monkey.

full_text: [Examines the picture of the library.] Wow, shouldn't be too hard to find a place like this out here.
character_words: Wow, shouldn't be too hard to find a place like this out here.

full_text: [Groans in frustration.] Does this place even exist?
character_words: Does this place even exist?

full_text: Some say it doesn't.
character_words: Some say it doesn't.

full_text: [Eyes widen in surprise before narrowing.] Shouldn't you have mentioned that before? [Collapses on the saddle, putting her feet over the side.]
character_words: Shouldn't you have mentioned that before?

full_text: [Pointing over the side of the saddle with excitement.] There it is! [Everybody on Appa looks to where Toph is pointing, but they can only see sand dunes. Aang, Katara, and Sokka glare at Toph in annoyance for tricking them. Cut back to the shot of Toph.] That's what it will sound like when one of you spots it. [Waves her hand in front of her face with a blank grin to remind them of the fact that she is blind. She quickly goes back to clutching the saddle.]
character_words: There it is!  That's what it will sound like when one of you spots it.

full_text: It shouldn't be this hard to spot a giant, ornate building from the air.
character_words: It shouldn't be this hard to spot a giant, ornate building from the air.

full_text: [Looks through his telescope and spots a tower. Pointing.] Down there, what's that?
character_words: Down there, what's that?

full_text: [Holding the illustrations.] Forget it. It's obviously not what we're looking for. [Side shot.] The building in this drawing is enormous.
character_words: Forget it. It's obviously not what we're looking for.  The building in this drawing is enormous.

full_text: [To Zei.] What kind of animal is that?
character_words: What kind of animal is that?

full_text: I think that was one of the Knowledge Seekers. [Frontal shot.] Oh, we must be close to the library!
character_words: I think that was one of the Knowledge Seekers.  Oh, we must be close to the library!

full_text: [Looking at the illustration Katara is holding.] No, this is the library- look! [Camera pans down from the tower to the illustration.] It's completely buried.
character_words: No, this is the library- look!  It's completely buried.

full_text: [Shouting dramatically.] The library is buried?! [Cut to a shot of the group standing in front of the spire. Zei runs forward. Depressed.] My life's ambition is now full of sand. [Collapses. Smiling, he lifts his head and reveals a small shovel in hand. Excitedly.] Well, time to start excavating. [He attempts to unearth the library using the tiny shovel. Cut to a close-up of the spire's surface as Toph places her palm against it.]
character_words: The library is buried?!  My life's ambition is now full of sand.  Well, time to start excavating.

full_text: [Cut a small part of the library which Toph puts her hand on.] Actually, that won't be necessary. The inside seems to be completely intact. [Aerial shot.] And it's huge.
character_words: Actually, that won't be necessary. The inside seems to be completely intact.  And it's huge.

full_text: That fox thingy went in through a window. I say we climb up there and give it a look.
character_words: That fox thingy went in through a window. I say we climb up there and give it a look.

full_text: I say you guys go ahead without me.
character_words: I say you guys go ahead without me.

full_text: You got something against libraries?
character_words: You got something against libraries?

full_text: I've held books before. And I gotta tell you, they don't exactly do it for me.
character_words: I've held books before. And I gotta tell you, they don't exactly do it for me.

full_text: [Sheepishly.] Oh, right. Sorry.
character_words: Oh, right. Sorry.

full_text: Let me know if they have something you can listen to.
character_words: Let me know if they have something you can listen to.

full_text: [To Appa.] Don't worry, buddy. I'm not making you go underground ever again. You can stay out here with Toph. [Walks off camera.]
character_words: Don't worry, buddy. I'm not making you go underground ever again. You can stay out here with Toph.

full_text: [Awkwardly.] What's up?
character_words: What's up?

full_text: Oh, it's breathtaking! [Shot changes to show Zei, Aang, and Sokka climb down the rope with owl arches in the background.] The spirit spared no expense in designing this place. [Pointing.] Look at those beautiful buttresses! [Cut to an above shot of Sokka, Aang, and Zei, who are hanging from the rope.Sokka and Aang giggle at the word.] What's funny?
character_words: Oh, it's breathtaking!  The spirit spared no expense in designing this place.  Look at those beautiful buttresses!  What's funny?

full_text: Nothing. We just like architecture.
character_words: Nothing. We just like architecture.

full_text: [Cut back to a smiling Zei.] As do I.
character_words: As do I.

full_text: My word! [Examines an owl mosaic above two pillars.] The exquisite mosaic handiwork of this tile-rendered avian symbol ... [Sokka, Katara, and Aang look at Zei quizzically.] Eh, nice owl.
character_words: My word!  The exquisite mosaic handiwork of this tile-rendered avian symbol ...  Eh, nice owl.

full_text: [Turns his head around.] I know you're back there.
character_words: I know you're back there.

full_text: [Smiles and walks from behind the pillar and up to Wan Shi Tong.] Hello, I'm Professor Zei, head of anthropology at Ba Sing Se University.
character_words: Hello, I'm Professor Zei, head of anthropology at Ba Sing Se University.

full_text: You should leave the way you came. [Looks to the side.] Unless you want to become a stuffed head of anthropology.
character_words: You should leave the way you came.  Unless you want to become a stuffed head of anthropology.

full_text: Are you the spirit who brought this library to the physical world?
character_words: Are you the spirit who brought this library to the physical world?

full_text: Indeed, I am Wan Shi Tong, "He Who Knows Ten Thousand Things." And you are obviously humans, which, by the way, are no longer permitted in my study.
character_words: Indeed, I am Wan Shi Tong, "He Who Knows Ten Thousand Things." And you are obviously humans, which, by the way, are no longer permitted in my study.

full_text: What do you have against humans?
character_words: What do you have against humans?

full_text: Hm! Humans only bother learning things to get the edge on other humans. [Cut to Zhao, studying scrolls in the library. Voice-over.] Like that firebender who came to this place a few years ago, looking to destroy his enemy. [Scene changes to the present.] So ... [Leans toward a sweating Sokka.] who are you trying to destroy?
character_words: Hm! Humans only bother learning things to get the edge on other humans.  Like that firebender who came to this place a few years ago, looking to destroy his enemy.  So ...  who are you trying to destroy?

full_text: [Cut to his reflection in Wan Shi Tong's eye.] What? No-no-no-no destroying. We're not into that.
character_words: What? No-no-no-no destroying. We're not into that.

full_text: [Blinks.] Then why have you come here?
character_words: Then why have you come here?

full_text: Um ... knowledge for knowledge's sake?
character_words: Um ... knowledge for knowledge's sake?

full_text: [Shot changes to him leaning toward Sokka.] If you're going to lie to an all-knowing spirit being, you should at least put some effort into it.
character_words: If you're going to lie to an all-knowing spirit being, you should at least put some effort into it.

full_text: I'm not lying, I'm here with the Avatar, [Grabs Aang and puts him into the shot.] and he's the bridge between our worlds. He'll vouch for me. [Nudges Aang.]
character_words: I'm not lying, I'm here with the Avatar,  and he's the bridge between our worlds. He'll vouch for me.

full_text: Ow. [Frontal shot.] Uh, yeah, I'll vouch. We will not abuse the knowledge in your library, good spirit. [Side shot.] You have my word. [They bow to Wan Shi Tong.]
character_words: Ow.  Uh, yeah, I'll vouch. We will not abuse the knowledge in your library, good spirit.  You have my word.

full_text: Hmm, very well. I'll let you peruse my vast collection [Shot changes to Zei, Aang, Katara, and Sokka looking hopefully.] on one condition. [They look at the spirit a little worriedly. Further overhead shot.] To prove your worth as scholars, you have to contribute some worthwhile knowledge.
character_words: Hmm, very well. I'll let you peruse my vast collection  on one condition.  To prove your worth as scholars, you have to contribute some worthwhile knowledge.

full_text: [Walks up to Wan Shi Tong holding a book and kneels down.] Please accept this tome as a donation to your library.
character_words: Please accept this tome as a donation to your library.

full_text: [Frontal shot.] First edition, very nice. [Grabs the book with his wing.]
character_words: First edition, very nice.

full_text: [Camera pans up to show her holding the waterbending scroll.] I have an authentic waterbending scroll.
character_words: I have an authentic waterbending scroll.

full_text: [Frontal shot.] Ooh, these illustrations are quite stylish. [Grabs the scroll.]
character_words: Ooh, these illustrations are quite stylish.

full_text: [Cut to him.] Uh ... oh, I know! [Grabs his wanted poster out of his shirt and shows it to Wan Shi Tong.] Hah!
character_words: Uh ... oh, I know!  Hah!

full_text: I suppose that counts. [Takes the poster.]
character_words: I suppose that counts.

full_text: [Side shot of him walking forward.] Oh, great spirit, [Frontal shot of him holding a piece of string.] check this out. [Ties the string into a butterfly knot and shows it to Wan Shi Tong.] Ta-da! [Aang, Katara, and Zei look at Sokka with uncertainty.Shot of Wan Shi Tong just looking at him in silence.] It's a special knot. That counts as knowledge!
character_words: Oh, great spirit,  check this out.  Ta-da!  It's a special knot. That counts as knowledge!

full_text: [Frontal shot.] You're not very bright, are you? [Sokka grunts as Wan Shi Tong takes the knot.] Enjoy the library. [Jumps off the bridge and flies down to lower levels of the library.]
character_words: You're not very bright, are you?  Enjoy the library.

full_text: [Narrows his eyes.] Bright enough to fool you.
character_words: Bright enough to fool you.

full_text: [To Appa.] So ... you like ... flying? [Appa purrs deeply and scratches his ear.] Of course, I'm more comfortable on the ground where I can see. Well, I don't see the way you do. I feel the vibrations in the ground with my feet. [Closer shot of the two. Toph picks up a handful of sand and lets it fall.] But this sand is so loose and shifty, it makes everything look fuzzy. [Appa makes a rumbling groan with a further shot.] Not that there's anything wrong with fuzzy. [Appa grunts.]
character_words: So ... you like ... flying?  Of course, I'm more comfortable on the ground where I can see. Well, I don't see the way you do. I feel the vibrations in the ground with my feet.  But this sand is so loose and shifty, it makes everything look fuzzy.  Not that there's anything wrong with fuzzy.

full_text: [Holds the illustration up to show Sokka and Katara.] Hey, look at these weird lion turtle things.
character_words: Hey, look at these weird lion turtle things.

full_text: [Pulls a book off the bookshelf with the symbols  on the cover.] Eh, I've seen weirder.
character_words: Eh, I've seen weirder.

full_text: [Walks up to Aang, carrying a book.] Aang, did you know in a past life, you were left-handed?
character_words: Aang, did you know in a past life, you were left-handed?

full_text: I always knew I was special.
character_words: I always knew I was special.

full_text: [Reading from the parchment.] "The darkest day in Fire Nation history." It's got a date at the top, but it doesn't say anything else. [He looks around, making sure no one is watching, before prying open the frame with his sword and taking the parchment.]
character_words: "The darkest day in Fire Nation history." It's got a date at the top, but it doesn't say anything else.

full_text: [Walks in with Katara and Zei.] Sokka, where are you going?
character_words: Sokka, where are you going?

full_text: [Running down a section of a library.] I want to know what happened to the Fire Nation on their darkest day. This could be promising. [Aang, Katara, and Zei follow him.] The information on the Fire Nation should be right up here.
character_words: I want to know what happened to the Fire Nation on their darkest day. This could be promising.  The information on the Fire Nation should be right up here.

full_text: [Looking at a room full of ashes.] Firebenders.
character_words: Firebenders.

full_text: They destroyed everything having to do with the Fire Nation.
character_words: They destroyed everything having to do with the Fire Nation.

full_text: That's so unfair! Just when I think I'm one step ahead of the Fire Nation, it turns out they beat us here a long time ago. [Collapses on his knees.] I need to know what happened on the darkest day. [Hears whimpering and looks at the entrance to see the Knowledge Seeker standing on its hind legs.] Hello, little weird fox guy.
character_words: That's so unfair! Just when I think I'm one step ahead of the Fire Nation, it turns out they beat us here a long time ago.  I need to know what happened on the darkest day.  Hello, little weird fox guy.

full_text: Seems it's trying to assist you.
character_words: Seems it's trying to assist you.

full_text: Um, sure, I guess I'll follow you.
character_words: Um, sure, I guess I'll follow you.

full_text: This room is a true marvel, a mechanical wonder. It's a planetarium that shows the heavens moving.
character_words: This room is a true marvel, a mechanical wonder. It's a planetarium that shows the heavens moving.

full_text: Uh, this is beautiful, but how is it helpful?
character_words: Uh, this is beautiful, but how is it helpful?

full_text: Maybe these dials represent dates and times. Sokka, try entering that date from that parchment you took.
character_words: Maybe these dials represent dates and times. Sokka, try entering that date from that parchment you took.

full_text: [Mock whispering.] Shh, Katara, not in front of the fox, he's with the owl.
character_words: Shh, Katara, not in front of the fox, he's with the owl.

full_text: Wow, I got to hand it to you, Sokka. You picked the best mini-vacation for sure.
character_words: Wow, I got to hand it to you, Sokka. You picked the best mini-vacation for sure.

full_text: Hey, wait. What happened to the sun?
character_words: Hey, wait. What happened to the sun?

full_text: [Narrows his eyes.] Great, you must have broken it.
character_words: Great, you must have broken it.

full_text: [Walks next to Aang.] It's not broken. [Shot changes to show the sun piece of the planetarium covered by the moon piece.] The sun is behind the moon. It's a solar eclipse! It's literally the darkest day in Fire Nation history. Now I get it. [Grabs Aang's shoulders and shakes him.] Something awful happened on that day. I don't know what, but I do know why. Firebenders lose their bending during a solar eclipse. [Pushes Aang back.] Sorry.
character_words: It's not broken.  The sun is behind the moon. It's a solar eclipse! It's literally the darkest day in Fire Nation history. Now I get it.  Something awful happened on that day. I don't know what, but I do know why. Firebenders lose their bending during a solar eclipse.  Sorry.

full_text: That makes sense. I mean, think what the lunar eclipse at the North Pole did to the waterbenders. This is huge.
character_words: That makes sense. I mean, think what the lunar eclipse at the North Pole did to the waterbenders. This is huge.

full_text: [To the Knowledge Seeker.] Fine, you earned it. [Tosses the fox a snack from his bag. To Aang and Katara.] We've gotta get this information to the Earth King at Ba Sing Se. We'll wait for the next eclipse, then we'll invade the Fire Nation when they're totally helpless. The Fire Lord is going down!
character_words: Fine, you earned it.  We've gotta get this information to the Earth King at Ba Sing Se. We'll wait for the next eclipse, then we'll invade the Fire Nation when they're totally helpless. The Fire Lord is going down!

full_text: [Enters the shot from behind Sokka.] Mortals are so predictable, and such terrible liars. [Sokka gulps. Shot changes to show Wan Shi Tong talking to them from the entrance.] You betrayed my trust. From the beginning, you intended to misuse this knowledge for evil purposes.
character_words: Mortals are so predictable, and such terrible liars.  You betrayed my trust. From the beginning, you intended to misuse this knowledge for evil purposes.

full_text: You don't understand. If anyone's evil, it's the Fire Nation. You saw what they did to your library. They're destructive and dangerous. We need this information.
character_words: You don't understand. If anyone's evil, it's the Fire Nation. You saw what they did to your library. They're destructive and dangerous. We need this information.

full_text: You think you're the first person to believe their war was justified? Countless others before you have come here seeking weapons or weaknesses or battle strategies.
character_words: You think you're the first person to believe their war was justified? Countless others before you have come here seeking weapons or weaknesses or battle strategies.

full_text: We had no choice. Please, we're just desperate to protect the people we love.
character_words: We had no choice. Please, we're just desperate to protect the people we love.

full_text: And now I'm going to protect what I love. [Flaps his wings and the library starts shaking.]
character_words: And now I'm going to protect what I love.

full_text: What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: I'm taking my knowledge back. No one will ever abuse it again.
character_words: I'm taking my knowledge back. No one will ever abuse it again.

full_text: [Sand pours from the ceiling.] He's sinking the building. We've gotta get out of here.
character_words: He's sinking the building. We've gotta get out of here.

full_text: I'm afraid I can't allow that. You already know too much. [Pecks at them, but misses.]
character_words: I'm afraid I can't allow that. You already know too much.

full_text: I already told you, I don't wanna snuggle. [Appa stands up and hurries away from the library. Toph looks at the sinking library.] Library sinking. [Running up to the library.] Library sinking! [Punches both fists into the library to stop it from sinking. Her feet slip in the sand, so she pauses to solidify it.] Hi-yah! [Struggles to stop it from sinking again.]
character_words: I already told you, I don't wanna snuggle.  Library sinking.  Library sinking!  Hi-yah!

full_text: [Stops running and turns back toward Wan Shi Tong.] Great Knowledge Spirit, I beg you, do not destroy your vast collection of priceless tomes.
character_words: Great Knowledge Spirit, I beg you, do not destroy your vast collection of priceless tomes.

full_text: [Runs back to Katara, Zei, and Sokka.] We've gotta get back to the surface!
character_words: We've gotta get back to the surface!

full_text: Sokka, let's go.
character_words: Sokka, let's go.

full_text: But we still don't know when the next eclipse is gonna to happen.
character_words: But we still don't know when the next eclipse is gonna to happen.

full_text: Don't be stupid! We'll find out later!
character_words: Don't be stupid! We'll find out later!

full_text: No, we won't. If we leave this place, we'll never get the information. Aang, come with me to the planetarium, [Aang runs up to him.] I need cover. Katara, take Momo and get out of here!
character_words: No, we won't. If we leave this place, we'll never get the information. Aang, come with me to the planetarium,  I need cover. Katara, take Momo and get out of here!

full_text: But ...!
character_words: But ...!

full_text: Go!
character_words: Go!

full_text: Hurry, Sokka!
character_words: Hurry, Sokka!

full_text: What is it now?
character_words: What is it now?

full_text: [Struggling.] Who's there?
character_words: Who's there?

full_text: Why are we doing this?
character_words: Why are we doing this?

full_text: Because if this calendar can tell us about eclipses in the past, then maybe it can project when the next one will be.
character_words: Because if this calendar can tell us about eclipses in the past, then maybe it can project when the next one will be.

full_text: You can't possibly check every single date.
character_words: You can't possibly check every single date.

full_text: [Adjusting the calendar wheel.] I don't have to. We just need to check every date before Sozin's Comet arrives. Because after that- well, try not to think about that.
character_words: I don't have to. We just need to check every date before Sozin's Comet arrives. Because after that- well, try not to think about that.

full_text: [Pushing the lever.] Come on, eclipse.
character_words: Come on, eclipse.

full_text: That's it! The solar eclipse! It's just a few months away. [Takes out a piece of paper and writes down the date.] Got it. Now, let's get to Ba Sing Se.
character_words: That's it! The solar eclipse! It's just a few months away.  Got it. Now, let's get to Ba Sing Se.

full_text: Don't make me put this down.
character_words: Don't make me put this down.

full_text: No! Stop sinking! [Fires three more slices of sand.] No! [Grabs the library.] I'm sorry, Appa. [Closes her eyes as the camera pans to show the sand-sailers dragging Appa away.]
character_words: No! Stop sinking!  No!  I'm sorry, Appa.

full_text: At least I'll have one specimen to add to my collection.
character_words: At least I'll have one specimen to add to my collection.

full_text: Your waterbending won't do you much good here. [Raises his head and unfolds his wings to attack.] I've studied Northern water style, Southern water style, even Foggy Swamp style.
character_words: Your waterbending won't do you much good here.  I've studied Northern water style, Southern water style, even Foggy Swamp style.

full_text: That's called Sokka style. [Swings his fist to the side as he says this.] Learn it.
character_words: That's called Sokka style.  Learn it.

full_text: Wait! Professor, let's go.
character_words: Wait! Professor, let's go.

full_text: [Sitting among a pile of books holding a scroll that surrounds him. The sand is building up and beginning to cover some of the stacks. Zei is reading a scroll. The camera slowly zooms in.] I'm not leaving. I can't. [Drops the parchment to his lap and raises his right fist.] I've spent too long trying to find this place. [Places his hand on his chest and looks up.] There's not another collection of knowledge like this on earth. [Cut to a close-up of Zei with his eyes closed. He opens his eyes while smiling and speaks wistfully.] I could spend an eternity in here.
character_words: I'm not leaving. I can't.  I've spent too long trying to find this place.  There's not another collection of knowledge like this on earth.  I could spend an eternity in here.

full_text: [Cut to a shot of Sokka and Katara looking at the professor. Katara looks up at Sokka.] Just go!
character_words: Just go!

full_text: We got it. There's a solar eclipse coming. [Jumps and hugs his sister.] The Fire Nation's in trouble now!
character_words: We got it. There's a solar eclipse coming.  The Fire Nation's in trouble now!

full_text: [Stands up and walks toward Toph.] Where's Appa?
character_words: Where's Appa?

full_text: [Enraged.] How could you let them take Appa?!  Why didn't you stop them?!
character_words: How could you let them take Appa?!  Why didn't you stop them?!

full_text: [Defensively.] I couldn't! The library was sinking! You guys were still inside and-
character_words: I couldn't! The library was sinking! You guys were still inside and-

full_text: [Still enraged.] You could've come to get us. I could've saved him!
character_words: You could've come to get us. I could've saved him!

full_text: [Turns to face him slightly.] I can hardly feel any vibrations out here. The sandbenders snuck up on me and there wasn't time for
character_words: I can hardly feel any vibrations out here. The sandbenders snuck up on me and there wasn't time for

full_text: [Snaps at Toph in a harsh way.] You just didn't care! You never liked Appa! You wanted him gone!
character_words: You just didn't care! You never liked Appa! You wanted him gone!

full_text: Aang, stop it. You know Toph did all she could. She saved our lives.
character_words: Aang, stop it. You know Toph did all she could. She saved our lives.

full_text: Who's going to save our lives now? We'll never make it out of here.
character_words: Who's going to save our lives now? We'll never make it out of here.

full_text: That's all any of you guys care about, yourselves! You don't care whether Appa is okay or not!
character_words: That's all any of you guys care about, yourselves! You don't care whether Appa is okay or not!

full_text: We're all concerned, but we can't afford to be fighting now.
character_words: We're all concerned, but we can't afford to be fighting now.

full_text: [In a cold, hard tone.] I'm going after Appa.
character_words: I'm going after Appa.

full_text: Aang, wait!
character_words: Aang, wait!

full_text: We'd better start walking. We're the only people who know about the solar eclipse. We have to get that information to Ba Sing Se.
character_words: We'd better start walking. We're the only people who know about the solar eclipse. We have to get that information to Ba Sing Se.

full_text: You think if we dig out the giant owl, he'll give us a ride?
character_words: You think if we dig out the giant owl, he'll give us a ride?

full_text: Maybe we should make camp.
character_words: Maybe we should make camp.

full_text: No please, don't stop just for me!
character_words: No please, don't stop just for me!

full_text: [Annoyed.] What now?
character_words: What now?

full_text: Colonel Mongke! What a pleasant surprise!
character_words: Colonel Mongke! What a pleasant surprise!

full_text: If you're surprised we're here, then the Dragon of the West has lost a few steps.
character_words: If you're surprised we're here, then the Dragon of the West has lost a few steps.

full_text: [Surprised.] You know these guys?
character_words: You know these guys?

full_text: Sure. Colonel Mongke and the Rough Rhinos are legendary. Each one is a different kind of weapon specialist. [The camera cuts to each member of the Rough Rhinos.] They are also a very capable singing group.
character_words: Sure. Colonel Mongke and the Rough Rhinos are legendary. Each one is a different kind of weapon specialist.  They are also a very capable singing group.

full_text: We're not here to give a concert. We're here to apprehend fugitives!
character_words: We're not here to give a concert. We're here to apprehend fugitives!

full_text: [While rubbing his arm.] Would you like some tea first? I'd love some. How about you, Kahchi? I make you as a jasmine man. Am I right?
character_words: Would you like some tea first? I'd love some. How about you, Kahchi? I make you as a jasmine man. Am I right?

full_text: Enough stalling! Round 'em up!
character_words: Enough stalling! Round 'em up!

full_text: It's nice to see old friends.
character_words: It's nice to see old friends.

full_text: Too bad you don't have any old friends that don't want to attack you.
character_words: Too bad you don't have any old friends that don't want to attack you.

full_text: [Grasping his shoulder again as he racks his brain in search of an answer.] Hmmm ... Old friends that don't want to attack me ...
character_words: Hmmm ... Old friends that don't want to attack me ...

full_text: [Annoyed.] Can't you watch where you're ... [His eyes widen in comprehension as he sees who bumped into him.]
character_words: Can't you watch where you're ...

full_text: No.
character_words: No.

full_text: Right. Sorry.
character_words: Right. Sorry.

full_text: Come on guys, we've got to stick together.
character_words: Come on guys, we've got to stick together.

full_text: If I sweat anymore, I don't think sticking together will be a problem.
character_words: If I sweat anymore, I don't think sticking together will be a problem.

full_text: Katara, can I have some more water?
character_words: Katara, can I have some more water?

full_text: Okay, but we've got to try to conserve it.
character_words: Okay, but we've got to try to conserve it.

full_text: [As he points to his mouth.] We're drinking your bending water. [He tries to define the taste of the water, smacking his lips. Disgustedly he exclaims.] You used this on the swamp guy! Urch!
character_words: We're drinking your bending water.  You used this on the swamp guy! Urch!

full_text: It does taste swampy.
character_words: It does taste swampy.

full_text: [Sad tone.] I'm sorry, it's all we have.
character_words: I'm sorry, it's all we have.

full_text: Not anymore! Look!
character_words: Not anymore! Look!

full_text: [Worried.] Sokka, wait! You shouldn't be eating strange plants!
character_words: Sokka, wait! You shouldn't be eating strange plants!

full_text: There's water trapped inside these!
character_words: There's water trapped inside these!

full_text: [Backing away from Sokka and the cactus.] I don't know ...
character_words: I don't know ...

full_text: [While cactus juice drips off his chin.] Suit yourself. It's very thirst quenching though.
character_words: Suit yourself. It's very thirst quenching though.

full_text: [In a strange echoing voice.] Drink cactus juice. It'll quench ya! Nothing's quenchier. [He crawls over the ground as a caterpillar before jumping back to the front, pushing his face toward the camera with a big smile.] It's the quenchiest!
character_words: Drink cactus juice. It'll quench ya! Nothing's quenchier.  It's the quenchiest!

full_text: Okay, I think you've had enough.
character_words: Okay, I think you've had enough.

full_text: Who lit Toph on fire?
character_words: Who lit Toph on fire?

full_text: Can I get some of that cactus?
character_words: Can I get some of that cactus?

full_text: [Wrapping her arm around Toph's shoulders.] I don't think that's a good idea. Come on, we need to find Aang.
character_words: I don't think that's a good idea. Come on, we need to find Aang.

full_text: [In awe.] How did we get out here in the middle of the ocean?
character_words: How did we get out here in the middle of the ocean?

full_text: Appa! [He glides down and lands on a dune.] Appa!
character_words: Appa!  Appa!

full_text: No ... [Yelling.] No!
character_words: No ...  No!

full_text: What is that?
character_words: What is that?

full_text: What? What is what?
character_words: What? What is what?

full_text: It's a giant mushroom! [Very excited.] Maybe it's friendly!
character_words: It's a giant mushroom!  Maybe it's friendly!

full_text: Let's just keep moving. I hope Aang's okay ...
character_words: Let's just keep moving. I hope Aang's okay ...

full_text: Friendly mushroom! Mushy giant friend!
character_words: Friendly mushroom! Mushy giant friend!

full_text: Yeah, a little barefoot blind girl and her friends passed through here a few days ago.
character_words: Yeah, a little barefoot blind girl and her friends passed through here a few days ago.

full_text: Did they give you any indication where they were headed?
character_words: Did they give you any indication where they were headed?

full_text: Maybe you could give me a little incentive?
character_words: Maybe you could give me a little incentive?

full_text: You suggesting I break your fingers?
character_words: You suggesting I break your fingers?

full_text: They went in the desert! Too bad there's almost no chance they survived.
character_words: They went in the desert! Too bad there's almost no chance they survived.

full_text: That's okay, 'cause she's wanted dead or alive.
character_words: That's okay, 'cause she's wanted dead or alive.

full_text: No she's not! I'm certain her father wants her alive.
character_words: No she's not! I'm certain her father wants her alive.

full_text: Hey, look ... Fire Nation wanted posters!
character_words: Hey, look ... Fire Nation wanted posters!

full_text: So?
character_words: So?

full_text: So, look who's here.
character_words: So, look who's here.

full_text: I'm sorry, Aang. I know it's hard for you right now but ... we need to focus on getting out of here.
character_words: I'm sorry, Aang. I know it's hard for you right now but ... we need to focus on getting out of here.

full_text: [Hopelessly.] What's the difference? We won't survive without Appa. We all know it.
character_words: What's the difference? We won't survive without Appa. We all know it.

full_text: [Encouraging.] Come on, Aang. We can do this if we work together. Right Toph?
character_words: Come on, Aang. We can do this if we work together. Right Toph?

full_text: As far as I can feel, we're trapped in a giant bowl of sand pudding. I got nothin'.
character_words: As far as I can feel, we're trapped in a giant bowl of sand pudding. I got nothin'.

full_text: [Hopeful.] Sokka? Any ideas how to find Ba Sing Se?
character_words: Sokka? Any ideas how to find Ba Sing Se?

full_text: [Pointing up at the sky.] Why don't we ask the circle birds?
character_words: Why don't we ask the circle birds?

full_text: [Grabs her head in annoyance.] Ugh ... We're getting out of this desert, and we're going to do it together! Aang, get up. Everybody, hold hands. We can do this. We have to.
character_words: Ugh ... We're getting out of this desert, and we're going to do it together! Aang, get up. Everybody, hold hands. We can do this. We have to.

full_text: I think we should stop for the night.
character_words: I think we should stop for the night.

full_text: Is there any more water?
character_words: Is there any more water?

full_text: This is the last of it. Everyone can have a little drink.
character_words: This is the last of it. Everyone can have a little drink.

full_text: [Theatrically panics, grabbing his head in despair.] Momo, no! You've killed us all!
character_words: Momo, no! You've killed us all!

full_text: No, he hasn't.
character_words: No, he hasn't.

full_text: [Relieved.] Oh, right. Bending.
character_words: Oh, right. Bending.

full_text: Sokka, let me see the things you got from the library.
character_words: Sokka, let me see the things you got from the library.

full_text: [Offended.] What?! I didn't steal anything! Who told you that? [Pointing an accusing finger at Momo.] It was you! You ratted me out!
character_words: What?! I didn't steal anything! Who told you that?  It was you! You ratted me out!

full_text: Sokka, I was there.
character_words: Sokka, I was there.

full_text: [Sadly.] It doesn't matter. None of those will tell us where Appa is.
character_words: It doesn't matter. None of those will tell us where Appa is.

full_text: No, but we can find out which way Ba Sing Se is. We can use the stars to guide us. [She pulls out a map of the stars.] That way we can travel at night when it's cool and rest during the day.
character_words: No, but we can find out which way Ba Sing Se is. We can use the stars to guide us.  That way we can travel at night when it's cool and rest during the day.

full_text: Just try to get some sleep. We'll start again in a few hours.
character_words: Just try to get some sleep. We'll start again in a few hours.

full_text: No one here is going to help us. These people just look like filthy wanderers.
character_words: No one here is going to help us. These people just look like filthy wanderers.

full_text: So do we. [Pointing at something behind Zuko.] Ah, this is interesting. I think I found our friend.
character_words: So do we.  Ah, this is interesting. I think I found our friend.

full_text: You brought us here to gamble on Pai Sho?
character_words: You brought us here to gamble on Pai Sho?

full_text: I don't think this is a gamble.
character_words: I don't think this is a gamble.

full_text: Let's take them now!
character_words: Let's take them now!

full_text: This place is full of desperate characters. If they find out we're collecting a bounty, we might have to fight them all just to keep our prize. Patience.
character_words: This place is full of desperate characters. If they find out we're collecting a bounty, we might have to fight them all just to keep our prize. Patience.

full_text: May I have this game?
character_words: May I have this game?

full_text: [Gesturing Iroh to sit down.] The guest has the first move. [Iroh places the lotus tile in the center of the board.] I see you favor the white lotus gambit. Not many still cling to the ancient ways. [He cups his hands toward Iroh.]
character_words: The guest has the first move.  I see you favor the white lotus gambit. Not many still cling to the ancient ways.

full_text: Those who do can always find a friend.
character_words: Those who do can always find a friend.

full_text: Then let us play.
character_words: Then let us play.

full_text: Welcome, brother. The White Lotus opens wide to those who know her secrets.
character_words: Welcome, brother. The White Lotus opens wide to those who know her secrets.

full_text: What are you old gasbags talking about?
character_words: What are you old gasbags talking about?

full_text: I always tried to tell you that Pai Sho is more than just a game.
character_words: I always tried to tell you that Pai Sho is more than just a game.

full_text: I'm not waiting all night for these geezers to finish yapping! [He walks over to the Pai Sho table, followed by Yu.] It's over! You two fugitives are coming with me!
character_words: I'm not waiting all night for these geezers to finish yapping!  It's over! You two fugitives are coming with me!

full_text: [Quickly places himself before Iroh and Zuko, preventing Xin Fu and Yu from reaching them.] I knew it! You two are wanted criminals with a giant bounty on your heads!
character_words: I knew it! You two are wanted criminals with a giant bounty on your heads!

full_text: I thought you said he would help!
character_words: I thought you said he would help!

full_text: [Places a hand on Zuko's shoulder to reassure him.] He is. Just watch.
character_words: He is. Just watch.

full_text: [To Yu and Xin Fu.] You think you're going to capture them and collect all that gold?
character_words: You think you're going to capture them and collect all that gold?

full_text: Gold?
character_words: Gold?

full_text: Uh ... Maybe we shouldn't.
character_words: Uh ... Maybe we shouldn't.

full_text: Come on, get up. We need to go.
character_words: Come on, get up. We need to go.

full_text: Yesterday my mouth tasted like mud. Now it just tastes like sand. I never thought I'd miss the taste of mud so much.
character_words: Yesterday my mouth tasted like mud. Now it just tastes like sand. I never thought I'd miss the taste of mud so much.

full_text: I'm awake. I couldn't sleep.
character_words: I'm awake. I couldn't sleep.

full_text: Well, we need to get moving if we want to get out of this sand pit.
character_words: Well, we need to get moving if we want to get out of this sand pit.

full_text: [Joyfully.] Appa!
character_words: Appa!

full_text: Appa? But why would Princess Yue need him? She's the moon! [Grabs Momo's tail, using it to rub his cheek.] She flies by herself!
character_words: Appa? But why would Princess Yue need him? She's the moon!  She flies by herself!

full_text: [Sadly.] It's just a cloud. Wait! A cloud! [Offers he pouch to Aang.] Here, fly up and bend the water from that cloud into my pouch.
character_words: It's just a cloud. Wait! A cloud!  Here, fly up and bend the water from that cloud into my pouch.

full_text: [Disappointed.] Wow ... there's hardly any in here.
character_words: Wow ... there's hardly any in here.

full_text: [Lashes out.] I'm sorry, okay! It's a desert cloud; I did all I could! What's anyone else doing?! [Pointing his staff at Katara.] What are you doing?!
character_words: I'm sorry, okay! It's a desert cloud; I did all I could! What's anyone else doing?!  What are you doing?!

full_text: Trying to keep everyone together. Let's just get moving. We need to head this direction.
character_words: Trying to keep everyone together. Let's just get moving. We need to head this direction.

full_text: Ow! Crud! I am so sick of not feeling where I'm going! [Pointing toward the little rocklike shaped object she tripped over.] And what idiot buried a boat in the middle of the desert?
character_words: Ow! Crud! I am so sick of not feeling where I'm going!  And what idiot buried a boat in the middle of the desert?

full_text: A boat?
character_words: A boat?

full_text: Believe me, I kicked it hard enough to feel plenty of vibrations.
