character_words: What?

full_text: No way!
character_words: No way!

full_text: Forget it!
character_words: Forget it!

full_text: [Gets a sly look on his face.] I got it, how's this from now on, we'll take food breaks and potty breaks at the same time.
character_words: I got it, how's this from now on, we'll take food breaks and potty breaks at the same time.

full_text: Hey, it might be gross, but it's efficient. Either way, we have to leave here first thing tomorrow morning.
character_words: Hey, it might be gross, but it's efficient. Either way, we have to leave here first thing tomorrow morning.

full_text: What's the matter Katara?
character_words: What's the matter Katara?

full_text: I think Appa's sick.
character_words: I think Appa's sick.

full_text: [Panicking.] What? Appa's sick? That's awful!
character_words: What? Appa's sick? That's awful!

full_text: Wow, Sokka, I didn't realize you cared so much.
character_words: Wow, Sokka, I didn't realize you cared so much.

full_text: Of course I care. I might as well just throw our schedule away now. [Pulls out his schedule. He stops and looks at the group. Cut to a shot of the rest of the gang giving him the evil eye, and he quickly changes his tone, rushing solicitously to Appa's side.] And I'm concerned because my big, furry friend doesn't feel well.
character_words: Of course I care. I might as well just throw our schedule away now.  And I'm concerned because my big, furry friend doesn't feel well.

full_text: He must have gotten sick from being in the polluted water.
character_words: He must have gotten sick from being in the polluted water.

full_text: He doesn't look sick. You okay, buddy? [Appa groans and Aang pulls out Appa's purple tongue.] His tongue is purple! That can't be good. Katara, can you heal him?
character_words: He doesn't look sick. You okay, buddy?  His tongue is purple! That can't be good. Katara, can you heal him?

full_text: It looks like he needs some medicine. Maybe we can find the right herbs in town.
character_words: It looks like he needs some medicine. Maybe we can find the right herbs in town.

full_text: Is it just me, or does this place seem different?
character_words: Is it just me, or does this place seem different?

full_text: Yeah, are the people ... happier?
character_words: Yeah, are the people ... happier?

full_text: Hey, Xu, what's going on with everyone today?
character_words: Hey, Xu, what's going on with everyone today?

full_text: [Drinks from a ladle.] Ah, something amazing happened last night. Food was delivered to our village by a mysterious and wonderful person ... the Painted Lady.
character_words: Ah, something amazing happened last night. Food was delivered to our village by a mysterious and wonderful person ... the Painted Lady.

full_text: The Painted who now?
character_words: The Painted who now?

full_text: The Painted Lady. [He places a miniature statuette of the spirit down on the counter.] She's part of our town's lore. They say she's a river spirit who watches over our town in times of need. I always thought she was just a legend. Until now.
character_words: The Painted Lady.  She's part of our town's lore. They say she's a river spirit who watches over our town in times of need. I always thought she was just a legend. Until now.

full_text: See, we don't need to help these people, they already have someone to help them. All we need is medicine for our sick friend.
character_words: See, we don't need to help these people, they already have someone to help them. All we need is medicine for our sick friend.

full_text: Medicine? Sorry, all the medicine we have goes to the factory. That's why there's so many sick people in our village.
character_words: Medicine? Sorry, all the medicine we have goes to the factory. That's why there's so many sick people in our village.

full_text: Looks like we need to stay another night so Appa can rest.
character_words: Looks like we need to stay another night so Appa can rest.

full_text: [Sighs.] I guess you're right. You got any more food to sell?
character_words: I guess you're right. You got any more food to sell?

full_text: [Goes under the counter and emerges holding a fish in each hand.] Would you like the one-headed fish, or the two-headed fish? [He turns the fish on the left sideways to show the second head.]
character_words: Would you like the one-headed fish, or the two-headed fish?

full_text: [Ponders.] Two-headed! [The rest of the group lowers their heads and small sweat drops appear.] What? You get more for your money that way! [Holds up the polluted fish.]
character_words: Two-headed!  What? You get more for your money that way!

full_text: Thank you, Painted Lady.
character_words: Thank you, Painted Lady.

full_text: Hi, Dock. Is Xu around?
character_words: Hi, Dock. Is Xu around?

full_text: Let me check ... [He runs around the shop and ducks beneath the counter to switch hats.] Hey there! Back again, are ya?
character_words: Let me check ...  Hey there! Back again, are ya?

full_text: [Pushes Sokka away.] We need more food. [Slams the money on the counter.] Our friend is still sick and we can't leave until he's better.
character_words: We need more food.  Our friend is still sick and we can't leave until he's better.

full_text: Oh, well, that's too bad. Maybe if you guys are lucky, the Painted Lady will visit you in the night, and heal your friend.
character_words: Oh, well, that's too bad. Maybe if you guys are lucky, the Painted Lady will visit you in the night, and heal your friend.

full_text: [Picks up the clams. Sarcastically.] And maybe she'll cook us a midnight snack, and we'll all have a sing-along.
character_words: And maybe she'll cook us a midnight snack, and we'll all have a sing-along.

full_text: [Not getting the sarcasm. Sokka looks annoyed now.] Yeah, may be! You know, last night she visited us again. Healed most of our sick folks.
character_words: Yeah, may be! You know, last night she visited us again. Healed most of our sick folks.

full_text: Is that why this place seems so festive?
character_words: Is that why this place seems so festive?

full_text: Yep, it's all because of the Painted Lady.
character_words: Yep, it's all because of the Painted Lady.

full_text: Can you believe how much an entire village can be affected by one lady I mean ... spirit?
character_words: Can you believe how much an entire village can be affected by one lady I mean ... spirit?

full_text: Well, I hope she returns every night. Otherwise this place would go right back to the way it was.
character_words: Well, I hope she returns every night. Otherwise this place would go right back to the way it was.

full_text: [Gets annoyed.] Why would you say that? Look how much better off these people are.
character_words: Why would you say that? Look how much better off these people are.

full_text: Yeah, now, but without her they wouldn't be able to fend for themselves. If she really wanted to help, she would use her spirit magic to blow up that factory. [He makes mocking gestures to indicate explosive spirit magic. He crosses his arms with a smile. Katara gets even more annoyed. The screen pans to the right to show Aang who has his arms crossed not impressed.]
character_words: Yeah, now, but without her they wouldn't be able to fend for themselves. If she really wanted to help, she would use her spirit magic to blow up that factory.

full_text: Spirit magic doesn't work that way, Sokka. It's more like ... [He waves his body with arms in the air making similar gestures to indicate spirit magic. Katara storms away from the two.]
character_words: Spirit magic doesn't work that way, Sokka. It's more like ...

full_text: [Sokka wraps and arm over Aang's shoulder and the two combined their little imitation but far more ridiculous.] Wooooooooo ... [Sokka chuckles.]
character_words: Wooooooooo ...

full_text: What's the matter, buddy? [Katara leaves Team Avatar.] It's her! [Excited, waves his hand to Katara and puts on his headband.] Hello, Painted Lady Spirit!
character_words: What's the matter, buddy?  It's her!  Hello, Painted Lady Spirit!

full_text: [Jumps up the hill.] Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule. [Continues to follow her down the hill as she crosses the river.] Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine! [Aang freezes some water to form stepping stones to cross the river.] I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends! [Katara moves faster, and Aang jumps on a wooden bridge. Katara runs out of the river onto the docks and notices Aang's reflection in the water. She looks up and sees Aang running across a roof.] Heeey! [He suddenly hits a pole, Katara flinches and feels sorry for him but continues on across the river to the other side. She stops to look out at the village thinking she is safe but Aang drops in front of her.] My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar. [Lifts his headband and points at his arrow.]
character_words: Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule.  Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine!  I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends!  Heeey!  My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar.

full_text: [Using a disguised voice.] Well, hello Avatar. I wish I could talk, but I am very busy.
character_words: Well, hello Avatar. I wish I could talk, but I am very busy.

full_text: Yeah, me too. I hate that. [Looks at Katara's face from behind the veil.] You know, you're really pretty spirit. I don't meet too many spirits, but the ones I do meet, not very attractive. [Looks at Katara suspiciously. Tries to look under the hat.]
character_words: Yeah, me too. I hate that.  You know, you're really pretty spirit. I don't meet too many spirits, but the ones I do meet, not very attractive.

full_text: [Giggles nervously.] Thank you, but-
character_words: Thank you, but-

full_text: You seem familiar too.
character_words: You seem familiar too.

full_text: A lot of people say that.
character_words: A lot of people say that.

full_text: [Suspicious.] No, you really seem familiar.
character_words: No, you really seem familiar.

full_text: Look, I really should get going. [Covers her face and runs, but Aang uses his airbending and blasts her hat up into the air, exposing her.]
character_words: Look, I really should get going.

full_text: Katara?
character_words: Katara?

full_text: [Guiltily.] Hi, Aang.
character_words: Hi, Aang.

full_text: [Shocked.] You're the Painted Lady? [Pointing at Katara.] But how?
character_words: You're the Painted Lady?  But how?

full_text: I wasn't her at first, I was just trying to help the village. [Takes her hat off.] But since everyone thought that's who I was anyway, I guess I just kinda became her. [Drops her hat on the ground.]
character_words: I wasn't her at first, I was just trying to help the village.  But since everyone thought that's who I was anyway, I guess I just kinda became her.

full_text: So you've been sneaking out at night? Wait, is Appa even sick?
character_words: So you've been sneaking out at night? Wait, is Appa even sick?

full_text: He might be sick of the purple berries I've been feeding him, but other than that he's fine!
character_words: He might be sick of the purple berries I've been feeding him, but other than that he's fine!

full_text: I can't believe you lied to everyone, so you could help these people.
character_words: I can't believe you lied to everyone, so you could help these people.

full_text: I'm sorry, I know I shouldn't have ...
character_words: I'm sorry, I know I shouldn't have ...

full_text: [Happily.] No, I think it's great! You're like a secret hero!
character_words: No, I think it's great! You're like a secret hero!

full_text: Well, if you wanna help, there's one more thing I have to do.
character_words: Well, if you wanna help, there's one more thing I have to do.

full_text: You wanna destroy this factory?
character_words: You wanna destroy this factory?

full_text: Yes. Sokka was just kidding, but he was right. Getting rid of this factory is the only way to help these people permanently.
character_words: Yes. Sokka was just kidding, but he was right. Getting rid of this factory is the only way to help these people permanently.

full_text: Shhh! [Quietly.] We don't wanna wake Sokka. [She turns and sees that Sokka and Toph are awake.] Hi, Sokka, we were just out on a morning walk!
character_words: Shhh!  We don't wanna wake Sokka.  Hi, Sokka, we were just out on a morning walk!

full_text: [Angrily and disappointed.] Oh, really? A morning walk? [Dumps the hay out of Katara's sleeping bag.] I know you're the Painted Lady, I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and been feeding him [Sticks out his own tongue.] purpleising tongue berries! [Toph sticks out her tongue and shows that it is purple and holds up a bag of berries which Momo starts eating.] Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now!
character_words: Oh, really? A morning walk?  I know you're the Painted Lady, I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and been feeding him  purpleising tongue berries!  Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now!

full_text: And how long did you know about this?
character_words: And how long did you know about this?

full_text: [Defensively.] Hey, I just found out this morning!
character_words: Hey, I just found out this morning!

full_text: [Approaching and kneeling down with the others.] What's going on?
character_words: What's going on?

full_text: Fire Nation soldiers are heading toward the village!
character_words: Fire Nation soldiers are heading toward the village!

full_text: [To Katara.] What did you do?
character_words: What did you do?

full_text: I kind of destroyed their factory.
character_words: I kind of destroyed their factory.

full_text: You what?
character_words: You what?

full_text: [Defensively.] It was your idea!
character_words: It was your idea!

full_text: I was joking! I also said to use spirit magic and made funny noises! [Slaps his forehead.] Did you even think this through? The army is gonna blame the villagers! They're headed there right now to get revenge!
character_words: I was joking! I also said to use spirit magic and made funny noises!  Did you even think this through? The army is gonna blame the villagers! They're headed there right now to get revenge!

full_text: Well, what was I supposed to do?
character_words: Well, what was I supposed to do?

full_text: Leave! Do nothing!
character_words: Leave! Do nothing!

full_text: [Angrily.] No, I will never, ever turn my back on people who need me! [Gets up.] I'm going down to that village, and I am gonna do whatever I can.
character_words: No, I will never, ever turn my back on people who need me!  I'm going down to that village, and I am gonna do whatever I can.

full_text: Wait! I'm coming, too.
character_words: Wait! I'm coming, too.

full_text: I thought you didn't want to help.
character_words: I thought you didn't want to help.

full_text: You need me, and I will never turn my back on you.
character_words: You need me, and I will never turn my back on you.

full_text: Sokka, you really do have a heart. [The two hug.]
character_words: Sokka, you really do have a heart.

full_text: [Wiping away tears.] He really does have a heart, doesn't he?
character_words: He really does have a heart, doesn't he?

full_text: I thought we could live as neighbors, in peace. But I guess I was wrong. You steal our food, our medicine ... and then you destroy our factory.
character_words: I thought we could live as neighbors, in peace. But I guess I was wrong. You steal our food, our medicine ... and then you destroy our factory.

full_text: [Pops out of the crowd wearing Dock hat.] We didn't do any of that. [Pops out in a different place wearing his Xu hat.] Yeah, the Painted Lady brought us food. She's the one that healed our sick, not your medicine.
character_words: We didn't do any of that.  Yeah, the Painted Lady brought us food. She's the one that healed our sick, not your medicine.

full_text: [Holding a statuette.] Oh, right, the mysterious Painted Lady did it. And I suppose she drew the army emblem on your containers, too. [Throws the statuette at the container, smashing it. The crowd gasps.] This is a town of thieves and liars! [Firebends a blast at a house. Mockingly.] Where's your Painted Lady now? We're going to cure the world of this wretched village.
character_words: Oh, right, the mysterious Painted Lady did it. And I suppose she drew the army emblem on your containers, too.  This is a town of thieves and liars!  Where's your Painted Lady now? We're going to cure the world of this wretched village.

full_text: Light it again!
character_words: Light it again!

full_text: Look at that! Where's it coming from?
character_words: Look at that! Where's it coming from?

full_text: I don't know. Something strange is going on.
character_words: I don't know. Something strange is going on.

full_text: It's the Painted Lady. [Grins slyly. Ominous tone.] She's coming.
character_words: It's the Painted Lady.  She's coming.

full_text: There is no Painted Lady!
character_words: There is no Painted Lady!

full_text: What is that sound?
character_words: What is that sound?

full_text: Maybe it is her.
character_words: Maybe it is her.

full_text: Do something! [Pushes his soldiers forward. As they timidly draw near, they are rattled by a blast of airbending. Aang is shown hiding beneath the dock. The two soldiers run off. To the remaining soldiers.] Stand your ground! [Katara waterbends two jet skis into a nearby cliff. As she raises her hand to wreak further damage, the soldiers jump into the remaining jet skis and speed off, leaving Mung.] I'll take care of you myself.
character_words: Do something!  Stand your ground!  I'll take care of you myself.

full_text: Leave this village and never come back.
character_words: Leave this village and never come back.

full_text: I knew you'd come.
character_words: I knew you'd come.

full_text: Thank you!
character_words: Thank you!

full_text: Painted Lady, you're the best!
character_words: Painted Lady, you're the best!

full_text: Me and my brothers really owe you a lot. [Looking at her and her faded Painted Lady marks.] Hey, wait a minute! I know you! You're not the Painted Lady, you're that colonial girl!
character_words: Me and my brothers really owe you a lot.  Hey, wait a minute! I know you! You're not the Painted Lady, you're that colonial girl!

full_text: Yeah, you're the lady that gave me a fish.
character_words: Yeah, you're the lady that gave me a fish.

full_text: [Angrily.] You've been tricking us. You're a waterbender!
character_words: You've been tricking us. You're a waterbender!

full_text: She's a waterbender!
character_words: She's a waterbender!

full_text: How dare you act like our Painted Lady!
character_words: How dare you act like our Painted Lady!

full_text: Maybe she is a waterbender, but she was just trying to help you. Because of her, that factory won't be polluting your river, and the army is gone. You should be down on your knees thanking her!
character_words: Maybe she is a waterbender, but she was just trying to help you. Because of her, that factory won't be polluting your river, and the army is gone. You should be down on your knees thanking her!

full_text: Sokka, it's okay. [She steps forward and moves Sokka back. To the villagers.] I shouldn't have acted like someone I wasn't, and I shouldn't have tricked you. But I felt like I had to do something. It doesn't matter if the Painted Lady is real or not. Because your problems are real, and this river is real. You can't wait around for someone to help you. You have to help yourself.
character_words: Sokka, it's okay.  I shouldn't have acted like someone I wasn't, and I shouldn't have tricked you. But I felt like I had to do something. It doesn't matter if the Painted Lady is real or not. Because your problems are real, and this river is real. You can't wait around for someone to help you. You have to help yourself.

full_text: She's right, but what should we do?
character_words: She's right, but what should we do?

full_text: [Pops out from behind the little boy's mother and uses a lower voice.] Maybe we can clean the river!
character_words: Maybe we can clean the river!

full_text: Yeah, we can clean the river! [The crowd cheers.] Thank you. You know, you're not so bad for a waterbender.
character_words: Yeah, we can clean the river!  Thank you. You know, you're not so bad for a waterbender.

full_text: You wouldn't mind keeping that a secret, by the way, would you?
character_words: You wouldn't mind keeping that a secret, by the way, would you?

full_text: No problem. Keeping my mouth shut is a personal specialty. My brother Xu, on the other hand, ohh, he's a blabbermouth. [Sokka facepalms.]
character_words: No problem. Keeping my mouth shut is a personal specialty. My brother Xu, on the other hand, ohh, he's a blabbermouth.

full_text: So, Dock, are you gonna help us clean?
character_words: So, Dock, are you gonna help us clean?

full_text: No, ma'am. I'm going to get my other brother, Bushi. He loves cleaning rivers. [Dock brazenly switches hats right in front of them.] All right, I'm Bushi! Let's get some river cleaning done!
character_words: No, ma'am. I'm going to get my other brother, Bushi. He loves cleaning rivers.  All right, I'm Bushi! Let's get some river cleaning done!

full_text: Aha, I knew it! I knew you were the same guy. You're the shop owner and the boat guy.
character_words: Aha, I knew it! I knew you were the same guy. You're the shop owner and the boat guy.

full_text: Oh, you must be talking about my brothers, Dock and Xu.
character_words: Oh, you must be talking about my brothers, Dock and Xu.

full_text: [Annoyed.] No, I just saw you! You switched hats and called yourself a different name!
character_words: No, I just saw you! You switched hats and called yourself a different name!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Oh, you know who does that? My brother, Dock. [Conspiratorial whisper.] He's crazy. [Goes off chuckling.]
character_words: Oh, you know who does that? My brother, Dock.  He's crazy.

full_text: Thank you. [Slowly disappears.]
character_words: Thank you.

full_text: Wow, this is amazing to watch.
character_words: Wow, this is amazing to watch.

full_text: Kind of makes you realize how insignificant we are.
character_words: Kind of makes you realize how insignificant we are.

full_text: [Close-up. Causally.] Eh, you've seen nothing once, you've seen it a thousand times.
character_words: Eh, you've seen nothing once, you've seen it a thousand times.

full_text: Oh man, [Close-up. Standing.] you've never not seen anything like this.
character_words: Oh man,  you've never not seen anything like this.

full_text: The fire is gonna destroy that town!
character_words: The fire is gonna destroy that town!

full_text: Not if we can stop it!
character_words: Not if we can stop it!

full_text: [Jumps onto Appa's head, taking the reins.] There's a creek over here. I'll bend the water onto the fire. [Signals Appa to take off.]
character_words: There's a creek over here. I'll bend the water onto the fire.

full_text: [Frontal view of Toph, Sokka, and Aang.] Toph, let's make a trench to stop the fire from coming any closer.
character_words: Toph, let's make a trench to stop the fire from coming any closer.

full_text: What should I do?
character_words: What should I do?

full_text: [Slight pause, points at Momo.] Keep an eye on Momo.
character_words: Keep an eye on Momo.

full_text: So what, I'm just a lemur sitter? [Pets Momo; sarcastically.] There, there, feel better?
character_words: So what, I'm just a lemur sitter?  There, there, feel better?

full_text: Sokka, stand clear!
character_words: Sokka, stand clear!

full_text: [Side-view of the crash site with Sokka and Momo looking left.] Right. [Picks up Momo and makes to move away.] Staying clear, got it.
character_words: Right.  Staying clear, got it.

full_text: Good work, everybody.
character_words: Good work, everybody.

full_text: Look at you, [Frontal view.] you're just a fat disgusting old man. [Panning aerial view from behind.] You do nothing, you say nothing, you just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig. [Frontal view of Poon as Iroh continues to eat.] You're a disgrace. [Spits on the floor in front of him and leaves.]
character_words: Look at you,  you're just a fat disgusting old man.  You do nothing, you say nothing, you just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig.  You're a disgrace.

full_text: These people have no idea [Closer side-view of the three.] how close they were to getting toasted last night.
character_words: These people have no idea  how close they were to getting toasted last night.

full_text: Yeah, the worst thing about being in disguise is that we don't get the hero worship anymore. I miss the love.
character_words: Yeah, the worst thing about being in disguise is that we don't get the hero worship anymore. I miss the love.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Boo-hoo, [Shot of Sokka from behind looking back.] poor heroes. [Turns away.]
character_words: Boo-hoo,  poor heroes.

full_text: What's your problem? You haven't even touched your smoked sea slug.
character_words: What's your problem? You haven't even touched your smoked sea slug.

full_text: It's just, all you guys can do this awesome bending stuff like putting out forest fires, and flying around and [Side-view of Toph, Aang and Katara.] making other stuff fly around. I can't fly around, okay? [View of Sokka from behind.] I can't do anything.
character_words: It's just, all you guys can do this awesome bending stuff like putting out forest fires, and flying around and  making other stuff fly around. I can't fly around, okay?  I can't do anything.

full_text: That's not true. No one can read a map like you.
character_words: That's not true. No one can read a map like you.

full_text: I can't read at all!
character_words: I can't read at all!

full_text: Yeah, and who keeps us laughing with sarcastic comments all the time? [Frontal view of Katara and Aang.] I mean, look at Katara's hair, right? What's up with that?
character_words: Yeah, and who keeps us laughing with sarcastic comments all the time?  I mean, look at Katara's hair, right? What's up with that?

full_text: What? What's wrong with my hair? [Blushes.]
character_words: What? What's wrong with my hair?

full_text: [Realizing his mistake.] Nothing. I was just trying to ...
character_words: Nothing. I was just trying to ...

full_text: Look, I appreciate the effort, [Cut to view from behind.] but the fact is each of you is so amazing and so special and I'm ... not. [Side-view close-up.] I'm just the guy in the group who's regular.
character_words: Look, I appreciate the effort,  but the fact is each of you is so amazing and so special and I'm ... not.  I'm just the guy in the group who's regular.

full_text: [Approaches and sits next to him.] I'm sorry you're feeling so down but I hope you know, none of us see you that way. [Frontal view of the two. Looks down for a moment before putting her hand on his shoulder.] I know something that's going to make you feel better.
character_words: I'm sorry you're feeling so down but I hope you know, none of us see you that way.  I know something that's going to make you feel better.

full_text: [Side-view.] You do?
character_words: You do?

full_text: Shopping! [Clapping excitedly. Runs toward the camera. Cut to side-view as he approaches to view some weapons.] Maybe a little something to reinvigorate my battling. [Spots some nunchaku.] Hey, how about these? [Frontal view of Sokka. Sokka tests the nunchaku, making attacking noises, but he hits himself on the head and falls into some of the other weapons.]
character_words: Shopping!  Maybe a little something to reinvigorate my battling.  Hey, how about these?

full_text: [Off-screen.] What do you think? [Cut to Aang as the camera pans up to see him wearing strange, scary armor.] Pretty slick, huh? [Close-up of Katara with a scared and surprised expression. Side-view of Katara approaching Aang, holding a hand up to avoid the glare coming off Aang's helmet.] All I need to complete the outfit is a wind sword.
character_words: What do you think?  Pretty slick, huh?  All I need to complete the outfit is a wind sword.

full_text: What's a wind sword?
character_words: What's a wind sword?

full_text: It's where I get a sword handle and then I just swing this around and bend air out like a blade. [Raises a sword handle, swishing it around like a sword.] Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh.
character_words: It's where I get a sword handle and then I just swing this around and bend air out like a blade.  Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh.

full_text: Yeah ... nice.
character_words: Yeah ... nice.

full_text: I'll just stick to what I got.
character_words: I'll just stick to what I got.

full_text: [Close-up.] Ooh! [Walks to the sword. Side-view of Sokka inspecting the sword.] That's what Sokka's talking about.
character_words: Ooh!  That's what Sokka's talking about.

full_text: You have a good eye. [Aerial view of Sokka as shopkeeper approaches.] That's an original from Piandao, [Katara, Toph and Aang approach.] the greatest swordsmaster and sword maker in Fire Nation history. [Close-up.] He lives in the big castle up the road from here. [Walks away.]
character_words: You have a good eye.  That's an original from Piandao,  the greatest swordsmaster and sword maker in Fire Nation history.  He lives in the big castle up the road from here.

full_text: [Side-view of group.] That's it! That's what you needed all along, Sokka.
character_words: That's it! That's what you needed all along, Sokka.

full_text: A sword?
character_words: A sword?

full_text: Not the sword, a master. [Sokka takes the sword from the rack.] We've all had masters to help us get better. You should see if you can study with Piandao.
character_words: Not the sword, a master.  We've all had masters to help us get better. You should see if you can study with Piandao.

full_text: [Frontal view of Sokka with Katara behind.] That's a great idea. I could've never gotten to where I am without Master Pakku. Everyone needs a teacher.
character_words: That's a great idea. I could've never gotten to where I am without Master Pakku. Everyone needs a teacher.

full_text: [Side-view of group.] I learned from badgermoles. They don't talk, but they're still good teachers.
character_words: I learned from badgermoles. They don't talk, but they're still good teachers.

full_text: [Close-up. Pulling out the blade, inspecting it.] It would be nice to be a master sword fighter. All right, I'll talk to him.
character_words: It would be nice to be a master sword fighter. All right, I'll talk to him.

full_text: [A little annoyed.] Can I help you?
character_words: Can I help you?

full_text: I've come to train with the master.
character_words: I've come to train with the master.

full_text: [Side-view of both.] You should know The Master turns almost everyone away. [Holds hand out in front of Sokka.] What did you bring him to prove your worth?
character_words: You should know The Master turns almost everyone away.  What did you bring him to prove your worth?

full_text: [Frontal view.] Well, uhh ... [Feels around, patting his clothes for something to offer.]
character_words: Well, uhh ...

full_text: [Frontal view.] Right ... [Shakes head sadly.] Let's get this over with.
character_words: Right ...  Let's get this over with.

full_text: Master, my name is Sokka, and I wish to be instructed in the way of the sword.
character_words: Master, my name is Sokka, and I wish to be instructed in the way of the sword.

full_text: Sokka. That's an unusual name.
character_words: Sokka. That's an unusual name.

full_text: [Frontal view. Nervously.] Oh, uh, really, uh where I come from, the Fire Nation colonies, it's a pretty normal name ... for Fire Nation colonials.
character_words: Oh, uh, really, uh where I come from, the Fire Nation colonies, it's a pretty normal name ... for Fire Nation colonials.

full_text: [Side-view. Writing calligraphy on a piece of parchment.] Let me guess. You've come hundreds of miles from your little village where you're the best swordsman in town. And you think you deserve to learn from the master.
character_words: Let me guess. You've come hundreds of miles from your little village where you're the best swordsman in town. And you think you deserve to learn from the master.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Well, actually, I've been all over the world.
character_words: Well, actually, I've been all over the world.

full_text: [Side-view of his arm and hand as he continues to write. Knowingly.] Yep, here we go.
character_words: Yep, here we go.

full_text: [Frontal view.] And I know one thing for sure: [Gets down on his knees and hangs his head.] I have a lot to learn.
character_words: And I know one thing for sure:  I have a lot to learn.

full_text: [Shot from behind. Glancing back.] You're not doing a very good job of selling yourself.
character_words: You're not doing a very good job of selling yourself.

full_text: [Side-view of room.] I know. Your butler told me that when I met you, I would have to prove my worth. [Close-up.] But the truth is ... I don't know if I am worthy.
character_words: I know. Your butler told me that when I met you, I would have to prove my worth.  But the truth is ... I don't know if I am worthy.

full_text: [Close-up side-view.] Hm, I see. [Smiles and turns his head. Cut to his hand picking up his sword.] Well, then, [Close-up of Sokka.] let's find out together how worthy you are.
character_words: Hm, I see.  Well, then,  let's find out together how worthy you are.

full_text: I will train you.
character_words: I will train you.

full_text: [Frontal view.] The first thing you must learn is that your weapon is an extension of yourself. [Cut further away as he unsheathes his sword and begins performing a sword form.] You must think of it as another part of your own body.
character_words: The first thing you must learn is that your weapon is an extension of yourself.  You must think of it as another part of your own body.

full_text: [Close-up.] Like a second head.
character_words: Like a second head.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Well, more like an extra-long, really sharp arm. [Side-view of both. Continuing his demonstration.] The sword is a simple tool, but in the hands of a master it becomes [Close-up.] the most versatile of weapons, [Frontal view from below. Sheathes his sword and assumes a stance.] and just as the imagination is limitless, [Close-up of Sokka smiling in amazement.] so too are the possibilities of the sword.
character_words: Well, more like an extra-long, really sharp arm.  The sword is a simple tool, but in the hands of a master it becomes  the most versatile of weapons,  and just as the imagination is limitless,  so too are the possibilities of the sword.

full_text: What should we do today?
character_words: What should we do today?

full_text: I'm tapped out. I already picked my toes, twice.
character_words: I'm tapped out. I already picked my toes, twice.

full_text: Twice?
character_words: Twice?

full_text: The first time was for cleaning, but the second time's just for the sweet picking sensation!
character_words: The first time was for cleaning, but the second time's just for the sweet picking sensation!

full_text: Sokka's been in charge of the schedule. I'm not sure what we should be doing.
character_words: Sokka's been in charge of the schedule. I'm not sure what we should be doing.

full_text: [Frontal view of Aang with Toph behind. Picking her nose.] Plus, it's so hot today.
character_words: Plus, it's so hot today.

full_text: [Attempting to joke.] How hot is it?
character_words: How hot is it?

full_text: I dunno. Real hot?
character_words: I dunno. Real hot?

full_text: [Camera pans across to show Katara.] I-It's so hot, it's so hot ... Momo is shedding like Appa. [Pets Momo and flicks tufts of fur from her fingers.] Huh, huh?
character_words: I-It's so hot, it's so hot ... Momo is shedding like Appa.  Huh, huh?

full_text: I guess the jokes don't run in the family.
character_words: I guess the jokes don't run in the family.

full_text: Oh, everyone's a critic.
character_words: Oh, everyone's a critic.

full_text: The warrior practices a variety of arts to keep his mind sharp and fluid. [Flattens out a piece of paper on the table.] The first you will learn is calligraphy. [Cut to his hands as Piandao delicately hands a brush to Sokka, who takes it, messing the bristles up with his thumb.] Write your name.
character_words: The warrior practices a variety of arts to keep his mind sharp and fluid.  The first you will learn is calligraphy.  Write your name.

full_text: [Close-up. Skeptical.] Writing my name will make me a better swordsman?
character_words: Writing my name will make me a better swordsman?

full_text: [Takes the brush and positions it correctly in Sokka's hand. Cut to a wide shot of both.] When you write your name, you stamp the paper with your identity. You must learn to use your sword to stamp your identity on a battlefield. [Sokka holds his sleeve back. Cut to close-up of the ink as Sokka dips the brush in to it. Cut to frontal view of Sokka readying himself to paint as Piandao looks on.] Remember, you cannot take back a stroke of the brush, or a stroke of the sword.
character_words: When you write your name, you stamp the paper with your identity. You must learn to use your sword to stamp your identity on a battlefield.  Remember, you cannot take back a stroke of the brush, or a stroke of the sword.

full_text: [Close-up as he moves forward.] You are getting ink on your face.
character_words: You are getting ink on your face.

full_text: [Frontal view of both.] I am? [Looks at the brush.] I am! So this is about putting my identity on the page, right?
character_words: I am?  I am! So this is about putting my identity on the page, right?

full_text: Landscape painting teaches a warrior to hold the lay of the land in his mind.
character_words: Landscape painting teaches a warrior to hold the lay of the land in his mind.

full_text: In battle, you only have an instant to take everything in.
character_words: In battle, you only have an instant to take everything in.

full_text: Now, paint it.
character_words: Now, paint it.

full_text: And no peeking.
character_words: And no peeking.

full_text: I'm finished!
character_words: I'm finished!

full_text: [Frontal view.] You added a rainbow.
character_words: You added a rainbow.

full_text: [Frontal view. Worried.] Is that okay?
character_words: Is that okay?

full_text: [Off-screen.] Sokka.
character_words: Sokka.

full_text: [Close-up.] Concentrate on what you're doing.
character_words: Concentrate on what you're doing.

full_text: Rock gardening teaches the warrior to manipulate his surroundings and use them to his advantage.
character_words: Rock gardening teaches the warrior to manipulate his surroundings and use them to his advantage.

full_text: Hm, manipulate them to my advantage ... oh!
character_words: Hm, manipulate them to my advantage ... oh!

full_text: Hey, would you mind grabbing a cold drink for me?
character_words: Hey, would you mind grabbing a cold drink for me?

full_text: I'll take a slice of lemon in mine, please.
character_words: I'll take a slice of lemon in mine, please.

full_text: What's going on in there?
character_words: What's going on in there?

full_text: Crazy old man.
character_words: Crazy old man.

full_text: So where are we going next? [Cut to a shot of Aang and Katara sitting around a map of the Fire Nation. Pointing to the map.] We're starting from here ...
character_words: So where are we going next?  We're starting from here ...

full_text: [Pointing at a different spot.] No, we're over on this island.
character_words: No, we're over on this island.

full_text: [Lying down.] You noodle-brains don't know what you're doing. I miss Sokka.
character_words: You noodle-brains don't know what you're doing. I miss Sokka.

full_text: Ooh, I got one, if you miss him so much, why don't you marry him?
character_words: Ooh, I got one, if you miss him so much, why don't you marry him?

full_text: You've had a good first day of training.
character_words: You've had a good first day of training.

full_text: [Frontal view.] I have? But I thought I messed up every single thing we worked on!
character_words: I have? But I thought I messed up every single thing we worked on!

full_text: [Frontal view of feet. Camera pans up to his face.] You messed things up in a very special way. You are ready for a real sword.
character_words: You messed things up in a very special way. You are ready for a real sword.

full_text: [Frontal view. Excited.] Are you giving me one of yours?
character_words: Are you giving me one of yours?

full_text: [Frontal view.] No.
character_words: No.

full_text: [Frontal view. Camera zooms in on his face.] Your sword must be an extension of yourself. So tomorrow, you will make your own sword.
character_words: Your sword must be an extension of yourself. So tomorrow, you will make your own sword.

full_text: Choosing the correct material is the most important step in crafting a sword. [Close-up and zooms out showing the steel in front of him.] You must trust your steel with your life. Choose carefully.
character_words: Choosing the correct material is the most important step in crafting a sword.  You must trust your steel with your life. Choose carefully.

full_text: Master, [Side-view of Sokka looking at Piandao.] would it be possible for me to leave and bring back a special material for my sword?
character_words: Master,  would it be possible for me to leave and bring back a special material for my sword?

full_text: [Side-view of Piandao looking at Sokka.] I wouldn't have it any other way.
character_words: I wouldn't have it any other way.

full_text: [Excitedly.] Sokka's coming!
character_words: Sokka's coming!

full_text: Hey, guys. What are you doing?
character_words: Hey, guys. What are you doing?

full_text: Sokka!
character_words: Sokka!

full_text: You're back!
character_words: You're back!

full_text: [Close-up of Sokka and Katara with Aang in the foreground.] We missed you so much!
character_words: We missed you so much!

full_text: [Close-up as he steps back slightly.] Say something funny!
character_words: Say something funny!

full_text: [Close-up. Confused.] Funny how?
character_words: Funny how?

full_text: [Side-view of Sokka with Toph in the foreground. To Toph.] What's their deal?
character_words: What's their deal?

full_text: [Turns away, blushing and smiling.] I don't know. They missed you or something. I didn't care.
character_words: I don't know. They missed you or something. I didn't care.

full_text: [Overhead side-view of group.] Thanks. That warms my heart. Anyway, I need some help.
character_words: Thanks. That warms my heart. Anyway, I need some help.

full_text: Who's this?
character_words: Who's this?

full_text: [Overhead view from behind Piandao.] Oh, these are my friends. Just other good Fire Nation folks. [They bow to Piandao. Cut to Piandao, who bows back. The camera zooms out to show the meteorite and Sokka.] Do you think we can make a sword out of a meteorite?
character_words: Oh, these are my friends. Just other good Fire Nation folks.  Do you think we can make a sword out of a meteorite?

full_text: [Close-up.] We'll make a sword unlike any other in the world.
character_words: We'll make a sword unlike any other in the world.

full_text: Sokka, when you first arrived, you were so unsure. You even seemed down on yourself. [Frontal view of Piandao as the camera pans across to the right revealing Fat.] But I saw something in you right away. [Side-view of Sokka.] I saw a heart as strong as a lion turtle, and twice as big. [Side-view of the room.] And as we trained, it wasn't your skills that impressed me. [Fat kneels to Piandao and gives him the sword. Frontal view of Piandao as he turns back to face the camera.] No, it certainly wasn't your skills. [Brief close-up of Sokka, who looks down in shame, before cutting back to a close-up of Piandao.] You showed something beyond that. [Unsheathes the sword, showing its black blade. Cut to side-view of Piandao as the camera zooms out and follows the blade as he strikes out to the side.] Creativity, versatility, [Frontal view of Sokka with the sword in the foreground.] intelligence ... [Sokka looks down.] these are the traits that define a great swordsman. [Side-view of Piandao as he sheathes the sword.] And these are the traits that define you. [Kneels and presents the sword to Sokka. Cut to frontal view of Sokka, from Piandao's perspective, who takes it.] You told me you didn't know if you were worthy, [Close-up shot as he stands up.] but I believe that you are more worthy than any man I have ever trained.
character_words: Sokka, when you first arrived, you were so unsure. You even seemed down on yourself.  But I saw something in you right away.  I saw a heart as strong as a lion turtle, and twice as big.  And as we trained, it wasn't your skills that impressed me.  No, it certainly wasn't your skills.  You showed something beyond that.  Creativity, versatility,  intelligence ...  these are the traits that define a great swordsman.  And these are the traits that define you.  You told me you didn't know if you were worthy,  but I believe that you are more worthy than any man I have ever trained.

full_text: I'm sorry, Master. You're wrong. [Close-up of Piandao.] I am not worthy. [Side-view of Sokka.] I'm not who you think I am. I'm not from the Fire Nation. I'm from the Southern Water Tribe. [Cut to side-view of Aang, Katara, and Toph who all gawk at Sokka with shock and disbelief. Close-up side-view of Piandao and Sokka.] I lied so that I could learn swordsmanship from you. I'm sorry. [Offering his sword back.]
character_words: I'm sorry, Master. You're wrong.  I am not worthy.  I'm not who you think I am. I'm not from the Fire Nation. I'm from the Southern Water Tribe.  I lied so that I could learn swordsmanship from you. I'm sorry.

full_text: [Close-up.] I'm sorry, too.
character_words: I'm sorry, too.

full_text: No, this is my fight, alone.
character_words: No, this is my fight, alone.

full_text: You used to be the pride of the Fire Nation. Our top general, the Dragon of the West. Now, look at you. [Drops the food to the floor. Cut to aerial shot of the floor as the trays contents go everywhere. Iroh grabs a green fruit from behind the bars. Cut to close-up of Iroh on the ground as he moves the fruit to his mouth.] Look what you've become.
character_words: You used to be the pride of the Fire Nation. Our top general, the Dragon of the West. Now, look at you.  Look what you've become.

full_text: Excellent! [Close-up.] Using your superior agility against an older opponent ... smart.
character_words: Excellent!  Using your superior agility against an older opponent ... smart.

full_text: Good use of terrain ... fighting from the high ground.
character_words: Good use of terrain ... fighting from the high ground.

full_text: Yes, use your surroundings. [Piandao deflects the attacks as Sokka runs away. Sokka grabs two stalks and pulls them back before releasing them. They whip around at Piandao, who slices through them.] Make them fight for you!
character_words: Yes, use your surroundings.  Make them fight for you!

full_text: Very resourceful.
character_words: Very resourceful.

full_text: Excellent work, Sokka.
character_words: Excellent work, Sokka.

full_text: I think I'm a little old to be fighting the Avatar.
character_words: I think I'm a little old to be fighting the Avatar.

full_text: How did you know?
character_words: How did you know?

full_text: Oh, I've been around a while. You pick things up. [Wipes the dirt off his face with the cloth.] Of course, I knew from the beginning that Sokka was Water Tribe. [Close-up of Sokka.] You might want to think of a better Fire Nation cover name. [Camera zooms out to show Piandao.] Try "Lee." There's a million "Lees". [Sips his drink.].
character_words: Oh, I've been around a while. You pick things up.  Of course, I knew from the beginning that Sokka was Water Tribe.  You might want to think of a better Fire Nation cover name.  Try "Lee." There's a million "Lees". .

full_text: But why would you agree to train someone from the Water Tribe?
character_words: But why would you agree to train someone from the Water Tribe?

full_text: [Close-up.] The way of the sword doesn't belong to any one nation. [Frontal shot of Piandao, Sokka and Fat as the other three look on, their backs to the camera.] Knowledge of the arts belongs to us all. [Gives his sword to Fat. Cut to Sokka's sword as he pulls it out of the ground. Cut to side-view of Piandao and Sokka as Piandao gives the sword back to Sokka.] Sokka, you must continue your training on your own. [Close-up.] If you stay on this path, I know that one day [Close-up.] you will become an even greater master than I am.
character_words: The way of the sword doesn't belong to any one nation.  Knowledge of the arts belongs to us all.  Sokka, you must continue your training on your own.  If you stay on this path, I know that one day  you will become an even greater master than I am.

full_text: Wait! [Everyone turns to him. Side-view.] The Master wanted you to have this, as something to remember him by.
character_words: Wait!  The Master wanted you to have this, as something to remember him by.

full_text: It's a Pai Sho tile.
character_words: It's a Pai Sho tile.

full_text: The White Lotus. Huh.
character_words: The White Lotus. Huh.

full_text: What does it mean?
character_words: What does it mean?

full_text: [Cut to close-up of Aang and Sokka as Fat is seen in the background closing the doors. Sokka and Aang look back and the camera zooms in on the doors, clearly showing a lotus design on the doors surrounding the Fire Nation symbol.] I have no idea. [Overhead view. Sokka reaches into his pocket.] Ooh, that reminds me! Toph, I thought you might like this [Close-up view of Sokka offering her a chunk of the meteorite.] since you've probably never had a chance to bend space earth before.
character_words: I have no idea.  Ooh, that reminds me! Toph, I thought you might like this  since you've probably never had a chance to bend space earth before.

full_text: [Taking the rock. Side-view.] Sweet! [Cut to a close-up of the space earth floating between Toph's hands. She shapes it into a swirl, a star, and a splatter shaped similar to the Nickelodeon logo.] Check this out.
character_words: Sweet!  Check this out.

full_text: You know, I don't think there's such a thing as "space earth". If it's from space, then it's not really "earth".
character_words: You know, I don't think there's such a thing as "space earth". If it's from space, then it's not really "earth".

full_text: Must you ruin everything?
character_words: Must you ruin everything?

full_text: I can't believe I missed you.
character_words: I can't believe I missed you.

full_text: I'm so excited to spend the weekend on Ember Island. [Cuts to close-up of her, Azula, and Zuko and Mai, who are revealed to have been sitting on a bench behind the two girls.] It's going to be great to hang out on the beach and do nothing. [Places her hands behind her head, imitating a relaxed position.]
character_words: I'm so excited to spend the weekend on Ember Island.  It's going to be great to hang out on the beach and do nothing.

full_text: [Cut to closer view of Zuko and Mai. Angrily.] Doing nothing is a waste of time. [Rises from his seat next to Mai.] We're being sent away on a forced vacation. [Walks over and grips the railing of the boat.] I feel like a child.
character_words: Doing nothing is a waste of time.  We're being sent away on a forced vacation.  I feel like a child.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Lighten up. So Dad wants to meet with his advisers alone, without anyone else around. Don't take it personally.
character_words: Lighten up. So Dad wants to meet with his advisers alone, without anyone else around. Don't take it personally.

full_text: [Wide-view of the group from behind Azula and Ty Lee. To Azula.] Doesn't your family have a house on Ember Island?
character_words: Doesn't your family have a house on Ember Island?

full_text: [Turns head toward Ty Lee; nostalgically.] We used to come every summer when we were kids.
character_words: We used to come every summer when we were kids.

full_text: That must have been fun!
character_words: That must have been fun!

full_text: [Frontal view. Distantly.] That was a long time ago.
character_words: That was a long time ago.

full_text: Welcome to Ember Island, kids.
character_words: Welcome to Ember Island, kids.

full_text: [Whispering.] It smells like old lady in here.
character_words: It smells like old lady in here.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Gee, I wonder why.
character_words: Gee, I wonder why.

full_text: [Side-view of Ty Lee as she inspects a painting of two young women in yellow bikinis posing back-to-back. Lo and Li approach. Raises arm and points at it.] Who are these two beautiful women? [Cut to close-up of the painting as she speaks.]
character_words: Who are these two beautiful women?

full_text: [Camera pans out to Lo and Li, now standing in front of the painting.] Can't you tell?
character_words: Can't you tell?

full_text: [They both imitate the painting.] It's Lo and me.
character_words: It's Lo and me.

full_text: [At the same time.] It's Li and me.
character_words: It's Li and me.

full_text: Ooh, I love the seashell bedspread. [Rubs the pillow admiringly.]
character_words: Ooh, I love the seashell bedspread.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Are you serious? It looks like the beach threw up all over it.
character_words: Are you serious? It looks like the beach threw up all over it.

full_text: [Cut to panning shot of the room. Ty Lee sits lays on the bed in the foreground as the camera pans right to show Lo and Li standing to the left of Zuko, Mai, and Azula.] We know you're upset that you were forced to come here this weekend.
character_words: We know you're upset that you were forced to come here this weekend.

full_text: But Ember Island is a magical place. [Side-view. Pans around to reveal both sisters.] Keep an open mind.
character_words: But Ember Island is a magical place.  Keep an open mind.

full_text: Give it a chance.
character_words: Give it a chance.

full_text: [In unison.] And it can help you understand yourselves and each other.
character_words: And it can help you understand yourselves and each other.

full_text: [Cut to close-up of three rocks on a table. Grabs a smooth rock. Cut to frontal view of the sisters from behind Azula, Ty Lee, and Zuko.] The beach has a special way ...
character_words: The beach has a special way ...

full_text: [Takes the rock from Lo. Cut close-up as she speaks.] ... of smoothing even the most ragged edges.
character_words: ... of smoothing even the most ragged edges.

full_text: [They clap twice.] Time to hit the beach!
character_words: Time to hit the beach!

full_text: Aang, I know swimming is fun and all, [Cut to frontal view of Katara wringing water out of her hair, Aang swimming in the background, and Sokka fishing. Toph sits with her back to the camera in the foreground.] but do you really think you should be exposing yourself like that? [Frontal view.] Cover up.
character_words: Aang, I know swimming is fun and all,  but do you really think you should be exposing yourself like that?  Cover up.

full_text: [Frontal view as he swims along in the water. Defensively, but innocently.] What? I'm wearing trunks.
character_words: What? I'm wearing trunks.

full_text: I know. [Frontal view of Katara looking on as Toph sits in the background.] It's your tattoos I'm worried about. What if someone sees you?
character_words: I know.  It's your tattoos I'm worried about. What if someone sees you?

full_text: [Turns to Toph.] There are walls all around us. It's completely safe.
character_words: There are walls all around us. It's completely safe.

full_text: [Completely unamused.] This has got to be the most boring job in the Fire Nation. [Close-up of the other watchman who sniffs the back edge of his sword.] Nothing ever happens.
character_words: This has got to be the most boring job in the Fire Nation.  Nothing ever happens.

full_text: [While sliding down the tunnel.] Whoa! [The guard turns his head and hides. Cut to a wide-view of the area as the two guards hide and one of them looks throw his telescope. Cut to a view through the telescope as Aang emerges from the water, with Momo.] Let's go again! [Momo chitters in response as Aang jumps out of the water. The camera pans as the telescope follows Aang's movements up the cliff. Cut to frontal view of the guards watching and shaking in horror. Cut to side-view from the other side of the rock.]
character_words: Whoa!  Let's go again!

full_text: The Avatar's alive! We'd better send a messenger hawk to the Fire Lord. [He gets up and moves off camera. Cut to a frontal view of a messenger hawk as the watchman opens the cage. The messenger hawk steps on to the watchman's arm. Cut to behind the messenger hawk as the watchman attaches a message with a black ribbon around it. Cut to frontal view as the hawk takes off and the camera pans out slightly to reveal both watchmen.]
character_words: The Avatar's alive! We'd better send a messenger hawk to the Fire Lord.

full_text: A black ribbon message. [Wide shot from behind the two guards as the hawk flies away. Enthusiastically.] This is so exciting! [The watchmen turn to each other, the other not amused as the second one chuckles.]
character_words: A black ribbon message.  This is so exciting!

full_text: Hey, you need some help unpacking?
character_words: Hey, you need some help unpacking?

full_text: Sure. Thanks. [Hands him her bag, the sheer weight of which causes him to fall over.]
character_words: Sure. Thanks.

full_text: [Close-up. Squinting from the sun. She gestures with her hand.] Could you scooch just a little bit more to the- [Cut to side-view looking up at the boy, who moves to the side to block the sun and give her shade. Cut back to close-up of Ty Lee.] Perfect. [Winks.]
character_words: Could you scooch just a little bit more to the-  Perfect.

full_text: [Picks up shell and turns to Mai.] Here. [Closer frontal view of both.] This is for you. [Offers it to her.]
character_words: Here.  This is for you.

full_text: Why would I want that?
character_words: Why would I want that?

full_text: I saw it, and I thought it was pretty. Don't girls like stuff like this?
character_words: I saw it, and I thought it was pretty. Don't girls like stuff like this?

full_text: [Scoffs.] Maybe stupid girls.
character_words: Maybe stupid girls.

full_text: [Angrily.] Forget it! [Throws the shell away.]
character_words: Forget it!

full_text: [Frontal view. Takes the shell.] Wow! Thanks. This is so pretty.
character_words: Wow! Thanks. This is so pretty.

full_text: [Frontal view of the two teens from the side of Ty Lee. The first teen showing his anger.] Not as pretty as you are.
character_words: Not as pretty as you are.

full_text: [Moves to the side of the other teen; annoyed.] That shell's not so great!
character_words: That shell's not so great!

full_text: [Close-up. Blocks her eyes.] Ahem! Shade. Shade!
character_words: Ahem! Shade. Shade!

full_text: [Closer frontal view of the two.] I thought, since it's so hot ... here. [Offers an ice cream cone, which falls out and onto Mai's lap.]
character_words: I thought, since it's so hot ... here.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Thanks. This is really refreshing.
character_words: Thanks. This is really refreshing.

full_text: [To the people playing.] Hey, beach bums, we're playing next. [Turns to Ty Lee, who is being fanned by two teenagers while a third boy holds up a blanket to give her shade. The camera zooms in on her.] Ty Lee, get over here, now!
character_words: Hey, beach bums, we're playing next.  Ty Lee, get over here, now!

full_text: See that girl with the silly pigtails? When she runs toward the ball, [Cuts to a girl with pigtails juggling the ball with her legs.] there's just the slightest hesitation of her left foot. I'm willing to bet a childhood injury has weakened her. [Cut to a view through the foursome as they look on.] Keep serving the ball to her left, and we'll destroy her and the rest of her team. [Cut to frontal view as they turn to face the other team.] Dismissed.
character_words: See that girl with the silly pigtails? When she runs toward the ball,  there's just the slightest hesitation of her left foot. I'm willing to bet a childhood injury has weakened her.  Keep serving the ball to her left, and we'll destroy her and the rest of her team.  Dismissed.

full_text: [Frontal view, camera zooms in, through the squares of the net; evilly.] Yes! We defeated you for all time! You will never rise from the ashes of your shame and humiliation! [Frontal view of Ty Lee, Mai, Zuko, and Azula. To Zuko, Mai, and Ty Lee; calmly.] Well. That was fun.
character_words: Yes! We defeated you for all time! You will never rise from the ashes of your shame and humiliation!  Well. That was fun.

full_text: [Camera zooms out slightly as Chan and Ruon-Jian approach.] I'm having a party tonight. [Frontal view.] You should come by.
character_words: I'm having a party tonight.  You should come by.

full_text: Sure. [Close-up.] I love parties.
character_words: Sure.  I love parties.

full_text: [Frontal view of Ruon-Jian and Chan. About Mai.] Your friend can come, too.
character_words: Your friend can come, too.

full_text: [Cut to Ty Lee smiling as the camera zooms out to show Azula approaching. Slightly angered.] Uh ... What about me and my brother? Aren't you going to invite us? [Frontal view of Chan and Ruon-Jian, who look at each other.] You don't know who we are, do you?
character_words: Uh ... What about me and my brother? Aren't you going to invite us?  You don't know who we are, do you?

full_text: Don't you know who we are? We're Chan and Ruon-Jian.
character_words: Don't you know who we are? We're Chan and Ruon-Jian.

full_text: Yeah.
character_words: Yeah.

full_text: [Frontal view.] But, fine, you're invited. Just so you know, though, some of the most important teenagers in the Fire Nation are gonna be at this party, so try and act normal.
character_words: But, fine, you're invited. Just so you know, though, some of the most important teenagers in the Fire Nation are gonna be at this party, so try and act normal.

full_text: [Close-up. Smiles sinisterly.] We'll do our best.
character_words: We'll do our best.

full_text: Why didn't you tell those guys who we were?
character_words: Why didn't you tell those guys who we were?

full_text: I guess I was intrigued. [Frontal view of Azula and Ty Lee from between Zuko and Mai.] I'm so used to people worshiping us.
character_words: I guess I was intrigued.  I'm so used to people worshiping us.

full_text: They should.
character_words: They should.

full_text: Yes, I know, and I love it. But, for once, I just wanted to see how people would treat us if they didn't know who we were.
character_words: Yes, I know, and I love it. But, for once, I just wanted to see how people would treat us if they didn't know who we were.

full_text: [Side-view.] Like waves washing away the footprints on the sand, [Frontal view of Mai and Zuko.] Ember Island gives everyone a clean slate.
character_words: Like waves washing away the footprints on the sand,  Ember Island gives everyone a clean slate.

full_text: [Aerial view from behind Zuko and Mai showing the entire group.] Ember Island reveals the true you.
character_words: Ember Island reveals the true you.

full_text: [They stand up, clap, snap their fingers twice each, and point upward.] To the party!
character_words: To the party!

full_text: [Confused.] Um ... You're a little early. No one's here yet.
character_words: Um ... You're a little early. No one's here yet.

full_text: [Frontal view.] I heard you telling someone you'd be partying from dusk 'till dawn. It's dusk, so we're here.
character_words: I heard you telling someone you'd be partying from dusk 'till dawn. It's dusk, so we're here.

full_text: [Frontal view.] But that's just an expression.
character_words: But that's just an expression.

full_text: [Frontal view.] We are the perfect party guests. We arrive right on time, because we are very punctual.
character_words: We are the perfect party guests. We arrive right on time, because we are very punctual.

full_text: All right, listen. My dad's an admiral. He has no idea I'm having this party, [View from behind. He turns to Azula.] so don't mess anything up.
character_words: All right, listen. My dad's an admiral. He has no idea I'm having this party,  so don't mess anything up.

full_text: [Close-up as she smiles. Side-view.] That's a sharp outfit, Chan. Careful. [Close-up.] You could puncture the hull of an empire-class Fire Nation battleship, leaving thousands to drown at sea, [Side-view. Points at Chan's outfit.] because it's so sharp.
character_words: That's a sharp outfit, Chan. Careful.  You could puncture the hull of an empire-class Fire Nation battleship, leaving thousands to drown at sea,  because it's so sharp.

full_text: [Awkwardly.] Um ... thanks.
character_words: Um ... thanks.

full_text: [Casually.] Hey! First ones here, huh?
character_words: Hey! First ones here, huh?

full_text: [Side-view of Zuko and Mai walking.] He thinks he's so great. [To Mai.] Well, what do you think of him?
character_words: He thinks he's so great.  Well, what do you think of him?

full_text: I don't have any opinion about him. I hardly know him.
character_words: I don't have any opinion about him. I hardly know him.

full_text: You like him, don't you? [Mai sighs and walks away.]
character_words: You like him, don't you?

full_text: So how do you know Ty Lee?
character_words: So how do you know Ty Lee?

full_text: I met her at the beach today. She was pretty impressed by a sand pagoda that I made for her.
character_words: I met her at the beach today. She was pretty impressed by a sand pagoda that I made for her.

full_text: [Camera zooms out slightly.] Well, I met her first.
character_words: Well, I met her first.

full_text: [Nervously.] Look, i-it doesn't matter who I met first, 'cause I like you all.
character_words: Look, i-it doesn't matter who I met first, 'cause I like you all.

full_text: [Frontal view.] But which one of us do you like?
character_words: But which one of us do you like?

full_text: Yeah.
character_words: Yeah.

full_text: Tell us.
character_words: Tell us.

full_text: [Frontal view.] I don't know! I don't know! [She kicks and punches out. Cut to behind the teens as they fall over after being chi blocked. Ty Lee cartwheels over the teens. Side-view of Azula as Ty Lee approaches.] Oh, I'm glad you're here. Those boys won't leave me alone. I guess they all just like me too much.
character_words: I don't know! I don't know!  Oh, I'm glad you're here. Those boys won't leave me alone. I guess they all just like me too much.

full_text: Come on, Ty Lee. You can't be this ignorant.
character_words: Come on, Ty Lee. You can't be this ignorant.

full_text: [Close-up.] What are you talking about?
character_words: What are you talking about?

full_text: [Frontal view over Ty Lee's shoulder.] Those boys only like you because you make it so easy for them. You're not a challenge. You're a tease. It's not like they actually care who you are. [Close-up of Ty Lee, who starts sobbing. Side-view of the two. Azula changes to a softer and gentler tone.] Okay, okay, calm down. I didn't mean what I said. [Frontal view over Ty Lee's shoulder.] Look, maybe I just said it because I was a little ... [Whispers.] jealous.
character_words: Those boys only like you because you make it so easy for them. You're not a challenge. You're a tease. It's not like they actually care who you are.  Okay, okay, calm down. I didn't mean what I said.  Look, maybe I just said it because I was a little ...  jealous.

full_text: [Frontal view over Azula's shoulder.] What? You're jealous of me? But you're the most beautiful, smartest, perfect girl in the world.
character_words: What? You're jealous of me? But you're the most beautiful, smartest, perfect girl in the world.

full_text: [Turns away.] Well, you're right about all those things. [Cut to panning shot of the room.] But, for some reason, when I meet boys, they act as if I'm going to do something horrible to them.
character_words: Well, you're right about all those things.  But, for some reason, when I meet boys, they act as if I'm going to do something horrible to them.

full_text: [Frontal view of Azula's shoulder. Giggling.] But you probably would do something horrible to them. I'm sure they're just intimidated by you. Okay, look, if you want a boy to like you, [Close-up.] just look at him and smile a lot and laugh at everything he says even if it's not funny.
character_words: But you probably would do something horrible to them. I'm sure they're just intimidated by you. Okay, look, if you want a boy to like you,  just look at him and smile a lot and laugh at everything he says even if it's not funny.

full_text: [Close-up.] Well, that sounds really shallow and stupid ... [Turns to Ty Lee.] Let's try it.
character_words: Well, that sounds really shallow and stupid ...  Let's try it.

full_text: [Side-view.] Okay. [Deep voice, imitating a boy.] Hey there, sweet sugar cakes. How you liking this party?
character_words: Okay.  Hey there, sweet sugar cakes. How you liking this party?

full_text: I'm bored.
character_words: I'm bored.

full_text: I know.
character_words: I know.

full_text: I'm hungry.
character_words: I'm hungry.

full_text: So what?
character_words: So what?

full_text: So, find me some food.
character_words: So, find me some food.

full_text: Sure. [Stands up and walks away.]
character_words: Sure.

full_text: Chan, I'm ready for a tour of the house.
character_words: Chan, I'm ready for a tour of the house.

full_text: Is this your first time on Ember Island?
character_words: Is this your first time on Ember Island?

full_text: No. I used to come here years ago.
character_words: No. I used to come here years ago.

full_text: [Side-view.] It's a great place, if you like sand. [Close-up of Azula, who laughs. Side-view.] Yeah, it's like, welcome to Sandy Land!
character_words: It's a great place, if you like sand.  Yeah, it's like, welcome to Sandy Land!

full_text: Your arms look so strong.
character_words: Your arms look so strong.

full_text: Yeah, I know. [He flexes his muscles and they kiss. Close-up of Chan after they kiss.] You're pretty.
character_words: Yeah, I know.  You're pretty.

full_text: [Close-up; softly.] Together, [Camera zooms out as she steps back; her voice grows progressively louder.] you and I will be the strongest couple in the entire world! [Creates blue fireballs in her hands.] We will dominate the Earth!
character_words: Together,  you and I will be the strongest couple in the entire world!  We will dominate the Earth!

full_text: [Shakes his head back to normal. Freaked out.] Uh ... I got to go.
character_words: Uh ... I got to go.

full_text: [Angered.] Hey, watch it! That food was for my cranky girlfriend!
character_words: Hey, watch it! That food was for my cranky girlfriend!

full_text: What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: [Close-up. Angrily.] Stop talking to my girlfriend!
character_words: Stop talking to my girlfriend!

full_text: [Side-view. Walks up to Zuko.] Relax. It's just a party.
character_words: Relax. It's just a party.

full_text: [Angrily.] Zuko, what is wrong with you?
character_words: Zuko, what is wrong with you?

full_text: What's wrong with me?
character_words: What's wrong with me?

full_text: [Scolding.] Your temper is out of control. You blow up over every little thing. You're so impatient and hotheaded and angry!
character_words: Your temper is out of control. You blow up over every little thing. You're so impatient and hotheaded and angry!

full_text: [Snapping back.] Well, at least I feel something, as opposed to you. [Frontal view from behind Mai.] You have no passion for anything! You're just a big blah!
character_words: Well, at least I feel something, as opposed to you.  You have no passion for anything! You're just a big blah!

full_text: [Turns away from Zuko.] It's over, Zuko. We're done.
character_words: It's over, Zuko. We're done.

full_text: [Frontal view. Runs up to Ruon-Jian.] Who broke my nana's vase? [Ruon-Jian points at Zuko. Cut to frontal view of Zuko and Mai. Chan runs up to him; to Zuko now.] That's it! You're out of here!
character_words: Who broke my nana's vase?  That's it! You're out of here!

full_text: [Close-up.] I was just leaving.
character_words: I was just leaving.

full_text: [Frontal view as Zuko walks away.] Have fun by yourself, loser boy.
character_words: Have fun by yourself, loser boy.

full_text: Nice.
character_words: Nice.

full_text: Guys, you're all gonna think I'm crazy, but it feels like a metal man is coming.
character_words: Guys, you're all gonna think I'm crazy, but it feels like a metal man is coming.

full_text: I thought I'd find you here.
character_words: I thought I'd find you here.

full_text: [Side-view.] Those summers we spent here seem so long ago. So much has changed.
character_words: Those summers we spent here seem so long ago. So much has changed.

full_text: Come down to the beach with me. Come on. This place is depressing.
character_words: Come down to the beach with me. Come on. This place is depressing.

full_text: [Side-view. Hesitating at first.] Hey.
character_words: Hey.

full_text: [View of both from behind. Turning to Mai.] Where's your new boyfriend? [Side-view. Mai turns away. View from behind Mai as Zuko sits down next to her.] Are you cold? [Mai slaps his hand when he tries to place it on her shoulder.]
character_words: Where's your new boyfriend?  Are you cold?

full_text: I'm freezing.
character_words: I'm freezing.

full_text: [Side-view; smiling.] I'll make a fire. [View from behind Zuko as the camera pans up to show the vacation house.] There's plenty of stuff to burn in there.
character_words: I'll make a fire.  There's plenty of stuff to burn in there.

full_text: This is crazy! How can we beat a guy who blows things up with his mind?
character_words: This is crazy! How can we beat a guy who blows things up with his mind?

full_text: [Gets up.] We can't! Jump on Appa! I'll try to distract him!
character_words: We can't! Jump on Appa! I'll try to distract him!

full_text: I'm okay. [Momo jumps on his shoulder.]
character_words: I'm okay.

full_text: Well, that was random.
character_words: Well, that was random.

full_text: [Sitting up and looking back.] I don't think so. I get the feeling he knows who we are.
character_words: I don't think so. I get the feeling he knows who we are.

full_text: What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: [Frontal view.] What does it look like I'm doing?
character_words: What does it look like I'm doing?

full_text: [Close-up aerial view of Zuko standing next to the fire.] But, it's a painting of your family.
character_words: But, it's a painting of your family.

full_text: [The camera pans up to Zuko's face; angrily.] You think I care?
character_words: You think I care?

full_text: [Off-camera.] I think you do.
character_words: I think you do.

full_text: You don't know me, so why don't you just mind your own business? [Walks away.]
character_words: You don't know me, so why don't you just mind your own business?

full_text: [Close-up. Scoffs.] I know you.
character_words: I know you.

full_text: [Frontal view.] No, you don't. [Close-up.] You're stuck in your little "Ty Lee world" where everything's great all the time.
character_words: No, you don't.  You're stuck in your little "Ty Lee world" where everything's great all the time.

full_text: Zuko, [Frontal view.] leave her alone.
character_words: Zuko,  leave her alone.

full_text: [Walks away. Frontal view of campsite. Imitating Ty Lee.] "I'm so pretty. Look at me. I can walk on my hands. Whoo!" [Does a handstand. Frontal view of Ty Lee, upset. Close-up of Zuko, as he falls to the ground. Frontal view of Ty Lee, Zuko's face in the foreground.] Circus freak.
character_words: "I'm so pretty. Look at me. I can walk on my hands. Whoo!"  Circus freak.

full_text: [Side-view. Azula giggles. Ty Lee cries.] Yes, I'm a circus freak. Go ahead and laugh all you want. You want to know why I joined the circus?
character_words: Yes, I'm a circus freak. Go ahead and laugh all you want. You want to know why I joined the circus?

full_text: Here we go.
character_words: Here we go.

full_text: [Aerial view of camp site.] Do you have any idea what my home life was like? [Frontal view.] Growing up with six sisters who look exactly like me? [She stands.] It was like I didn't even have my own name. [Side-view. Kneels down, crying.] I joined the circus [Close-up side-view.] because I was scared of spending the rest of my life as part of a matched set. At least I'm different now. [Frontal view, she lifts her head; angrily.] "Circus freak" is a compliment.
character_words: Do you have any idea what my home life was like?  Growing up with six sisters who look exactly like me?  It was like I didn't even have my own name.  I joined the circus  because I was scared of spending the rest of my life as part of a matched set. At least I'm different now.  "Circus freak" is a compliment.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Guess that explains why you need ten boyfriends, too.
character_words: Guess that explains why you need ten boyfriends, too.

full_text: [Frontal view over Mai's shoulder; balls her hands into fists and points them on her hips.] I'm sorry, what?
character_words: I'm sorry, what?

full_text: [Frontal view.] Attention issues. You couldn't get enough attention when you were a kid, so you're trying to make up for it now.
character_words: Attention issues. You couldn't get enough attention when you were a kid, so you're trying to make up for it now.

full_text: [Close-up.] Well, what's your excuse, Mai? You were an only child for fifteen years, but even with all that attention, your aura is this dingy, pasty, gray ...
character_words: Well, what's your excuse, Mai? You were an only child for fifteen years, but even with all that attention, your aura is this dingy, pasty, gray ...

full_text: [Frontal view.] I don't believe in auras.
character_words: I don't believe in auras.

full_text: [Camera pans right. Getting up.] Yeah, you do not believe in anything.
character_words: Yeah, you do not believe in anything.

full_text: [Close-up; sarcastically.] Oh, well, I'm sorry I can't be as high-strung and crazy as the rest of you.
character_words: Oh, well, I'm sorry I can't be as high-strung and crazy as the rest of you.

full_text: [Aerial view of campsite. Walking up to the campfire.] I'm sorry, too. I wish you would be high-strung and crazy for once instead of keeping all your feeling bottled up inside. [Frontal view.] She just called your aura dingy. Are you gonna take that?
