character_words: I'm sorry, too. I wish you would be high-strung and crazy for once instead of keeping all your feeling bottled up inside.  She just called your aura dingy. Are you gonna take that?

full_text: [Aerial view of campsite. Leaning back.] What do you want from me? You want a teary confession about how hard my childhood was? Well, it wasn't. [Close-up.] I was a rich only child who got anything I wanted ... as long as I behaved [Cut to shot of the sky.] and sat still, and didn't speak unless spoken to. [Close-up of Zuko.] My mother said I had to keep out of trouble. We had my dad's political career to think about.
character_words: What do you want from me? You want a teary confession about how hard my childhood was? Well, it wasn't.  I was a rich only child who got anything I wanted ... as long as I behaved  and sat still, and didn't speak unless spoken to.  My mother said I had to keep out of trouble. We had my dad's political career to think about.

full_text: [Side-view of campsite.] Well, that's it, then. [Close-up.] You have a controlling mother who had certain expectations, and if you strayed from them, you were shut down. That's why you're afraid to care about anything, and why you can't express yourself.
character_words: Well, that's it, then.  You have a controlling mother who had certain expectations, and if you strayed from them, you were shut down. That's why you're afraid to care about anything, and why you can't express yourself.

full_text: [Frontal view.] You want me to express myself? [Stands up and yells.] Leave me alone!
character_words: You want me to express myself?  Leave me alone!

full_text: [Side-view of campsite. Frontal view of Zuko.] I like it when you express yourself. [Approaching, attempting to put a hand on her shoulder.]
character_words: I like it when you express yourself.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Don't touch me! I'm still mad at you. [She sits.]
character_words: Don't touch me! I'm still mad at you.

full_text: [Side-view of Mai.] My life hasn't been that easy either, Mai.
character_words: My life hasn't been that easy either, Mai.

full_text: Whatever. That doesn't excuse the way you've been acting.
character_words: Whatever. That doesn't excuse the way you've been acting.

full_text: Calm down, you guys. [Frontal view of her and Azula.] This much negative energy is bad for your skin. You'll totally break out.
character_words: Calm down, you guys.  This much negative energy is bad for your skin. You'll totally break out.

full_text: Bad skin? [Frontal view.] Normal teenagers worry about bad skin. I don't have that luxury. [Leaning forward.] My father decided to teach me a permanent lesson on my face! [Points to his scar.]
character_words: Bad skin?  Normal teenagers worry about bad skin. I don't have that luxury.  My father decided to teach me a permanent lesson on my face!

full_text: [Frontal view of Azula and Ty Lee from behind Zuko. Apologetically.] Sorry, Zuko, I ...
character_words: Sorry, Zuko, I ...

full_text: [Turning around.] For so long I thought that if my dad accepted me, I'd be happy. I'm back home now, my dad talks to me. Ha! He even thinks I'm a hero. [Close-up of Azula, who smiles.] Everything should be perfect, right? [Aerial view of campsite.] I should be happy now, but I'm not. [Turning back to the others.] I'm angrier than ever and I don't know why!
character_words: For so long I thought that if my dad accepted me, I'd be happy. I'm back home now, my dad talks to me. Ha! He even thinks I'm a hero.  Everything should be perfect, right?  I should be happy now, but I'm not.  I'm angrier than ever and I don't know why!

full_text: [Frontal view.] There's a simple question you need to answer, then. Who are you angry at?
character_words: There's a simple question you need to answer, then. Who are you angry at?

full_text: [Close-up.] No one. I'm just angry.
character_words: No one. I'm just angry.

full_text: [Side-view of the three girls.] Yeah, who are you angry at, Zuko?
character_words: Yeah, who are you angry at, Zuko?

full_text: [Close-up.] Everyone. I don't know. [Becoming frustrated.]
character_words: Everyone. I don't know.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Is it Dad?
character_words: Is it Dad?

full_text: [Close-up.] No, no.
character_words: No, no.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Your uncle?
character_words: Your uncle?

full_text: Me?
character_words: Me?

full_text: [Close-up.] No, no, n-no, no!
character_words: No, no, n-no, no!

full_text: [Close-up.] Then who? Who are you angry at?
character_words: Then who? Who are you angry at?

full_text: [Camera pans left, past Ty Lee, to Azula.] Answer the question, Zuko.
character_words: Answer the question, Zuko.

full_text: [Close-up.] Talk to us.
character_words: Talk to us.

full_text: [Extreme close-up.] Come on, answer the question.
character_words: Come on, answer the question.

full_text: Come on, answer it.
character_words: Come on, answer it.

full_text: [Frontal view from behind the girls. Losing it now; furiously.] I'm angry at myself!
character_words: I'm angry at myself!

full_text: Why?
character_words: Why?

full_text: [Close-up.] Because I'm confused. Because I'm not sure I know the difference between right and wrong anymore.
character_words: Because I'm confused. Because I'm not sure I know the difference between right and wrong anymore.

full_text: You're pathetic.
character_words: You're pathetic.

full_text: [View from behind Zuko.] I know one thing I care about. [Walks up to Zuko. Frontal view.] I care about you. [They kiss.]
character_words: I know one thing I care about.  I care about you.

full_text: [Claps. Camera zooms out to show her as Mai and Zuko turn.] Well, those were wonderful performances, everyone.
character_words: Well, those were wonderful performances, everyone.

full_text: [Frontal view.] I guess you wouldn't understand, would you, Azula? [He puts an arm around Mai.] Because you're just so perfect.
character_words: I guess you wouldn't understand, would you, Azula?  Because you're just so perfect.

full_text: [Frontal view.] Well, yes, I guess you're right. I don't have sob stories like all of you. I could sit here and complain how our mom liked Zuko more than me, but I don't really care. [Gazes into the fire. Close-up view of the fire pit.] My own mother [Close-up.] thought I was a monster. [Close-up of Zuko and Mai. Close-up of Ty Lee. Side-view of campsite. After a momentary pause.] She was right, of course, but it still hurt.
character_words: Well, yes, I guess you're right. I don't have sob stories like all of you. I could sit here and complain how our mom liked Zuko more than me, but I don't really care.  My own mother  thought I was a monster.  She was right, of course, but it still hurt.

full_text: What Lo and Li said came true. The beach did help us learn about ourselves. [She picks up a rock and rubs it, smiling. Close-up.] I feel all smoothed. I'll always remember this.
character_words: What Lo and Li said came true. The beach did help us learn about ourselves.  I feel all smoothed. I'll always remember this.

full_text: [Side-view of campsite. Standing up.] You know what would make this trip really memorable?
character_words: You know what would make this trip really memorable?

full_text: [Frontal view.] We've got some bad news, Chan.
character_words: We've got some bad news, Chan.

full_text: [Camera zooms in quickly to Zuko. Turns to look at Chan.] Party's over.
character_words: Party's over.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Aang, it's time you learn of my history with Fire Lord Sozin. [Cut to a close-up of Aang's face in his dream, before cutting back to Roku.] You need to understand how the war began, if you want to know how to end it. [Cut to an overhead shot of Roku's island.] Meet me on my home island on the day of the summer solstice.
character_words: Aang, it's time you learn of my history with Fire Lord Sozin.  You need to understand how the war began, if you want to know how to end it.  Meet me on my home island on the day of the summer solstice.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Talking in his sleep.] Okay, Roku.
character_words: Okay, Roku.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Reading the scroll.] You need to know the story of your great-grandfather's demise. It will reveal your own destiny. [He closes the scroll, and stares down the hallway.]
character_words: You need to know the story of your great-grandfather's demise. It will reveal your own destiny.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: There it is. That's Roku's home.
character_words: There it is. That's Roku's home.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Confused.] But, there's nothing here.
character_words: But, there's nothing here.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Yes, there is. An entire village, hundreds of houses ... [A strong breeze moves a layer of ash along the ground, brushing past their feet.] all completely buried in ash.
character_words: Yes, there is. An entire village, hundreds of houses ...  all completely buried in ash.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: It's never too early for a sitting with the court painter, Zuko. Make sure he gets your good side.
character_words: It's never too early for a sitting with the court painter, Zuko. Make sure he gets your good side.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Wait, I need to ask you something. [Azula stops walking.] What do you remember about our great-grandfather's history?
character_words: Wait, I need to ask you something.  What do you remember about our great-grandfather's history?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [She sighs.] Oh, Zuko, it's so strange how your mind works. [Cut to an overhead shot of the hall, as Azula tells Zuko about Sozin's history.] Fire Lord Sozin began the war, of course. [Cut to Fire Lord Sozin's portrait, as it pans from the bottom to the top.] He spent his early years secretly preparing for it. He was as patient as he was clever. He famously waited for the comet, later renamed Sozin's Comet, and used its power to launch his full-scale invasion of the world. [Cut back to Zuko and Azula.] In the end, he died a very old and successful man.
character_words: Oh, Zuko, it's so strange how your mind works.  Fire Lord Sozin began the war, of course.  He spent his early years secretly preparing for it. He was as patient as he was clever. He famously waited for the comet, later renamed Sozin's Comet, and used its power to launch his full-scale invasion of the world.  In the end, he died a very old and successful man.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: But how did he die?
character_words: But how did he die?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Turning toward Zuko.] Didn't you pay any attention in school, Zuko? He died peacefully, in his sleep. [Cut to a shot of the full room, as Azula walks away.] He was ancient.
character_words: Didn't you pay any attention in school, Zuko? He died peacefully, in his sleep.  He was ancient.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: What does it mean?
character_words: What does it mean?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Reading.] The Fire Sages keep the secret history in the Dragonbone Catacombs.
character_words: The Fire Sages keep the secret history in the Dragonbone Catacombs.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Reading aloud.] The final testimony of Fire Lord Sozin.
character_words: The final testimony of Fire Lord Sozin.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Come, Aang.
character_words: Come, Aang.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [He climbs on Fang, who flies off.] Where're we going?
character_words: Where're we going?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: To visit my past. [He smiles at Aang, as Aang grins widely.] Our shared past.
character_words: To visit my past.  Our shared past.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Narrating his history.] As I feel my own life dimming, I can't help but think of a time when everything was so much brighter.
character_words: As I feel my own life dimming, I can't help but think of a time when everything was so much brighter.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: I remember my friend.
character_words: I remember my friend.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Looks like I win again, Roku. [Extends a hand to help Roku to his feet.]
character_words: Looks like I win again, Roku.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Are you kidding? [Takes Sozin's hands and gets up.] The tree root did all the work. [After getting up, he pats Sozin on his shoulders.] Nice one, Sozin.
character_words: Are you kidding?  The tree root did all the work.  Nice one, Sozin.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Surprised.] You were friends with Fire Lord Sozin?
character_words: You were friends with Fire Lord Sozin?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Back then, he was just Prince Sozin. [Cut to a close-up of Roku's face.] And he was my best friend.
character_words: Back then, he was just Prince Sozin.  And he was my best friend.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Nudging Roku.] Say something to her.
character_words: Say something to her.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Love is hard when you are young.
character_words: Love is hard when you are young.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: You don't have to tell me.
character_words: You don't have to tell me.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Putting his hand over Aang's shoulder.] Don't worry, it gets better. [He turns back and walks, along with Aang.] Now, come with me. [Cut to a celebration on a courtyard.] We have a party to attend.
character_words: Don't worry, it gets better.  Now, come with me.  We have a party to attend.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Wait, whose party is it?
character_words: Wait, whose party is it?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to the young Roku and Prince Sozin.] Sozin and I shared many things, including a birthday.
character_words: Sozin and I shared many things, including a birthday.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Did something happen to my father?
character_words: Did something happen to my father?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: No, Prince Sozin. We are not here for you. [Shot cuts to the Fire Sage talking.] We're here to announce the identity of the next Avatar. [The crowd whispers, as the shot cut to Roku and Sozin, both in shock. Cut again to a close-up of the Sages. The Sages bow to the new Avatar.] It is our honor to serve you, Avatar Roku.
character_words: No, Prince Sozin. We are not here for you.  We're here to announce the identity of the next Avatar.  It is our honor to serve you, Avatar Roku.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Soon the day came when my friend Roku had to leave the Fire Nation and face his destiny as the Avatar. [Cut to a close-up of Zuko's face, as he reads.] He needed to travel the world so he could master the other elements.
character_words: Soon the day came when my friend Roku had to leave the Fire Nation and face his destiny as the Avatar.  He needed to travel the world so he could master the other elements.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Hey, why aren't you packed yet, all-powerful Avatar?
character_words: Hey, why aren't you packed yet, all-powerful Avatar?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Sozin leaps in the room, attempting to demonstrate examples of all the bending disciplines.] Come on, show me how it's done using all four kinds of bending.
character_words: Come on, show me how it's done using all four kinds of bending.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: I started packing, but then the Fire Sages told me I won't need any worldly possessions anymore.
character_words: I started packing, but then the Fire Sages told me I won't need any worldly possessions anymore.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Oh. [He sits down near Roku.]
character_words: Oh.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: It happened so fast. Everything's gonna be different now.
character_words: It happened so fast. Everything's gonna be different now.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Here, hope you're at least allowed to have this. [Shot cuts to a close-up of the headpiece.]
character_words: Here, hope you're at least allowed to have this.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: But this is a royal artifact. [Cut to a shot of the friends from behind.] It's supposed to be worn by the Crown Prince.
character_words: But this is a royal artifact.  It's supposed to be worn by the Crown Prince.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: I want you to have it.
character_words: I want you to have it.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Do they have bathrooms in the Spirit World?
character_words: Do they have bathrooms in the Spirit World?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Raises his forefinger.] As a matter of fact, they do not.
character_words: As a matter of fact, they do not.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Excited.] Hey, we're almost at the Southern Air Temple!
character_words: Hey, we're almost at the Southern Air Temple!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: This was the first stop on my Avatar journey.
character_words: This was the first stop on my Avatar journey.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: It was the place where I was trained to master airbending.
character_words: It was the place where I was trained to master airbending.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: And also where I met an old friend of yours: Monk Gyatso.
character_words: And also where I met an old friend of yours: Monk Gyatso.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: No way!
character_words: No way!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Hey, Gyatso, you wanna see a new glider trick? [He flies up and loops twice.]
character_words: Hey, Gyatso, you wanna see a new glider trick?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Laughing.] Check this out! [He flips himself over and stands on top of his glider. Cut to Aang and Roku.]
character_words: Check this out!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: He's air surfing! I can't believe I never thought of that.
character_words: He's air surfing! I can't believe I never thought of that.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Smiling and surprised.] That's amazing! I can't believe you were friends with Monk Gyatso just like I was!
character_words: That's amazing! I can't believe you were friends with Monk Gyatso just like I was!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Camera pans back to show Roku.] Some friendships are so strong, [He closes his eyes.] they can even transcend lifetimes.
character_words: Some friendships are so strong,  they can even transcend lifetimes.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: After my years mastering airbending, I traveled to the Northern Water Tribe.
character_words: After my years mastering airbending, I traveled to the Northern Water Tribe.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Waterbending was especially challenging for me. But in time, I mastered it as well.
character_words: Waterbending was especially challenging for me. But in time, I mastered it as well.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: I moved on to the Earth Kingdom.
character_words: I moved on to the Earth Kingdom.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: My earthbending master, Sud, was uncompromising, stubborn, and blunt ...
character_words: My earthbending master, Sud, was uncompromising, stubborn, and blunt ...

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: ... And a lifelong friend.
character_words: ... And a lifelong friend.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: It was bitter work ... [The camera pans back to Roku, as he moves his arms to bend the different elements.] but the results were worth it. [He starts by waterbending, before moving on to earthbending, firebending, and finally, airbending. The camera zooms out to an aerial view of Roku at the center of the four elements.]
character_words: It was bitter work ...  but the results were worth it.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Twelve long years passed before I saw my friend again. When Roku returned, he was a fully realized Avatar, and I had changed as well.
character_words: Twelve long years passed before I saw my friend again. When Roku returned, he was a fully realized Avatar, and I had changed as well.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Sozin! Or should I say, Fire Lord!
character_words: Sozin! Or should I say, Fire Lord!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Scene changes to Sozin from below him. Serious.] Customarily, my subjects bow before greeting me. [He walks down from his throne.] But you're the exception. [He smiles and hugs Roku.]
character_words: Customarily, my subjects bow before greeting me.  But you're the exception.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: After all these years, he was still my best friend. [Scene changes to a wedding ceremony and celebration in a Fire Nation courtyard, with many guests attending. Cut to Roku, on whose right is Sozin, holding a scroll.] And a few months later, he was my best man.
character_words: After all these years, he was still my best friend.  And a few months later, he was my best man.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [As Roku lifts the veil.] Roku, it's that girl who didn't even know you're alive!
character_words: Roku, it's that girl who didn't even know you're alive!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Ta Min. I was persistent. [She stands up near Roku.] When love is real, it finds a way. [The attendees clap, as the newly-wed couple bow their heads. Cut to a shot of the couple from the side, as Aang and Roku watch.] And being the Avatar doesn't hurt your chances with the ladies, either.
character_words: Ta Min. I was persistent.  When love is real, it finds a way.  And being the Avatar doesn't hurt your chances with the ladies, either.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: On wedding days, we look to the future with optimism and joy. [Fade to Sozin in deep thought.] I had my own vision for a brighter future.
character_words: On wedding days, we look to the future with optimism and joy.  I had my own vision for a brighter future.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Leaning toward Ta Min.] Excuse me. May I borrow him for a moment?
character_words: Excuse me. May I borrow him for a moment?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: It's not very traditional, but, okay.
character_words: It's not very traditional, but, okay.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: What's on your mind?
character_words: What's on your mind?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Raises his fist slightly.] I've been thinking hard about the state of the world lately.
character_words: I've been thinking hard about the state of the world lately.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Putting his arm over Sozin's shoulder.] Sozin, it is my wedding! Have a cookie, dance with someone, lighten up!
character_words: Sozin, it is my wedding! Have a cookie, dance with someone, lighten up!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Smiling slightly.] I know, I know, but just hear me out. [Roku bows in agreement. Cut to a shadowed side-shot of the balcony as they walk.] Right from the start, I was destined to be Fire Lord. And although we didn't always know it, you were destined to be the Avatar. [Cut to a close-up side-shot of the two. Roku stops as Sozin continues on.] It's an amazing stroke of fate we know each other so well, isn't it? Together, we could do ... anything.
character_words: I know, I know, but just hear me out.  Right from the start, I was destined to be Fire Lord. And although we didn't always know it, you were destined to be the Avatar.  It's an amazing stroke of fate we know each other so well, isn't it? Together, we could do ... anything.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [The camera pans toward Roku. Now serious.] Yeah, we could.
character_words: Yeah, we could.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to a shot of the Fire Nation from the balcony.] Our nation is enjoying an unprecedented time of peace and wealth. Our people are happy, and we're so fortunate in so many ways.
character_words: Our nation is enjoying an unprecedented time of peace and wealth. Our people are happy, and we're so fortunate in so many ways.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Concerned.] Where are you going with this?
character_words: Where are you going with this?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: I've been thinking, we should share this prosperity with the rest of the world. [Cut to a shocked Roku with the camera closing in on him.] In our hands is the most successful empire in history. [Back to a close-up of Sozin.] It's time we expanded it.
character_words: I've been thinking, we should share this prosperity with the rest of the world.  In our hands is the most successful empire in history.  It's time we expanded it.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: No! The four nations are meant to be just that: four.
character_words: No! The four nations are meant to be just that: four.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to Sozin.] Roku, you haven't even stopped to consider the possibilities.
character_words: Roku, you haven't even stopped to consider the possibilities.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to a close-up side-shot of Roku.] There are no possibilities. This is the last I want to hear [Closes his eyes.] about this. [He walks away from the balcony, with an angry expression on his face.]
character_words: There are no possibilities. This is the last I want to hear  about this.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [His spirit speaks to Aang.] That was my first real test as the Avatar. Unfortunately, it was many years before I learned [Cut to a extreme close-up of Sozin.] that Sozin [Sozin narrows his eyes. Fade to a back-shot of Fang flying with Roku.] had gone ahead with his plan, despite my warning.
character_words: That was my first real test as the Avatar. Unfortunately, it was many years before I learned  that Sozin  had gone ahead with his plan, despite my warning.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Angry.] I've seen the colonies, Sozin. [Points at Sozin.] How dare you occupy Earth Kingdom territory!
character_words: I've seen the colonies, Sozin.  How dare you occupy Earth Kingdom territory!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to Sozin, as Roku walks up to him.] How dare you, a citizen of the Fire Nation, address your Fire Lord this way. [Cut to a close-up of Sozin's face from the side.] Your loyalty is to our nation first. Anything less makes you a traitor.
character_words: How dare you, a citizen of the Fire Nation, address your Fire Lord this way.  Your loyalty is to our nation first. Anything less makes you a traitor.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Don't do this, Sozin. Don't challenge me. It will only end badly. It's over.
character_words: Don't do this, Sozin. Don't challenge me. It will only end badly. It's over.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: I'm sparing you, Sozin. [Cut to a frontal shot of Roku.] I'm letting you go in the name of our past friendship. But I warn you. [Cut to a extreme close up of Roku.] Even a single step out of line will result in your permanent end.
character_words: I'm sparing you, Sozin.  I'm letting you go in the name of our past friendship. But I warn you.  Even a single step out of line will result in your permanent end.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Sozin and I didn't speak or see each other for twenty-five years after our battle. [Cut to Roku's house.] I spent most of my spare time here, at my home.
character_words: Sozin and I didn't speak or see each other for twenty-five years after our battle.  I spent most of my spare time here, at my home.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Let's go! [He catches his wife's hand, and airbends smoke and ash in their way, creating a path, as both run through the path he created.]
character_words: Let's go!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Roku's island was a hundred miles away. But I could still feel it rumbling and see the black plume of smoke. I had never seen anything like this catastrophe.
character_words: Roku's island was a hundred miles away. But I could still feel it rumbling and see the black plume of smoke. I had never seen anything like this catastrophe.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: This is amazing, Roku! You're battling a volcano, and you're winning.
character_words: This is amazing, Roku! You're battling a volcano, and you're winning.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Unfortunately, my success didn't last long, Aang. There was no way I could do it all.
character_words: Unfortunately, my success didn't last long, Aang. There was no way I could do it all.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [To Aang.] Battling the elements was hard enough. I had to do it while I could barely breathe. The poisonous, volcanic gases were overwhelming.
character_words: Battling the elements was hard enough. I had to do it while I could barely breathe. The poisonous, volcanic gases were overwhelming.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Airbends a jet of gases.] It's all right Fang! [Coughs.] Get out of here! I'm fine!
character_words: It's all right Fang!  Get out of here! I'm fine!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Need a hand, old friend?
character_words: Need a hand, old friend?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [A surprised Roku turns back.] Sozin?
character_words: Sozin?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: There's not a moment to waste.
character_words: There's not a moment to waste.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Don't breathe the toxic gas.
character_words: Don't breathe the toxic gas.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Shaking, Cut to Roku's point of view. He lifts his hands to look at them, as they blur out of focus.] It's too much.
character_words: It's too much.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Please.
character_words: Please.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Without you, all my plans are suddenly possible. [Cut to Roku.] I have a vision for the future, Roku.
character_words: Without you, all my plans are suddenly possible.  I have a vision for the future, Roku.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Who's ... wait, that's me, isn't it? [Cut to a long shot of three Air Nomads. A nun holds up the baby to the light while two people, presumably the infant's parents, stand in the shadows.]
character_words: Who's ... wait, that's me, isn't it?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Make sense of our past, Aang. [Cut to Roku and Aang.] And you will bring peace, and restore balance in the world. [He slowly disappears.]
character_words: Make sense of our past, Aang.  And you will bring peace, and restore balance in the world.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Roku? Roku!
character_words: Roku? Roku!

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: With Roku gone, and the great comet returning, the timing was perfect to change the world. [Cut to Sozin, standing on a balcony, from the behind, looking at his soldiers and the Fire Navy ships.] I knew the next Avatar would be born an Air Nomad. So I wiped out the Air Temples. [Scene changes to a burning temple. The camera slowly fades into an extreme close-up of Sozin's face.] But somehow, the new Avatar eluded me. [Scene changes to Fire Navy ships searching in the polar regions.] I wasted the remainder of my life searching in vain. [Cut to underside of the ship.] I know he's hiding out there somewhere. [Camera pans below to show the iceberg Aang was trapped in.] The Fire Nation's greatest threat ... the last airbender.
character_words: With Roku gone, and the great comet returning, the timing was perfect to change the world.  I knew the next Avatar would be born an Air Nomad. So I wiped out the Air Temples.  But somehow, the new Avatar eluded me.  I wasted the remainder of my life searching in vain.  I know he's hiding out there somewhere.  The Fire Nation's greatest threat ... the last airbender.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: That can't be it! Where's the rest of it? [He searches the scroll to find more information.]
character_words: That can't be it! Where's the rest of it?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Angrily.] You sent this, didn't you? I found the secret history, which by the way should be renamed history most people already know! The note said that I needed to know about my great-grandfather's death, but he was still alive in the end.
character_words: You sent this, didn't you? I found the secret history, which by the way should be renamed history most people already know! The note said that I needed to know about my great-grandfather's death, but he was still alive in the end.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Looking up at Zuko.] No, he wasn't.
character_words: No, he wasn't.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Confused.] What are you talking about?
character_words: What are you talking about?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: You have more than one great-grandfather, Prince Zuko. Sozin was your father's grandfather. [Cut to a bewildered Zuko.] Your mother's grandfather was Avatar Roku.
character_words: You have more than one great-grandfather, Prince Zuko. Sozin was your father's grandfather.  Your mother's grandfather was Avatar Roku.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Shocked.] Why are you telling me this?
character_words: Why are you telling me this?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Because understanding the struggle between your two great-grandfathers can help you better understand the battle within yourself. [Zuko sits down, with his head facing down.] Evil and good are always at war inside you, Zuko. It is your nature, your legacy. But, there is a bright side. [Zuko looks up.] What happened generations ago can be resolved now, by you. Because of your legacy, you alone can cleanse the sins of our family and the Fire Nation. Born in you, along with all the strife, is the power to restore balance to the world.
character_words: Because understanding the struggle between your two great-grandfathers can help you better understand the battle within yourself.  Evil and good are always at war inside you, Zuko. It is your nature, your legacy. But, there is a bright side.  What happened generations ago can be resolved now, by you. Because of your legacy, you alone can cleanse the sins of our family and the Fire Nation. Born in you, along with all the strife, is the power to restore balance to the world.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: This is a royal artifact. It's supposed to be worn [Zuko stands.] by the Crown Prince.
character_words: This is a royal artifact. It's supposed to be worn  by the Crown Prince.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: You mean, after all Roku and Sozin went through together, even after Roku showed him mercy, Sozin betrayed him like that?
character_words: You mean, after all Roku and Sozin went through together, even after Roku showed him mercy, Sozin betrayed him like that?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to Toph.] It's like these people are born bad.
character_words: It's like these people are born bad.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to Aang from the side, with Sokka standing near him.] No, that's wrong. I don't think that was the point of what Roku showed me at all.
character_words: No, that's wrong. I don't think that was the point of what Roku showed me at all.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Shrugging.] Then what was the point?
character_words: Then what was the point?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Cut to Katara, Toph and Sokka from the behind, as Aang speaks.] Roku was just as much Fire Nation as Sozin was, right? If anything, their story proves anyone's capable of great good and great evil. [Cut to an aerial shot of the hardened lava wave.] Everyone, even the Fire Lord and the Fire Nation have to be treated like they're worth giving a chance. [Shot cuts to a close-up of Aang's face.] And I also think it was about friendships.
character_words: Roku was just as much Fire Nation as Sozin was, right? If anything, their story proves anyone's capable of great good and great evil.  Everyone, even the Fire Lord and the Fire Nation have to be treated like they're worth giving a chance.  And I also think it was about friendships.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Camera pans to Toph, and cuts to a close-up of her face.] Do you really think friendships can last more than one lifetime?
character_words: Do you really think friendships can last more than one lifetime?

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Catching Toph's hand.] I don't see why not.
character_words: I don't see why not.

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: Well, scientifically speaking, there's no way to prove that ...
character_words: Well, scientifically speaking, there's no way to prove that ...

chapter: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
full_text: [Annoyed.] Oh, Sokka, just hold hands.
character_words: Oh, Sokka, just hold hands.

full_text: [Angrily.] How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!
character_words: How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!

full_text: [Crosses her arms.] You brought this on yourself. I had no choice. [Turns away from Toph with her arms folded.]
character_words: You brought this on yourself. I had no choice.

full_text: Okay. I'm ready for some training.
character_words: Okay. I'm ready for some training.

full_text: Good job, Twinkle Toes. Visualize, then attack.
character_words: Good job, Twinkle Toes. Visualize, then attack.

full_text: Maybe you should take your own advice, Toph!
character_words: Maybe you should take your own advice, Toph!

full_text: What's the matter? Can't handle a little dirt, Madame Fussy-Britches?
character_words: What's the matter? Can't handle a little dirt, Madame Fussy-Britches?

full_text: Oh, sorry. Did I splash you, Mud-Slug?
character_words: Oh, sorry. Did I splash you, Mud-Slug?

full_text: Are we taking a break?
character_words: Are we taking a break?

full_text: [Screaming.] Sneak Attack!
character_words: Sneak Attack!

full_text: [While raising his blindfold and turning to face Sokka.] Sokka, sneak attacks don't work if you yell it out loud.
character_words: Sokka, sneak attacks don't work if you yell it out loud.

full_text: Hungry for a mud pie? [Kicks mud in Katara's face.]
character_words: Hungry for a mud pie?

full_text: [Wiping mud off of her face.] I'll give you a mud pie!
character_words: I'll give you a mud pie!

full_text: Uh guys, I thought we were supposed to be training me.
character_words: Uh guys, I thought we were supposed to be training me.

full_text: [Takes a few steps forward, covered in mud; calmly.] Very well, pupil. I believe we've had enough training for today. [Turns and walks away.]
character_words: Very well, pupil. I believe we've had enough training for today.

full_text: While Katara cleans up, [Earthbends the mud off of herself and runs toward Aang and Sokka.] let's go have some fun!
character_words: While Katara cleans up,  let's go have some fun!

full_text: Yeah!
character_words: Yeah!

full_text: [Simultaneously with Aang.] Yes!
character_words: Yes!

full_text: Look at all those messenger hawks! You know, I've been thinking about getting one for myself. That way, I wouldn't have to talk to anyone. I could just send them messages.
character_words: Look at all those messenger hawks! You know, I've been thinking about getting one for myself. That way, I wouldn't have to talk to anyone. I could just send them messages.

full_text: I gotta say, I like the idea of not talking to you. [Sokka glares at her.]
character_words: I gotta say, I like the idea of not talking to you.

full_text: [While holding up a silver piece.] So, guys. What are we gonna get with our last silver piece?
character_words: So, guys. What are we gonna get with our last silver piece?

full_text: [Stops walking.] We can get more money. [They both look back at her.] Right there. [Points to an area beneath them. Aang and Sokka move back to look where she is pointing.]
character_words: We can get more money.  Right there.

full_text: This is where you seeing people are at a disadvantage. Everyone guesses wrong because the dealer moves the rock at the last minute. But I can feel it with my earthbending. [As she says this, the scam artist continues to move the shells around as the gambler tries to focus on the shell with the rock, and right before stopping, the scam artist quickly and inconspicuously earthbends the rock from underneath one of the shells into his sleeve.]
character_words: This is where you seeing people are at a disadvantage. Everyone guesses wrong because the dealer moves the rock at the last minute. But I can feel it with my earthbending.

full_text: [To Toph.] You there. Wanna play a friendly game?
character_words: You there. Wanna play a friendly game?

full_text: How can I possibly play? [Waves her hand in front of her face.] I'm blind.
character_words: How can I possibly play?  I'm blind.

full_text: You don't have to see to be lucky.
character_words: You don't have to see to be lucky.

full_text: Flamey-O, Toph.
character_words: Flamey-O, Toph.

full_text: Wow. Fancy guessing. You are amazing at this. [Plays with a few silver pieces in his hands.] Would you like to make the game a little more interesting?
character_words: Wow. Fancy guessing. You are amazing at this.  Would you like to make the game a little more interesting?

full_text: [Curiously.] More interesting? How?
character_words: More interesting? How?

full_text: [Points at Sokka's sword.] Well, let's say you toss in your friend's fine sword there, [Grabs a big bag of money.] then I'll put up twenty silver pieces against it, and that's more interesting.
character_words: Well, let's say you toss in your friend's fine sword there,  then I'll put up twenty silver pieces against it, and that's more interesting.

full_text: [Grabs Sokka's sword.] I'll do it for forty silver pieces. [Sokka stares at them with his mouth wide open.]
character_words: I'll do it for forty silver pieces.

full_text: Forty silver pieces it is. [Drops some more money into the bag and starts moving the shells, faster this time.]
character_words: Forty silver pieces it is.

full_text: [Moves his hand over to the shell, about to lift it.] Sorry, little lady, but- [Lifts up the shell and sees the rock, which shocks and confuses him.] Huh? [Stares closely at the rock.]
character_words: Sorry, little lady, but-  Huh?

full_text: I won! [She grabs the bag of money, and Sokka grabs his sword as they run off.]
character_words: I won!

full_text: Where did you guys get the money to buy all this stuff?
character_words: Where did you guys get the money to buy all this stuff?

full_text: Toph got us money. [Grabs an apple and takes a bite out of it as he sits down.] She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like. [He mimics the scam artist moving the shells with his hand. Katara's expression shows disapproval.]
character_words: Toph got us money.  She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like.

full_text: [Sits down too.] She used earthbending to win the game! Classic!
character_words: She used earthbending to win the game! Classic!

full_text: Ah, so she cheated.
character_words: Ah, so she cheated.

full_text: [Starts to bite her apple, but stops to defend herself.] Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating! [Smiles.] I cheated a cheater. [Closes her eyes in confidence.] What's wrong with that?
character_words: Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating!  I cheated a cheater.  What's wrong with that?

full_text: I'm just saying this isn't something we should make a habit of doing.
character_words: I'm just saying this isn't something we should make a habit of doing.

full_text: Why? Because it's fun? And you hate fun?
character_words: Why? Because it's fun? And you hate fun?

full_text: I don't hate fun! [Places Momo on her head like a hat while grinning unconvincingly.] See? Fun! [Momo slips off her head, screeches at her, and runs away.]
character_words: I don't hate fun!  See? Fun!

full_text: [Stands up.] Katara, [Slightly lifts his headband to reveal his airbender tattoo and bows.] I'll personally make you an Avatar Promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.
character_words: Katara,  I'll personally make you an Avatar Promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.

full_text: Guys, I think these scams have gone far enough. If you keep doing them, something bad is gonna happen.
character_words: Guys, I think these scams have gone far enough. If you keep doing them, something bad is gonna happen.

full_text: Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up? [Tosses some money to Katara.]
character_words: Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up?

full_text: [Angrily.] Oh, I'm sorry! You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child? [Tosses the money back at Toph.]
character_words: Oh, I'm sorry! You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child?

full_text: Yeah! Maybe! Maybe then you'd see[Sokka grabs the money off the ground.]how great we have it! I mean, look at us! [Leans back on the rock behind her and crosses her arms behind her head.] We're traveling around the world! Making easy money! Having fun! With no parents to tell us what to do!
character_words: Yeah! Maybe! Maybe then you'd seehow great we have it! I mean, look at us!  We're traveling around the world! Making easy money! Having fun! With no parents to tell us what to do!

full_text: Ah. I see. You're acting like this because of your parents.
character_words: Ah. I see. You're acting like this because of your parents.

full_text: Whatever.
character_words: Whatever.

full_text: They were controlling over you, so you ran away, and now you act like your parents don't exist. You act like you hate them, but you don't. You just feel guilty.
character_words: They were controlling over you, so you ran away, and now you act like your parents don't exist. You act like you hate them, but you don't. You just feel guilty.

full_text: I do hate them.
character_words: I do hate them.

full_text: I don't think so. I think you miss them, but you just don't wanna deal with that, so instead you act like this crazy person.
character_words: I don't think so. I think you miss them, but you just don't wanna deal with that, so instead you act like this crazy person.

full_text: [Stands up; angrily.] Look, I ran away to help Aang!
character_words: Look, I ran away to help Aang!

full_text: You know what? It doesn't matter. These scams put us all at risk, and we don't need that. [Points at her forehead.] We've already got some third-eyed freak after us.
character_words: You know what? It doesn't matter. These scams put us all at risk, and we don't need that.  We've already got some third-eyed freak after us.

full_text: Speaking of that "third-eyed freak", I think I've come up with a name for him. What do you think of "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man"? [Silence.] Just think about it.
character_words: Speaking of that "third-eyed freak", I think I've come up with a name for him. What do you think of "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man"?  Just think about it.

full_text: [Angrily.] We have enough money! You need to stop this!
character_words: We have enough money! You need to stop this!

full_text: [Angrily.] I'll stop when I wanna stop and not when you tell me! [Uses earthbending to launch the bag of money behind her into her hand and walks away angrily. Katara shakes her head angrily as Toph sits and creates an earth tent.]
character_words: I'll stop when I wanna stop and not when you tell me!

full_text: [Grabs his bag of money and his sword and stands up.] Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later. [Walks away.]
character_words: Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later.

full_text: Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting. [Scratches Hawky on the stomach.] Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers? [While walking away, he notices a wanted poster he had just past with Toph's picture on it. He gasps in horror and rips it off the wall. Hawky screeches.] You're right, Hawky. This is bad. [Suddenly, the bird poops while standing on Sokka's arm.]
character_words: Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting.  Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers?  You're right, Hawky. This is bad.

full_text: Toph, while I was in town, I found something that you're not gonna like. [Pulls out the wanted poster and shows it to her.]
character_words: Toph, while I was in town, I found something that you're not gonna like.

full_text: Well it sounds like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's on the sheet of paper.
character_words: Well it sounds like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's on the sheet of paper.

full_text: It's a wanted poster. Of you. They've nicknamed you the Runaway.
character_words: It's a wanted poster. Of you. They've nicknamed you the Runaway.

full_text: [Happily.] A wanted poster! That's so great! "The Runaway." I love my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good?
character_words: A wanted poster! That's so great! "The Runaway." I love my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good?

full_text: [Looks a few times at both the wanted poster and Toph.] Well yeah, actually, it does look pretty good. [Gets back on topic.] But, Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.
character_words: Well yeah, actually, it does look pretty good.  But, Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.

full_text: Don't be such a worrywart like your sister. [Stands up and walks up to Sokka.] Think of it this way: Now you've got plenty of money to help with the invasion plan. [Holds up a bag of money and jiggles it in front of him.]
character_words: Don't be such a worrywart like your sister.  Think of it this way: Now you've got plenty of money to help with the invasion plan.

full_text: [Ponders for a moment.] Well, that is true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa. [Looks at Appa, who is napping, but opens one eye upon hearing this.]
character_words: Well, that is true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa.

full_text: [Takes some money out of the bag and hands the money to him.] Here's a little extra, so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what? [Gives the entire bag to him.] Make it an atlas.
character_words: Here's a little extra, so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what?  Make it an atlas.

full_text: [While taking the bag.] I do like expensive atlases.
character_words: I do like expensive atlases.

full_text: Of course you do. [Grabs the wanted poster and tucks it into her outfit.] And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret. [Walks away.]
character_words: Of course you do.  And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret.

full_text: Sokka, [Places her hand on her face; annoyed.] tell me you didn't buy a bird.
character_words: Sokka,  tell me you didn't buy a bird.

full_text: Not just a bird, a messenger bird. Now we can send messages all over the world. Even to Gran Gran.
character_words: Not just a bird, a messenger bird. Now we can send messages all over the world. Even to Gran Gran.

full_text: [Excited.] Wow, how does it work?
character_words: Wow, how does it work?

full_text: Hm. Uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky, [Points away from himself.] Gran Gran, South Pole. [Hawky shakes himself.] I think he gets it.
character_words: Hm. Uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky,  Gran Gran, South Pole.  I think he gets it.

full_text: Hawky! Make nice! Bad Hawky!
character_words: Hawky! Make nice! Bad Hawky!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Well. Look who decided to join us. [Stands up.] Where have you two been? Off scamming again?
character_words: Well. Look who decided to join us.  Where have you two been? Off scamming again?

full_text: Yes, we were. [Puts her bag down.]
character_words: Yes, we were.

full_text: [Slides to the right to behind Toph.] And I suppose you don't think what you're doing is dangerous at all?
character_words: And I suppose you don't think what you're doing is dangerous at all?

full_text: No, I don't.
character_words: No, I don't.

full_text: Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: Yes. Really.
character_words: Yes. Really.

full_text: [Starts to pull something out.] Well then. What's this? [Shows Toph her wanted poster.]
character_words: Well then. What's this?

full_text: [Annoyed.] I don't know! I mean, seriously! What is with you people? I'm blind! [Points at her eyes and pulls down her bottom eyelids to emphasize her words.]
character_words: I don't know! I mean, seriously! What is with you people? I'm blind!

full_text: It's a wanted poster of you! "The Runaway!" Is that what you're called now? Are you proud of this?
character_words: It's a wanted poster of you! "The Runaway!" Is that what you're called now? Are you proud of this?

full_text: [Angrily.] Where did you get that!?
character_words: Where did you get that!?

full_text: It doesn't matter where I got it. The fact is-
character_words: It doesn't matter where I got it. The fact is-

full_text: You went through my stuff! You had no right!
character_words: You went through my stuff! You had no right!

full_text: Your stuff was messy and I was just straightening up, and I happened to stumble across it!
character_words: Your stuff was messy and I was just straightening up, and I happened to stumble across it!

full_text: That's a lie! [Points at her.] You're lying, Katara!
character_words: That's a lie!  You're lying, Katara!

full_text: [Cut to a surprised Katara who glares at Toph. Pushes Toph's pointing hand out of her face.] Fine! It's a lie! But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up! I knew you were hiding something and you were! [Shows her the poster again, but Toph grabs it, tosses it and starts to walk past Katara.] Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!
character_words: Fine! It's a lie! But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up! I knew you were hiding something and you were!  Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Oh really, Mom? Or what are you gonna do? Send me to my room?
character_words: Oh really, Mom? Or what are you gonna do? Send me to my room?

full_text: I wish I could!
character_words: I wish I could!

full_text: Well you can't! Because you're not my mom, and you're not their mom! [Extends her arm at Aang and Sokka, who are sitting on a ledge.]
character_words: Well you can't! Because you're not my mom, and you're not their mom!

full_text: I never said I was!
character_words: I never said I was!

full_text: No, but you certainly act like it! You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not! You're just a regular kid like the rest of us! So stop acting like you can tell me what to do! I can do whatever I want!
character_words: No, but you certainly act like it! You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not! You're just a regular kid like the rest of us! So stop acting like you can tell me what to do! I can do whatever I want!

full_text: I don't act that way! [Looks at Sokka, who jumps as she says his name.] Sokka, do I act motherly?
character_words: I don't act that way!  Sokka, do I act motherly?

full_text: [Puts his hands up defensively.] Hey. I'm staying out of this one.
character_words: Hey. I'm staying out of this one.

full_text: [Looks at Aang.] What do you think, Aang? Do I act like a mom?
character_words: What do you think, Aang? Do I act like a mom?

full_text: [Rubs his eye.] Well. I, uh-
character_words: Well. I, uh-

full_text: [Slightly annoyed.] Stop rubbing your eye and speak clearly when you talk!
character_words: Stop rubbing your eye and speak clearly when you talk!

full_text: [He and Sokka sit straight.] Yes, ma'am.
character_words: Yes, ma'am.

full_text: I can't be around you right now!
character_words: I can't be around you right now!

full_text: Well, I can't be around you!
character_words: Well, I can't be around you!

full_text: [Rests his head in his hands.] I know, Hawky. Why can't they just get along?
character_words: I know, Hawky. Why can't they just get along?

full_text: Hey, Aang. You wanna test out my messenger hawk with me? I've got an idea.
character_words: Hey, Aang. You wanna test out my messenger hawk with me? I've got an idea.

full_text: Sure. [Leans his head closer to Sokka.]
character_words: Sure.

full_text: [Talks into Aang's ear.] I'm going to send a note to Katara and say it's from Toph, who wants to apologize. Then everyone will be friends again.
character_words: I'm going to send a note to Katara and say it's from Toph, who wants to apologize. Then everyone will be friends again.

full_text: I gotta say, Sokka, you continue to impress me with your ideas.
character_words: I gotta say, Sokka, you continue to impress me with your ideas.

full_text: It's a gift. [Pulls out a pen and ink and a piece of paper and starts to write.] "Dear Katara, sorry for everything. Your friend, Toph."
character_words: It's a gift.  "Dear Katara, sorry for everything. Your friend, Toph."

full_text: I know this is from you, Sokka! Toph can't write! [Tears the note up into pieces.] Ugh! You're all driving me crazy! [Turns and walks away.]
character_words: I know this is from you, Sokka! Toph can't write!  Ugh! You're all driving me crazy!

full_text: I can't believe we forgot Toph can't write.
character_words: I can't believe we forgot Toph can't write.

full_text: Yup. We're idiots. [Hawky flies back onto his arm.]
character_words: Yup. We're idiots.

full_text: I guess Plan B is we send a note to Toph pretending it's from Katara.
character_words: I guess Plan B is we send a note to Toph pretending it's from Katara.

full_text: I think we're gonna run into a similar problem. [Hawky screeches.] Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help. [Walks to Toph.] Come on. We need to talk.
character_words: I think we're gonna run into a similar problem.  Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help.  Come on. We need to talk.

full_text: So lemme guess: You brought me out here to tell me that your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be.
character_words: So lemme guess: You brought me out here to tell me that your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be.

full_text: Nah, she's pretty much a pain. [Katara, looking up at their feet from below and behind, glares and looks away.] She's always got to be right about everything and she gets all bossy and involved and in your business ...
character_words: Nah, she's pretty much a pain.  She's always got to be right about everything and she gets all bossy and involved and in your business ...

full_text: Yeah. I don't know how you could deal with it.
character_words: Yeah. I don't know how you could deal with it.

full_text: Actually, in a way, I rely on it. [Katara looks back up at them.]
character_words: Actually, in a way, I rely on it.

full_text: I don't understand.
character_words: I don't understand.

full_text: When our mom died, that was the hardest time in my life. Our family was a mess, but Katara? She had so much strength. She stepped up and took on so much responsibility. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom.
character_words: When our mom died, that was the hardest time in my life. Our family was a mess, but Katara? She had so much strength. She stepped up and took on so much responsibility. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom.

full_text: I guess I never thought about that.
character_words: I guess I never thought about that.

full_text: I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly? I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like. It really seems like my whole life, Katara's been the one looking out for me. She's always been the one that's there. And now, when I try to remember my mom, Katara's is the only face I can picture. [Katara, touched by what Sokka says, is reduced to tears.]
character_words: I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly? I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like. It really seems like my whole life, Katara's been the one looking out for me. She's always been the one that's there. And now, when I try to remember my mom, Katara's is the only face I can picture.

full_text: The truth is sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me. [Wipes away tears from her left eye.] You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom. [Katara, deeply touched by Toph's words, sinks slightly into the water. Toph punches Sokka in the arm.] Don't ever tell her I said any of this!
character_words: The truth is sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me.  You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom.  Don't ever tell her I said any of this!

full_text: Hey, my lips are sealed.
character_words: Hey, my lips are sealed.

full_text: Hi, Toph. Um, I wanna-
character_words: Hi, Toph. Um, I wanna-

full_text: [Holds up her hand in a "stop" fashion.] Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them.
character_words: Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them.

full_text: [Smiles.] Actually I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say ... I wanna pull a scam with you. [Aang and Sokka stare at her from behind, extremely shocked.]
character_words: Actually I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say ... I wanna pull a scam with you.

full_text: [Also shocked.] What? You wanna pull a scam?
character_words: What? You wanna pull a scam?

full_text: Not just any scam. The ultimate scam. [Sokka and Aang, still staring at her with shock, look at each other and faint, foaming from the mouth slightly. Katara puts her arm around Toph's shoulder, who gives a sly smile.] Whaddaya say, Toph? Just me and you. One last go. You in?
character_words: Not just any scam. The ultimate scam.  Whaddaya say, Toph? Just me and you. One last go. You in?

full_text: [Excited.] You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours? [They walk away and leave Aang and Sokka behind, who are now unconscious and foaming at the mouth.]
character_words: You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours?

full_text: The plan is simple: This wanted poster says you're worth a lot of money; Ten times more than you've made in all of your scams. So I'm gonna turn you in and collect the reward. Then you metalbend yourself out of jail, and we're on our way. [As she speaks, the screen fades to the beginning of the episode, where Toph is seen running from the authorities and is caught in a net.]
character_words: The plan is simple: This wanted poster says you're worth a lot of money; Ten times more than you've made in all of your scams. So I'm gonna turn you in and collect the reward. Then you metalbend yourself out of jail, and we're on our way.

full_text: [Angrily.] How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!
character_words: How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!

full_text: [Crosses her arms.] You brought this on yourself. I had no choice. [Turns away from Toph.]
character_words: You brought this on yourself. I had no choice.

full_text: You did the right thing by turning in the Runaway.
character_words: You did the right thing by turning in the Runaway.

full_text: The right thing is its own reward.
character_words: The right thing is its own reward.

full_text: Well, I'm happy to hear you say that.
character_words: Well, I'm happy to hear you say that.

full_text: [Pauses for a moment.] But, I still want the actual reward.
character_words: But, I still want the actual reward.

full_text: Of course. Right this way.
character_words: Of course. Right this way.

full_text: Hey! What kind of cell is this?
character_words: Hey! What kind of cell is this?

full_text: A wooden one. [She walks away as Toph becomes visibly worried.]
character_words: A wooden one.

full_text: That's her! That's the girl you were looking for!
character_words: That's her! That's the girl you were looking for!

full_text: Do you think this scam of theirs should be taking this long?
character_words: Do you think this scam of theirs should be taking this long?

full_text: I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out. [To Hawky and Momo.] You two behave. [Pointing at Appa.] Appa's in charge. [Appa lifts his head as the two animals start screeching at each other as soon as Sokka and Aang leave, but stop as soon as Appa roars at them.]
character_words: I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out.  You two behave.  Appa's in charge.

full_text: Wait! It's a trap!
character_words: Wait! It's a trap!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Really? No kidding! Is that why we're sitting in a wooden cage right now? Gee, how'd you figure out it was a trap?
character_words: Really? No kidding! Is that why we're sitting in a wooden cage right now? Gee, how'd you figure out it was a trap?

full_text: Not for us, Katara! We're the bait! He wants Aang! [Katara's eyes widen with realization.]
character_words: Not for us, Katara! We're the bait! He wants Aang!

full_text: I can't believe I'm so stupid! See? This is exactly why I'm against these scams! I knew this would happen!
character_words: I can't believe I'm so stupid! See? This is exactly why I'm against these scams! I knew this would happen!

full_text: But, this was your idea.
character_words: But, this was your idea.

full_text: I know. I wanted to show that I'm not so motherly. I wanted to show you that I can have fun too.
character_words: I know. I wanted to show that I'm not so motherly. I wanted to show you that I can have fun too.

full_text: Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with.
character_words: Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with.

full_text: I know your relationship with your parents is complicated. And I shouldn't have said what I said.
character_words: I know your relationship with your parents is complicated. And I shouldn't have said what I said.

full_text: It's okay. I was really mad when you said that because ... well because, maybe it's true. [Starts to cry.] I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them.
character_words: It's okay. I was really mad when you said that because ... well because, maybe it's true.  I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them.

full_text: Where do you think they might be?
character_words: Where do you think they might be?

full_text: Where do you think anyone is? [The assassin is seen walking across a rooftop behind them. Aang hears him inhaling and becomes shocked when he turns and sees him.] Sokka, watch out! [He grabs Sokka as they dodge a blast from the assassin and take cover behind an Ozai statue.] It's Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man!
character_words: Where do you think anyone is?  Sokka, watch out!  It's Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man!

full_text: You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit.
character_words: You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit.

full_text: What are we gonna do?
character_words: What are we gonna do?

full_text: I don't know. I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables.
character_words: I don't know. I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables.

full_text: What about your meteor bracelet? You can make a saw.
character_words: What about your meteor bracelet? You can make a saw.

full_text: I left it back at camp. [Sits down.] I was worried they would take it.
character_words: I left it back at camp.  I was worried they would take it.

full_text: [Confused.] Um, Katara? Are you okay?
character_words: Um, Katara? Are you okay?

full_text: Just fine.
character_words: Just fine.

full_text: [Still confused.] Well, what are you doing?
character_words: Well, what are you doing?

full_text: I'm making my own water.
character_words: I'm making my own water.

full_text: [Amazed.] Katara! You're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius!
character_words: Katara! You're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius!

full_text: This guy is too good! He shoots fire from his brain!
character_words: This guy is too good! He shoots fire from his brain!

full_text: We should split up. He can't chase us both.
character_words: We should split up. He can't chase us both.

full_text: Aang, get up! [She helps him up and they run away.]
character_words: Aang, get up!

full_text: Let's get out of here!
character_words: Let's get out of here!

full_text: [Still running.] Hey, I got it! The perfect name for that guy: "Combustion Man!"
character_words: Hey, I got it! The perfect name for that guy: "Combustion Man!"

full_text: Good job, Sokka. Now let's get outta here before Combustion Man catches us.
character_words: Good job, Sokka. Now let's get outta here before Combustion Man catches us.

full_text: See? It fits so well!
character_words: See? It fits so well!

full_text: [Yawns.] Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy? [Hawky makes a bird call.] Yeah. You're such a lazy little bird.
character_words: Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy?  Yeah. You're such a lazy little bird.

full_text: Katara? I need your help.
character_words: Katara? I need your help.

full_text: [Sits back down.] What is it, Toph?
character_words: What is it, Toph?

full_text: [Pulls out a sheet of paper.] I need you to write some things down for me. I wanna send a letter to my parents.
character_words: I need you to write some things down for me. I wanna send a letter to my parents.

full_text: [Smiling.] I'll be happy to help.
character_words: I'll be happy to help.

full_text: Hey, where'd Hawky go?
character_words: Hey, where'd Hawky go?

full_text: [Narrating a preview.] Previously on Avatar ...
character_words: Previously on Avatar ...

full_text: You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole. This ship has haunted my tribe when Gran-Gran was a little girl. It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.
character_words: You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole. This ship has haunted my tribe when Gran-Gran was a little girl. It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.

full_text: The legend said the moon was the first waterbender. Our ancestor saw how it pushed and pulled the tides, and learned how to do it themselves.
character_words: The legend said the moon was the first waterbender. Our ancestor saw how it pushed and pulled the tides, and learned how to do it themselves.

full_text: I always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.
character_words: I always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.

full_text: What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: I'm making my own water!
character_words: I'm making my own water!

full_text: [Telling a ghost story.] Suddenly, they heard something down the hall in the dark. Oooh ... It came into the torchlight ... and they knew the blade of Wing Fung was haunted! [Draws sword, stands up and points it toward the fire; yells dramatically.] Ooh-aaah!
character_words: Suddenly, they heard something down the hall in the dark. Oooh ... It came into the torchlight ... and they knew the blade of Wing Fung was haunted!  Ooh-aaah!

full_text: [Unimpressed.] I think I like "the man with a sword for a hand" better.
character_words: I think I like "the man with a sword for a hand" better.

full_text: Water Tribe slumber parties must stink.
character_words: Water Tribe slumber parties must stink.

full_text: No, wait! I've got one! And this is a true Southern Water Tribe story.
character_words: No, wait! I've got one! And this is a true Southern Water Tribe story.

full_text: [Sitting down.] Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories?
character_words: Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories?

full_text: No, it happened to Mom.
character_words: No, it happened to Mom.

full_text: One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home. [Cuts to ground-level shot of the group sitting around the fire, the camera panning slightly to the right.] Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice. [In a scary voice.] "It's so cold and I can't get warm!" [Sokka stiffens in fear.] Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.
character_words: One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home.  Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice.  "It's so cold and I can't get warm!"  Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.

full_text: [Peering from behind a tree trunk.] Where'd she go?
character_words: Where'd she go?

full_text: No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day, but sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm.
character_words: No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day, but sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm.

full_text: [Gasping.] Wait! Guys, did you hear that? [Aang, Katara, and Sokka clutch each other tightly, too stiff to move, with Toph standing alertly.] I hear people under the mountain. And they're screaming.
character_words: Wait! Guys, did you hear that?  I hear people under the mountain. And they're screaming.

full_text: Pft! Nice try, Toph.
character_words: Pft! Nice try, Toph.

full_text: [Cuts to shot of the campsite viewed through the ominous looking tree branches.] No, I'm serious. I hear something.
character_words: No, I'm serious. I hear something.

full_text: You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories ...
character_words: You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories ...

full_text: It just ... stopped.
character_words: It just ... stopped.

full_text: [Cuts back to him and Katara, still hugging, Sokka sitting close by.] All right, now I'm getting scared.
character_words: All right, now I'm getting scared.

full_text: [Off-camera from behind group.] Hello, children.
character_words: Hello, children.

full_text: Sorry to frighten you. My name is Hama. [Cuts to side-view of the campsite.] You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night. [Cuts to ground-level shot of Hama standing over the fire.] I have an inn nearby. Why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?
character_words: Sorry to frighten you. My name is Hama.  You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night.  I have an inn nearby. Why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?

full_text: [Sheepishly, places arm behind head.] Yes, please.
character_words: Yes, please.

full_text: Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn.
character_words: Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn.

full_text: [Sets teapot down.] Aren't you sweet? [Walks over to her seat and sits down.] You know you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.
character_words: Aren't you sweet?  You know you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.

full_text: What do you mean "disappearing"?
character_words: What do you mean "disappearing"?

full_text: [Sets her teacup down.] When the moon turns full, people walk in and they don't come out. [Stand up and holds up her teapot; cheerfully smiling.] Who wants more tea?
character_words: When the moon turns full, people walk in and they don't come out.  Who wants more tea?

full_text: Don't worry, you'll all be completely safe here. [Clasps hands together and smiles.] Why don't I show you to your rooms and you can get a good night's rest?
character_words: Don't worry, you'll all be completely safe here.  Why don't I show you to your rooms and you can get a good night's rest?

full_text: I know, Momo. [Places sword back inside holster and sets it down.] This place is creepy! [Lies back down on the pillow and pulls the covers over him.] I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep!
character_words: I know, Momo.  This place is creepy!  I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep!

full_text: [Off-camera.] Wakey, wakey! [Cuts to shot of the innkeeper, standing brightly over him.] Time to go shopping!
character_words: Wakey, wakey!  Time to go shopping!

full_text: That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages?
character_words: That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages?

full_text: [Seriously.] You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man? [Cheerfully.] I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly!
