character_words: You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man?  I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly!

full_text: You won't have any ash bananas till next week?
character_words: You won't have any ash bananas till next week?

full_text: Well, I have to send the boy to Hing Wa Island to get them, and it's a two-day trip.
character_words: Well, I have to send the boy to Hing Wa Island to get them, and it's a two-day trip.

full_text: Oh, right. Tomorrow's the full moon.
character_words: Oh, right. Tomorrow's the full moon.

full_text: [In a lowered voice.] Exactly. I can't lose another delivery boy in the woods.
character_words: Exactly. I can't lose another delivery boy in the woods.

full_text: People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff happening during full moons? This just reeks of Spirit World shenanigans.
character_words: People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff happening during full moons? This just reeks of Spirit World shenanigans.

full_text: I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad.
character_words: I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad.

full_text: [Makes gesture with his hand.] And then you can sew up this little mystery lickety-split, Avatar style!
character_words: And then you can sew up this little mystery lickety-split, Avatar style!

full_text: [Proudly.] Helping people ... that's what I do.
character_words: Helping people ... that's what I do.

full_text: Why don't you take all those things back to the inn? I just have to run a couple more errands. I'll be back in a little while.
character_words: Why don't you take all those things back to the inn? I just have to run a couple more errands. I'll be back in a little while.

full_text: [Walks up to her.] This is a mysterious little town you have here.
character_words: This is a mysterious little town you have here.

full_text: [Extremely close-up. Ominously.] Mysterious town for mysterious children.
character_words: Mysterious town for mysterious children.

full_text: That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something.
character_words: That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something.

full_text: [Unpacking items.] That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay. [Picks up cabbage.] She kinda reminds me of Gran-Gran.
character_words: That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay.  She kinda reminds me of Gran-Gran.

full_text: But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"?
character_words: But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"?

full_text: Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious?
character_words: Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious?

full_text: I'm gonna take a look around. [Walks away and up a flight of wooden stairs.]
character_words: I'm gonna take a look around.

full_text: [Appears along with the others at the bottom of the stairwell.] Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing? [Off-camera as Sokka peers around the inn.] You can't just snoop around someone's house.
character_words: Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing?  You can't just snoop around someone's house.

full_text: It'll be fine.
character_words: It'll be fine.

full_text: [Off-camera while Sokka peers into a room.] She could be home any minute.
character_words: She could be home any minute.

full_text: [Walking down hallway with the rest of the team.] Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble and this is just plain rude!
character_words: Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble and this is just plain rude!

full_text: [Tugging on a cupboard door.] I'm not finished yet. [Grunts, as he tries to pull it free.] Come on ...
character_words: I'm not finished yet.  Come on ...

full_text: Okay, that's pretty creepy.
character_words: Okay, that's pretty creepy.

full_text: [Walks over and closes the cupboard; a bit weirded out.] So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that. [Angrily.] Sokka, you've looked enough. [Off-camera as Sokka ascends into the attic.] Hama will be back soon.
character_words: So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that.  Sokka, you've looked enough.  Hama will be back soon.

full_text: Just an ordinary puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Well then why does she have a locked door up here?
character_words: Just an ordinary puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Well then why does she have a locked door up here?

full_text: [Annoyed.] Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff!
character_words: Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff!

full_text: We'll see. [Peers through the keyhole into the room. Cuts to shot of the attic from his perspective. Through the keyhole, a small room can be seen, with a chest lying on the ground in the middle. The camera zooms in on the chest.] It's empty, except for a little chest.
character_words: We'll see.  It's empty, except for a little chest.

full_text: Maybe it's treasure!
character_words: Maybe it's treasure!

full_text: [Approaches him.] Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room!
character_words: Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room!

full_text: I have to see what's in there.
character_words: I have to see what's in there.

full_text: We shouldn't be doing this.
character_words: We shouldn't be doing this.

full_text: Maybe there's a key here somewhere ...
character_words: Maybe there's a key here somewhere ...

full_text: Ooh! Hand it over!
character_words: Ooh! Hand it over!

full_text: [Eagerly.] Come on, come on!
character_words: Come on, come on!

full_text: [Annoyed; Katara appears from behind her, peering nervously over her shoulder.] This isn't as easy as it looks!
character_words: This isn't as easy as it looks!

full_text: [Nervously.] Guys, I don't know about this ...
character_words: Guys, I don't know about this ...

full_text: This is crazy! I'm leaving!
character_words: This is crazy! I'm leaving!

full_text: Suit yourself! Do it, Toph!
character_words: Suit yourself! Do it, Toph!

full_text: [Off-camera from behind them.] I'll tell you what's in the box.
character_words: I'll tell you what's in the box.

full_text: [Surprised.] An old comb?
character_words: An old comb?

full_text: It's my greatest treasure. It's the last thing I own from growing up in the Southern Water Tribe.
character_words: It's my greatest treasure. It's the last thing I own from growing up in the Southern Water Tribe.

full_text: [Stunned.] You're from the Southern Water Tribe?
character_words: You're from the Southern Water Tribe?

full_text: [Sets down comb.] Just like you.
character_words: Just like you.

full_text: How did you know?
character_words: How did you know?

full_text: I heard you talking around your campfire.
character_words: I heard you talking around your campfire.

full_text: But why didn't you tell us?
character_words: But why didn't you tell us?

full_text: I wanted to surprise you! I bought all this food today so I could fix you a big Water Tribe dinner. Of course, I can't get all the ingredients I need here, but ocean kumquats are a lot like sea prunes if you stew them long enough.
character_words: I wanted to surprise you! I bought all this food today so I could fix you a big Water Tribe dinner. Of course, I can't get all the ingredients I need here, but ocean kumquats are a lot like sea prunes if you stew them long enough.

full_text: [Sticking his tongue out in disgust.] Great ...
character_words: Great ...

full_text: I knew I felt a bond with you right away.
character_words: I knew I felt a bond with you right away.

full_text: And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right. [Grimaces as Katara hits him in the arm.] But I'm sorry we were sneaking around.
character_words: And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right.  But I'm sorry we were sneaking around.

full_text: Apology accepted. [Turns to the side and motions with her hand.] Now, let's get cooking!
character_words: Apology accepted.  Now, let's get cooking!

full_text: [Whispering to Toph.] I'd steer clear of the sea prunes.
character_words: I'd steer clear of the sea prunes.

full_text: I thought they were ocean kumquats.
character_words: I thought they were ocean kumquats.

full_text: Close enough.
character_words: Close enough.

full_text: Who wants five flavor soup?
character_words: Who wants five flavor soup?

full_text: [Delighted.] You're a waterbender! [Faces Hama in delight.] I've never met another waterbender from our tribe!
character_words: You're a waterbender!  I've never met another waterbender from our tribe!

full_text: [Cuts to side-view of her; sadly.] That's because the Fire Nation wiped them all out. I was the last one ...
character_words: That's because the Fire Nation wiped them all out. I was the last one ...

full_text: So how did you end up out here?
character_words: So how did you end up out here?

full_text: [Grimly.] I was stolen from my home.
character_words: I was stolen from my home.

full_text: [Voice-over.] It was over sixty years ago when the raids started.
character_words: It was over sixty years ago when the raids started.

full_text: [Voice-over.] They came again and again, each time rounding up more of our waterbenders and taking them captive.
character_words: They came again and again, each time rounding up more of our waterbenders and taking them captive.

full_text: [Voice-over.] We did our best to hold them off, but our numbers dwindled as the raids continued.
character_words: We did our best to hold them off, but our numbers dwindled as the raids continued.

full_text: [Voice-over.] Finally, I too was captured.
character_words: Finally, I too was captured.

full_text: [Voice-over.] I was led away in chains. The last waterbender of the Southern Water Tribe.
character_words: I was led away in chains. The last waterbender of the Southern Water Tribe.

full_text: They put us in terrible prisons here in the Fire Nation. I was the only one who managed to escape.
character_words: They put us in terrible prisons here in the Fire Nation. I was the only one who managed to escape.

full_text: How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation?
character_words: How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation?

full_text: I'm sorry. It's too painful to talk about anymore.
character_words: I'm sorry. It's too painful to talk about anymore.

full_text: We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid.
character_words: We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid.

full_text: [Sympathetically.] Oh, you poor things.
character_words: Oh, you poor things.

full_text: I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor. You're a hero.
character_words: I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor. You're a hero.

full_text: I never thought I'd meet another Southern waterbender. I'd like to teach you what I know so you can carry on the Southern tradition when I'm gone.
character_words: I never thought I'd meet another Southern waterbender. I'd like to teach you what I know so you can carry on the Southern tradition when I'm gone.

full_text: Yes! Yes, of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me.
character_words: Yes! Yes, of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me.

full_text: Growing up in the South Pole, waterbenders are totally at home surrounded by snow and ice and seas. But as you probably noticed on your travels, that isn't the case wherever you go.
character_words: Growing up in the South Pole, waterbenders are totally at home surrounded by snow and ice and seas. But as you probably noticed on your travels, that isn't the case wherever you go.

full_text: I know! When we were stranded in the desert, I felt like there was almost nothing I could do.
character_words: I know! When we were stranded in the desert, I felt like there was almost nothing I could do.

full_text: [Stops walking.] That's why you have to learn to control water wherever it exists.
character_words: That's why you have to learn to control water wherever it exists.

full_text: I've even used my own sweat for waterbending.
character_words: I've even used my own sweat for waterbending.

full_text: [Smiling.] That's very resourceful, Katara. You're thinking like a true master. But did you know you could even pull water out of thin air?
character_words: That's very resourceful, Katara. You're thinking like a true master. But did you know you could even pull water out of thin air?

full_text: You have got to keep an open mind, Katara. [The water around her fingertips freezes, creating ice claws.] There's water in places you never think about.
character_words: You have got to keep an open mind, Katara.  There's water in places you never think about.

full_text: This has got to be the nicest natural setting in the Fire Nation. I don't see anything that would make a spirit mad around here.
character_words: This has got to be the nicest natural setting in the Fire Nation. I don't see anything that would make a spirit mad around here.

full_text: Maybe the Moon Spirit just turned mean.
character_words: Maybe the Moon Spirit just turned mean.

full_text: [Angrily.] The Moon Spirit is a gentle, loving lady. She rules the sky with compassion and ... lunar goodness!
character_words: The Moon Spirit is a gentle, loving lady. She rules the sky with compassion and ... lunar goodness!

full_text: [Catches sight of a villager walking past.] Excuse me, sir. Can you tell us anything about the spirit that's been stealing people?
character_words: Excuse me, sir. Can you tell us anything about the spirit that's been stealing people?

full_text: Only one man ever saw it and lived and that's Old Man Ding.
character_words: Only one man ever saw it and lived and that's Old Man Ding.

full_text: Where does Old Man Ding live?
character_words: Where does Old Man Ding live?

full_text: Wow, these flowers are beautiful.
character_words: Wow, these flowers are beautiful.

full_text: They're called fire lilies. They only bloom a few weeks a year, but they're one of my favorite things about living here. And like all plants and all living things, they're filled with water.
character_words: They're called fire lilies. They only bloom a few weeks a year, but they're one of my favorite things about living here. And like all plants and all living things, they're filled with water.

full_text: I met a waterbender who lived in a swamp and could control the vines by bending the water inside.
character_words: I met a waterbender who lived in a swamp and could control the vines by bending the water inside.

full_text: You can take it even further.
character_words: You can take it even further.

full_text: That was incredible! [Sees the wilted lilies.] It's a shame about the lilies, though.
character_words: That was incredible!  It's a shame about the lilies, though.

full_text: They're just flowers. When you're a waterbender in a strange land, you do what you must to survive. Tonight I'll teach you the ultimate technique of waterbending. It can only be done during the full moon, when your bending is at its peak.
character_words: They're just flowers. When you're a waterbender in a strange land, you do what you must to survive. Tonight I'll teach you the ultimate technique of waterbending. It can only be done during the full moon, when your bending is at its peak.

full_text: [Cautiously.] But isn't that dangerous? I thought people have been disappearing around here during the full moon.
character_words: But isn't that dangerous? I thought people have been disappearing around here during the full moon.

full_text: Oh, Katara. Two master waterbenders beneath a full moon? [Begins walking away.] I don't think we have anything to worry about.
character_words: Oh, Katara. Two master waterbenders beneath a full moon?  I don't think we have anything to worry about.

full_text: Old Man Ding?
character_words: Old Man Ding?

full_text: Huh? [Accidentally hammers his thumb.] Ow, dang blame it! What? Can't you see I'm busy? Got a full moon rising. And why does everyone call me that? I'm not that old! [Attempts to lift a wooden plank off the ground, but fails to do so. Sighs.] Well, I'm young at heart.
character_words: Huh?  Ow, dang blame it! What? Can't you see I'm busy? Got a full moon rising. And why does everyone call me that? I'm not that old!  Well, I'm young at heart.

full_text: Not ready to get snapped up by some moon monster yet at least.
character_words: Not ready to get snapped up by some moon monster yet at least.

full_text: [Proceeds to nail the board to the window frame.] We wanted to ask you about that.
character_words: We wanted to ask you about that.

full_text: Did you get a good look at the spirit that took you?
character_words: Did you get a good look at the spirit that took you?

full_text: Didn't see no spirit, just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain. [Points to the mountain.] I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my own limbs. It just about had me into a cave up there. [Imitates a walking puppet.] And I looked up at the moon for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light. [Cuts to shot of the trio, Sokka quivering in fear.] But then the sun started to rise and I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!
character_words: Didn't see no spirit, just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain.  I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my own limbs. It just about had me into a cave up there.  And I looked up at the moon for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light.  But then the sun started to rise and I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!

full_text: Why would a spirit want to take people to a mountain?
character_words: Why would a spirit want to take people to a mountain?

full_text: Oh no! [Sokka and Aang assume defensive positions.] I did hear people screaming under the mountain. The missing villagers must still be there!
character_words: Oh no!  I did hear people screaming under the mountain. The missing villagers must still be there!

full_text: [Feels the ground with her hand.] I can hear them. They're this way!
character_words: I can hear them. They're this way!

full_text: Can you feel the power the full moon brings?
character_words: Can you feel the power the full moon brings?

full_text: For generations it has blessed waterbenders with its glow, allowing us to do incredible things!
character_words: For generations it has blessed waterbenders with its glow, allowing us to do incredible things!

full_text: [Extreme close-up; in a sinister tone.] I've never felt more alive.
character_words: I've never felt more alive.

full_text: This is the place.
character_words: This is the place.

full_text: I can't see anything down there.
character_words: I can't see anything down there.

full_text: [Grabs Sokka's hand.] That's why you have me. Let's go!
character_words: That's why you have me. Let's go!

full_text: We're saved!
character_words: We're saved!

full_text: I didn't know spirits made prisons like this. Who brought you here?
character_words: I didn't know spirits made prisons like this. Who brought you here?

full_text: It was no spirit.
character_words: It was no spirit.

full_text: It was a witch!
character_words: It was a witch!

full_text: A witch? What do you mean?
character_words: A witch? What do you mean?

full_text: [Speaking, as Toph unlocks her shackles.] She seems like a normal old woman, but she controls people like some dark puppetmaster!
character_words: She seems like a normal old woman, but she controls people like some dark puppetmaster!

full_text: [Gritting.] Hama!
character_words: Hama!

full_text: Yes, the innkeeper!
character_words: Yes, the innkeeper!

full_text: I knew there was something creepy about her!
character_words: I knew there was something creepy about her!

full_text: We have to stop Hama!
character_words: We have to stop Hama!

full_text: I'll get these people out of here. You go!
character_words: I'll get these people out of here. You go!

full_text: What I'm about to show you, [Cuts to close-up of Hama glaring menacingly.] I discovered in that wretched Fire Nation prison.
character_words: What I'm about to show you,  I discovered in that wretched Fire Nation prison.

full_text: [Voice-over.] The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend. [A side-view is shown of Fire Nation guards giving water to a tied up prisoner.] Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution. [Cuts to shot of the full moon in the sky during present day.] And yet each month, I felt the full moon enriching me with its energy. [Cuts to shot of Hama.] There had to be something I could do to escape. [Scene fades to flashback of the prison.] Then I realized that where there is life, there is water. [A younger Hama is shown bending the water inside an elephant rat that had wandered its way into her cage.] The rats that scurried across the floor of my cage were nothing more than skins filled with liquid and I passed years developing the skill that would lead to my escape. [A close-up is shown of Hama smiling at her discovery. The scene fades back to present day. Ominously.] Bloodbending. [Cut to a scared Katara.] Controlling the water in another body, [Cut to ground shot of both Hama and Katara.] enforcing your own will over theirs. [The scene fades back to a flashback of young Hama controlling a horde of rats using bloodbending.] Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
character_words: The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend.  Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution.  And yet each month, I felt the full moon enriching me with its energy.  There had to be something I could do to escape.  Then I realized that where there is life, there is water.  The rats that scurried across the floor of my cage were nothing more than skins filled with liquid and I passed years developing the skill that would lead to my escape.  Bloodbending.  Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.

full_text: [Voice-over.] And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades. [The guard attempts to get up, but Hama quickly forces him back down to the ground. She walks unsteadily away.] My cell unlocked by the very guards assigned to keep me in. [Scene changes back to present day; camera focuses on a close-up of Hama.] Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything or [Looks at Katara from the corner of her eyes sadistically.] anyone.
character_words: And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades.  My cell unlocked by the very guards assigned to keep me in.  Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything or  anyone.

full_text: [Unsure.] But ... to reach inside someone and control them? [Casts unsure glance off to the side.] I don't know if I want that kind of power.
character_words: But ... to reach inside someone and control them?  I don't know if I want that kind of power.

full_text: [Camera zooms out to the two standing in the forest.] The choice is not yours. The power exists. And it's your duty to use the gifts you've been given to win this war. [Closes up to Hama.] Katara, they tried to wipe us out, our entire culture, your mother!
character_words: The choice is not yours. The power exists. And it's your duty to use the gifts you've been given to win this war.  Katara, they tried to wipe us out, our entire culture, your mother!

full_text: [Close-up of her face.] I know.
character_words: I know.

full_text: [Camera changes back to Hama.] Then you should understand what I'm talking about! We're the last two waterbenders of the Southern Tribe. [Camera focuses on Katara; off-camera.] We have to fight these people whenever we can, wherever they are, with any means necessary!
character_words: Then you should understand what I'm talking about! We're the last two waterbenders of the Southern Tribe.  We have to fight these people whenever we can, wherever they are, with any means necessary!

full_text: [Widens eyes in realization.] It's you ... [Angrily.] You're the one who's been making people disappear during the full moons!
character_words: It's you ...  You're the one who's been making people disappear during the full moons!

full_text: [Close-up of her face, as she tilts her head downward.] They threw me in prison to rot, along with my brothers and sisters! They deserve the same! You must carry on my work!
character_words: They threw me in prison to rot, along with my brothers and sisters! They deserve the same! You must carry on my work!

full_text: [Points to Hama, stretching out her left hand.] I won't! I won't use bloodbending and I won't allow you to keep terrorizing this town! [Her hand suddenly twists to one side. She tries desperately to stop it, but fails to do so.]
character_words: I won't! I won't use bloodbending and I won't allow you to keep terrorizing this town!

full_text: [Now using bloodbending to subdue to her.] You should've learned the technique before you turned against me! [Forces Katara into a strained position.] It's impossible to fight your way out of my grip! I control every muscle, every vein in your body!
character_words: You should've learned the technique before you turned against me!  It's impossible to fight your way out of my grip! I control every muscle, every vein in your body!

full_text: [Tearfully.] Stop! Please ...
character_words: Stop! Please ...

full_text: [Determined.] You're not the only one who draws power from the moon! [Assumes a fighting stance.] My bending is more powerful than yours, Hama. Your technique is useless on me!
character_words: You're not the only one who draws power from the moon!  My bending is more powerful than yours, Hama. Your technique is useless on me!

full_text: [Shouts.] Aahhh!
character_words: Aahhh!

full_text: We know what you've been doing, Hama!
character_words: We know what you've been doing, Hama!

full_text: Give up! [Takes a fighting stance.] You're outnumbered!
character_words: Give up!  You're outnumbered!

full_text: No! [Rising.] You've outnumbered yourselves.
character_words: No!  You've outnumbered yourselves.

full_text: [Unwillingly draws his sword.] Katara, look out! [Forced to walk like a puppet, while waving the blade back and forth rapidly.] It's like my brain has a mind of its own! Stop it arm, stop it!
character_words: Katara, look out!  It's like my brain has a mind of its own! Stop it arm, stop it!

full_text: This feels weird!
character_words: This feels weird!

full_text: [Using waterbending to freeze him to a nearby tree.] I'm sorry, Aang!
character_words: I'm sorry, Aang!

full_text: It's okay!
character_words: It's okay!

full_text: [Sinisterly.] Don't hurt your friends, Katara! And don't let them hurt each other!
character_words: Don't hurt your friends, Katara! And don't let them hurt each other!

full_text: [Horrified.] No!
character_words: No!

full_text: You're going to be locked away forever.
character_words: You're going to be locked away forever.

full_text: My work is done. [Turns to Katara.] Congratulations, Katara. You're a bloodbender.
character_words: My work is done.  Congratulations, Katara. You're a bloodbender.

full_text: [Somewhat excitedly.] This is it! The official rendezvous point for the invasion force.
character_words: This is it! The official rendezvous point for the invasion force.

full_text: How did you pick this place?
character_words: How did you pick this place?

full_text: Before we split up, my dad and I found this island on the map. It's uninhabited, and the harbors surrounded by the cliffs seemed like the perfect secluded place.
character_words: Before we split up, my dad and I found this island on the map. It's uninhabited, and the harbors surrounded by the cliffs seemed like the perfect secluded place.

full_text: Nice choice, Sokka. And we're here four days ahead of schedule.
character_words: Nice choice, Sokka. And we're here four days ahead of schedule.

full_text: [Anxiously.] Wait! Four days? The invasion's in four days?
character_words: Wait! Four days? The invasion's in four days?

full_text: [Yawns.] Whatever. That's like four days from now. Let's just calm down and-
character_words: Whatever. That's like four days from now. Let's just calm down and-

full_text: Sokka's got the right idea, Aang. We're here. We're ready. The best thing we can do now is get plenty of rest. [Lies down.]
character_words: Sokka's got the right idea, Aang. We're here. We're ready. The best thing we can do now is get plenty of rest.

full_text: [Half-heartedly.] I guess.
character_words: I guess.

full_text: [He makes some fast and dramatic ninja-like moves as he speaks.] Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord! I'm bringing you down.
character_words: Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord! I'm bringing you down.

full_text: Really? [Brings his face close to Aang.] How do you plan on doing that when you're not even wearing pants?
character_words: Really?  How do you plan on doing that when you're not even wearing pants?

full_text: Oh no!
character_words: Oh no!

full_text: It was just a dream, Momo. I still have my pants. [Stands up.] Well, I better keep training.
character_words: It was just a dream, Momo. I still have my pants.  Well, I better keep training.

full_text: Fresh fruit, Prince Zuko?
character_words: Fresh fruit, Prince Zuko?

full_text: May I wash your feet, sir?
character_words: May I wash your feet, sir?

full_text: Head massage?
character_words: Head massage?

full_text: Hot towel?
character_words: Hot towel?

full_text: Prince Zuko, is something wrong? You didn't take the palanquin.
character_words: Prince Zuko, is something wrong? You didn't take the palanquin.

full_text: I'm just going to Mai's house. It's not far.
character_words: I'm just going to Mai's house. It's not far.

full_text: It's not a prince's place to walk anywhere, sir.
character_words: It's not a prince's place to walk anywhere, sir.

full_text: Hey. How long have you been up?
character_words: Hey. How long have you been up?

full_text: A couple hours. I got a lot more skills to refine if I'm gonna fight Ozai.
character_words: A couple hours. I got a lot more skills to refine if I'm gonna fight Ozai.

full_text: [Aang stops, panting.] You know, there is such a thing as over-training.
character_words: You know, there is such a thing as over-training.

full_text: You don't get it, do you? My form is bad, I'm sloppy, and I still don't know any firebending. Not even the basics.
character_words: You don't get it, do you? My form is bad, I'm sloppy, and I still don't know any firebending. Not even the basics.

full_text: That's okay, Aang. The eclipse will block off firebending anyway. You don't need to know it. [Looking at Aang.] Plus, it's a stupid element.
character_words: That's okay, Aang. The eclipse will block off firebending anyway. You don't need to know it.  Plus, it's a stupid element.

full_text: Okay, well I still have to work on everything else. I better spend the whole day training.
character_words: Okay, well I still have to work on everything else. I better spend the whole day training.

full_text: [Wide shot of the group on the cliffside with the camera slowly zooming out.] Good night, Katara. Good night, Sokka. Good night, Toph. Good night, Appa. Good night, Momo. Good night, Appa and Mo-
character_words: Good night, Katara. Good night, Sokka. Good night, Toph. Good night, Appa. Good night, Momo. Good night, Appa and Mo-

full_text: [With chibi face in a speech bubble that appears above her; angrily.] Go to sleep already! [Clenches her teeth.]
character_words: Go to sleep already!

full_text: [Frontal shot as he points outward.] Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord. [Scowls.] I'm bringing you down! [Looks down momentarily; confidently.] And this time, I brought pants.
character_words: Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord.  I'm bringing you down!  And this time, I brought pants.

full_text: So it seems, but are you prepared for your ... mathematics test?
character_words: So it seems, but are you prepared for your ... mathematics test?

full_text: Math test? Oh no! I forgot all about the math test!
character_words: Math test? Oh no! I forgot all about the math test!

full_text: I've gotta be ready.
character_words: I've gotta be ready.

full_text: Aang, it's the middle of the night. You need to go back to sleep.
character_words: Aang, it's the middle of the night. You need to go back to sleep.

full_text: But I forgot my pants and my math test.
character_words: But I forgot my pants and my math test.

full_text: Aang, sleep. Please. For me.
character_words: Aang, sleep. Please. For me.

full_text: Tell me, if you could have anything you want right now, what would it be?
character_words: Tell me, if you could have anything you want right now, what would it be?

full_text: Hm ... A big fancy fruit tart, with rose petals on top.
character_words: Hm ... A big fancy fruit tart, with rose petals on top.

full_text: You know, being a prince and all, I might just be able to make that happen.
character_words: You know, being a prince and all, I might just be able to make that happen.

full_text: [Chuckles.] That would be impressive.
character_words: That would be impressive.

full_text: [To the servants.] Do you think you could find a fresh fruit tart for the lady, with rose petals on top?
character_words: Do you think you could find a fresh fruit tart for the lady, with rose petals on top?

full_text: Excellent choice, sir.
character_words: Excellent choice, sir.

full_text: I guess there's some nice perks that come with being royalty. [Pushing him Zuko to lay down with her.] Though there's annoying stuff, too. Like that all-day war meeting coming up.
character_words: I guess there's some nice perks that come with being royalty.  Though there's annoying stuff, too. Like that all-day war meeting coming up.

full_text: [Sitting up, followed by Mai.] War meeting? What are you talking about?
character_words: War meeting? What are you talking about?

full_text: Azula mentioned something. I-I assumed you were going, too.
character_words: Azula mentioned something. I-I assumed you were going, too.

full_text: I guess I wasn't invited.
character_words: I guess I wasn't invited.

full_text: Wake up, Aang. Wake up, sleepy head! [Cut to an out of focus swaying shot of the Fire Lord standing over Aang.] Rise and shine! You overslept. [The Fire Lord bends in close and then even closer.] You missed the invasion.
character_words: Wake up, Aang. Wake up, sleepy head!  Rise and shine! You overslept.  You missed the invasion.

full_text: Sokka, get up! I needa know what day it is!
character_words: Sokka, get up! I needa know what day it is!

full_text: What? Who's talking?
character_words: What? Who's talking?

full_text: Relax! It's still two days before the invasion!
character_words: Relax! It's still two days before the invasion!

full_text: Sokka, you've gotta get up drill your rock-climbing exercises.
character_words: Sokka, you've gotta get up drill your rock-climbing exercises.

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: In one of my dreams, you were running from Fire Nation soldiers, trying to climb this cliff, [Camera turns to show an annoyed look on Sokka's face.] but you were too slow and they got you!
character_words: In one of my dreams, you were running from Fire Nation soldiers, trying to climb this cliff,  but you were too slow and they got you!

full_text: But that was just a dream. I'm a great climber!
character_words: But that was just a dream. I'm a great climber!

full_text: [While pointing at the cliff nearby.] Then climb that cliff! Climb it fast!
character_words: Then climb that cliff! Climb it fast!

full_text: Stupid Avatar! Stupid cliff! Stupid dream! I can climb fast!
character_words: Stupid Avatar! Stupid cliff! Stupid dream! I can climb fast!

full_text: [Turning around to her.] Don't drink that!
character_words: Don't drink that!

full_text: Why? Is it poisoned?
character_words: Why? Is it poisoned?

full_text: In my dream, we were right in the middle of the invasion, and you had to stop to use the bathroom! [He puts his hands between his legs and squeezes them together.] We died because of your tiny bladder. [He turns to Katara.] And you need to start wearing your hair up. In my dream, your hair got caught in a train, and-.
character_words: In my dream, we were right in the middle of the invasion, and you had to stop to use the bathroom!  We died because of your tiny bladder.  And you need to start wearing your hair up. In my dream, your hair got caught in a train, and-.

full_text: [Putting a hand on the side of his face.] Aang! I know you're just trying to help, but you really need to get a grip. You're unraveling.
character_words: Aang! I know you're just trying to help, but you really need to get a grip. You're unraveling.

full_text: [He takes a deep breath before finally speaking.] You're right. I'm losing my mind.
character_words: You're right. I'm losing my mind.

full_text: It's like every time I think about how stressed I am, I just end up more stressed. I'm like a big growing snowball of nerves.
character_words: It's like every time I think about how stressed I am, I just end up more stressed. I'm like a big growing snowball of nerves.

full_text: [Turning to look at Aang.] Of course you are. That's 'cause you gotta fight the Fire Lord, the baddest man on the planet. And you better win or we're all done for.
character_words: Of course you are. That's 'cause you gotta fight the Fire Lord, the baddest man on the planet. And you better win or we're all done for.

full_text: [Approaching Sokka, annoyed.] Sokka! You're not helping!
character_words: Sokka! You're not helping!

full_text: [Standing.] What? It's true. That's the deal. He knows it.
character_words: What? It's true. That's the deal. He knows it.

full_text: You know what, I've got just the thing! Get ready to be de-stressified!
character_words: You know what, I've got just the thing! Get ready to be de-stressified!

full_text: These yoga stretches can really work wonders if you do them in extreme heat. Reach up. [Katara puts her hands above her head together, Aang follows along.] Reach for the sun. [They wave their hands and upper bodies side to side.] Feel your chi paths clearing. [Both bend over so their heads touch the ground, grabbing their legs.] Now close your eyes. How are you feeling?
character_words: These yoga stretches can really work wonders if you do them in extreme heat. Reach up.  Reach for the sun.  Feel your chi paths clearing.  Now close your eyes. How are you feeling?

full_text: [Close-up of Aang sweating.] I feel ... really warm.
character_words: I feel ... really warm.

full_text: Good, good. Go on.
character_words: Good, good. Go on.

full_text: Like there's this warm feeling all around me. This heat. [Becoming frantic again.] Like I'm in the Fire Lord's palace and he's shooting a bunch of fireballs at me! And the whole world is being engulfed in flames!
character_words: Like there's this warm feeling all around me. This heat.  Like I'm in the Fire Lord's palace and he's shooting a bunch of fireballs at me! And the whole world is being engulfed in flames!

full_text: Maybe your stress is the kind you need to talk out.
character_words: Maybe your stress is the kind you need to talk out.

full_text: [In his Wang Fire voice.] Why don't you get right down to business and tell me what's been bothering you.
character_words: Why don't you get right down to business and tell me what's been bothering you.

full_text: You know what's bothering me. I have to fight the Fire Lord in a few days.
character_words: You know what's bothering me. I have to fight the Fire Lord in a few days.

full_text: [He nods upon hearing Aang's explanation.] Tell me more about this "Fire Lord". Why are you so afraid of him?
character_words: Tell me more about this "Fire Lord". Why are you so afraid of him?

full_text: You said it yourself! He's the baddest man on the planet! I'm supposed to defeat him and save the world!
character_words: You said it yourself! He's the baddest man on the planet! I'm supposed to defeat him and save the world!

full_text: [Nodding in agreement.] Life does feel that way sometimes, doesn't it? Like we're all trying to save the world from evil.
character_words: Life does feel that way sometimes, doesn't it? Like we're all trying to save the world from evil.

full_text: Okay! But what can I do to feel better?
character_words: Okay! But what can I do to feel better?

full_text: [While handing Aang a koala sheep.] Want to try screaming into this pillow?
character_words: Want to try screaming into this pillow?

full_text: Hello, Zuzu. If you've come for a royal hair-combing, I'm afraid you'll have to wait.
character_words: Hello, Zuzu. If you've come for a royal hair-combing, I'm afraid you'll have to wait.

full_text: So I guess there's a big war meeting coming up, huh? And apparently I'm not welcome there.
character_words: So I guess there's a big war meeting coming up, huh? And apparently I'm not welcome there.

full_text: What do you mean? Of course you're welcome there!
character_words: What do you mean? Of course you're welcome there!

full_text: Oh, yeah?! I guess that's why no one bothered to tell me about it!
character_words: Oh, yeah?! I guess that's why no one bothered to tell me about it!

full_text: Oh, Zuko. Don't be so dramatic. I'm certain Dad wants you there. You probably just weren't invited because it's so obvious you're supposed to be there.
character_words: Oh, Zuko. Don't be so dramatic. I'm certain Dad wants you there. You probably just weren't invited because it's so obvious you're supposed to be there.

full_text: Well, were you invited?
character_words: Well, were you invited?

full_text: Of course! I'm the princess.
character_words: Of course! I'm the princess.

full_text: And I'm the prince!
character_words: And I'm the prince!

full_text: Exactly, so stop acting like a paranoid child! Just go to the meeting.
character_words: Exactly, so stop acting like a paranoid child! Just go to the meeting.

full_text: Forget it! I'm not going!
character_words: Forget it! I'm not going!

full_text: All right! What you need is a good old-fashioned back pounding to relieve your stress.
character_words: All right! What you need is a good old-fashioned back pounding to relieve your stress.

full_text: [Looking up at her.] Pound away.
character_words: Pound away.

full_text: [The pillars causing him pain.] Ow! Toph ... I ... think ... this ... is ... bruising ... me!
character_words: Ow! Toph ... I ... think ... this ... is ... bruising ... me!

full_text: Sorry. I forgot you had baby skin. [Aang grabs onto the edge of the pillars and gets up.] Well, there's one other thing we can try. [She stomps the ground, sending a distant boar-q-pine to her. She catches it and holds it out to Aang with a wide grin.] Acupuncture!
character_words: Sorry. I forgot you had baby skin.  Well, there's one other thing we can try.  Acupuncture!

full_text: Zuko, it's just a dumb meeting. Who cares?
character_words: Zuko, it's just a dumb meeting. Who cares?

full_text: I don't.
character_words: I don't.

full_text: Well, good. You shouldn't. I mean, why would you even want to go? Just think about how things went the last meeting you went to.
character_words: Well, good. You shouldn't. I mean, why would you even want to go? Just think about how things went the last meeting you went to.

full_text: [Sighs.] I know.
character_words: I know.

full_text: You know what will make you feel better? [Zuko turns his head slightly.] Ordering some servants around. I might be hungry for a whole tray of fruit tarts. And maybe a little palanquin ride around town. Double time.
character_words: You know what will make you feel better?  Ordering some servants around. I might be hungry for a whole tray of fruit tarts. And maybe a little palanquin ride around town. Double time.

full_text: Thanks for everything, guys.
character_words: Thanks for everything, guys.

full_text: So, do you feel less stressed? Ready for a good night's sleep?
character_words: So, do you feel less stressed? Ready for a good night's sleep?

full_text: [He turns his head away.] Uh, I kinda think I sorta might slightly feel a little better. [He looks back at his friends.] Maybe.
character_words: Uh, I kinda think I sorta might slightly feel a little better.  Maybe.

full_text: Then our work here is done.
character_words: Then our work here is done.

full_text: What happened, Aang?
character_words: What happened, Aang?

full_text: [Turns away on hands and knees.] It's the nightmares. They just get worse and worse.
character_words: It's the nightmares. They just get worse and worse.

full_text: Looks like it's time for another ... [He turns around and puts his Wang Fire disguise on and voice.] therapy session.
character_words: Looks like it's time for another ...  therapy session.

full_text: [Momentarily looking back.] No. That won't help. Nothing helps. There's only one thing I can do! I'm going to stay awake straight through to the invasion!
character_words: No. That won't help. Nothing helps. There's only one thing I can do! I'm going to stay awake straight through to the invasion!

full_text: Invasion. All aboard for the invasion.
character_words: Invasion. All aboard for the invasion.

full_text: [Approaching.] You don't look so good. You sure you can't just lie down for a little nap?
character_words: You don't look so good. You sure you can't just lie down for a little nap?

full_text: I told you, I can't go back to sleep.
character_words: I told you, I can't go back to sleep.

full_text: Aang, staying up all night can't be good for you.
character_words: Aang, staying up all night can't be good for you.

full_text: [Walking toward the cliff edge. Katara turns and moves a bit to follow.] Actually, staying up all night has given me some time to think. And I've realized some big things, Katara.
character_words: Actually, staying up all night has given me some time to think. And I've realized some big things, Katara.

full_text: What big things?
character_words: What big things?

full_text: I see everything so clearly now. What really matters. Why I'm really doing this. [He turns around to look at Katara.] I'm doing it to save the world. But more than that. I'm doing it for the people I love. [Side shot of Aang and Katara near each other.] I'm doing it for you, Katara.
character_words: I see everything so clearly now. What really matters. Why I'm really doing this.  I'm doing it to save the world. But more than that. I'm doing it for the people I love.  I'm doing it for you, Katara.

full_text: Aang, what are you saying?
character_words: Aang, what are you saying?

full_text: I'm saying, I love you! [He kisses her. After he pulls back, she embraces and kisses him back.]
character_words: I'm saying, I love you!

full_text: [After kissing for a while she pulls back, whispering slightly.] What are we doing?
character_words: What are we doing?

full_text: What our hearts have been telling us to do for a long, long time. Baby, [He moves Katara down to the side.] you're my forever girl. [Aang puckers up his lips for another kiss.]
character_words: What our hearts have been telling us to do for a long, long time. Baby,  you're my forever girl.

full_text: Aang! [Aang realizes he was just daydreaming, and realizes he is not holding Katara anymore.] I was just saying you should take a nap.
character_words: Aang!  I was just saying you should take a nap.

full_text: [He quickly turns around to face Katara.] Oh, I guess I kinda drifted off into a daydream.
character_words: Oh, I guess I kinda drifted off into a daydream.

full_text: What was your dream about?
character_words: What was your dream about?

full_text: [He pauses to think for a moment.] Uh, living underwater?
character_words: Uh, living underwater?

full_text: [Initially confused, she smiles back.] Sounds neat!
character_words: Sounds neat!

full_text: Prince Zuko, [He bows before the prince.] everyone's waiting for you.
character_words: Prince Zuko,  everyone's waiting for you.

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: The high admirals, the high generals, the war ministers, and the princess have all arrived. You're the only person missing.
character_words: The high admirals, the high generals, the war ministers, and the princess have all arrived. You're the only person missing.

full_text: So, my dad wants me at the meeting?
character_words: So, my dad wants me at the meeting?

full_text: The Fire Lord said he would not start until you arrived, sir.
character_words: The Fire Lord said he would not start until you arrived, sir.

full_text: Put 'em up, Fire Lord!
character_words: Put 'em up, Fire Lord!

full_text: Hey! I'm tryin' build Appa some armor here so he doesn't have to go into the invasion naked. He's your bison.
character_words: Hey! I'm tryin' build Appa some armor here so he doesn't have to go into the invasion naked. He's your bison.

full_text: [Standing in front of the "Ozai" tree in a fighting stance.] Ozai's defense is impeccable. I'll have to try a different approach.
character_words: Ozai's defense is impeccable. I'll have to try a different approach.

full_text: You think you're untouchable, don't you, Mr. Fire Lord?
character_words: You think you're untouchable, don't you, Mr. Fire Lord?

full_text: [Off-screen.] Boy, you are really starting to lose it, kid.
character_words: Boy, you are really starting to lose it, kid.

full_text: Momo, did you hear something? [Turns back.]
character_words: Momo, did you hear something?

full_text: [Off-screen.] No, but I said something. [Aang becomes shocked and gets close to Momo.] You, my friend, are just a few plums short of a fruit pie. [Aang stares at Momo in disbelief, his jaw wide open. He quickly stands up, shakes his head, and covers his eyes. He peeks through them, at which point Momo begins chittering normally again. Aang walks up to him and pets him.]
character_words: No, but I said something.  You, my friend, are just a few plums short of a fruit pie.

full_text: That's more like it. I'm so tired that for a second there, I imagined you were talking to me. [Momo tilts his head in confusion. Everyone is seen walking forward and watching Aang.] Oh, Momo, let me explain. [Aang begins chattering like Momo. Katara and Sokka share a look of confusion, as Toph merely stands there with a slightly annoyed look. Momo chitters back, in which Aang laughs before chittering again. Katara interrupts him.]
character_words: That's more like it. I'm so tired that for a second there, I imagined you were talking to me.  Oh, Momo, let me explain.

full_text: Aang? We're all starting to get a little worried about you.
character_words: Aang? We're all starting to get a little worried about you.

full_text: You've been awake too long.
character_words: You've been awake too long.

full_text: And you're acting downright weird.
character_words: And you're acting downright weird.

full_text: You've got to take care of yourself. You can't go on like this.
character_words: You've got to take care of yourself. You can't go on like this.

full_text: [Sighs.] Look, I appreciate what you guys are saying, but the stress and the nightmares. They were just too much. Staying awake is the best way for me to deal with it.
character_words: Look, I appreciate what you guys are saying, but the stress and the nightmares. They were just too much. Staying awake is the best way for me to deal with it.

full_text: [Standing and pointing at Appa.] Yeah! Leave the kid alone!
character_words: Yeah! Leave the kid alone!

full_text: [Pointing back.] Hey, who asked you? [The two begin to fight.]
character_words: Hey, who asked you?

full_text: You guys, come on.
character_words: You guys, come on.

full_text: No! I am sick of this guy always mouthing me and telling me what to do!
character_words: No! I am sick of this guy always mouthing me and telling me what to do!

full_text: Oh, you don't like it? Well, let's go right now!
character_words: Oh, you don't like it? Well, let's go right now!

full_text: Sokka, what do we do?
character_words: Sokka, what do we do?

full_text: [Confused.] About what?
character_words: About what?

full_text: [Pointing.] About that!
character_words: About that!

full_text: [Cut to a group of koala sheep.] Appa! Appa! Appa! [Cut to another group.] Momo! Momo! Momo!
character_words: Appa! Appa! Appa!  Momo! Momo! Momo!

full_text: Come on, guys. We're all on the same side.
character_words: Come on, guys. We're all on the same side.

full_text: [Singing.] Chakras, chakras, everybody loves chakras. Chakras, chakras, chakras sandwich tastes good. Yum!
character_words: Chakras, chakras, everybody loves chakras. Chakras, chakras, chakras sandwich tastes good. Yum!

full_text: [Cut to some koala sheep.] Yay! Yay! Yay! Yay! Yay!
character_words: Yay! Yay! Yay! Yay! Yay!

full_text: I just need to jump in a cold waterfall!
character_words: I just need to jump in a cold waterfall!

full_text: So, how did it go? [They walk on together.]
character_words: So, how did it go?

full_text: When I got to the meeting, everyone welcomed me. My father had saved me a seat. He wanted me next to him. I was literally at his right hand.
character_words: When I got to the meeting, everyone welcomed me. My father had saved me a seat. He wanted me next to him. I was literally at his right hand.

full_text: Zuko, that's wonderful! You must be happy.
character_words: Zuko, that's wonderful! You must be happy.

full_text: During the meeting, I was the perfect prince. The son my father wanted. [Looks down, eyes closed.] But I wasn't me.
character_words: During the meeting, I was the perfect prince. The son my father wanted.  But I wasn't me.

full_text: Oh, look. Another hallucination. An imaginary bed made out of clouds.
character_words: Oh, look. Another hallucination. An imaginary bed made out of clouds.

full_text: Hey! It's real! We spent hours working on it.
character_words: Hey! It's real! We spent hours working on it.

full_text: We made it for you. A good night's sleep will probably take the crazy away. We hope.
character_words: We made it for you. A good night's sleep will probably take the crazy away. We hope.

full_text: Look! You guys keep telling me that I need to sleep, but I can't! The invasion's tomorrow!
character_words: Look! You guys keep telling me that I need to sleep, but I can't! The invasion's tomorrow!

full_text: [Concerned.] Aang ...
character_words: Aang ...

full_text: No, Katara! There's still so much I haven't learned. I don't need sleep. What I need is practice. Quick, hit me! [He begins to wobble.]
character_words: No, Katara! There's still so much I haven't learned. I don't need sleep. What I need is practice. Quick, hit me!

full_text: I'm not going to hit you.
character_words: I'm not going to hit you.

full_text: You want me to do it? [Sokka nudges her back.]
character_words: You want me to do it?

full_text: [Approaching Aang, placing a hand on his shoulder.] Listen, you've been training for this since the day we met. [Moves behind him, talking over his shoulder.] I've seen your progress. You're smart, brave, and strong enough.
character_words: Listen, you've been training for this since the day we met.  I've seen your progress. You're smart, brave, and strong enough.

full_text: You really think so? [Katara nods.]
character_words: You really think so?

full_text: We all do. You can do this. You're ready.
character_words: We all do. You can do this. You're ready.

full_text: You're the man, Twinkle Toes!
character_words: You're the man, Twinkle Toes!

full_text: Thanks, guys. [He nods, yawns, and rubs his eyes. Katara aids him to the bed, where he lies down.] You know what? I think I am ready. [The other three watch as he falls asleep quickly. He falls into another dream, meeting with Ozai again.] Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord!
character_words: Thanks, guys.  You know what? I think I am ready.  Your days of tyranny are over, Fire Lord!

full_text: Really? You're gonna take me out? You're not even wearing pants!
character_words: Really? You're gonna take me out? You're not even wearing pants!

full_text: [Smiles smugly.] No, Fire Lord Ozai. You're not wearing any pants.
character_words: No, Fire Lord Ozai. You're not wearing any pants.

full_text: No! My royal parts are showing.
character_words: No! My royal parts are showing.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Momo jumps onto his shoulder; cheerfully.] Top of the morning, Momo!
character_words: Top of the morning, Momo!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Rises and places hands on hips.] Sounds like you slept well.
character_words: Sounds like you slept well.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Moves his hand aside in a sweeping motion.] Like a baby moose lion. [Assumes a fighting stance and raises fists; exuberantly.] I'm ready to face the Fire Lord.
character_words: Like a baby moose lion.  I'm ready to face the Fire Lord.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: So, what's your strategy for taking him down? [Smiling and raises her hands to her eyes, her fingers wiggling outward in a mimicry of the Avatar State.] Gonna get your glow on and [Punches the air with a determined expression on her face.] hit him with a little Avatar State action?
character_words: So, what's your strategy for taking him down?  Gonna get your glow on and  hit him with a little Avatar State action?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Looks down sorrowfully.] I can't. [Cut to side-view of him, the camera panning slightly to the left.] When Azula shot me with lightning, [Close his eyes briefly.] my seventh chakra was locked, cutting off my connection to all the cosmic energy in the universe. [Cut back to shot of him and Toph.]
character_words: I can't.  When Azula shot me with lightning,  my seventh chakra was locked, cutting off my connection to all the cosmic energy in the universe.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: You know what I just heard? [Holds up one hand and opens and closes it in a "gibber-gabber" expression.] Blah, blah, spiritual mumbo jumbo blah, blah, something about space. [Bored.]
character_words: You know what I just heard?  Blah, blah, spiritual mumbo jumbo blah, blah, something about space.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Cut to a wide shot of the ocean; thick fog is visible on the horizon.] Oh, no. [Cut to a shot of Katara, appearing concerned.] Sokka, do you think the fog will delay the invasion?
character_words: Oh, no.  Sokka, do you think the fog will delay the invasion?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Stands up.] No. [Cut to close-up of the fog, five Water Tribe ships suddenly appearing from amid the mist.] That is the invasion!
character_words: No.  That is the invasion!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: You made it, Dad! [Cut to shot of Katara embracing her father happily.]
character_words: You made it, Dad!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Spirited.] Where you able to locate everyone I told you to find?
character_words: Where you able to locate everyone I told you to find?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: I did. [Two members of the Foggy Swamp Tribe disembark. Doubtfully.] But I'm a little worried, Sokka. Some of these men aren't exactly the "warrior type". [Turns head slightly toward the two swamp dwellers.]
character_words: I did.  But I'm a little worried, Sokka. Some of these men aren't exactly the "warrior type".

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Enthusiastically, swinging his arm.] Oooh-whee! [Cut to shot of the two men standing on the dock.] This place ain't nothing like a swamp. [Points accusingly to a rock in the water.] What you reckon that is, Tho? Some sort of Fire Nation exploding trap what eat ya?
character_words: Oooh-whee!  This place ain't nothing like a swamp.  What you reckon that is, Tho? Some sort of Fire Nation exploding trap what eat ya?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Impartial.] It's just a rock, Due.
character_words: It's just a rock, Due.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Grins.] Well, I'll be. [Scratching his head.]
character_words: Well, I'll be.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Is it just me, or are those fellas a little loose in the leaf-hat?
character_words: Is it just me, or are those fellas a little loose in the leaf-hat?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Walks past, behind the chief and his family, stopping beside Sokka.] I just wish they would wear pants.
character_words: I just wish they would wear pants.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Cut to shot of Huu standing alone on the dock. Scratches his stomach.] Pants are an illusion, and so is death.
character_words: Pants are an illusion, and so is death.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Off-screen.] Hi, Katara. [Cut to close-up of the figure who reveals himself to be Haru; he smiles, now sporting a small mustache and goatee.]
character_words: Hi, Katara.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Cut to zoomed out shot of Haru.] Haru! [Runs over and embraces him.] It's so good to see you!
character_words: Haru!  It's so good to see you!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Appears on screen with Toph.] Toph, this is Haru. When we met him, his town was controlled by the Fire Nation. So he had to hide his earthbending.
character_words: Toph, this is Haru. When we met him, his town was controlled by the Fire Nation. So he had to hide his earthbending.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [With Katara resting a hand on his shoulder.] Katara inspired me and my father to take back our village. [Turns to Katara who blushes and looks away.]
character_words: Katara inspired me and my father to take back our village.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Tyro appears and lays his hands on Haru's and Katara's shoulders.] You helped us find our courage, Katara. [Katara turns to him.] Now we're here to help you.
character_words: You helped us find our courage, Katara.  Now we're here to help you.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: No way! Is that-
character_words: No way! Is that-

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Hippo happy to see Blind Bandit!
character_words: Hippo happy to see Blind Bandit!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Angrily.] You guys here for a rematch?
character_words: You guys here for a rematch?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Negatory. The Boulder and The Hippo no longer fight for others' entertainment. Now, we fight for our kingdom!
character_words: Negatory. The Boulder and The Hippo no longer fight for others' entertainment. Now, we fight for our kingdom!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Smiling.] Sweet.
character_words: Sweet.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Was that a new invention?
character_words: Was that a new invention?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Teo licking his fingers clean.] Yes, but unfortunately the incendiary capabilities of peanut sauce prove to be a failure.
character_words: Yes, but unfortunately the incendiary capabilities of peanut sauce prove to be a failure.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [The others seems disgusted.] You're making peanut sauce bombs?
character_words: You're making peanut sauce bombs?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: They're destructive.
character_words: They're destructive.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: And delicious. [They both lick the sauce that splashed all over their faces. Momo flies over to Pipsqueak and starts licking his face, much to his and The Duke's amusement.]
character_words: And delicious.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Where you able to complete work on the plans I send you?
character_words: Where you able to complete work on the plans I send you?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Yes, I was, and I think the Fire Nation will be quite surprised.
character_words: Yes, I was, and I think the Fire Nation will be quite surprised.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Aang, my dad and I made this for you.
character_words: Aang, my dad and I made this for you.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: A new glider! This is amazing!
character_words: A new glider! This is amazing!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: And as a special feature, I added the snack compartment. [Rotates the handle, making the snacks come out.]
character_words: And as a special feature, I added the snack compartment.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Oh ... well, I'm sure that will come in handy.
character_words: Oh ... well, I'm sure that will come in handy.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: I bet you're tired of being in this cell old man. Well too bad. [Camera shows Iroh's face.] You're never stepping outside these walls again.
character_words: I bet you're tired of being in this cell old man. Well too bad.  You're never stepping outside these walls again.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Enters.] Breakfast.
character_words: Breakfast.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Stands.] Careful, Ming, don't get too close. His stench will knock you right out. [Leaves, laughing.]
character_words: Careful, Ming, don't get too close. His stench will knock you right out.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Looks at Poon contemptuously and approaches Iroh.] I snuck in some white jade tea. I know you like rare teas.
character_words: I snuck in some white jade tea. I know you like rare teas.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Ming places the tray of tea inside Iroh's cell.] Thank you, Ming. Ever since I was put in here, you have been very kind to me.
character_words: Thank you, Ming. Ever since I was put in here, you have been very kind to me.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Don't worry, you'll do great.
character_words: Don't worry, you'll do great.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Good morning everyone. Ahh! [Trips on stage.] Umm ... so, as you know, today, we're invading the Fire Nation! I mean I know you know that because otherwise why else would you be here? [Laughs nervously.] Uh anyway, [Dropping scrolls. Unraveling one on a board.] the Fire Lord's palace is here [Points at map, realizing it isn't the map, flips the chart several times until it is the map.]. Uh nope, uh wait, uh wait, uh wait, it's here, [Brief shot of Due scratching his head.] and uh, there's an eclipse today and Aang's gonna fight the Fire Lord and the firebenders won't have any fire to use so that's good for us! [Brief shot of Teo and the mechanist looking on.] And ... um ... I'm sorry let me start at the beginning [Stands up straight, and begins talking very fast.]. Katara and I discovered Aang frozen in an iceberg, now I didn't like Aang at first but grew to love him over time, then we went to the Southern Air Temple where Aang used to live and then we met Suki, [Water Tribe warrior yawns.] who's a Kyoshi warrior. She dressed me like a woman and then she kissed me, and then Aang's friend was a crazy old king and ...
character_words: Good morning everyone. Ahh!  Umm ... so, as you know, today, we're invading the Fire Nation! I mean I know you know that because otherwise why else would you be here?  Uh anyway,  the Fire Lord's palace is here . Uh nope, uh wait, uh wait, uh wait, it's here,  and uh, there's an eclipse today and Aang's gonna fight the Fire Lord and the firebenders won't have any fire to use so that's good for us!  And ... um ... I'm sorry let me start at the beginning . Katara and I discovered Aang frozen in an iceberg, now I didn't like Aang at first but grew to love him over time, then we went to the Southern Air Temple where Aang used to live and then we met Suki,  who's a Kyoshi warrior. She dressed me like a woman and then she kissed me, and then Aang's friend was a crazy old king and ...

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Cut to Katara speaking over Sokka as he continues talking.] Wow, when he says the beginning he means the beginning beginning. [Hakoda gets up and approaches Sokka.]
character_words: Wow, when he says the beginning he means the beginning beginning.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: ... And then Katara got Haru arrested and then now he's grown a mustache which if you look at him in the front row you can see it ...
character_words: ... And then Katara got Haru arrested and then now he's grown a mustache which if you look at him in the front row you can see it ...

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Interrupting.] Thank you, Sokka. It's okay why don't you take a break? [Sokka leaves the stage to sit down, disappointed in himself. Hakoda addresses the crowd.] Let me just clarify a few points for everyone. [Shot of Haru stroking his chin. Everyone pays attention to Hakoda.] Today, is the day of black sun, and I want to thank you all for your self-sacrifice, and your courage. There are two steps to the invasion, a naval stage, and then a land stage. [Shot of Sokka looking down, sad, Katara, Momo and Aang looking at Hakoda and Toph.] To gain sea access to the Fire Nation capital, we need to get past our first major obstacle here, [Points at map.] The Great Gates of Azulon. Next, we hit the land, and we hit hard. We must fight past their battlements and secure the plaza tower. Once we do that, it's up to the Royal Palace. At that point, the eclipse will begin.
character_words: Thank you, Sokka. It's okay why don't you take a break?  Let me just clarify a few points for everyone.  Today, is the day of black sun, and I want to thank you all for your self-sacrifice, and your courage. There are two steps to the invasion, a naval stage, and then a land stage.  To gain sea access to the Fire Nation capital, we need to get past our first major obstacle here,  The Great Gates of Azulon. Next, we hit the land, and we hit hard. We must fight past their battlements and secure the plaza tower. Once we do that, it's up to the Royal Palace. At that point, the eclipse will begin.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Excuse me. The Boulder is confused. Isn't the point to invade during the eclipse, when the firebenders are powerless?
character_words: Excuse me. The Boulder is confused. Isn't the point to invade during the eclipse, when the firebenders are powerless?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: The eclipse only lasts eight minutes, not enough time for the whole invasion. And the Royal Palace is heavily guarded by firebenders. So that's where we'll need the eclipse's advantage the most. When this is finished, the Avatar will have defeated the Fire Lord. We will have control of the Fire Nation capital, and this war will be over!
character_words: The eclipse only lasts eight minutes, not enough time for the whole invasion. And the Royal Palace is heavily guarded by firebenders. So that's where we'll need the eclipse's advantage the most. When this is finished, the Avatar will have defeated the Fire Lord. We will have control of the Fire Nation capital, and this war will be over!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: We've been looking everywhere for you. The boats are ready to leave.
character_words: We've been looking everywhere for you. The boats are ready to leave.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: I messed up, Aang.
character_words: I messed up, Aang.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: What?
character_words: What?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: The invasion plan was my moment of truth and I completely flubbed it. I just fell apart.
character_words: The invasion plan was my moment of truth and I completely flubbed it. I just fell apart.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Approaches, putting a hand on his shoulder.] Sokka, that speech wasn't your moment of truth. That was just public speaking, and nobody's really good at that.
character_words: Sokka, that speech wasn't your moment of truth. That was just public speaking, and nobody's really good at that.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: My dad is! He explained the plan perfectly and inspired everyone, like a real leader should.
character_words: My dad is! He explained the plan perfectly and inspired everyone, like a real leader should.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Look, your moment of truth isn't gonna be in front of some map; it's gonna be out there on the battlefield.
character_words: Look, your moment of truth isn't gonna be in front of some map; it's gonna be out there on the battlefield.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: You seem so confident about everything, how do you know we're gonna win?
character_words: You seem so confident about everything, how do you know we're gonna win?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Because I already failed the world once at Ba Sing Se. I won't let myself fail again.
character_words: Because I already failed the world once at Ba Sing Se. I won't let myself fail again.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: There they are, the Great Gates of Azulon.
character_words: There they are, the Great Gates of Azulon.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: I don't see any gates.
character_words: I don't see any gates.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Katara, you and the swamp benders whip up a fog cover.
character_words: Katara, you and the swamp benders whip up a fog cover.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: We'll sneak by them statues just like we sneak by that Fire Navy blockade!
character_words: We'll sneak by them statues just like we sneak by that Fire Navy blockade!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Keep it up, we're almost through!
character_words: Keep it up, we're almost through!

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Everyone below deck! [Everyone goes into the boats; to Sokka.] Let's hope your invention works.
character_words: Everyone below deck!  Let's hope your invention works.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: No one's on board, sir.
character_words: No one's on board, sir.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Where'd they go?
character_words: Where'd they go?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Placing a hand on Sokka's shoulder.] You've really outdone yourself this time, son.
character_words: You've really outdone yourself this time, son.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, congratulations, Sokka. You managed to invent a worse way of travel than flying. [She holds her mouth, about to throw up.]
character_words: Yeah, congratulations, Sokka. You managed to invent a worse way of travel than flying.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Takes off his helmet and offers it to Toph.] Helmet?
character_words: Helmet?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Well, I just came up with the idea. The mechanist did all the work.
character_words: Well, I just came up with the idea. The mechanist did all the work.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Now don't sell yourself short, my boy. [Cut briefly to Katara and Huu waterbending.] It was your idea to use waterbending to make the subs sink and float, brilliant! [Cuts back to the mechanist opening a scroll, revealing a very crude drawing of a submarine.] Though your original designs were a bit difficult to decipher. Unfortunately there is one problem I couldn't fix. [Cut to outside of submarine as the submarines swim past, along with Aang on Appa.] The subs have a limited air supply. Before we land on the beaches, we'll need to resurface.
character_words: Now don't sell yourself short, my boy.  It was your idea to use waterbending to make the subs sink and float, brilliant!  Though your original designs were a bit difficult to decipher. Unfortunately there is one problem I couldn't fix.  The subs have a limited air supply. Before we land on the beaches, we'll need to resurface.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Lunchtime, General Iroh. [Whispers and looks back.] And this time, I brought you an extra bowl of rice.
character_words: Lunchtime, General Iroh.  And this time, I brought you an extra bowl of rice.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: Thank you, Ming. Your little gestures of kindness have made my days in prison bearable. [Thinks for a moment and smiles.] I think you should take the rest of the day off.
character_words: Thank you, Ming. Your little gestures of kindness have made my days in prison bearable.  I think you should take the rest of the day off.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: [Confused.] What?
character_words: What?

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: You don't look well. Maybe you should go home and rest.
character_words: You don't look well. Maybe you should go home and rest.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
full_text: No, I feel fine.
character_words: No, I feel fine.

chapter: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
